I had to get a plastic spatula and force the beans into the grinder. The opening is apparently too small. Probably not the safest thing to do. I am disappointed with the grinder but I intend to keep it, get some fresh beans with no added flavoring and see if it works any better.

I give this grinder a 5 star rating because it delivers a decent grind. I am NOT using it for anything but my electric drip coffee maker. I use a coarse grind, yes there is some dust, but it's just not an issue for me. All I wanted was a grinder that would grind my beans fresh for a good cup of coffee. I use quality beans and have never seen a bean come through unground.
This machine carries an 18 month warranty. I have had mine for about 5 or 6 years and it finally has died. I could buy parts for the part on mine that has broken, but after this amount of time, I am treating myself to a new one.
Yes it's pretty loud, that doesn't bother me and if it did, I'd just set it, turn it on and leave the room!
This will be my second Cuisinart DMB-8 Burr Mill. I have been totally satisfied with my first one and look forward to another 5 years of freshly ground coffee. Just hope it comes soon, because if it doesn't I'll have to rely on my blade grinder because I just won't buy ground coffee!!
If you just want a good, inexpensive grinder, don't hesitate. This one is a bargain at the price. I will say that Amazon has really upped the SRP figure. This grinder sells for $49.95 or so on the cuisinart site. They do charge over $8 shipping, so buying from Amazon still makes sense, but don't be thinking you will be saving $50 +...

Every morning I offer a sacrifice of the locally roasted beans to the Destroyer in hopes that I will live another day without fear of the Destroyer destroying me. It seems to like the beans. The beans make it happy. And the leftover of the beans post Destroyer makes a wonderful beverage if added to hot water. Good ole smushed bean juice. Gotta love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Owned this for 5 months & it quit working 👎
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this on Jan 2nd & recieved it on Jan 5th & here it is exactly 5 months later, to the day & it literally ground to a halt about 5 seconds after I pushed the start button & just quit working. ☹ I used it daily at least once a day since getting it & was satisfied with its performance albeit being at bit loud (which I expected, it's a bean grinder 🤷🏼‍♀️ they're not quiet) but surely it's designed for daily usage & I had high hopes for it lasting us at least a year or more 😕 so it's not like I have unrealistic expectations for a small appliance's lifespan. I now have to own the fact that I no longer have any of the paperwork on it so I will have to research to see if the manufacturer has/will honor some sort of warranty so 🤞

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool and easy, but a bit messy.
reviews.reviewText: OK, grinding coffee beans is going to be noisy, not much you can do about that. But the slide out drawer that catches the grounds is a bit messy. It is simply impossible to pull it out and dump it without some coffee grounds falling on the counter. BUT, the automatic function is nice, and the storage on top makes it even easier. Wasn't sure I would like it when I saw the small mess it made, but after a couple weeks of using it, I like it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Husband loves this and very easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Husband loves this and very easy to use. Very classic looking and can grind a larger amount for future use.
I like this grinder better than the other ones that I've had. It makes the amount of noise you'd expect from a coffee grinder. It does well with adjustable grind sizes.

Had this grinder for less that 6 weeks. It had a couple of times where it had a hard time grinding. Then, a few days later it wouldn’t even turn on. It just quit working. Searched Amazon and saw I couldn’t return it at that point. Checked the reviews to see if I could exchange it with the manufacturer but they require the customer to pay a $25 shipping fee. Very frustrating!

reviews.reviewTitle: NOISY - but does the job for most
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder is a good example of you get what you pay for. If you don't care about noise, more noise, grind consistency, or static then this is a good option due to the lower price tag.

However, we ended up replacing ours with the Oxo burr grinder. It's much quieter, has a much better grind size consistency, and the metal cup of the Oxo means no static cling for the grinds.

I recommend spending the extra money for the Oxo if you need to adjust for different brew methods.

This is fine for a second home or if you're just going to use your drip machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: It appears to be the best value for the $
reviews.reviewText:
I have owned this grinder for 5 years and it has served me well. I ground LOTS of beans to make my daily latte's. It has finally quit working properly and I believe it is because I was grinding frozen beans in it from time to time. While looking on Amazon for a new burr grinder, I have come to the conclusion that I will buy another Cuisinart grinder. It appears to be the best value for the $. My recommendation is to not grind frozen beans and this unit will last for a very, very long time when you give it the care it deserves. I believe that was my mistake or it would have run longer.

It does take some cleaning maintenance to keep it running well. I read the reviews that this grinder sometimes quits working after a few months. All that needs to be done is to clean the groove of the opening where the coffee grounds come out in the basket. We ground very fine grounds for espresso, so it clogged every once in a while. Just run a table knife around the edge of the opening and inside the groove and this will most likely solve your problem.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grind 6-8 full pots per day, every single day of the year. Still working strong after three years.
reviews.reviewText:
I estimate that the crew of my tugboat has ground over seven thousand full pots of beans with this grinder in the three years it's been on board. We didn't buy it through Amazon, but my wife mentioned that we need a new grinder and I didn't hesitate to look up this model for our home, where I expect it to last decades. We do have to perform some maintenance on it from time to time with a Q-tip, a some keyboard cleaner compressed air.

We don't make espresso, but we do keep it on the finer setting for our Bunn-o-matic. I love that it takes the guess work out of measuring for new guys on the crew. Making coffee for the on-coming watch, they just have to know what number to set it on. Dixie cups with marker on the inside are a thing of the past. It's not too noisy, it's easy to clean, unobtrusive on the counter, and has yet to fall over in heavy seas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds well, but the removable container can be annoying
reviews.reviewText: Does a nice job of evenly grinding the coffee. The automatic shutoff is great. No need to stand there while the coffee is grinding. My only complaint is the container that hold the coffee after it is ground. It has a removable lid which has coffee dust and makes a mess where ever you set it down. Also the container must be perfectly positioned to be put back on the grinder. Once you get it positioned, it goes in easily, but it takes a bit of messing around to get it in the right position.

This grinder will give you a taste of what a good burr grinder can do. It will also create a large amount of fine dust no matter what setting you are on, which will stick to the sides of the grounds container via static charge. The amount of dust this thing creates is the source of a great deal of waste and annoyance to me.

reviews.reviewTitle: I take my coffee brewing pretty seriously. That's why I hand ground my quality ...
reviews.reviewText:
I take my coffee brewing pretty seriously. That's why I hand ground my quality whole beans using a manual ceramic burr grinder for quite a long time now. I found this electric burr grinder and purchased it based on all the favorable reviews. It deserves every one of them. The grind is consistent and tastes great with my Chemex coffee maker(the best method in my humble opinion). My only issue with this device is the type of plastic that the collection receptacle is made from. It apparently holds a significant static charge and many of grounds stick over the entire surface area inside and out. Minor, I know, but still slightly annoying. Does anyone reading this silly review have a solution to this problem? Any advice would be greatly appreciated. Enjoy!!!

Addendum: Yes it is very loud. So if your up before the other members of your household you may as well grind enough for everyone because they are sure to be woken by the industrial machinery that is your new burr grinder.
Not a fan. This is my third one. The other two broke in about a year but this one broke the very first bag of coffee that I tried. There are better options out there

reviews.reviewTitle: Four Stars, With a Bonus Star for Value
reviews.reviewText:
I'm very satisfied with this grinder, and I'm fussy about my coffee. I can't imagine doing much better for the price. Overall construction is solid, which is what I expect from Cuisinart, The hopper holds enough beans for about five 12-cup pots. The box which catches your grounds can be a little tricky to slide back into the unit, but once I got use to it, it's fine.

Some advice for prospective buyers: as with any new grinder, it can be difficult finding the right grind and amount for your taste, so maybe I can save you some time by sharing my own experience. For a 12 cup drip machine with cone filter, my settings are as follows: the volume/amount setting is at 12, and the grind setting is at the 6th dot, going from left to right. This gives me a coffee of "medium" strength--flavorful without any bitterness. But if you like your brew with a little "bite," go to the next finer setting. Also, some folks complain about dust-sized grind in the reservoir, which you definitely don't want because it will cause bitterness. My solution: this sticks in a clump to the top edge of the reservoir. I carefully remove the reservoir from the unit so I don't knock it loose, and then flick it into the garbage with my finger. Yeah, a bit of a pain, but for 40 bucks, I'm not complaining.

reviews.reviewTitle: Crapped Out After a Few Months
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this grinder not knowing what to expect. It generally worked as advertised making a pretty consistent grind which is why I bought it in the first place. When I got it I tried it out and had it didn't start when I pressed the button but after a few presses it worked so I thought it was just a fluke. After a few months, the unit just quit working. My only complaint (other than the fact that it stopped working) is that the grinder causes the beans to become statically charged and its hard to get all the grounds out of the cup. In any case, I don't think I would buy this again because of the issues it had. I think I'll try a different brand.

I have had this grinder since May of 2018 and it has been nothing but problems. It quits working and have to take the top off to unclog the machine.. well it finally died this week November 2019. I just reviewed a UTube video in hopes to get this thing working again... Lol 3/4 of the way through the video there are big Letters DON't DO THIS IT IS NOT WORTH IT !!… The guy got it working again but due to the product defective... very fine dust like particulates will be produced and continue to jam the machine. VERY POORLY DESIGNED !! Also the fine dust will get into your coffee filter in coffee machine a clog the filter.... So... who makes this Cuisinart.. thought they had a good product.. NOT NOW... Hope this helps

I love this coffee grinder. It grinds to the predetermined ground size, using the same quantity of coffee beans. You just fill the hopper, then when you fancy a brew, press the start button and let it go to work. Then pull out the repository for the grounds, pour into your chosen coffee maker and off you go. We use it everyday and there have been no problems since purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Died after two years, motor won't get up to speed
reviews.reviewText: I used this daily to grind a small amount of coffee beans for my usual morning cup of coffee, and sometimes one in the afternoon. I liked the convenient functions and that it ground fine enough for Turkish coffee. And today, it stopped working, the motor speed sounds allot more anemic and slower and no grinding... So I guess that's as long as I can expect it to live. Not really sure I'd buy it again.

Unless you like spending more time cleaning after each grind spend more and pick up the Capresso grinder. This design, while cute and efficient looking leaves the hopper threads and pass through port coated with grinds. I tried mine once, saw that it took 2 mins to grind a full pot and 7 mins to clean it and repacked it for immediate return. I thought I would save a few bucks over the Capresso but wasted another $9.52 in return shipping for my trouble instead. In case you are wondering, the hopper on the Capresso removes from the top and gives access to the grinding blade which pulls free so it can be brushed clean in a few strokes. Then, by tipping the unit, a few gentle taps to the body and a few brush strokes clears the grinds from the chamber into the catch bin. Quick, easy and efficient. Leaving me more time to enjoy my cup of coffee which is what I was after in the first place ;).

This grinder has all the features I was looking for at a good price. As others have mentioned, it is noisy, but then so are all coffee grinders. I don't find it any messier than other grinders and it seems to do a good job of grinding the beans. I'm satisfied with my purchase so far. Cannot comment on durability as I've only had it a month. I did spend a few extra dollars and get an extended warranty based on other comments.

reviews.reviewTitle: A fine grinder if you don't mind huge messes.
reviews.reviewText: The coffee grinds well, but there's a major design flaw when it comes to removing the canister and putting that ground coffee into your coffee maker. I have had it for a month, and have yet to find a way to open the container and/or transfer the contents without lots of ground coffee getting everywhere. If the receptacle container were designed better, perhaps with a better lid or different material, this could be something I didn't hate using every day. As it stands, though, I hate using this every day. I would rather go back to the $8 one I got from another brand.

First day I received it I Ran the hopper, lid and container through the top rack of The dishwasher like the manual says. Got rust on the burr area of the hopper and there is now water trapped inside the hopper underneath the black piece. Absolute garbage. Will be returning

First one died within a month, second one last a little over a year. Died.. won't even turn on at all.

I'd say for the year we had it, it did OKAY. We still fought it to grind consistently, and the correct amount. If we ground "18", sometimes the equivalent of 4 would come.

I don't believe the lifespan of a coffee grinder should be 1.5 years. I expect a longer life span.I would also like one that grinds consistently and the correct amount.

reviews.reviewTitle: Meh Burr Grinder Is Too Loud
reviews.reviewText: I have a similar grinder from the same brand that costs twice as much. I wanted this just for decaf. I guess I’m spoiled because this one is less accurate with the coarse settings. You cannot pulse grind with it either. The worst issue with this grinder is the horrid, wake-the-dead sound it makes when operating. If you have house guests or family members you want to passive-aggressively annoy; then fire up this at 5 or 6 in the morning. It works but it’s a meh for burr grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes good coffee but I hate it
reviews.reviewText: I had a bodum bur grinder, but after cleaning the last time I can’t get it calibrated to grind the right size. Usually I could get it after a day but it was 7yrs old so I figured it’s probably time to replace. This grinder grinds the beans - I do see more range in size from it. But it’s a pain in the butt. Static, mess to pour. So messy. And the complaints about the sound are no joke, much to my surprise. It runs for much longer than the old one and sooo loud. Currently watching prices to buy a new bodum.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't bother if you need a fine grind for espresso
reviews.reviewText:
I couldn't get it to a fine grind. There were fairly large pieces of coffee beans on the fine setting and it was very inconsistent, no matter which type of coffee bean I used. I truly wish it worked well for us but it just didn't.

Overall:

Would be great for a regular drip coffee maker and certainly worth the price if you need it for that. However, trying to take the cheaper route for espresso was a bad idea and I certainly can't recommend this to anyone needing it for that purpose. Not sure why it even has the 'fine' setting.
The cleanup is relatively easy, although it was a tad messy during the process.

Had this about a month now and have been using it every day with great results after a few days of expirementing with the grind and quantity settings. The "cup" setting is a timer that ranges from 4-12 cups but I tend to use a lot of beans and I found that it was leaving un-ground beans in the hopper when I was using the 4 cup setting so now I just set it to 6 cup and measure the beans my self, so it just ends up running 10 seconds or so after there are no beans left. I think this might be useful if you fill the hopper and wanted to just grind the right amount of beans for each pot of coffee but I store my beans in an air-tight container. I have a drip coffee maker so have only been playing with the "medium" grind settings so I can't speak to the grinders ability to make fine or corse grinds but there seems to be plenty of range to make anyone happy. As others have said, it does produce a bit of bean dust that sticks in the output container but no more than my old blade grinder and it there are no whole beans left over like with the blade grinder.
Two things that kind of caught me off guard with this grinder are it's size, it is about the size of a 12 cup coffee maker, and it is pretty loud, kind of sounding like a hair dryer. When I am making coffee during the day it does not seem loud but at 5am when the rest of the house is asleep it seems a lot louder.
Overall I am very happy with this unit for the price. With my blade grinder I was always fighting for a consistent grind and often ended up with several untouched beans or too-fine coffee that ended up making strong but bitter coffee and even caused an over flow or two from the filter clogging.
Max

reviews.reviewTitle: works great at grinding coffee but...
reviews.reviewText: This product is extremely noisy. Grind your coffee the night before. It grinds beans into very small pieces and its auto cup measure feature makes for very efficient use of coffee-I think by about 1/3, in my case. However, the grinds are so fine as to be difficult to extract from the receptor. I need to fill my coffee pot grind holder over the sink where it is easy to clean. Otherwise, I have a small dusting of grinds everywhere. Despite all this negativity, this product is far superior to my old single load traditional grinder and I recommend this product. Just be aware of its limitations.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great grinder for little cost - saving me lots of money!
reviews.reviewText:
I love the fact that I can grind my coffee using different grind levels. Fine, to Course. This in expensive grinder is saving me all sorts of money. I got the 3 year Protection plan because it is doing such a good job, I dont need to buy the Keurig coffee which runs me about .50c per coup of coffee. This may cut that in half. Fresh ground coffee is the best!

The unit is a little loud but does the job every time! It has the ability to grind for how long or how many cups you want, as well as over 10 different grinding methods. Very Fine, to Very Course.

Thank you Cuisinart!

reviews.reviewTitle: and treats it like a rented mule
reviews.reviewText:
I am buying my second one. The first one has rendered faithful service for over twenty years. Recently, I've had to take it apart and clean out clogs (probably caused by my kids grinding flavored coffee beans). I suspect after 20 years, coffee dust has worked its way into the bearings or some such thing. Once I've blown the area under the grinding disk with canned air, it works as well as it ever did. My friend broke the lip of the receptacle container, but he is a ham-fisted son-of-a-gun and slams it around, pounds it shut, and treats it like a rented mule.

My family has used it daily, several times a day, using every grind setting. I'm pleased with the performance, the quality, and the price.

Despite the impeccable reputation that Cuisinart has for its products, this one failed after only a half dozen uses. When I contacted Cuisinart about the product and its brief operational life, I was told they would replace the item if I paid $13 for cost shipping. When I explained how briefly the unit operated and my concerns about paying the shipping cost for repeated failed units which would equate to a rental fee rather than a purchase price. Cuisinart was unwilling to waive the shipping cost for the return or to compensate me in any way for my difficulties with their product. Obviously, Cuisinart doesn't have much faith in the durability of their product either.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working correctly after only 4 months
reviews.reviewText: My coffee grinder gets used for about 3 pots a day of coffee. Already starting to get blocked up and stop grinding. Can't be confident that are getting the amount of grounds that you want/expect per pot. Wouldn't buy again. Will buy one that is more heavy duty.

reviews.reviewTitle: After daily use for 1 year: It's possessed !
reviews.reviewText:
After 1 year of daily use at least 4 times a day, it is now possessed.
It turns itself on and starts grinding at random. The motor will just continue running until you unplug it or pull the catch basin.
Other than it now being a potential fire hazzard from the motor burning up, if you tear it apart and clean it thoroughly about once a month it's been a good machine.
I like it enough I'd still buy another one.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great burr grinder
reviews.reviewText: This is a great burr grinder. Everything seems to be made of good quality materials, and everything functions as it should. The grind is consistent and is a quick process. My only problem with this product is that it is not ideal for someone looking to make less than 4-6 cups of coffee at a time. The hopper on top is so large that if you put in less than 4 cups worth of beans, the beans will rattle around for 20-30 seconds at the end of the grind. This is annoying if you are making a small amount of coffee, as you probably measured your coffee and want those last beans. Also, if you put in more beans to force the beans in, they will go stale if not grinded in the first day. Along with that, since it is a burr, there is some production of coffee dust. This can throw off any precise measurements, since the catcher is larger enough that the dust clings to the walls, requiring some scraping if you want all the coffee. I also wish it had the option to continuously grind with the button pushed, as opposed to being limited to the cup settings. In conclusion, this is a great grinder if you plan to grind up a lot of coffee. If you are only making 1-3 cups at a time, stick to a smaller model or a hand cranked grinder.

This noisy little burr grinder is really quite nice for the price. Numerous grind settings from fine espresso to coarse. It does require periodic cleaning by removing the top and cleaning out the grind area, but this is not difficult. This purchase was to replace an identical grinder which we had had for four years until it quit. Not a really long life, but perfect for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good starter grinder, but has some issues.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this grinder a year ago. It was the first burr grinder I've ever purchased, and is the one I'm using currently.

Most burr grinders are really expensive, so if you just need an upgrade over a blade grinder/if you're tired of hand grinding your beans, this an okay choice.

However, there are a few issues. First, this grinder throws out a lot of powder. I use an Aeropress for my drip coffee, so I can't use this stuff-It'll clog the filter and lead to explosions. It usually collects on the edges of the container, so I can scrape it out without a lot of difficulty, but I imagine I lose something like 10% of a bag of beans this way. I've used a Hario hand grinder and I don't have this problem, so I've concluding its specific to this machine.

A lot of coffee guides will tell you to only load the hopper with as many beans as you're going to use. I don't recommend this for this grinder. If the beans aren't being weighed down by other beans, there's a good chance that the burrs will just spit them out and they'll bounce around the hopper. As a result, I usually buy a week's worth of beans from a local roaster and fill the hopper.

Finally, this burr grinder will not give a consistent amount of ground coffee. I've had it barely fill the container, and sometimes I've had it fill too much.

Ultimately, this is an affordable burr grinder that will give you better, more consistent coffee than a blade grinder. That's why this gets three stars-the gulf between quality burr grinders and inexpensive burr grinders is pretty vast. But if you have money to spend on a burr grinder, get something else.

I bought this to replace one that failed (same model)
New unit is much quieter than previous one. First one lasted about 4 years. Grind consistency is not that great. You get quite a bit of powder along with selected grind. I have nothing to compare against and I am not willing to buy a $200 unit just to find out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for the price, don't expect more.
reviews.reviewText:
Like many of the other reviewers, I have to say that for a $40 grinder, it works OK. If you expect better, you will be disappointed. I use the grinder for a quick 4 tbsp. grind and make one 20 oz. French press batch that yields two cups of strong Joe. I've had better coffee. I prefer making a batch of cold process (Toddy) concentrate, but when I run low or plan badly, the French press works in a pinch. I use the coarsest setting for French press, and get some powder residue like the other reviewers. If you are very fussy about your coffee, skip over this grinder. If you are just looking for an alternative to blade grinders and you like the pleasant effect of grinding just as much as you need and keeping the whole beans handy, this is a decent grinder. That's all it is. I'd expect it to last a few years before it fails, it is not a commercial grade appliance. Good, not great.
Update: I expected it to last a few years. It did not. After six months of light daily use, it died. I would not buy another.

reviews.reviewTitle: It grinds coffee like a champ
reviews.reviewText:
So it's a $40 coffee grinder. It grinds coffee like a champ. The little bin is awkwardly shaped, but that's a nitpicky thing.

My only complaint really is the noise...HOLY HELL is this thing loud! No need for a cup of coffee to wake up, just grind the beans and you get the same effect.

This thing is awesome! Love how easy it grinds and it’s consistent with no leftover chunks like my old blade grinder. The only negative is if you and your significant other like different blends you have to take a few steps to empty and refill. Also know that you will have some remaining bits in the mill but no issues overall. Love the price point and would recommend! I was not paid for the review and wanted to give my 2-cents.

As far as grinders go, I can appreciate the speed, though the noise is quite loud. Luckily, in my situation I don't need to worry about that.

The issue lies in the static electricity, leading to a painful cleanup if you remove the lid of the grind container. Tip: grind the coffee, but leave the lid on. You can knock it against your brewer (mine is a french press) to get the coffee out without the static electricity causing it to fly everywhere.

One thing, I feel it may produce too many fines, even after a cleaning. If you see a lot of this comment on reviews, it may be an indication there is an issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: Timer stops working after warranty period ends
reviews.reviewText: This worked great for a little over two years, then the timer stopped working. It's way too noisy to stay in the room with it, so my husband was turning it on and leaving to do something else, coming back to ground coffee. But then it wouldn't shut off. Our son and his wife had the same problem with theirs, so we should have known not to buy this.

DO NOT BUY THIS. It broke after 4 months of use. Cuisinart offered to replace it, but I have to pay for them to send it to me ($10), AND pay to send the broken one back to them. I can *maybe* see me being responsible to pay for shipping the new one... but seriously?? I’m responsible for returning their defective product? Crazy!

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect grinder for a Chemex coffeemaker
reviews.reviewText: I was worried about buying this after asking questions about the ability of this grinder to grind coarse coffee for a Chemex drip coffeemaker. I got several negative answers to a question I asked about it. Despite all that, my experience has been that the grinder works like a dream. It's very adjustable and grinds coffee to the exact coarseness I need -- all at a super affordable price. Fairly small footprint on my counter as well. I've never been disappointed by a Cuisinart product and this is no exception.

reviews.reviewTitle: great value, super easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Most burr grinders sell around $100, but this one was lot less expensive. You choose the grind and tell it how many cups of coffee you're preparing to make and it grinds just the right amount of beans, whether you drip or French press. You just press Start and let it do the work. Excellent value!

Not for espresso. This grinder cannot produce ground coffee fine enough for espresso machines. Even at the finest setting, the coffee is still too course. It is fine for grinding coffee for drip brewing. Look for a Beville grinder if you'd like something that can produce much finer ground coffee; but it is much more expensive than this one. I rated this 2 stars because while it does work, it doesn't work as specified and I had to immediately buy a new grinder to replace it.

I have read several of the reviews and must now add my own .02. I have had this grinder for over a year without so much as a hiccup. The only time I have had ANY problems is when I ignore the hopper and I run out of beans to grind. Yes, there is dust. Yes there is static cling. Get over it, this is a fact of physics. Some use a brush to clean the container (yes, a glass container would be preferred) and I suppose that would be just fine. I swipe it out with my finger (gasp) and put it in with the rest of the grinds to make a wonderful brew. The "sludge" at the bottom of my cup can be swirled in with my coffee or discarded by the mood that strikes me each morning. The differences in flavor I find in different beans is more of an issue to me.

I am sure there are many coffee snobs who will read this and pass out from the sacrilege, but I find the flavor, on the worst of days, interesting. As to inconsistent grinds, I cannot understand how anyone could mistake this extremely inexpensive grinder for a MUCH MORE expensive one. If you need a snobbishly consistent grind, spend $200-400 and get what you want. I'll stick with this unit that consistently feeds my morning habit and occasionally treats my family and friends to a wonderful afternoon/evening brew of java.

reviews.reviewTitle: Burr grind at a good price
reviews.reviewText: This is my second one in 8 years. I like it because it will grind more than one cup at the time. I use it to grind course for cold brewed coffee and you need more coffee as a rule. These things can be costly. I needed another and the price was still right.

Normally I would have reviewed this months ago but I really wanted to give this a good test before I gave my two cents. We drink a lot of coffee so this thing was used once or more daily. And today it gave out after a little over a year ...so if you’re a big coffee person don’t expect to get a ton of use out of this model. (Side note: my in laws have had the older model going on 5+ years)

*** updated stars to 5 found the problem, make sure you check/clean internal housing where grind comes out and where beans filter into grinder itself things get jammed up occasionally and cause unit to not function properly.

This may be an excellent grinder for drip coffee but is too inconsistent for use as an espresso grinder. The reason is that the metal burr heads are not given a close enough tolerance when set on the fine setting due to tolerances allowed during the manufacturing process. The setting can vary by .0015 or more making espresso grind too coarse. My first one of these was great. On fine grind it worked well for espresso. My new machine (the old one was lost during our move) doesn't have the same tolerance between the grinding teeth as the original. I guess it's what you can expect for the price. Again, not a bad machine for drip or French Press coffee.

I purchased this item over a year ago and have used it daily. It still works great. There is an excellent you tube video that describes how to clean this machine which is easy to do but a necessary step to keep this machine in tip top condition. I never believed what a noticeable difference a burr grinder makes versus the mill grinder. So take a look, try it, clean the grinder and have a great cup of coffee.

I purchased a second grinder after the first one kicked the bucket but the second one lasted about six months. So I am revising my review.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy 5 years of every day use!
reviews.reviewText: compact design fits on the counter nicely, and simple to use. does require frequent cleaning, especially if you grind on "fine", the coffee powder will clog the ejection port to the receiving cannister, but is easy to clean. 1 point off, due to grind timer is not quite what I want for full 14 cups, since I prefer a strong brew, I have to grind two cycles to get enough powder that I prefer, but that's just me.

4 months in, so far so good. Easy to use and maintain. Grinds the perfect amount, and the grind is smooth and not brittle or irregularly sized. A little noisy, but so what......it's the morning and the rest of the house needs to be up anyway! Really happy with this purchase. Just bought another one for a gift.

I continue to be disappointed with the durability of Cuisinart products. However, I continue to purchase because of the exceptional working/functionality of the product. This coffee grinder is certainly no exception. Love the variability of the grinding options. Worked great for approximately 2 1/2 years before suddenly quitting on us. This is our third machine. We also purchased the Cuisinart coffee maker with the exact same results; with the brewer, we typically have them last about 18 months but continue to purchase. I think it's time to consider a more expensive product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Slow and Not Easy to Clean
reviews.reviewText: It works as advertised but when its grinding you need to be patient, it takes 4+ minutes to grind a full chamber of coffee at a medium grind level. The noise level is on par with most units of this type but due to it's slow speed it does become annoying. The clean-up afterwards involves 4 removable parts plus the main unit involving the blades and the cleaning of the tube connecting it to the grind chamber. Combined with the fine coffee dust other reviewers have mentioned and which clings to all the parts its too much of a clean-up process if you're doing it for just one or two cups of coffee.

We are thrilled with this product. We can do a large bag of beans in only two different time periods and are able to make them fine. It is the best grinder we've found.
I find it uite easy to clean and do so after each grinding. It is a bit noisy but that is OK with us. IT WORKS!

Nice looking, and appears well made. It does the job, but it's quite noisy, and the grind is not as even as I expected. There is a lot of really fine coffee powder generated. A more even grind without the poweder was one of the main reasons I switched from a blade grinder, so this was disappointing. I don't know if this is something that occurs with all burr grinders, but I'm guessing a more expensive one would provide a more even grind. Although the minimum setting is four cups, I have found that there is a click below 4 that lets you make 2-3 cups (depending on how strong you like your coffee). I use that setting for one large mug (16 oz.) of joe. While I'm not completely satisfied, I'd say that for the price, I'm happy enough with the product.

reviews.reviewTitle: I had been reading a lot of reviews talking about how the regular grinder heats up the beans and it makes for better coffee with
reviews.reviewText: I did not notice a huge difference in the taste of the coffee. I had been reading a lot of reviews talking about how the regular grinder heats up the beans and it makes for better coffee with the burr grinder. So, I gave it a try. It does make a mess when you transfer the grounds from the bin to the drip coffee filter. I've tried to do this w/o making a mess. It's next to impossible. I only brew around 8 cups a day, so grinding this amount is no problem when walking away from grinder, as the beans will feed well into grinder. If you go above 8 cups/per day like 12, then I agree with other posts, that you ought to hang around the grinder and tap the bean bin to help feed the beans down the chute.

I’ve wanted an electric burr grinder my entire adult life. I’m so happy to finally own one! This grinder does its job. The chosen grind seems consistent, though I’m still playing around to find the perfect grind for my current set up. I did notice the static and dust-like grinds in the plastic reservoir with each use but it’s not enough to really bother me. I measure out my beans with each use to retain freshness, and wish I could push the grinder ON and it’d grind until there is nothing left to grind opposed to hitting a preset cup portion.

Bought this for an office full of coffee junkies. They literally broken the last grinder and made huge mess with this grinder you pour beans in and set measurement lot less spills and seems to be holding up well under multiple daily pots brewed. Bit noisy but no grinder is quiet. Looks nice on the counter too

Loud and a bit inconsistent, but the worst part is the static. Every time I open the receptacle of ground coffee the static makes it fly all over the place. Making coffee is a happy part of my day, but this grinder makes me frustrated every morning. I've used a Capresso Infinity burr grinder in the past, and it was so much better. I was wrong thinking I could get the same quality out of this one. If you're going to get a burr grinder, get a conical type and pay the extra for something good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good burr grinder for the price
reviews.reviewText: I don’t have any other coffee burr grinders to compare it to being this is my first one. It is loud but not any louder than a blender. Grounds are decent size but I haven’t tried different types of grind. Love having fresh grounds for every cup. It is a good beginner grinder due to its low cost.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Utility/Good Price but a troubled history.
reviews.reviewText: Replaces earlier purchase that died after a few years. Good price and works fine while it lasts. Customer Service so-so when I wanted help fixing/replacing it...... they didn't care since it was outta warranty...but it failed after only a few years of lite use. Probably made to last thru it's warranty but not much more. I think the motor died.

reviews.reviewTitle: The BEST we've had - consistent and long-lasting!
reviews.reviewText:
We've been using this model's predecessor for about 4-5 years. As long as I clean it regularly, it's been fine. We've been buying Coffee Fool coffee (ordered online and delivered automatically according to our schedule/needs.) for years. We bought a far more expensive grinder before we had this one and it stopped working after less than a week. The sales girl at Sur La Table suggested we change coffee because it was the oils in the coffee beans that were 'clogging' that very expensive grinder. (obviously she was not a coffee drinker!)
This one, after all this use (and that's at least 4 pots/day!) is finally getting tired. We're going to replace it with this new Cuisinart....I WILL NOT CHANGE COFFEE FOR ANYTHING! Dark, French Roast that is NOT burned or bitter tasting - and this Cuisinart grinds down to Fine with no problem.
One has to remember it's important to clean machine, according to mfg. directions, on a regular basis....Like any good tool, if you take care of it, it will take care of you!

It isn't a true burr grinder, but it isn't 200 dollars, looks nice on my counter, and makes a nice grind. I do pour over and got a manual burr grinder, but didn't have 20 minutes each morning to make one cup of coffee.If I could make any critique on this grinder, is to try and somehow make it smaller, and make the grounds bin more pourable. I find it nearly impossible to remove the lid and pour ground coffee without spilling some on the counter.

This grinder is AWESOME! We use it on the very finest grind setting for espresso nearly every morning and it works perfectly. Really saves us a lot of money to be able to buy coffee beans in bull and use this.

It's also so convenient to have all beans already loaded in the top and be able to just push a button that grinds whatever quantity you preset.

Last but not least, it's really sleek and attractive. It really looks good sitting on the counter.

I've used my new Cuisinart DBM-8 Burr Mill every day for the past month or so, brewing about 8 cups of fine-grind coffee per day. (It replaced a Mr. Coffee burr mill that worked well for about 4 years, until I ruined it by grinding almonds in it one day. No need to dwell here on my stupidity.)

The Cuisinart's grind seems very precise and uniform.

The automatic feature is convenient: You choose the number of cups you want, and it then measures out and grinds the beans at the touch of a button. The machine automatically stops grinding when it is done. (My now-departed Mr. Coffee lacked this feature. I had to measure and load the beans each day. Then I had to start and manually stop the grinder.)

The hopper holds about 8 oz. of beans. That's 4 to 5 days worth, set at 8 cups per day. I would prefer a larger hopper, holding a full pound of beans. But this is a minor complaint.

The black and stainless machine looks sharp on my kitchen counter. It disassembles for easy cleaning.

I think the DBM-8 has good features and seems well constructed, considering the fairly low price. But, of course, having only used it for a month, I have no opinion yet on its durability. So far it has worked flawlessly. I am very pleased.

UPDATE AS OF NOVEMBER 2012:
----------------------------
I now have used the DBM-8 for more than 1.5 years. It continues to work flawlessly.

This unit is very noisy. Another review I just read said it sounds like a saw cutting wood. I can say it's as load as my table saw when I am pushing a board through it, with my dust collector going in the background. At 6AM, it's kind of annoying but I deal with it.
My other big issue is it clogs up in the port that sends the ground coffee from the grinder into the collector. After a few uses, at least with the coffee I use, Ruta Maya, the opening is clogged with ground coffee and I need spend a fair bit of time cleaning out the port or grinding comes to a complete halt.

This thing is loud but it sure does the job! Lots of options for how you want the grind, and a burr grinder as well. The only thing I don't like is getting the grounds out. It's a bit of a mess no matter how you do it and coffee powder always ends up all over the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works fine but I find myself on Amazon shopping for a ...
reviews.reviewText: Bought this in Oct. 2017, it is now Mar. 21, 2018. It works fine but I find myself on Amazon shopping for a new grinder at this moment. The reason??? This thing is loud as heck! I mean it is really loud. The motor spins very fast, the plastic lid vibrates really bad so when I grind coffee I hold the lid down really tight to lessen the noise of the plastic lid vibrating. If your in the market for a coffee grinder, I would focus on noise. Think about it, this is a morning operation. If anyone in the house is sleeping in, they WILL HEAR a noisy coffee grinder.

I was looking forward to having something that ground more beans at a time than my current grinder. After a bit of research I landed on this one for it's fairly good reviews, cost, and the Cuisinart name. It is a nice unit, seems solid, however, it is SO LOUD! I ground one pound of coffee through it and am sending it back. You would have to wear ear plugs to operate this on a regular basis. I don't know the dB level, but it is louder than a hairdryer and almost as loud as my electric miter saw. Too bad. I'll be paying attention to this feature with my next purchase.

Wanted a burr mill for better grind than the blade type-this one is excellent, price is great. As with anything that grinds coffee, fine coffee dust gets in places, but this is a lot more contained than any others I have ever tried. Good variable control to adjust for what I need-espresso, drip, pour-over, press. Very durable. Great value for the dollar.

reviews.reviewTitle: Defective Switch - Company known about problem for at least 1 year.
reviews.reviewText: Switch doesn't work correctly. It would not consistently activate in any of the slide switch positions. After I received the item and ran into this problem, I did some searching about this and apparently it's been persistent for at least a year. Even if you randomly get the thing to start, it won't stay running. Must have pressed that button over 1000 times (not kidding) while trying any position on the slide switch and got about 6 "cups" worth of ground coffee out of it. Those 6 cups were decently ground though. At any rate - DO NOT BUY.

reviews.reviewTitle: There's a reason this unit is so cheap!
reviews.reviewText: Very inconsistent grind. At medium there is everything from small rocks to fine powder. The noise level is atrocious. My decibel meter showed 104-96db during a 1/2 cup batch. I wanted to graduate from spin blade grinders. I became aware how commercial burr grinders at the market or coffee shop always produce perfect, uniform grounds. I regret wasting $40 on this machine when I should have spent $100 a real Burr Grinder.
Quieter and easier to use than the comparably priced Mr Coffee unit. Convenient - no reason not to have freshly ground coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. Just have to be careful and not overfill ...
reviews.reviewText: Works great. Just have to be careful and not overfill the ground coffee container. The discharge hole can get stopped up and jam up the grinder. I did this and the grinder overheated and I had to wait until it cooled before using it again. This is not a fault of the grinder but of the operator. I had to clean out the coffee that had gotten packed in it before I was able to use. Be sure to get a good brush to clean it out. The one that comes with the grinder is not very good.

Durable machine. this was a replacement for my Mr. Coffee burr mill grinder that fell apart and grinded pieces of itself after only four months. It sits nice and compact on my counter. Has a sliding bar for number of cups, up to twelve. Medium grind is more like the fine grind on the Mr. Coffee. good for my Ninja bar coffee. The grind is mostly consistent with a little powder. Its slightly less noisy that the Mr. Coffee brand; but it still makes some noise and you have to wait on your conversation til it's done. The results though, are worth it. We use this every day at least 4 times and it's holding up like a charm.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works wonderfully, don't spill water drops onto it tho.
reviews.reviewText: Works wonderfully and performs as advertised. Grind setting is incredibly easy and intuitive to use. My only advisement is to be wary of water around the operating buttons. I was filling our pot and accidentally spilled a few drops into the "Grind" button only to have it turn on immediately without pushing the button. A few hits from the air compressor cleared out the water and returned normal operating function. It would seem a bit of an oversight to have an appliance that would normally be used near water to not have some sort of water guarding. Oh well, it works so well, this is something that only takes one star away. I would definitely recommend

Very impressed with how even the grind is. I use the coarse grind for making cold brew and also French press coffee. Some reviews here complain about powder - as a former barista, I can tell you that powder is 1) Easy to remove with a brush (like the tablespoon/brush duo provided in the kit 2) Part of life 3) Not a big deal at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a long term grinding solution
reviews.reviewText: I am writing this review after having used the item since Sept 28, 2016. The grinder worked good for about a year. It then started making some really bad noises while grinding. I called the tech support line and was told to grind some rice to clean out the grinder. I did this multiple times. Just recently the grinder actually started smoking. I called tech support again and the unit is just out of warranty. :( I do not recommend that you expect to use this grinder for more than a year. Spend a little more and get a better made unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Product / UPDATE not so great!
reviews.reviewText:
I love this grinder!! I was using a small one that you had to keep your finger on the button with no settings. After using this one I was in heaven! I love the fact I can grind it fine (as I like it) & walk away while it is doing the work! Sometimes I will grind a large bag of beans & bag it in portions to fit my canister & put it in the freezer until I'm ready for it. I always do a good cleaning on it when I grind that much. I drink a lot of coffee so now I just couldn't live without it! I recommend it for anyone that grinds their own coffee!!!

UPDATE: I absolutely loved this grinder until I went to grind coffee last week & it was as dead as Lincoln. This is a replacement for the first one I bought. The motor burned out on that one in no time. It will hold 1/2 pound of coffee beans. That's about all you can grind at one time. I always took it apart & cleaned it good after every 1/2 pound. Then I would wait a bit and grind some more, but never over 1 pound in a day. The motor will not take it. I have gone back to my small grinder that I have had for about 15 years. I changed my rating from 5 stars to 2.

I use the coffee grinder every single day and haven't found any complaints on its function, it can be a little loud when grinding, it dosent bother my fiancé or animals in the morning when I use it, cleaning it is a bit of a pain by hand due to all the edges in it however if you throw it in the dishwasher then it comes out spotless. great product for a very affordable price!

We just purchased our second one of these burr mills and overall we've been quite pleased with this item. The first one lasted about 3.5 years, and while I think that's a decent length of time, in this day and age I think appliances should work a bit longer than that. That's the main reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5. Over the years it's worked great. The ability to adjust how fine it grinds is nice, though once we fiddled with it a bit and figured out our preferred level (medium) we never adjusted it again. There's usually some grounds build-up on the side of the canister, but I understand it's common with most all burr grinders, and it wasn't a huge problem. For anyone curious, we replaced our old one after the motor burned out.

I bought two of these. The first was refurbished and lasted about 18 months. The second I bought new from Amazon and it stopped grinding after 17 months. There is an 18 month warranty, but the manufacturer refused to stand by it. Generally, they're reasonably price and get pretty good reviews, but they just don't seem to be very durable.

So I have had this about a year now, works perfectly so far and not even a single glitch. However, if you need a cup of coffee to wake up in the morning you wont after grinding your morning beans with this machine. Its insanely loud, to the extent that I cover my ears if I am standing next to it and it makes my cat bolt for another room if she's in the vicinity. The adjustable grind size is stellar, hold a lot of beans and is otherwise a great product....but the noise is obnoxious compared to other grinders I have owned.

Bought this to save money on the pos because we have a Keurig and we love it. The bean type is half the price and better for the environment. Not as noisy as I Thought it would be from all the reviews I read. We use it regularly. Like the other reviews, the biggest annoyance is the static ,the ground coffee literally jumps onto things! Kind of funny actually. So, we are pleased with the purchase, hoping it lasts a long time,considering we drink allot of coffee.

I love this spice mill! That is all I will be using it for! I have used it several times already and I LOVE it! I have made my own spices and salts - no more looking for combined spices at the grocery store! I make my own now! If you want a good quality mill - look no further.

I'm surprised at the lack of duability.
I used this grinder for my drip coffee maker. I grind coffee on weekends and days off - only when I'm not at the office, so it's not like I was asking a lot from this machine. It took a bit of experimentation, but once I had dialed in the correct number of cups and coarseness, I didn't change the settings again. It worked well until about a month ago, when I stared noticing inconsistency in the amount of coffee it would grind. Finally yesterday, a year after I took it out of the box, it ground a fraction of the amount of coffee it should have and shut off...almost. Actually the whirring of the motor stopped, but the grinding noise continued. I had to unplug it to get it to stop. So, I'm shopping for another grinder. It definitely will not be a Cuisinart.

Unlike many modern coffee grinders, this one drops the beans through the grinder into a removable container, so they are not burned by repeatedly grinding. It has a large airtight bean storage container on top of grinder, a selector to pre-select the quantity of coffee beans dropping through the grinder into the removable container. Excellent design and price, but very noisy while grinding.

Initially, we were very happy with this grinder and used it nearly every day for either coarsely ground beans for cold brewing or finer ground beans for hot brewing. However, in less than 90 days, the motor burned up. We shall see how the manufacturer handles a warranty claim.

Let me preface this review by noting that I've only had this product for 1 week, so I cannot comment on its durability. But, based on my experience so far, this is a nice little machine for $45. It grinds perfectly for drip coffee on the Medium setting (I don't use Coarse or Fine, so cannot comment), and does so quickly. It is no louder than any other grinder. It is as clean an operation as you can expect from a coffee grinder, certainly much cleaner than when I was grinding small amounts in one of those little blade grinders. It is a nice looking appliance as well. My only criticisms: 1) the power cord is too short (about 18"), and 2) in order to adjust the grind, you have to turn the entire hopper assembly. Fortunately, I don't have to because it comes set on Medium. But if you like your coffee any other way, the hopper will not be aligned with the base of the unit (hopper is square-shaped at the top, btw, not round). Cuisinart, if you are reading this, the grind adjuster band should turn independently.

I bought this for use with a French press and a drip coffee maker. I needed a more consistent coarse grind for the French press than the blade grinder I was using. I do get a coarser grind, but I also get a lot of powder. The powder does cling to the plastic container, but I don't see that as major problem. It is far from perfect, but at this price I didn't expect perfection. I like the multiple setting for the grinder and that I can vary the amount ground at one time. It is several steps up from using pre-ground coffee and a couple steps up from the blade grinder which is what I was hoping for. I'll be very happy with it if it lasts for a couple of years.

reviews.reviewTitle: complete waste of money and time
reviews.reviewText: Do not buy this junk!!!!! Had this item 2 months and only used it 3 or 4 times and it completely quit working. Called Cuisinart and was told they would replace it but we had to pay to ship it back along with a check or money order to cover the return shipping. All together it will cost over half the origional cost of the machine, just to replace it, and that is assuming the replacement works... Never buying from this company again....complete waste of money and time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what it is supposed to do, grind coffee beans.
reviews.reviewText:
Works pretty good though the fine to coarse setting seems to always give the same output. The plastic container which holds the ground beans can be finicky to put back in and you you need to be gentle. Otherwise for the price it does its job.
This is my first grinder and after a few months of use will probably upgrade to better unit and of course ,more expensive.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointed. I threw it away didn't bother calling the ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this in Jan 2017 under normal once or twice a week use it started smoking and quit working in April 2017. My husband and I only drink one cup of coffee a day this didn't get a heavy workout. Three months is all the use I got out of this thing. Very disappointed. I threw it away didn't bother calling the seller.

Bought this Dec 2017 and it stopped working Dec 2018. Bought a Mr Coffee brand Dec 2018 and it broke April 2018. (The Mr Coffee iten no longer sold by Amazon) I grind one bag of coffee per week so these do not get a lot of use. I just bought one that cost more than the other two combined. Hope I get better luck.

reviews.reviewTitle: I would give it 10 stars, if I could.
reviews.reviewText: I had a grinder that lasted almost 20 years. This one is similar if not better. You don’t want one that leaves the grinds in the same compartment as the grinder. You will be much better off with one that shoots the grinds into a hopper. I use this everyday and love the fact that I no longer need to count scoops. Just set it and forget it. The grinder makes it easy to make a consistent and perfect pot of coffee every morning!

This is a really nice grinder while it lasts. Not sure why we've kept buying them when they wear out so quickly. We got about four years out of one, two years out of the next. Our most current one started acting up after four months and completely died after six months. Just stops grinding.

Cuisinart is a great brand, but this grinder is simply not built to last. I would think twice before purchasing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super convenient and an excellent grind
reviews.reviewText: Super convenient and an excellent grind. Looks very nice on my countertop. Only complaint is that the coffee grounds tend to stick around the inside wall of the container, and the square shape is difficult to pour from. I end up having to remove the lid and pour coffee grounds into my french press over the sink, because there's no way to prevent coffee grounds from flying over the edge and making a mess otherwise. I suppose you could scoop it out with a spoon instead of pouring it out, but that pretty much defeats the purpose of having perfectly measured user specified amounts of coffee coming out of the grinder.

My wife and I have had a number of coffee grinders over the years, but this may be the last one. The hopper holds a good amount of beans and the grind is very adjustable. She particularly likes the fact that it stops by itself when it's done (she doesn't like standing at the counter holding a switch). We use a certain grind for use with a french press and a different grind for re-usable k-cups. It's an all around super machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well but pouring grounds can be messy
reviews.reviewText: The grinder works as advertised and looks nice paired with the Cuisinart coffee maker. I like that you choose your setting, push a button, and get a consistent grind each time. I give it three stars because of the shape of the container which receives the ground coffee. Given the light weight of the grounds and the squarish shape of the container, it very difficult to move coffee from grinder to coffee maker without making a little mess. The mouth of the container is wider than the basket in the coffee maker, so overspill is pretty easy. Since the two products are from the same company I expected a little more coordination of design.

This grinder has lasted 18 months. After about 4 months it had a hard time starting to grind. Adjusting the coarseness of the grind will get it to start. Then it just eventually stops grinding unless I change it to the finest grind. I've read it may have to do with the various switches that are used to ensure the hopper is in place. These are apparently used to make sure you are not injured by trying to start the grinder without the hopper. Not a well made product.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... for the same setting changes all the time - waste of money
reviews.reviewText:
You have to clean it all the time and in addition the amount of grind coffee for the same setting changes all the time - waste of money

This morning it stopped working all together - I would not recommend it to anyone - this is a really bad product

reviews.reviewTitle: Not the quietest but grinds like crazy
reviews.reviewText: I use this to grind the coffee for our church. I grind enough for 10 pots each week on average. This is my second grinder. My first one lasted for a year and a half so that is not bad.It is on the noisy side but I sure can't complain about how durable it is.

reviews.reviewTitle: Powder and static come with the territory.
reviews.reviewText:
Powder and static are the two issues I have with this grinder. I use medium grind the majority of the time and I get about a teaspoon and a half of powder every time. This being the first burr grinder I've owned, I can't say how that compares to other burr grinders in this price range but it is the same, if not worse, than my blade grinder that wasn't automatic. Static is another issue I've run into. Granted, most of what sticks to the sides is powder but it's fairly frustrating to try to tap off the usable grinds while holding the lid on. Of course, you can use the brush every time too but that often makes it worse.
The fully automatic feature and multiple grind options are great and it is quieter than my blade grinder. It's easy to clean so far, with removable parts being safe in the dishwasher. The grinds are even and the coffee is better. I will be hard-pressed to go back to the blade even if I don't keep this one.
Considering the selection and quality of other burr grinders at this price range, I would purchase this one again despite the frustrations.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Real Shame The Machine Quit
reviews.reviewText:
Do you believe as soon as the machine got hot after grinding one pound of coffee beans, it stopped, and I could not finished grinding my 2 lbs of coffee in the same day. The next day, I was able to finish it.
Where can I buy a grinder that can grind 2lbs of coffee? I give up. Ana, go grind your coffee at the supermarket.

Love this grinder. It’s large capacity and easy use makes for lots of good ground coffee. I grind a bunch of beans at the beginning of the week and I’m set. The many setting options are fantastic. Too. It’s loud but hey, it’s worth it for good ground beans.

I had the previous version for years and it was great. The grind is some what consistent overall but there is a small amount (about a teaspoon or two) of very very fine grindings that tends to stick to the side. Those fine grindings contribute to the coffee tasting bitter. The grinder has a function to grind a specific amount of beans. It's never been accurate. If i set it for 8 cups then it usually grinds about 5 cups +- a cup. I have to weigh the results to determine how much water to use. I would not recommend this coffee grinder.

I got this for my husband for Christmas. He's had his eye on a coffee grinder for a while. This is a nice one and you can't beat with Cuisinart brand. It's looks stylish on the counter. It features many grinds to choose from, and it's easy to load and unload the coffee. Normally, coffee hurts my stomach, but with grinding our beans fresh, it doesn't affect me at all. Yeah! It makes a wonderful cup of coffee. I wish we'd gotten it sooner.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after 5 months of once a day use
reviews.reviewText:
Update: While looking for the S/N (while talking to Cuisinart), I noticed that the discharge port from the grinder into the hopper was blocked. I let Cuisinart know that I would hangup and unblock the port. I did the clean out and the machine now works fine.

This thing did a pretty good job, when it worked. I used it once a day and after a little under 5 months it quit grinding. It makes noise like it is trying to do something, but no ground beans. Now I have to figure how to get compensated/returned/repaired. What a pain.

Bought this grinder because we were sick of the blade style grinder.

Worked beautifully for one year. Then it decided it wanted to grind all the beans in the holder, or not grind the right size or just not do anything. I'm tired of manually stopping it where I think 4 or 6 cups are.

By the way, the blade grinder still works great and it's 7 years old.

TL:DR Don't buy this unless you like to replace things every year.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does a good job grinding consistently
reviews.reviewText:
I was torn on the number of stars. We owned a previous version of a Cuisinart burr grinder and did not have to clean the older model nearly as much as this one.

It does a good job grinding consistently, hence 4 stars. But the way it clogs and needs attention from time to time knocks off a star. If I was more sensitive about noise, I would take this to 3 stars. But I remind myself it is a grinder, noise is part of the deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had to buy a second one
reviews.reviewText: Had to replace another one of these that was only a few years old, but my wife likes Cuisinart products so we bought it again. I hope this one last longer than 2 years. Does a good job but the motor just didnt last long enough on the previous one.

Plenty powerful. Excellent functionality. Just one thing I would change. With the location of the "grind" switch, you can quite easily press is as you are placing the bin back in place. There is a safety switch that prevents the grinder from engaging unless the bin is perfectly in place.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty loud. Bigger than you might expect
reviews.reviewText: Works well. Pretty loud. Bigger than you might expect, if you're coming from the small Krups blade grinder. Not really a problem, just this is a counter appliance, not a little handheld thing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its gonna be hard to beat
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic device. Makes a good grind and easy to setup and use. The only criticism I have for it is the selector for the size of the grind is a bit off. It will do all the way from espresso to what are essentially rough cut bean but there appears to be little difference if any between the dot just above espresso and the next 3 dots. If this doesn't make sense, go watch the amazon embedded video and you'll get it instantly. My point is, its a great grinder and for the price and the very little foot print, its gonna be hard to beat.

This is our second Cuisinart coffee grinder. The first unit lasted about 3 years. This one lasted 9 months. The only salvation was Cuisinart replaced the unit but we had to pay shipping. I do not understand why we must pay shipping for a defective unit.Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill

I bought this grinder about 8 months ago and was super excited to be able to grind my coffee right before brewing. This grinder works fine for fine or medium grinds, but the coarse grind is terrible. I love using my French press, but even on the coarsest setting, there are WAY too many fine particles in my ground coffee, resulting in a very sad and muddy cup of coffee. If you are using this for espresso, drip, pour over, or something that does not require a course grind, I'd say you'd be fine.
Additionally, one of the screws one the underside of the hopper somehow came loose and ended up in the grinder...definitely not good. I removed the screw and everything is working fine without it, but it's clear that this isn't the best made matchine. Overall, I think it's good for the price point, but I will definitely be upgrading soon!

You won’t go wrong by this coffee grinder. Easy operation, and quality construction,this coffee grinder makes a perfect grind. This machine uses a burr grinder, isn’t too loud, and stops automatically after it’s finished. Cuisinart has made this model for many years.
A solid machine that will still be going strong many years from now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Failed just outside the warranty window
reviews.reviewText: I was okay about it being noisy and making a mess every time I try to use it, but disappointingly the motor started to fail just after a year of purchase. Tried to contact Cuisinart to have it repaired but they don't even answer the phone. Tried to send an e-mail and two-weeks after they haven't replied either. I won't be purchasing any Cuisinart product again.

reviews.reviewTitle: but this is a great grinder! Yes it makes noise-no coffee grinder is ...
reviews.reviewText: I was concerned with the previous reviews, but this is a great grinder! Yes it makes noise-no coffee grinder is completely silent. It is no louder than my previous one. I have saved SOOOOO much coffee by being able to perfectly set my desired cup amount/strength. When you spend $16 for 12oz of premium coffee, and it lasts you weeks VS 5 days-its worth it! The coffee grounds do like to stick to the sides of the plastic container, just make sure you tap the sides with your hand before dumping (its not the end of the world-its a very small amount that sticks). Great buy, I would recommend!

Have used for couple of weeks. Works wonderfully although a bit noisy. Most of the inexpensive grinders seem noisy anyway.

The freshly ground and brewed coffee smells and tastes so wonderful, I do not drink coffee shop bought coffees any more. If you want to have really tasty coffee, you should buy coffee beans and grind them at home instead of buying coffee grinds or those cute little onesies.
You need to figure out which coffee / water ratio is best for your taste based on type of coffee beans (french roast is very bitter, and espresso next) and the type of coffee maker. I currently use 4 cup setting (the lowest setting) on the grinder for 6 cups of water with my drip coffee maker. I set grinder to fine although the suggestions are medium for drip coffee maker. My theory is the more contact surface the better flavor. This makes enough coffee for two to three people.

This grinder is very easy to use and easy to clean.
The brush is very handy to sweep out the powder that clings to container due to static. No mess no fuss.
always have paper towel on the counter top to catch any spilled powder.
No need to wash the container as long as you brush out the powder clean although sometimes it seems quite oily.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Coffee Grinder - first one lasted 8- 10 years
reviews.reviewText: I bought this particular coffee grinder 8 - 10 years ago at Bed Bath and Beyond - I use my coffee grinder A LOT - so when it finally died - I replaced it with the same exact one! Well worth the money - the first one lasted for a long time! There are several settings for grinding, which is very nice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best value in a burr grinder.
reviews.reviewText: First--Burr grinding is much more uniform and easier to control than blade grinding. You can spend hundreds on a larger, fancier model, but performance of this model is more than adequate. And it's small enough to leave on the counter all the time. Excellent value. Great control over grind coarseness. Easy to keep clean. Compact, and not unsightly. This is my second DBM-8, purchased as gift for my son. Considerations: Being able to replace wear parts is a major benefit of this model. My first DBM-8 has lasted at least 6 years, and has required one part replacement. Hopper assembly has internal parts made from brittle bakelite, which I believe cracked from vibration and repeatedly being twisted to adjust grind. Entire hopper assembly was replaced for under $15. Buy one of these and use it gently for many years of perfect grounds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works better than I expected it to
reviews.reviewText: I'm more impressed with this grinder than I expected to be. It takes up a bit more room on the counter than I would like, but it holds enough beans to get me through a week, which is great. The finest setting is definitely an adequate espresso grind - very fine. It usually feeds ok, but once in a while I have to give it a shake to keep the beans feeding properly. I'm happy with it, though. I would recommend it. Edit: 18 months of daily use - still great.

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText: For $40, at the time of writing this, this will definitely grind your coffee beans for you and is a nice value proposition for those not interested in spending a lot of money. As others have stated, it does produce a fair amount of fines though. If you're using paper filters the fines shouldn't cause too much trouble but if you use a french press they will most definitely end up in the last few sips. I would say, if you take your coffee brewing seriously in the slightest or primarily brew with a french press, wait a little longer and save or splurge on a higher end grinder that will produce more uniform grinds and less fines.

Static electricity resulted in coffee grounds clinging to the plastic tray container and using the scoop with brush handle made a giant mess. Also, stopped grinding properly after only 5 months of use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works like a charm over a year later
reviews.reviewText: I use this grinder every morning and sometimes twice a day. I mainly use a coarse grind for my French press but I've recently started using a Moka as well and used the fine grind setting as well. It works like a charm. It needs to be cleaned every now and then especially if you use oily beans but it's simple to take apart and put back together. I highly recommend this product. Good value for the price!

After living with this for 7 months I’ve decided to dump it for the following reasons.... It’s loud! No matter what grind setting,even coarse you will always get about a tablespoon of powder grind with it which gives you dregs in the coffee, I’ve had to start using paper filters to help alleviate the problem. If you like dark roasts like French it will jam frequently from the oils on the beans. While it is convenient if you grind beans every morning the results are not worth the issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great price and best coffee grinder ever!
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is the best one I have ever used. It is EXACTLY what I expected from Cuisinart. I especially like the fact I can push the start button and be able to do something else while the machine grinds just the right amount of beans for my morning cup of coffee

Every time I use the grinder there is a layer of fine sediment that forms near the lid of the compartment that holds the ground beans. This is regardless of the setting I choose for the fineness of the grind (e.g. it happens even when I set the grinder for the maximum amount of coarseness).

In addition to creating a mess whenever I take off the lid and transfer the ground beans to the filter, this results in a layer of sediment whenever I use a re-usable mesh filter.

I would not recommend buying this grinder.

My last grinder was a Breville that lasted about 8 years and while I was very happy with it, I want anxious to spend $150 to replace it. I've heard good things about the Cuisinart, so I went with it.

The hopper is useful, but I'd prefer to add the beans from my airtight container just before I grind. This one spins the grinder so fast that the beans bounce around the hopper, which means I need to keep beans in the hopper to keep the beans down.

Likely related to the fast grinder action, it is a high pitch nose that wakes my toddler at 6 am, so I end up grinding the night before. The Breville was a lower tone that everyone slept through.

When I wear this grinder out (hopefully in 8-10 years), I'll replace it with a Breville. So none of these problems are deal breakers to the point I'm returning it, but they will stop me from buying it again.

My first was gift from my son lasted about 8 years and then in mid grind stopped working, So I ordered another
came Feb 13 and broke 3 weeks later never to run again......I really thought cuisinart was high quality..... but not
this time. ....

reviews.reviewTitle: I wanted to like it but it makes a mess
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to like it but it makes a mess. Static electricity causes the grinds to cling to the plastic container's interior walls, my hands, too. I have to bang the removable plastic container on the cutting board for the grounds to settle; pouring the ground coffee into my French press is mess. I always have to have a paper towel handy to clean up grinds on the cutting board and off the rim of the French press. Other than that - I was happy with the grind itself and the operation of the machine, but I have to try another option.

Grinding on 6 cup setting it produces about 37g of grounds, about 2-2.5g of which is espresso fine when grinding on a medium setting. This finer dust conveniently clings to the side of the catch bin then falls into a pile that can be scooped off and discarded. This is all good if you don't mind throwing away coffee. I returned it for the more expensive Cuisinart model, which from past experience does not have this issue.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better then blade grinder but not by much and flawed
