reviews.reviewText:
It is better then a blade grinder. I use one at my office to make decent coffee. The grind is not as consistent as a true or higher end burr grinder.

The main flaw is fine (finer then setting) grinds build up on container and eventually break apart and ruin your grind or coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Noisy, large, and does not grind as fine
reviews.reviewText:
Bought this to replace my Krups Burr Grinder. The grinder was making an odd noise, and did not want to be without coffee. I was disappointed in this Cuisinart grinder because 1. It makes a lot of noise. and 2. It does not grind as fine as the Krups. I get between 14.4 grams to 5 grams of coffee in the expresso machine cup (DeLonghi) with the Krups. Not so with the Cuisinart model.
I do not like the large coffee bean hopper, and I do not like the profile and size of the machine in general.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not recommended: Unreliable and creates excessive coffee dust
reviews.reviewText: I can't recommend this product. Most of the output is properly and evenly ground, but for every cup of beans you run through it, you end up with about half of a tablespoon of fine coffee dust in the corner of the output reservoir that must be dealt with each time you grind. Also, and perhaps more importantly, the grinder completely stopped working about three days after the Amazon return period ended. Amazon instructed me to contact the manufacturer who promptly offered to send me a replacement, but they did charge me $10 in shipping to do so.

I bought this thing about 6 months ago, and I'm really tired of trying to use it by now. I only grind about one hopper-full once a week, yet EVERY SINGLE TIME I try to use it, it wont turn on. I have to completely empty it, take it fully apart, and try to clean out every tiny spec of minuscule coffee that might be in there before the dang thing turns on. And its not like I used it several times between cleanings.....only a single hopper-full......why do I have to clean it after every use??? I bought this device to save me time, but case in point, I'm over an hour in today, and I still don't have any ground coffee. :(

Was looking forward to receiving this and was happy it arrived in fine fashion. I was a little surprised at the strong coffee smell when I opened the box and removed the grinder. I should not have been surprised since it was USED. There were still grounds in the hopper! I checked it over carefully and all the parts were present, unmarked, and fitting together well. All papers were included. But still.....

This WAS, and I repeat WAS a great espresso capable burr grinder for roughly 13 months. Suddenly this week I'm grinding as usual (no not in that way) just coffee beans, and suddenly the motor struggles to a complete stop. I gave it a whiff and the machine smelled like burning gears. I cleaned it, tried it and no action. Gave it a couple days and it turned on again, but not strong enough to grind a bean. Its still under warranted however just shipping it back cost more than what other competitors offer for a new one shipped out. So that made my choice. We will see about the next brand, or if Cuisinart will send me a new one I'll gladly take it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasted a Shorter Time Than I Had Expected
reviews.reviewText:
I've had this grinder since Dec. '04, and now in June '07 it suddenly stopped working. The machine was used gently a couple times a day, and only to grind enough coffee for two espressos. I suspect some electronic control inside the grinder gave up the ghost, as the machine shows no sign of life at all. I had expected it to last a lot longer than a little over two years considering it was not used to grind large amounts of coffee.
While it worked, it did a satisfactory job of grinding. The grind selector is very accurate, as is the slide bar for selecting the amount of coffee to be ground. The machine does make a great presentation, resembling a miniature version of the much larger grinders I've seen coffee shops and bars in Italy.
On the downside, other than the lack of longevity, is that this machine is not sturdy, being too "plasticky" in construction, despite the manufacturer's effort to make it look otherwise by using very thin sheet metal to cover the plastic parts.
Overall, I don't feel I got my money's worth from this machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Poor quality, stopped working after 3 months
reviews.reviewText: Searched reviews thoroughly trying to find a quality burr grinder that had decent storage capacity and would last. Only use once a day, worked fine for a little more than 3 months then just stopped. No excessive grinding prior to it stopping, just won't work. Piece of junk, especially for the $$$.

I got this to replace my capresso grinder that gave out after about 4 years. This one is a little noisier and harder to clean, but it does do a better job of making a course grind.

The problem is that it clogs up if you use fresh beans that are oily. I got my beans freshly roasted from a place in the bay area and they are roasted and sent to me right away. when I get them they are really oily (i get French roast beans) and the machine clogs up very badly. If I buy stale beans from the grocery store it grinds ok, but I would rather use fresh beans.

I think the problem is that the machine tries to shoot the ground coffee through a fairly small hole and since the beans are oily it clogs up immediately. I don't do espresso grind and I imagine it might clog up even worse with fresh beans if I tried to grind a fine grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not for use with “fine” setting to grind
reviews.reviewText: Upon receipt and review of the instructions this was set up and used right away. Unfortunately I found there to be a small gap between the plastic grounds catcher, and the top of the grinder (above the lid) which allowed grinds to blow out. This only occurred on the “fine” setting. Like the fine grounds were just enough to allow it to get past. Worked okay on the thicker grind settings.

reviews.reviewTitle: The motor keeps dieing in less than a year
reviews.reviewText: I bought the item after reading some external reviews. When we first got the item it worked well and ground the coffee as desired (but it was quite loud. About 8 months into its life cycle the motor just died. We sent the item in to be replaced since it was still withing the 1 year warranty. Today I go to grind my coffee and the motor does the exact same thing. the replace emnt was again less than one year old. At this point i have no intention of wasting my time and money sending it back again and am switching brands to see if i can get aproduct with some level of quality.

Bought the burr grinder. Is absolutely terrible. Main reason I bought it was help keep the counters clean. This machine makes a MESS. I end up with coffee grounds everywhere. The grounds are this odd, flaky texture. I only use anfrench press, and the coarse ground setting does not produce anything even close to what should be used- coffee ends up with grounds in it and a funky taste. Don’t buy this grinder. I will be writing to amazon separately to get my money back.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have been using it for around 2 months now and so far I'm happy with it
reviews.reviewText: I have an espresso machine at home and usually I bought the ground coffee from the store. But then I got some coffee beans from home in Indonesia and I finally had to buy this coffee grinder. I have been using it for around 2 months now and so far I'm happy with it. What I like about it is that I can always have my coffee freshly ground every time, and the smell is amazing. It works fine, kind of noisy but usually grinding the beans for 4 - 6 cups takes roughly 30 seconds so it's not a big deal. The only thing is that the size of the ground beans is not homogeneous (I'm using the scientific term here but you know what I mean). Compare to the ground coffee from the store, the ground coffee from this grinder is coarser even though with the finest setting. Part of it could be really fine but as I said they are not homogeneous. What I did, to make an espresso, I ground the beans with the finest setting then when it's done I stirred the coffee powder before loading it to the machine. With the right proportion, the espresso taste good. Overall I like this grinder and enjoy the ground coffee it makes. 4 stars because the size of the ground coffee is not homogeneous.

The motor burnt out and the unit is non-operational after 3 days of use. I will be contacting the company for a refund. This is the SECOND time this has happened to me with this exact unit. I guess I should have learned the fist time, but se la vi. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... any other coffee grinder so I dont have a good perspective maybe but I liked it enough to buy ...
reviews.reviewText: I have never owned any other coffee grinder so I dont have a good perspective maybe but I liked it enough to buy it again. Decent price, my previous one lasted 3 years (might have lasted longer if I had bothered to clean it!) and I use it almost every day. . For the price, I think that is acceptable performance. One down side is it is very messy. The cup that holds the grounds builds up a LOT of static and when you open it, you get a little spray of grounds. Again, I am willing to put up with this because I know I am buying the cheapest burr grinder on the market, and I just wipe off the counter every day after using it. The other is that as the machine aged, it became less consistent in the amount of ground it produced. I would like to reiterate that I never cleaned my machine (by running rice through the grinding mechanism, or taking it apart and washing it) If you have never had a grinder before, start with this one till you know how much you value the superior grind. Then buy a more expensive machine if you do use it.

reviews.reviewTitle: The second time is a charm
reviews.reviewText:
The first one we bought arrived defective -- basically the grinder only worked when you stood next to it and held the grind button down, completely eliminating the ability to grind coffee for a specific amount of cups. Amazon's return policy -- fabulous as always -- got us a replacement quickly, and we love it. We load up the coffee at the beginning of the week, set it for 8 cups, and grind and go each day. It has changed making coffee in the morning from a chore to a quick task. I am VERY happy with this purchase.

A few other reviews indicate a lot of static that causes fine grounds to stick to the inside of the dispenser, and that's true. At first I made a bit of a mess each time I put the grounds into the coffee filter, but I quickly learned how to tilt the dispenser to an angle and use the included brush and I haven't spilled since. Obviously it would be good if it didn't have this problem, but I haven't read a review for ANY grinder out there in this price range that didn't have a similar problem, so I suppose it simply goes with the territory.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent Grinder For Drip and Press Machines
reviews.reviewText:
I have been using this grinder for well over two years, and have not had one problem with it. I initially used it to grind beans for my drip coffee maker, and was pleased with how powdery the grounds were on the machines finest setting. I recently switch to a wonderful press, the Frieling Stainless-Steel 35-Ounce French Press, and for that, I switched to the most course grind available. Again, I have been absolutely pleased with the results.

I do think the motor is a bit loud, but I have yet to find/hear of a "quiet" coffee grinder. I find that I do end up with grind "dust" on my countertop every time I remove the reservoir, but it is not nearly as bad as other grinders I have used in the past, and the spills are due more to my clumsiness than any fault in the construction of the machine. I leave the grinder out on my counter, and think it looks stylish - especially when the hopper is full is beans! No complaints with this grinder that is going on three years of service.

Purchased to replace a 6 month-old-other-brand grinder received for Christmas. I was a little worried as I had never researched grinders and this one works wonderfully! It is easy to clean (well as easy as a grinder can be), grinds perfectly, and is quieter than our previous grinder. If you are concerned about looks...well it looks nice too!

reviews.reviewTitle: I like the way you can select the amount of ground ...
reviews.reviewText: I like the way you can select the amount of ground coffee you want, the coarseness and the way it automatically stops. I am really enjoying fresh ground coffee daily. It stays out on my counter top. It is a decent size appliance, so if leaving out you will need room. Cons would be that it is hard to push the ground bean collection container back in and the scoop that came with is small.

I like this grinder. I am not a coffee aficionado by any means but it beats the hell out of ground coffee. My only complaint, and I took a star off for it, was that coffee tends to stick in odd places. I grind it on medium, not fine, and that would be even worse I fear. Makes getting the coffee out of the receptacle difficult and has to be cleaned more often than I hoped. Overall, a good deal for the money.

Purchased Nov 2016. Has worked perfect until yesterday when it ground to a halt. Did all the troubleshooting and still not working. So I guess 3 years is pretty good for a product I used daily and more so at times. I did expect more from Cuisinart as I have other products that are still running 10-15 years.
grind is not fine enough for Turkish coffee. I guess I should look for a Very-Fine grinder for that. I'll keep it even though i have a Cuisinart coffee maker with grinder build in.

Love this grinder. Many great features:

Large hamper permits loading beans once for many pots.
Ability to select the # of cups for the grind
Ability to select the coarseness of the grind
Easy to clean. Just rinse and dry the plastic container and you are back in business.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bit loud , but worth it in the end
reviews.reviewText: It’s great, there is nothing like the smell of fresh gound coffees beans anytime! It has many settings, I usually just keep it on the same setting. The only thing I don’t like about it is, it’s so loud, the last thing I want to hear in the morning is that loud grinding sound. It’s so worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: I can't understand why this has so many great reviews. I've had 4 or 5 burr grinders ...
reviews.reviewText: Preface: never written a single review of any product, ever. Just had the second one of these in six months fail; bought the first one Christmas, it failed in May; its replacement failed in July. I can't understand why this has so many great reviews. I've had 4 or 5 burr grinders in my life, each used daily, and this is the only one/model that has consistently burned out - completely dead - after a couple of months. I would not buy this grinder no matter what. Disregard the other, positive reviews - not worth the hassle of failure.

reviews.reviewTitle: this little jewel makes those of us that know the best coffee of a morning is made from fresh ground ...
reviews.reviewText: Coolest device I've ever came across, set your grind needs, Set your desired amount and push the button, this little jewel makes those of us that know the best coffee of a morning is made from fresh ground coffee beans an effortless exercise. Cruisinart has designed a fabulous burr Grinder that is trouble free making the mornings simpler with this automated set your grind and ground coffee amount and forget it machine.

We've now had four of these grinders. The first one lasted 5 years, but subsequent ones lasted 7 months, 4 years, then 14 months again. Most recent one would clog and stop working every couple weeks requiring some digging around to clear out. When it works, does a good job of grinding to the selected setting.

Prior to getting this model, my wife and I were using a Bodum grinder. This Cuisinart is better in every way. The grinder settings work flawlessly. Once you find the setting that is right for you, it make the same grinds every time. We go through 49 cups a week and this thing doesn’t skip a beat.

reviews.reviewTitle: OK coffee mill, better than a grinder
reviews.reviewText:
What it is: burr-style coffee mill, not just a grinder.

Coffee mills - especially adjustable burr mills, are noted for their quality and consistency of grind.

This mill works okay.

There is a slider to select 2, 4, 6, 8, ... cups. (no odd increments.)

The mill does produce a consistent grind - though it is adjustable, it consistently produces particles of fine grind as well as whatever coarseness you set it on. So for instance, set to a very coarse grind for use in a french press, a significant amount of fine-grind is produced. This is undesirable.

It is an okay grinder, not bad enough return yet at the same time, not worthy of praise either.

--

after less than a year the safety switch in the base is malfunctioning and sometimes the grinder is UN-useable.
Used it literally for less than 5 minutes, didnt finish grinding my beans, then it just stopped working. I let it sit for an hour & tried again, still didnt work. RETURN!

I put off grinding too long because my previous use of chopper type units was so much of a hassle. Not so with this unit. You can store a reasonable amount of beans in it. Once you've set it up, just push the button, let it grind, and pour the coffee into the coffee maker's filter basket.

The unit is compact, fits easily under the cabinets in the kitchen. It's noisy, but not terrible.

Previous reviews scared me about the mess it can make with coffee powder. The facts are that the output container is covered. You can remove it with no mess. When you take off the top, you get a little scatter. So do it over the sink! Then pour the contents into the coffee maker, replace the cover (over the sink) and put it back the grinder. Done! It's easier than measuring grinds out of a container.

Of course, I can't speak to reliability. And as best I can tell, you can't replace the grinding parts, so if they wear out you have to replace the unit. Time will tell.

As an update. It turns out that the grind amount setting is in 2 cup increments, and at that the amounts are strange. 6 cup setting gives 40 grams, 8 cup setting 50 grams! I've downgraded my rating because of this nuisance.

This was the 3rd time I bought this model as I was extremely happy with the durability & performance of the unit. This time it arrived DOA so I sent it back & bought a commercial grade grinder instead. Sure it cost almost 3 times as much as this units but it’s like night & day with uniformity of grinds. If you want an inexpensive grinder this one isn’t bad, but if you’re expecting a good burr grind you’ll be disappointed.

PRODUCT WAS DOA, WOULD NOT TURN ON. I ALSO WENT TO THE CUISINART WEBSITE ONLY TO FIND OUT THAT THIS PRODUCT IS "NOT" FOR EVERYDAY USE, YOU NEED TO UPGRADE TO HAVE ONE FOR EVERYDAY USE. RETURNED FOR A FULL REFUND. BOUGHT A "BRAUN" MODLE INSTEAD TO GO ALONG WITH MY "BRAUN" DRIP COFFEE MAKER.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a coffee grinder so much a coffee flaker
reviews.reviewText:
It doesn't grind the coffee so much as flakes the coffee. Also you select the amount by sliding the switch which as clicks for the number of cups. This switch seems particularly insecure: even more than typical sliding switches which generally fail much quicker than dial switches. I would rather just hold the kind button for the amount of coffee I want: both options would be even nicer.

I knew this going it, but I don't like the hopper idea: if I want to switch to decaf as I do at night, or make a flavored coffee for a special guest: OK so this is not much of an issue.

This machine does all it's supposed to do and it does it well, it is NOISY but only for a few seconds. The air tight container keeps the coffee fresh - I grind it at night and scoop it in the morning. Highly recommend this machine.

I bought this for my husband and mother in law.... they both are in love with it!! It’s relatively quiet compared to other grinders we have had. We have only had it for a week so can’t comment much on the durability,but it feels like a quality piece of equipment. I was worried about it taking up counter space, but it’s a good size

I had this exact model for several years, actually wore it out. Great product. Replaced with the same unit. within 2 weeks it was not working. Considered sending it back but, it was too late. Took it apart and cleaned it. Realized it has some differences in structure (upgrades?). it is working ok now but, I cannot depend on the quantity of cups grinding to match expectation in coffee. so, I have to measure with my coffee spoon. Not what was expected and have to take time I don't want to have to spend,..because this unit is supposed to grind for X# of cups and type of grind (drip, perc, espresso, etc.)

This grinder had a 30 day guarantee. It broke after 60 days. It would no longer grind more that several tbls of coffee at a time, so we resorted to measuring the amt of coffee to use per cup. I tried to return it but I was ignored. Do not buy this unless you want to keep replacing it every two months or so.

This worked beautifully........ for about 2 months and it started having issues. At first it seemed a small issue, just reseating the catch container to push the trigger mechanism. Now I have to seat it 8-9 times before it starts. And no matter what size setting I have it on, it runs for about 3 seconds and I have to do the whole process over again. I'm very disappointed in this. I had hopes because it was rated so well.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2 failures in 2 years: done with Cuisinart
reviews.reviewText:
Used this in my home to grind coffee for my wife and I. Safe to say it was used daily, about twice a day. The motor failed after about a year from initial purchase. This product has an 18 month warranty so they replaced it with a refurbished unit (for which I had to pay Shipping and Handling). That refurb lasted for 8 months and then the motor failed again. Warranty is only good from date of original purchase, not replacement date, so now I have to buy a new grinder.
There’s a reason this one is so much cheaper than the others. If you want to replace it every year, then go with this one. Otherwise, go with a more high quality product.

Have had this coffee grinder for some time now and use it on daily basis. It is still works as good as the day I got it. I love that I can simply dial and select the type of grind I would like, from coarse to fine. Would highly recommend this to my family and friends.

reviews.reviewTitle: wasted REALLY GOOD HAWAIIAN coffee THAT i havent afforded myself in 5 years...
reviews.reviewText:
5 stars for being INCREDIBLY LOUD... RESTOCKING FEES?! Like a bad stereo in your ear an hour before you need to get up on a peaceful sunday morning.

BEST KEEP BOX AND ALL PACKING SLIPS TIL YOU THROW AWAY Mach ne too...

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for novice coffee drinkers!
reviews.reviewText: I love this grinder. I am a novice coffee drinker & this has allowed me to experiment with different grind settings for different coffee makers: I have a French Press, Automatic Drip & Pour Over. Noise level doesn’t seem too loud, although it’s definitely not silent. A little bit of powder grinds get stuck in the chute, but cleans easily with the brush provided.

It's not very old, but we're having trouble with it not working periodically. There's no rhyme or reason to when it will malfunction. It stays on the counter and we don't change the grind volume or settings. The times it doesn't work, I've found sometimes placing my hand on it helps, or turning the grinder one direction to another. I like the hopper quantity, but for the inconvenience I wouldn't buy this again.

The grinder is a great budget burr grinder.
I bought this to grind beans for my Keurig refillable k-cups. The blade grinder I was using was chopping up the beans too fine and causing them to clog the refillable k-cups and overflow. As soon as I started using this grinder, my problem was solved. As other reviews stated, not every piece of grind is going to be 100% the same size and consistency, there is some fine powder that does collect, it's true. But in reality, it's not that much and hardly worth complaining over for almost any purpose. If you have such a need, you already know that you should probably spend the $300+ on a top of the line burr grinder. While still noisy (as all grinders are) It's much quieter than my old blade grinder. All & all, I'm very satisfied with the unit.
Works well. Nice to have the hopper full of beans all the time. Much less mess than the little grinder. But this bad boy is one loud MF!

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to beat for the money
reviews.reviewText: I've owned this grinder for two years. It has an 18 month warranty which is important since the grinder will last about 1 year with daily use. After 1 year the motor gives out and stops working (this happened on the original unit and the replacement unit). Cuisinart service is very good and they will send you a replacement within a day so you're back in business after about 4 days (accounting for shipping). The grinder is consistent in its grind so the biggest benefit to a burr grinder is you set the grind (coarse to fine), put the switch on the number of cups of coffee, and push the button. The coffee collects in the clear plastic container on the front. Burr grinders generate static so the coffee clings to the plastic container but its very easy to remove so it doesn't present a problem. I rate the grinder 5 stars for ease of use, price, and a great warranty (most grinders have a 12 month warranty) and 2 stars for the motor which doesn't last as long as it should. Overall rating 4 stars in my opinion.

WHEN it works!!!! have to let this thing rest after a few grinds, don't try to grind a whole bag, won't let you... you will get through 2 full batches then let it rest as when grinding the 3rd, it WILL shut down and need to rest.

I bought this machine for my husband as a gift because he is more of a coffee drinker than I am. I drink coffee also just not everyday. I had been planning on getting him a really nice French press because he had been complaining about how our old Mr. Coffee drip machine left the coffee flavorless and decided that it was time that we invested in a quality grinder as well. When reading about the functions of this item I was impressed with ease of maintenance. I like the way that the grounds stay in the coffee drawer as well as there being a lid on top where the beans can be stored and stay fresh. I like the pre-measured portion selections that allow you to dump the grounds directly into your machine without measuring each spoonful of grounds. The fine to course selection for grinding is also very easy to use. The overall look of the machine is not bad either. We have been using this item for over a year now and have not run into any problems. Also when we got the item it was nice to get the little bonus scoop/brush this really helps to get all of the coffee grounds out of the coffee drawer once it is ground. A great purchase, really enhances the flavor of the coffee and my husband and I both agree that our coffee brewed at home is now just as good as you can get from the coffee shops. I almost forgot to mention that the built-in canister on the bottom also has a lid on it which helps to keep the grounds contained and makes for less of a mess. I suppose you could keep some ground coffee fresh for a day or so in the reservoir if you had a little extra.

Very nice coffee grinder. We have used it for over a year and it has ground lots and lots of pounds of coffee (estimate of over 50 lb.). We are coffee snobs of sorts and use this grinder to grind coffee every morning for our Chemex coffee maker. If i was getting another grinder i will probably upgrade to a conical burr grinder because they grind even more evenly and that speeds up the process for Chemex coffee makers if it is a consistent grind. But with that being said... we love this grinder over some others we used because it is easy to grind the amount you want because of its slider to adjust how many cups of coffee you are making.

Everything came as expected and delivered on time! The delivery on product was great.

This product is a decent first burr grinder. A few adjustments could be made:
1.) Coffee grounds stick to the plastic grounds-receiver. Not sure this can be easily fixed but thought i would mention it.
2.) To adjust the grind, the hopper must be turned. I'm not a fan of this method. A handle would be preferred for noticeable grind position - as I change grinds often - making it more pronounced.
3.) Adding a measuring line to the plastic grounds-receiver would assist in larger quantities.
4.) The "Coarse" grind (French Press) doesn't seem to be much different at all from the medium grounds. When I get my beans ground from a top-tier grinder, the coarse grounds seem noticeably different.
5.) I almost feel as if there needs to be an on/off switch to the grinder. Couldn't find one (other than turned the hopper past the grind levels).
6.) It would be helpful to have a fill line on the hopper to know an estimated amount of beans to load for "X" amount of grounds.

Hope this is helpful!

Good product - took me a while to get it set up just right to brew one 16 oz cup of coffee - but worth it. A little loud, and a little weird as well in how it the container for the ground coffee is constructed. But overall it is a good buy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Reliable, consistent coffee grinder for people who don't want to think before they have coffee.
reviews.reviewText:
This is the second one I bought. I gave the first away as a gift when I moved. Does exactly what it's supposed to, every morning. I don't have to think, I just hit the button and coffee grinds come out.

Wish they'd make the grinds catcher out of something else. For some reason the finer grinds really cake onto it. Not really sure how they'd fix that issue. Maybe a slower grind speed or something...

reviews.reviewTitle: save your money unless you don't mind coffee dust and a iffy grind cycle
reviews.reviewText:
as someone else said in their review, this is not a true burr grinder like my bodum bistro. the cup measure feature did not work properly. i tried it on the 8 and 12 cup modes and it kept shutting off before completing the cycle. another annoyance was the grind. while it seemed to be consistent in the grind size you get a very fine powder that cakes up at the end of the cycle. the powder coats the interior of the cup and is a real mess to get out. if you keep the clumps of coffee dust in with the coffee it makes the grind finer for all of the coffee in the cup.

my advice - spend $50 more and buy a bodum bistro - after 3 years mine still works like a champ with a consistent grind and no powder.- i love it and will order a new one tomorrow.

I think this works just fine considering the cost. It is the 2nd one I've purchased, so obviously I'm satisfied with it. The first one's top "funnel" broke after a year or so. I bought 2 replacement funnels, but it never worked correctly after that; the replacement funnels were apparently not to the correct spec, and I had to keep downward pressure on the top during grinding or it would not run. Cheap enough to just buy a new one and hope the funnel holds up for a longer period. Grinds are consistent, without an objectionable amount of fine powder. Real coffee aficionados might complain, but for day-in, day-out use with a coffee press, I'm happy.

GREAT grinder. BUT, what a mess! Coffee grounds everywhere. So much static that it's hard to get all the grounds out of the container. Such a shame as it produces a beautiful grind. UPDATE: Right after I wrote this review, it stopped grinding. We're sending it back. Too bad, I have always trusted Cuisinart.

reviews.reviewTitle: You'll Wake up to the Sound, Not the Smell
reviews.reviewText:
Man this thing produces a wonderful grind for the money. No, it's not perfectly even, unless you grind your beans to dust, which it can do. My only complaint is the noise. It is loud enough that I leave the room for fear of hearing loss due to repeated exposure. Seriously, I worked in a factory, this thing is loud! I wish the bin didn't charge, but that is easily solved by tapping with a metal spoon. To sum up:
Far less sludge in my French press
Grinds fine enough for Turkish coffee
Too loud

reviews.reviewTitle: I generally grind between medium and fine. The amount of loss from grinding is huge
reviews.reviewText:
My expectations were high for a Cuisinart brand product. This misses the mark. I generally grind between medium and fine. The amount of loss from grinding is huge. Lots of beans are ground far too fine and are spit out of the grinder stuck in a powdery mess on the side of the plastic receiving receptacle.

For the price, it does the job. However, if you're using an expensive bean, I'd strongly recommend looking at a more expensive/efficient grinder.

the first one lasted years, no problem. the second one lasted 4 months and would often shut off prematurely (bad switch) and then finally died totally. Luckily we have a Starbucks on the first floor of our building. First unit 5 star, 2nd unit 2 star. Did leave some powder mess.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dead after 45 days! lemon, who knows?
reviews.reviewText:
ran fine for about 45 days, suddenly it started slowing down and fully died. now i need to contact Cuisinart directly for service... major PITA. maybe mine is a lemon, dunno.

not easy to clean
doesn't have air tight storage,must grind daily.
super loud, dont grind when others are sleeping.

Don't bet your morning coffee on this.

My old one finally died. I like the storage capacity of this style. With the other smaller ones, you are always adding coffee beans. This does make a lot of NOISE! But, it grinds well, and nice selection of settings

Purchased this in September and have used it only three times since then. Was happy with the grind. Third use started out fine but motor started to sound different and then stopped completely. Won’t turn back on and I believe the motor may have burned out for whatever reason.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not working correctly after less than two months/Customer Service run around
reviews.reviewText: I used one of these units for a long time with no troubles. Recently purchased a new one as the old one finally wore out. Purchased the new one in March and have had trouble from the beginning with the coffee not being pulled down in to the grinder. Finally decided to stop procrastinating and call Cuisinart. I have been on the phone, now twice, with them and have gotten the run around. A product that is two months old should not have to be "troubleshooted" before they will help me. I will not buy another Cuisinart product because of their customer service.

After using this grinder for two months now I really regret purchasing it. I have to run it through several times and it fails to grind all the beans. Some of them even "fly" up to the top. After each use I use my long coffee brush I bought separately to empty what it did grind into my coffee maker and then use it to clean out the top and inside as best I can. I'm sure there is some coffee stuck in there but will use it until I can get a descent one. Would not recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does its job loud and messy
reviews.reviewText:
This is an adequate machine for the price. It's not a clean machine as it really invites static and the coffee grounds are often in choas when you try to spoon them out.
It's also loud but honestly ... it's $35. If it cost more, this review/rating would be lower.

After 5 years of daily use, the motor no longer stays on. I suspect it's the controlling electronics rather than the motor itself, which is a shame. The warranty only goes 18 months, so I guess I got pretty good mileage out of it. Always was quite loud and was a bit more expensive than comparable grinders I'd owned in the past. Then again, I suppose those all lasted about five years on average too. The burr discs on this one seemed to have held up better than most. Still, I'd hoped for a lot more use out of this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Sad, but manufacture said the warrantee was up although ...
reviews.reviewText:
Sorry to say, but I only used this machine about 8 times since I purchased it! It completely died, & stopped working. I checked the outlet & tried another outlet! Very Sad, but manufacture said the warrantee was up although I used is so few times.
Going in the Garbage :(..

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for at-home grinds from French press to espresso!
reviews.reviewText: Decent burr mill. Doesn’t create as much ‘dust’ as other grinders around the same price point. I’m satisfied with the quality of this purchase until I save enough money to buy a high-end professional grade burr mill.

I've had this machine for almost 2 years. Only once did I experience a 'failure'..the gunk in the grinding wheels seized the device. After taking out the hopper and removing the buildup, it worked fine. I use the Aeropress and this grinder provides just the right grind for what I need. I've also used it with a French press equally as well. I find that the consistency of grind is partially influenced by the coffee bean. Some beans break apart more easily and thus create a finer grind than what you've chosen.

My only complaint is that flavored coffees (e.g. amaretto) leave a residue on the inside of the plastic hopper that is nearly impossible to remove. I recently soaked it in very warm water with liquid soap and the residue turned white, leaving the hopper with a frosted look. I haven't tried something more aggressive to clean it, yet...

All in all, for the price, and for 90% of the users, this is a great grinder.

I have used this Cuisinart grinder at home for about 6 years and I love it, so I bought a second one for use in the office. It is the best grinder you will get without purchasing a professional model for hundreds of dollars. Has settings for grinding everything from French press coffee to espresso, grinds evenly every time, and comes apart for easy cleaning. Unless you are unlucky and get a factory defect, you cannot go wrong buying this grinder. Only complaint is that it creates static when grinding and sometimes grounds will fly out of the container when you empty it so I have learned to do this over the sink. I think that is a small price (literally!) to pay for such a great product. If you are like me and enjoy brewing coffee using various methods, then this grinder is definitely for you.

reviews.reviewTitle: When the smaller grinder failed we first bought a replacement like the one that had failed but a different maker
reviews.reviewText: This our second Supreme Grind Burr Grinder. This was to replace a Cuisinart coffee grinder that stopped grinding after only 6 years. We purchased the burr grinder first for our beach house and were thrilled with its performance, settings and storage of coffee, just press and grind, pour the ground coffee into the filter basket and away you go. When the smaller grinder failed we first bought a replacement like the one that had failed but a different maker. We had coffee all over the counters. Decided to get the one we really wanted to begin with.. now happy coffee drinkers.

Girlfriend loves this device. We buy the New Mexico Piñon 5lb bags of beans at costco and she always needed to stop by the coffee grinder near the exit and I thought that was annoying. So I got her this and now she can choose what coffee strength she'll have every morning if need be. It's rather quick when grinding large amounts of coffee and so far after grinding about 10lbs of beans no issues.
I don't drink coffee so I wonder what else I could use it for.

We got a broken product on our first order and they replaced it. I like Cuisinart products but this one is a let down. It is very loud and very inconsistent with the grinding even we didn’t change the setting.

reviews.reviewTitle: But I am happy to report that I got it right
reviews.reviewText:
I wanted to wait a few weeks so that I could give a more educated review. It took me a week of experimentation before getting the grind exactly right.
My commercial didn't translate exactly to the Cuisinart. But I am happy to report that I got it right. And my preference is saved for the life of the machine. It is so worth the small jump in price to upgrade to the Burr grinder. The blade choppers/grinders that I tried in the past just didn't get it right. I'm really happy with this purchase

reviews.reviewTitle: Ok grinder. I'll keeping it because of the price.
reviews.reviewText: This it pretty good. Looks great and I like that it has an area for the beans. The UX is kinda weird. You have to slide the dial then hit the start button. To turn it off you have to slide the dial back. It should be 1 button. Also this is not a bur grinder. There are better quality grinders but 3 times as expensive so I'm keeping this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't do what a burr mill grinder should do....
reviews.reviewText: My father-in-law has a Mocamaster coffee maker and a nice French press and in both machines his conventional electric blade grinder produced proper sized grounds but also a lot of very fine grounds that escaped the permanent filters and, thus, settled to the bottom of each cup of coffee. As I understand it, a burr mill grinder is supposed to grind coffee to a consistent size, which is why I bought this for him. I have a manual burr mill grinder and the beans are gravity fed into and out of the grinding area and are all the same size. This machine does not do that. I don't know why but some of the beans remain in the grinding area long enough to be reground over and over until they are as fine as dust and are next seen in the bottom of each cup of coffee. He graciously gave it back to me and it suits me fine because I use a pour-over system with a paper filter. If you want ground coffee and don't need a consistent sized grind, save 30 bucks and get the blade type. If you want a true burr mill grinder, look elsewhere.

Item as was stated, fast shipping, great seller, and highly recommended...As far as the unit itself-It is a coffee grinder, it does a good job, and it is fairly loud but that is the nature of the job it is tasked with...Thank you.

reviews.reviewTitle: After having this for 2 months I am very disappointed. It keeps bogging down and tripping the overheat ...
reviews.reviewText: After having this for 2 months I am very disappointed. It keeps bogging down and tripping the overheat switch. I just called product support and here is what I was told. About once per week you need to grind one of the following for 2-3 minutes, Kosher salt, real rice (not minute rice) or sugar. This helps clean the oils from the unit to make it functional. I am never buying a Cuisinart product again. This is going in the garbage.

Works great...for a year or two. My second grinder just burned out again. The first one starts chugging after a couple years then stopped grinding altogether. The newest one, bought a little over a year ago, worked great. Then suddenly when I tried to bring my normal 8 cup bring at medium the whole top started turning then that familiar odor of burning motor. I thought with the name Cuisinart I was safe. So much for the name.
Surprisingly, satisfied with the size of this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, easy to clean, makes great ground coffee
reviews.reviewText: We love having a burr grinder. Our last one broke and I was so lucky it did. This one is very simple to use and easy to clean. I used to spend 5-10 minutes taking out the burrs and sweeping them with the small brush. This one has washable parts that are really easy to clean. Dishwasher-safe too, though I wash them by hand. I love the features on this grinder, and the coffee comes out great, too.

I was looking for a grinder to take the place of a horrible Black and Decker model we bought about 6 months ago and saw this. We had one of the original Cuisinart grinders and loved it (a victim of my friends clumsiness).

I love this so far; looks far more expensive than it's price tag, and goes well with the Cuisinart stainless steel coffee maker we recently purchased. Grind is very even and the fact that I don't have to refill it every day is awesome!

Unlike other reviewers I have found that you CAN get to the burr grinder mechanism simply by unscrewing the entire hopper by grabbing the black grind selector ring and turn to coarse and keep turning to unscrew - then you can clean the grinding mechanism.

All in all I think it's an awesome value option over grinders that cost at least twice as much and do the exact same thing.

Works well, no mess, as used:
1. Buy a stiff bristled brush for $2.00 at any kitchen supply shop or home store.
2. After running desired amounts of beans through, extract holder and place it on a sheet of paper towel.
3. Tap the bottom of the holder gently.
4. Remove the lid and brush any clinging coffe into the filter (basket).
5. Very gently brush down the inside walls of the box to remove any clinging coffee.
6. Pour coffe into the filter.
7. Use the brush to clean the path from the grinder into the box, so the unit does not clog and burn out over time.
8. Wash and dry the box and lid. When replacing it on the unit, leave the box about a quarter of an inch open to let air circulate. I also unplug it. Fold the paper towel and swipe the counter clean. Enjoy your coffee!

I've been using this burr grinder practically every day for over a month, and so far it's been a great buy especially for the price I got it at. Even for a coffee novice like me, burr grinders do make coffee taste substantially better compared to the usual coffee chopper/grinder. I've been using it at a coarse grind for my french press and my coffee is uniformly perfect every time! The only criticism that i've had is similar to what's stated in the reviews- the plastic case which the grinds go into accumulates a lot of coffee dust, and it doesn't pour all of the coffee very easily. It's also a pretty large coffee grinder, which is convenient, but you should think about whether or not you want to give counter space to something this big too.

I purchased the same grinder several years ago and it lasted a few years. I made the mistake of putting the plastic pieces in the dishwasher and the plastic piece at the bottom of the hopper broke off and it also help water. The grinder itself worked till the end. I've learned my lesson and will only hand wash the plastic parts. Overall very satisfied with how it grinds and the price compared to other brands.
I bought this as a gift for my husband and he loves it! He’s had it for almost a year and it works fine after daily use. And it doesn’t ruin the bean flavor when going through the grinding process.

reviews.reviewTitle: Our second time buying this model!
reviews.reviewText: This is our second one of these. The other one burned out after seven or eight years. I love this grinder. It is extremely adjustable as far as fineness or coarseness of the grounds go or the amount you want to grind. The only weird issue is that the grounds don't come out of the catching container perfectly, so I end up scraping some of the grounds off the side every time. But still a great grinder for the price and very functional and adjustable.

This is a piece of junk. I have had three replacements within a year...first, it wouldn't grind fine on the fine setting, it was always coarse. It was replaced, and did the same thing. Now, the third one grinds a small amount, regardless of the number of cup settings! Now I see why they cut the price in half. Not worth it at all.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Auto Burr Mill
reviews.reviewText:
This unit looks great out of the box. The first unit I got from Amazon didn't work at all. I thought well, give
it another try. Well that was a mistake. The second unit worked for four months, and I have to say It didn't grind the coffee
concistantly- meaning most was ok BUT there was coffee that was ground to a powder, extreamly fine. The fine grounds
go through the filter into the bottom of my cup. I can't return it because it's past the return date.
My opinion is that I would not reccomend this unit to anyone.
Thanks, S. Dennison, Sugar Grove, Pa.

reviews.reviewTitle: My Grinder worked great while it worked
reviews.reviewText: My Grinder worked great while it worked, it just died after 6 months. Cleaned it out and and still wont work, seems the motor is fried. Looked for a replacement and the Krups is just as bad according to reviews. Looks like I have to spend more to get something reliable. Stay away, this should have lasted more than 6 months !Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill

reviews.reviewTitle: Best grinder on market for the price.
reviews.reviewText: I am partial to Cuisinart products; and having used this at my friends house I brought one for myself. Sturdy, seems to be a little quieter than my old grinder, maybe just my imagination. If so, it works for me!!

I really like the design and the ability to load the hopper and ready to grind. The negative, it’s very loud. I have had several coffee grinders over the years and this is truly the loudest I’ve heard. On the other hand it seems to work well. I gave it 4 stars due to how loud this machine is but for the price, works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Go Get It, It’s Like A Pro Coffee Grinder
reviews.reviewText: Best coffee grinder you can get for the money. I upgraded from a more basic version and now I feel like a pro barista (joke), but for real, it makes things so much easier and I get to test different levels for my coffee experiments.
At first I really liked it because it will store about 3 pots of coffee beans in it, but it takes a long time to grind coffee beans for 8 cups of coffee and it is extremely loud. Not impressed.
I use very fresh oily beans which does clog this and needs to be cleaned every few months, which is difficult. But the grind is great, and it works reliably otherwise. I've bought a couple.
I used this mill to grind beans for my cold brewed coffee. It worked great three times and then wouldn't start. It'll make a nice modern style addition to my trash barrel. I'm really disappointed.

I dont know what made these popular in the past. I have bought 8 of these for two locations and very single one of them has quit working after a month of use. One of them sounded sick the very first time we used it, that one instantly went into the trash. Save yourself the time and money, Buy a KitchenAid grinder on the first time. The reliability of this one makes you always have one on had as a backup.

Very happy with this grinder. It can grind a lot, it grinds well, and offers a lot of different grind types. As with all grinders it's loud, so there's that. If you're grinding 8+cups worth of beans it gets hot, but I doubt it affects the flavor (if anyone can sense that give them then I applaud you and feel bad for you as I'm sure you rarely enjoy any coffee). It's pretty easy to maintain and clean, although I found the less I do, the neater it is.

Another "con" which happens with a lot of grinders is pouring the grounds out can get a bit messy due to the way the grounds get stored. But, again, this seems to be with nearly and grinder and it's not all that messy.
Is Granger does a wonderful job at preparing my coffee. I like to find ground which gives my coffee ascertain Jena se qua. I looked like a deep dark roast and this grinder gives me just what I need.

We love this Cuisinart coffee grinder! There are two settings to use. You have the choice of grinding the coffee beans at Fine, Medium or Course and anything in between. We have ours set at Medium. You also set how many cups of water you are using in your coffee maker. You can select 4,6,8,10,12,14,16,or 18 cups. With these two settings in place, the Cuisinart does the rest and does it well. There is no guessing on how many beans to grind for the cups of coffee you want. It will automatically grind the exact amount of beans for the cups of coffee you want. Our coffee in the morning has never tasted better!

The Cuisinart is warranted for one year. Our last Cuisinart "died" a couple of weeks after the warranty expired. Oh well. It was such a great performing and easy grinder to use that we just had to buy another one!

reviews.reviewTitle: 3 replacements - all burnt motors in less than a year
reviews.reviewText:
Frustrating. I gave up and had to return and request for a full refund.

Customer Service: You might not notice it, but I heard the word "Okay" for 25th times (not exaggerating) and "MMhhmmm" many times while you're working on something to resolve the issue. It is annoying, while you're breathing so hard on the phone.

Grinds OK but the high pitch noise was unbearable. I finally had to get rid of it. Even though it was not a deal breaker like the noise, but I didn't like the lid on top of the receptacle. Every time I had to remove it to scoop the coffee, it made a mess regardless of how careful I was.

Have bought a few Cuisinart products lately that do not last and this is the latest to quit after 4-years. Funny thing is we have a Cuisinart food processor that is 25 years old that is still humming along. Lesson learned is Cuisinart is now building in planned obsolescence so look for another manufacturer.

So very pleased that we made this purchase via Amazon. Takes the guesswork out of coffee grinding with the option to choose the fineness or coarseness of the grind and the selection hub for amount you plan on brewing. Much quieter than our previous no frills grinder. The grind we use takes about 30 seconds once the unit has been activated. Very happy with this purchase.

I've put a pound of coffee through this grinder, and so far it's been ok.

I use a french press, so I have it on the coarsest grind setting, which is sufficient.
BUT. There is always a very fine powder that gets in the grounded coffee. Sometimes it's stuck to the wall of the bin, which is nice because I can very carefully collect it, and sprinkle it on pudding. Other times, it's in the coffee, and the last sip or two of my cup is a bit thick and unpleasant.

BUT the price is on par with the performance. It's not something you'll see at a professional coffee shop, but I would gift it to any coffee-loving friends I have.

Have had this for a few weeks now and it works as expected. Nice for the price. Coffee tastes better. We now have a very fast brew coffee maker, and I noticed that Folgers out of a can was tasting better than our gourmet beans and I realized that with a Bunn, grind is very, very important for flavor extraction. Much less mess than with a blade grinder!

My only complaint is when the beans are ground and go into the container, the static electricity has the ground coffee stuck to the sides and then it gets on the counter when I am pouring it into the filter. It has been a while now and this is still occurring. Not sure what to do about it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder, just not for me.
reviews.reviewText:
I wanted to buy a conical burr grinder, but opted for the cheaper option. This is a good burr grinder in all aspects as marketed. As I have moved into the coffee snobbery, the cake that this grinder makes is bothersome. The DBM-8 produced a good grind, only the tailing is ultra fine cake. Using a French press these particles pass through the mesh and make for a more tactical experience.. I should have gone with the conical burr....
This is a good grinder if you are looking for a poor over, or expresso grind.

I really wanted to like this grinder...it matches my coffee maker and looks great. Unfortunately it stopped working almost immediately after I bought it. I've cleaned it, banged on it, you name it, but it would only work periodically and now not at all. Very disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great price for a burr grinder but..
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder for the price! It doesn’t quite produce a uniform grind, one the coarsest setting it still shoots a fair amount of fine grind dust and it never quite finishes grinding all the beans in the hopper. They bounce out like popping popcorn! Overall it is a decent grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good burr grinder for the money
reviews.reviewText:
I was waiting for my old blade grinder to break for years. Once it did I choose this one to replace it. I like the fact that it stores 1/2 lb of beans and its predetermined settings let you hit a button and walk away. No more scooping beans and counting off a grind time. This machine will take care of that for you.
The reason I am only giving this 4 stars is because the amount of variables that go into deciding amount/grind size of your beans. The recommendations in the users guide are very loose and basically tell the reader to experiment with grind size and quantity to determine your own favorite cup of coffee. While this is true, I fell like they should have given me more to build on. A taste chart that factors in quantity/flavor intensity/grind size/bean quantity would be extremely helpful. If you enjoy making coffee as much as drinking it than this grinder will help you find the one you like best.
Man I love this thing!! You can't have it back. I can dump half a bag of coffee beans in it, set the amount I want ground each time and then just hit the button when I ant coffee ground.

This is a great product only one issue after you grind the beans and pull out the compartment to scoop them out is it leaves behind a ton of Coffee flakes so every day I have to vacuum it up a little bit and wipe it up with a wet towel there’s nothing you can do to fix it

Considering this grinder is only $40 it’s not a bad buy but the grind it produces is all over the board...on coarse I get fine and course chunks throughout which aren’t appealing when using a French press. The fine grind seems ok with just a few chunks in there.

Works great, grinds exactly what we need! Not sure how airtight the top is for storing coffee beans. It doesn’t seem right at all but we use it every day so I’m not worried about it staying fresh the whole time.

This is my 2nd of these products. The 1st lasted 11 years of daily use and through 3 long distance moves with less than ginger movers. The part that gave way was the plastic mount of the top burr. For so much use, I can't fault it, though. It did well for the use it provided.

Great and simple design. Perfect for the $ for those who still appreciate a nicer cup of coffee without the means to finance a professional set up in home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great step up from a blade grinder.
reviews.reviewText: Never had a burr grinder before and decided to splurge. Glad I did. Much easier to get a perfect grind. I think there our like 18 levels of grind you can pick from. No matter how hard i tried with other grinders, I usually managed to spill some grounds. The capture bin on this really works great and easy to pour into my filter and replace back into the unit without a spill.

I am on my second Cuisinart Burr Grinder. The first lasted several years and we have had the one we own now for about 4 years. It grinds the coffee and seems to last. We use it every day. I saw some reviews that complained about the noise. It is loud, I suppose, but I don't care. It's not intolerable and the noise doesn't last very long.
It creates consistent grounds and it's easy to adjust how fine the grinds are. It just works well. This year, I plan to get one for each of my kids for Christmas.

reviews.reviewTitle: 2 years later and it is still working perfectly....everyday
reviews.reviewText: We have owned this now for about 2 years and this puppy is still grinding away....everyday! Love it and if it ever should break, I will def buy it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: This does a fine job grinding
reviews.reviewText: This does a fine job grinding, but the STATIC!! It is soooooooo annoying!! The vessel that holds the grounds is plastic and the process of grinding creates some static so the grounds CLING like crazy to the inside of the plastic container. Then when getting them out, it creates a shower of spraying, static coffee grounds. For finely ground beans it is AWFUL! It works. But please Cuisinart, rethink that container!
Garbage. Only works if you CONSTANTLY shake it or bounce it. Otherwise the beans don’t feed and it just spoils up. I’ve been putting up with this grinder for years but I just can’t take it anymore.

reviews.reviewTitle: Static Electricity is the enemy of this product
reviews.reviewText: I tried hard to like this grinder, as I am usually a fan of Cuisinart products. But the negative reviews about the static electricity making the grinds cling to everything is incredibly annoying, messy, and inconvenient. It grinds perfectly, but either the materials of the collecting cup, or the grinder itself needs to be changed to avoid the buildup of static wreaking havoc with the grinds. You have to scrape the grinds down the edges of the cup to have the full amount of coffee for the filter, and even then, the static makes the grinds fly all over the place. Serious design flaw!

reviews.reviewTitle: Seems to work well so far. First one I ...
reviews.reviewText: Seems to work well so far. First one I ordered was defective and didn't work at all, but my replacement got here really quick, so all is well now. For a low cost burr grinder, it really does the trick.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great in an office environment
reviews.reviewText: Works great in an office environment, where fresh ground beans of a strong nature are most appreciated. It did not take many "experiments" to find the best setting for the preferred strength of the great majority. It is more loud than expected. But it seems the people in near by offices endure the sound, since the door to the convience room is closed when grinding. It is four stars because the noise, we have taken off one star.

reviews.reviewTitle: I really like this coffee grind
reviews.reviewText: I really like this coffee grind. The only reason it's not getting a 5-star review is because it is a little messy. When you remove the container with the freshly ground coffee, you have to remove the lid which is covered in coffee grounds/dust and bits spill out every time I do this. Beyond that, it's a fine coffee grind. It is very consistent in the range between fine grounds and coarse grounds. I would recommend this grind -- just be sure to put it on a tray or some sort.

This was purchased as a replacement for the same item. We originally purchased one at Costco, but that was years ago. Of course they didn't have another one when ours broke, so we turned to faithful Amazon and found the exact model we loved. We replaced it and it's still going strong! We grind coffee every day, so this is a must at our house. Adjustable grind lets you pick how fine you want your grounds. Easy to clean, easy to remove hopper and just all around great product. It also looks fabulous on the counter!

reviews.reviewTitle: accurately grinds beans according to amount and fineness selected
reviews.reviewText: Grinder accurately measured 4 cup and 14 cup pots and perfectly grinds beans for french press and screen filter on extra course as well for paper filter on medium. I wish I had purchased this a long time ago as I'm an avid coffee consumer and the smell of fresh ground beans is sooooo good!

Does a good job of grinding. I grind 32 ounces for an average of four days a week. It lasted nine months before it stopped working. I paid just under $44. You get what you pay for I suppose. I just expected it to last more than a year.

reviews.reviewTitle: Replacement for a 5 year old unit
reviews.reviewText: We had one of these die after 5 years of nearly daily use, so I bought another. It's a bit loud, but I love the large hopper and just pushing one button to get the exact grind and amount that I want. It's a nice little machine for a reasonable price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great piece of kit. Noisy kit.
reviews.reviewText:
Great grinder. Consistent grind. I use a paper filter so I grind a lot finer. Always grind based on your filter element.

It is loud. Considering some ear protection in the kitchen now. Lol. Cuisinart should have worked on perfecting noise insulation. If they did - I predict folks will replace theirs for the quieter grinder. I'd buy the quieter model if it performed as well.

I purchased this as a gift for my 25 yr old son for his birthday. He seems to enjoy it. He’s by no means a coffee snob. He didn’t give details so I have nothing to add to this from a review standpoint such as material quality, durability or versatility.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not For Grind Fine Enough for Espresso
reviews.reviewText:
This grinder does NOT grind beans fine enough for espresso! If that is why you are buying it, save yourself the time and buy another brand of grinder. The grind for espresso will not pack, and the water runs through the port-a-filter way too quickly, signaling a grind that is way too coarse.

Other than that, it's okay.

Great coffee grinder but I didn't expect it to be so LOUD! Sometimes I'd take it into the garage so I didn't wake up my kids, or I'd grind the coffee the night before to use in the morning. Holds a ton of beans which is nice.

We are replacing another cuisinart blade grinder, and we always filter our water and use fresh roasted beans, so we are used to good coffee. The burr grind makes GREAT tasting coffee! We are using much less coffee than we did before, so I think this grinder will pay for itself with savings. Yes, it is louder, but I can deal with that for the perfect grind and smooth coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinding at a low price
reviews.reviewText: Bought as a gift for my daughter who had just purchased an espresso machine. She says this is the best grinder she's ever used. Beans are consistently ground to the desired level of fine. Price was much lower than other burr mill style grinders.

My Cuisinart DBM-8 has produced great French press grounds for four cups for maybe seven years basically every day. When the motor revs up, I take the hopper off and clean out the burrs and the chute, but it's tempting to slap the bean bin or side of the grinder, which will give you another day or so. The last time I did that maybe too hard, the threads on the bin were damaged. (They might have worn out.) A new bin with top burr cost $8 plus shipping. If I'm careful the fine dust doesn't get onto the counter.

I bought this grinder in September 2016. It worked well for nine months until June 2017 at which point it just died. $42 for nine months of service seems a bit rich. Interestingly, when I tried to exercise the warranty, Cuisinart wanted me to send the old one back. The cost of doing so from UPS was $25. It made it so it was not worthwhile to exercise the warranty for that short of a period of time that it worked.

Do not buy this grinder! I used it a total of three times and it died. As in cannot use. No longer working. Waste of money. I have my Breville grinder for 10 year before it died. I should have spent the money and opted to purchase a more expensive reliable burr grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: The only grinder you should invest in if you love coffee
reviews.reviewText: This product is extremely reliable in terms of perfect grind. My coffee tastes much better now that I’m not crushing the beans in a blade grinder or overworking them just to get an even grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good but not easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: You will need another box for storage if you grind too much, the build in box doesn't look airtight ready. The noice is a bit loud to me. Overall is acceptable at this price.

Good grinder for the money. Two things that could be improved:

1) creates just a bit of fine powder, no matter how coarse the setting is. Other reviewers have posted pictures of this.
2) sometimes the grinder doesn’t feed beans and you have to shake it a bit out of fear the gears don’t grind down.

this is second one of these we have purchased. The first one lasted for about 6 years so we bought another one. It gets used daily and grinds up the coffee perfectly. It is rather loud but that is to be expected. five stars

I purchased this unit Jan. 2018. The unit worked fine for several months and then quit and would not turn on at all. I contacted Cuisinart and they replaced the unit.

Unfortunately, the grinder stopped working again. I've contacted Cuisinart about it. I don't know if they'll replace it or not. This is the 2nd unit to quit working in about a year. Not sure I would purchase this product again. If Cuisinart will continue to replace it, maybe I would. I expect better products from Cuisinart.

I used this product 2 times and it broke after the second time. I worked on cleaning it out, making sure nothing was blocking the grinder. Everything is clear and still doesnt work. I tried grinding it on the course setting, so I am not sure it this affected it. If it was unable grinding at that level, it should not have been an option. I am glad I used a gift card to purchase this item and did not have to waste my own money, but I am really disappointed because I have not been able to grind coffee for my french press.

Airtight... no, but stays fresh (maybe we use up our beams quickly?). Noice level is average - not loud, but definitely not quiet. Noise is not bothersome at all. Beans grind easily and fall 99.999% into its receptacle. We especially appreciate the various grind levels as we’re an espresso and a French press house. Would recommend 5/5 stars. Also, nice looking and compact.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can only polish a little, can't always polish
reviews.reviewText: Grinding coffee can't be polished all the time, and overheating will stop automatically. You need to wait for the temperature to cool before you can continue to polish. not very convenient
Too many switches! On/Off is what I need. Grind selector seems geared towards coffee powder, adjustment indices mean nothing. Hate the automatic feature- one more switch to fail.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasted 6 months but Cusinart is sending me a new one!
reviews.reviewText: Today almost 6 months to the day when I got the grinder it stopped working. I use organic coffee beans which probably have more oils than non-organic beans. Tara at Cusinart Customer service waived the $10 fee to send me a new one. They want me to cut the cord and send it back. i'm going to see if they can take a video of me cutting the cord electronically. They have an 18 month warranty. So the unit should last 18 months to 3 years the CSR said. That said, the device is very cool!

reviews.reviewTitle: ... to an electric percolator (and oh my how much better that is
reviews.reviewText: We recently threw out the tasteless automatic drip coffee maker and changed to an electric percolator (and oh my how much better that is!), and the blade grinder we had just wasn't getting the job done consistently. This machine is wonderful. The first try produced very consistent coarse grounds in the perfect amount for our percolator. The settings for coarseness and the amount of grounds needed for our desired number of cups was perfect! It is not very loud, and it gets the beans ground very quickly. If you are tired of the bland, tasteless coffee of the automatic drip world, I highly recommend this grinder, paired with a Presto electronic percolator. We enjoy our morning coffee again!

The noise level on this is ridiculously loud. I find myself plugging my ears when it's on. Then you have to be careful when youn take the cover off because all the fine dust sticks to the lid and the top of the container. I have to spend the wiping the dust that sticks due to static off the top of the container before I put the grounds in my French press. I bought this based on Amazon reviews but I wouldn't recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: there is a giant chunk of super fine grounds that makes a pour over taste incredibly ...
reviews.reviewText: Inconsistent grind, which is exactly the reason to purchase a burr grinder in the first place. The motor spins WAY too fast. No matter how coarse I set it, there is a giant chunk of super fine grounds that makes a pour over taste incredibly bitter.

Broke within 2 months. Cuisinart has a misleading and terrible warranty. They want $10 for a replacement, and want me to pay out of pocket to ship the old one back so they can refurbish it and make more money off of it. How do I know the new one won't break as fast as the old one did? You would be better off finding a different product from a trustworthy company.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy setup. Fairly even grind. Loud. Easy maintenance and cleaning.
reviews.reviewText: This thing has a pretty even grind and is quick to setup and use. It’s nice to press one button and grind the right amount of beans. I wake up early and press the button to grind the right amount of beans for my pot of coffee. It is loud and the static buildup in the container is a bit annoying. But overall a pretty quick even grind that’s adjustable and the hopper keeps a few days worth of beans stored between fillings.

Love this coffee Grinder! I've own other grinders not name Cuisinart and they brake and stop working! So far so good and I love the various amount of grinding options and its sealed well after grinding and probably the easiest grinder I've own when it comes to cleaning. Very Happy with the purchase and the packaging was well sealed.

Of all the great Cuisinart products I have in my kitchen, the Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill was the biggest disappointment. I don't expect products to last a lifetime but the grinder in question couldn't even grind a half container of whole beans after a year. It died a slow death and now just wastes space on my counter top.
I'd like to toss it but wondering if I need to return it for a refund or credit. Thank you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Started off good but static electricity is a problem
reviews.reviewText: I'm not one to write many reviews. 6 months ago I would have given 5 stars as the grind is very good and consistent. Recently though when I use it there is a tremendous amount of static electricity and the coffee is all over the counter and grinder. I am using the same brand whole beans, I'm at a loss to explain it, it's almost to the point that I consider buying my coffee already ground or look into another grinder, I wonder if anyone else has had this issue?

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds coffee very nicely, and with so many grinding choices!
reviews.reviewText: I had one of these years ago and liked it then so I bought another one as a replacement. I’m really enjoying ground coffee in the morning again! I’d but this item again.

It's extremely loud. Tiny particles fly everywhere when transferring from grinder to storage and you must make several transfers to store an adequate amount. We buy a big bag of beans from CostCo online (not available in store) but I'd rather take the bag to the store and use their large grinders than fuss with this small messy grinder. It's the first Cuisinart appliance that has disappointed me so I am returning it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little grinder for the price!
reviews.reviewText: Shocked about some of the reviews posted about this grinder. We've owned the grinder for 15 months now and have never had an issue with it. Never had to tear it and clean it like the other posts have said or have had to get a replacement and we use it everyday. I would highly recommend.

This is a very large grinder that can grind different course settings, but shoots a fine dust against the container that holds the grinders after the grind which is very messy and I wonder if that could add bitter to the final brewed coffee? I've used cheaper grinders that I felt did just as well except that you're not able to get the consistent grind that this will give you.We have used this for about 20 grinds, so cover all I'm mixed on this grinder. I personally would try a different grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: I like how easy this one is to use and clean
reviews.reviewText: I have used a few grinders before. I like how easy this one is to use and clean. I also found that this one doesn’t clog with high useage. I have one at home and suggested it for my job when our last on broke. It is great, especially since it has not needed an uncloggingz

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent grinder with very minor problems
reviews.reviewText: Machine grinds coffee well but can not grind less than two tablespoons worth. If you drink coffee one cup at a time you will have left over. System creates a lot of static so it is hard to get all the ground coffee out and when you remover collector lid to get at the coffee some invariably spills. Other then these minor problems an excellent purchase.

It's not quite as good as my true burr grinder, but it is much better than a regular blade grinder. It is kind of a hybrid between a true burr grinder and a blade grinder. It spins very fast and is relatively noisy and the size of the grounds is somewhat inconsistent, but it's not terrible. The operation is very simple with a single button to push and the grounds are well contained so there isn't a lot of mess. It holds about 12 to 16 ounces of beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: Product is defective after one year!
reviews.reviewText: The Cuisinart coffee grinder lasted almost a year to the day. It worked well enough up to that point, which is more than I can say for the 2 Cuisinart espresso machines that did not even work out of the box. I pulled my old coffee grinder from the 90's back out (we were using it to grind spices) and use it until it dies. I am certainly done with Cuisinart products. It is terrible that electronics seem to be engineered to fail at their warranty date, a shameful business model!

So far this Burr grinder works great! A must have for coffee lovers it will be a big difference in the taste of your coffee. Like any grinder you will get some "dust" , "cling" etc. I solved that problem by purchasing 2 brushes, a small 1" wide "paint" brush with soft bristles and use that to clear up the excess. And a stiff bristle paint brush to clean out the spout opening where the grinded coffee comes out. No biggie to clean up.( It does come with a "brush" on the end of the scoop but that thing is annoying to use.)
Good price. Hope this lasts longer than my last grinder so can buy as a gift.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not the grinder to end all grinders
reviews.reviewText:
What can one say, it won't be the last one I buy, but it is the best of the ones I have purchased in quite some time. The large size hopper to hold the beans are ideal. The adjustment levels are great for when you want a espresso grind or a coarse drip grind. It does take up more room on the counter then the old grinder, but not by much.

Yes I would buy this again and recommend to others.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice grinder, but it clogs up frequently
reviews.reviewText:
I didn't realize how large this grinder was, fortunately I have counter space for it, and fortunately it looks good. Then again, I can grind a whole day's coffee in a minute or so.
