It's less noisy than I'd expected (quieter than the Braun blade chopper it's replacing). The hopper conveniently holds half a pound of beans. I like being able to control grind size, between espresso and drip for my AeroPress.

One important drawback is that the ground coffee doesn't flow through the grinding wheels, but instead has to move sideways through a small opening. This opening clogs up every few times I use it, and I need to take the whole grinder apart to clean out the compacted coffee grounds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Second time around not as good as the first
reviews.reviewText: Our first Cuisinart Burr Mill was purchased 6+ ago at a department store. Worked like a champ until Dec 2019. Purchased the Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill in Dec 2019 and product looked, sounded and worked like the previous until it died last week after less than 6 months of service. Unfortunately, not much of a warranty on it through Amazon. Not that we thought we would need one. Chalking it up to "they don't make things like they used to" and moving on to a different product.

this thing is outstanding. two things i wish i had known before i bought it. the static electricity it generates causes the coffee to literally jump out of the plexiglass container and stick to the counters and sides of the microwave.
second its is inconsiderately loud. like wake the baby loud. probably twice as loud as a good blade gender. maybe its aggravating because its so high pitched. that may wear in and quiet down.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Grinder but a a bit loud and a bit messy
reviews.reviewText:
I like the output of the grinder, so the selection of different types of grounds and quantity is great.
But it is quite loud, and getting the grounds out is a bit of mess. Im not sure how this compares to other products, but it is not so bad as to send it back, just feel it is a pain.

It’s loud that’s about the only complaint beside the removing the top Lid of the compartment and grinds fall out over the counter. Would I buy it again. Yes. It’s not a bad grinder . Has so many grind options depending. Looks very nice and stylish.

Gets a super fine grind. For coffee. Could probably get a super fine grind for anything else you might want to grind up if you get my drift. But ya it works great for my espresso beans for storage and grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: staticky grounds make a big mess
reviews.reviewText: Two stars because it grinds the coffee. But what a mess and what a lot of noise! To grind 12 oz of beans took about 4 batches (my grind is set between med and fine). Each time you have to take the plastic bin of grounds out of the machine to dump it out, coffee flies out of the opening. And then when you take the lid off, the grinds are static charged and fly everywhere. I'm tempted to do this outside next time, so I'm not chasing coffee grounds all over my kitchen for the next week.

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder states that it is washable. The plastic ...
reviews.reviewText: This grinder states that it is washable. The plastic part, not the grinder itself. We washed it before use and water got between the plastic of the top part and the stem attached to it.

reviews.reviewTitle: great burr grinder for a penny pincher
reviews.reviewText: Filled it with my beans as soon as it arrived. So far it has been very user friendly (because I just can't function in the morning before I've had my coffee). The bin is plastic so it does get a little staticky and holds onto your grinds but unless you've got a glass bin that will always be an issue with any grinder you have. Definitely worth the money when you consider a blade grinder is around $20.

This is a flat burr grinder, not a conical burr grinder. This grinder is good for coffee that requires fine to small coarse grounds. However, I mainly drink coffee out of a french press, which requires medium to large coarse grounds. This grinder will ALWAYS produce powdered grounds with your large coarse grounds. There is always an excess of sediment at the bottom of my cup when I use beans from this grinder. It's also very loud.

This is a great grinder for the price. I had a chance to borrow my neighbors and found it was very easy to use and made very consistent grinds. This is not a conical grinder and collects a bit more grinds, but for the price it cannot be beat. It is a little bit on the noisy side but I can live with that. The hopper is large and can take quite a few beans. The fit and finish is good quality and I like the brushed aluminum look. It has a nice storage underneath for the cord as well. I mainly use this for my drip coffee machine but so far I am happy with the quality of the grinds and especially that fresh morning coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: worked for 1.25 lbs, then overheated, still works
reviews.reviewText: worked for 1.25 lbs, then died. tried to grind 2 lbs at once. motor got hot, wont work anymore. was able to fill up grounds container 3 times in 1 use before died. after 20 minutes, still no life from unit. 1 hour later the unit started working again. maybe thermal switch just needs to reset. so everything is okay, just cant grind more than 1 lb or so at a time, which should be okay for my needs.
Bought in July 2019 , October 2019 it quit working. Smell of burnt something! Have been trying to call every number I can fine. Not one human being to talk to. It has a 18 month warrant.
I have already had to replace the motor drive transistor TWICE to keep this running. And then, it only lasts through about ten fine grinds.. at most. Don't buy it.

The Cuisinart DBM-8 grinder continues to work after five years of daily use.
I gave one to my daughter three years ago and it continues on its grinding ways.
There are really no 'cons' to my appreciation of the grinder.

For me, a good and easy grind is my priority, and this machine delivers on that front. It can be really messy (I keep a mini dust pan nearby) and is very loud, but it's worth it to me. Others might not like that.

I'm thrilled with this grinder. Again, another well made product from Cuisinart. I couldn't ask for better for the price. My beans get ground uniformly and I can grind pretty close to the exact amount I need each day. I have a small complaint that was mentioned by another reviewer; that there are two tight crevices where some grounds get caught and the brush it comes with doesn't remove them easily. But this is trivial along with the way too short cord which forced me to add an extension on the wall. As I mentioned in my review of the Cuisinart DCC-450PK 4 Cup Cofeemaker: if this was perfect, the cost would be well out of my preferred price range like the other burr grinders that I considered.

reviews.reviewTitle: Work with the static cling and enjoy the rest.
reviews.reviewText: I am enjoying the grinder, good choice of grind settings, too much static cling, but that seems to be mostly the norm for all grinders. I purchased a $200.00 grinder (Kitchen Aid) that worked for exactly five months before freezing up and dying, to my disgust and this Cuisinart is doing the job well.

After some time has passed I now realize that some fine coffee particles somehow escape the grinder and end up on our kitchen counter. Also, I usually have to start it twice in order for all of the beans to be ground up. It is definitely a very loud appliance. Does the job but it would be great if these problems could be remedied in the future.
I purchased the Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill for my son and his wife for Christmas last year and they love it. It has worked great all year, no complaints.

This is the 2nd one I have had.
It is OK as a grinder, although it is very noisy. i do like the different levels of grinds.
I'm not sure if other grinders are easier to clean. This is not too bad to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
reviews.reviewText: We were shopping for an automatic burr grinder because it was taking too long to grind using the antique crank grinder we had. This grinder seemed best to meet our needs. In the month we have had it it has worked well. It is a bit loud and the grind selection seems to have more settings than actual grinds, that is, two notches past medium seem to yield the same grind as five notches past medium, or two notches before medium make a coarser grind than expected. Minor stuff, once you get used to it. One problem we had was the cup selector was off and the grinder didn't shut off. After I moved the selector a couple of times, it worked again and hasn't given us any more problems. Overall I like this grinder and hope it lasts a while.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the even grounds I get from this machine
reviews.reviewText: I love the even grounds I get from this machine. The noise level is off-putting, especially early in the morning. Coffee grounds get all over the place when trying to pour them into the filter, I'm trying to develop a system for this that is cleaner. Overall I'm satisfied with this purchase. I upgraded from another blade grinder. This is my first burr grinder. It fits great under my cupboard and I like all the options.

Other than it's a bit noisy, probably the nature of the Burr grinding, it works very well. I have it set for our two large coffees in the morning and since the beans are already in the hopper, I simply push the start button and it grinds the right amount of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just what we were looking for.
reviews.reviewText:
Great product! Read many of the mixed reviews and decided to buy it anyway. Glad we did, does a wonderful
job of grinding coffee as it is suppose to. Loud, but does a great job. Can't help but feel many of the negative
reviews were because reviewers wanted it to do more than grind coffee. Clearly states it is not for seeds or
other items...just coffee. So, if you want a great grinder for coffee and don't mind a little noise..this is it.

Coffee Grinder is well made and works well. The only problem is it is almost impossible to remove ground beans and put them in my coffee maker without spilling material on the counter. The pull out ground coffee reservoir top completely detaches and almost always spills ground beans. The reservoir top should be at least hinged to avoid spilling the ground beans when they are removed. It is extremely load when grinding.

Caused sparks in the coffee holding container...Sounds like grinding metal. Very loud. Contacted customer service and they will replace it if I pay for all shipping costs there and back. I'm not guaranteed that this isn't just how this works. I may pay many $ and have the same problem/ Very disappointing for a company whose products I have many of. Sad. DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT! DANGEROUS!

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved it until it broke. About 130 grinds of use.
reviews.reviewText: I loved this grinder until it died suddenly at 1 year and 3 months. I used it to grind 12 oz of beans about every ten days during that time. 12 oz is about 3 grinding sessions for this grinder. So that's about 130 sessions of grinding.

reviews.reviewTitle: One issue, otherwise it's a great little grinder.
reviews.reviewText: It should have a glass or metal receptacle, because static can be a real issue with the plastic bin. By "real issue" I mean some of the grounds literally jump out onto the counter when you pour them at the filter. I have found this to be a problem only with very dark roasts, and I do live in an arid part of the country, so maybe it will not be a problem for you.

This is a great grinder. Using it is almost effortless: merely fill the hopper with beans (the hopper holds several pots worth of beans, so just top it off periodically), select the grind size desired (this is usually always the same but is adjustable depending on any recommendations on the coffee bean bag); select the number of cups you wish to make and press the button. The burr grinder grinds until the selected amount of coffee is produced then shuts itself off. Remove the plastic container and dump into your coffee maker. Only issue is with the plastic container. Coffee tends to stick to the sides so it may be necessary to thump it on the counter or use a knife to dislodge all grounds. No big deal. And, there's no mess, or very little, to clean up.

Pretty good grinder for its price. We use it every day as you can tell the difference between freshly grounded coffee and "pre-grounded". Settings for number of cups are waaay off. :) These numbers are more about how long it will run. So if I want 2 cups of espresso - I need settings at 6-8.
It's by far the closest you can get in this price range automatic grinder, however, do not expect it to grind as well at coffee shop can do.
Overall - recommended!

It did it's job well until it didn't -It grinds coffee at different levels from fine to coarse. Check. And then after 6 months, it started slowing down on occasion. I shook it a little and it seemed to resolve. Then a week later the motor burned out and it's dead. Just like that. I'm not willing to hassle with the warranty (from what I've read it's a process). My time is probably more valuable than the cost of a new one (from another brand), although it's hard to put a price on the emotion of injustice...

A nice reliable grinder. I've been using this daily for 4 years and haven't had a single problem with it. I've burnt up 2 coffee pots in that time. I'm fussy enough to want freshly ground coffee each day, but not fussy enough to need to scrub it down after every use. So the dust on the inside of the plastic receptacle doesn't bother me, though it would be nice if it went away. I hold my ears when I turn it on, so it would be nice if it were quieter. Ehh, it does what I need it to do. Very happy with this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does an amazing job grinding beans.
reviews.reviewText: LOVE the end product, great for grinding beans to your specifications. Loud but what grinder isn't, it's not an air tight container on top, but I don't use it for that any way.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product, great service, and great price!
reviews.reviewText: Just small enough to be able to get this out of my pantry and just big enough the do the jobs I need it to do. The size is perfect. It doesn't waste my time doing teeny tiny jobs, but can hold enough coffee beans, herbs, whatever I need. I have 8 kids and 15 grandchildren so I do ALOT of cooking & prepwork. It never bogs or lags. The motor is powerful for this house of boys! I'm in my mid 50's and am surprised I never got one before now!
So good. Easy, well constructed, simple to use. Not to mention it's a burr grinder...soooo nice not cranking that handle every morning

It's not bad for starters. Will work for people, like me, who are just trying to get into coffee making with a budget.

Pros: Easy to use, Variable Grind Size, Easy to clean with compressed air (if youre a snob)
Cons: Will always produce a clump of extremely fine coffee. This is not good for real enthusiasts

Updates
2 months after (8/27/2016)
Still working great. I don't see this breaking down any time soon. The static cling from the plastic is starting to become noticable as Fall comes. It is actually very annoying but gives you a reason to quickly dump the contents into whatever you're using to brew; instead of the usual safe spooning it.
Great product.

Do not but. This thing doesn't last. It gets jammed up with coffee grounds and then overheats and shuts off, It is almost impossible to clean it out. Happened once and I finally got it working again, but now it happened again and it won't run. Don't waste your money, I thought with a good name like Cuisinart it would be a quality product and it would last, I was wrong on both parts and now it is too late to return it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is loud but then they all are but like the ease of how to change the grind and ...
reviews.reviewText: This is replacing my old grinder and was in a quandary whether to order the same brand but this was less expensive so got this one. I've been using it for awhile now and have no problems with it. It is loud but then they all are but like the ease of how to change the grind and amount of beans to be ground. A lot easier than my old one.

I am a barista and was looking for a burr grinder that was reasonably priced. Overall i was pretty satisfied. This product is great for making cold brews that use larger grinds and regular drip coffee that uses medium grinds. If you are trying to grind smaller than medium-small than the grinds get really inconsistant and powdery with does not make tasty espressso. Would like to see a little smaller grind size and more consistency but overall does the trick.

I purchased the Cuisinart in early 2010, to replace an Ariete I purchased last year after the Hopper broke twice. Piece of junk!
I really enjoy Coffee made from fresh beans from a Burr Grinder; much superior to blade grinding.

I almost didn't buy the Cuisinart DMB8 because I was afraid I would have trouble with another inexpensive grinder. After reading many good reviews I decided to take a chance and get the Cuisinart. I have been pleasantly surprised as the Cuisinart is quieter and doesn't jam when using oily coffees, just the opposite of the Ariete.It makes a full flavored cup of Coffee and looks good in my kitchen. Is has a Hopper design that feeds beans more smoothly in to the Burr, another failing of the Ariete.

My only complaint is it can be a little difficult to put the grounds drawer back in the machine; you must line it up correctly and push firmly. It is a little messy and tends to get some grounds on the counter top, but I suspect all burr grinders with the drawer underneath are just as bad.

For someone who is either new to Burr grinders or who is not in a position for a more spendy unit I would strongly recommend the Cuisinart

reviews.reviewTitle: This is our 3rd Cuisinart over the last 20 years ...
reviews.reviewText: This is our 3rd Cuisinart over the last 20 years. Each lasted and worked remarkably well for 10 years. We bought a cheap Mister Coffee Grinder to see how long it would last. Exactly 1 month! Yes this unit is loud...so grind your coffee at night and leave it in the bin if noise bothers you in the morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Uneven grind with powdery residue in each batch...
reviews.reviewText:
I bought the Cuisinart to replace a Breville that had burned out after six years. The Cuisinart is a very poor substitute. It grinds unevenly and finely ground powder collects at the chute and is dumped into the bin each time. This always produces some sludge in a French press and a bitter cup. Sorry I didn't get another Breville immediately.

Especially bad for smaller batches compared to the Breville.

reviews.reviewTitle: Reduced use of beans by about a third!
reviews.reviewText: This is my first electric burr grinder; I use so much less coffee now, and it tastes better! As some other reviewers noted, there is a fine powder that sticks to the case - it doesnt bother me, but I can confirm its existence. I like a coarser grind, but when the finer powder is mixed in it is fine - that may, in fact, be the reason I use so many fewer beans now, I have had this for about 6 or so months, and do not regret the purchase one bit. It is loud, so I have to grind beans in the basement, but I need the exercise anyway!

Worked great and then stopped working after a few months. Bought in September 2016 and stopped working in January. My old Krups grinder worked for years before I replaced it with this one... so a disappointment.
my son has become a real coffee nut. very knowledgable about coffee and brewing techniques. I got this for him and he is thrilled. loves it. nuff said.

At forty-three bucks (assuming you see the same search result), you are getting a great deal on a burr grinder. Very happy with the quality and consistency of the grind. The measure of any burr grinder is the uniform nature of the final product. Checked under a lab scope and size at 2 setting was 1.4 micron with standard deviation of less than 0.15! Kudo DBM-8.

reviews.reviewTitle: It did a great job grinding coffee
reviews.reviewText:
It did a great job grinding coffee, although it was very loud. Loved the larger capacity bean bin.
Then it quit. The grinding sound became very quiet and it just quit. Less than a year old.
Would not recommend.

Every time I visit my daughter and son in law I always think their coffee is much better than what I make. They grind the coffee beans fresh each day. I decided to buy a grinder. This one was more expensive but I decided to buy it after reading the reviews. It has worked great and yes, my morning coffee is noticeably better! It has performed just as it should. It took me a few days to get the grind and amount like I wanted but that is to be expected. Great product!
Me agradó muy bueno.....lo llevó para cuba mi mamá me lo pidió

I bought this product in June to replace our prior Cuisinart coffee grinder which had lasted us almost 6 years, This one didn't even make it 4 months before the motor burned out. We are very disappointed in this product. It appears that the quality level of Cuisinart's products has definitely declined.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinder works great! Cannot use while people are sleeping.
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is great for storing and grinding coffee beans as needed! However, it is rather loud which could make it difficult for use a multi-person household or apartment building with thin walls. It completely comes apart making it super easy to clean! It is very intuitive to use and the adjustability of the type of grind is great! I would buy again but could be swayed by a quieter grinder.
It's actually loud enough that this would not be LEGAL to use on a job (OSHA) without wearing HEARING PROTECTION. Don't buy this if you value your hearing.

as the headline suggests, this is a powerful and quick grinder. It does a good job, but is quite noisy. Also, I'm not sure if it is the shape or the material that it is made of, but it can be quite a chore to get your ground coffee out. Especially in the winter when everything is dry and static-y. Overall, a good heavy duty grinder, but perhaps not the best choice for single cup everyday use.
Works great so far, had one previously that just stopped working for no reason. Hopefully I will get longer use out of this one. Like the ability to grind more than the average coffee grinder.
Have had this for 6 months now. I clean it every time I got through a bag of coffee and it’s still working like the first day I got it. I grind 4 cups worth 2 times a day.
Arrived on time as expected! Super simple to use. It is noisy so if you’re the first one up in a house with children, you might want to grind at night! 😬 or it’s a good alarm clock!

reviews.reviewTitle: as well as how fine the resulting ground coffee should be
reviews.reviewText:
Really a professional grinding mill. It's fully automatic, allowing you to set the number of cups of coffee you wish to grind coffee for, as well as how fine the resulting ground coffee should be. Then you just press "Start" and walk away.

Seems well designed, no mess, and feels quite solid

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Grinder, but I think they reduced the power (and cost) of the motor
reviews.reviewText:
My previous Cuisinart version of this grinder was used every day 1-2X a day for 7 years. I loved it dearly, but eventually it wore out. A <$100 appliance I use every day that makes it 7 years is a great product in my book.

This one is quieter, and it works just fine. However, the motor struggles while grinding my beans, it gets through it, but it's not a reassuring process through the beans. I don't think it will make it 7 years.

The grind is great, very even and consistent. If you care enough to grind and brew it does the job well, and I don't know of one I'd recommend above this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works really well; unhappy with design
reviews.reviewText: If I thought I could return this, I would, but I don't have the box anymore. Let me first say I am very familiar with coffee--we make espresso, drip, and French press regularly. The grinder itself works excellent and it's a fine size for my counter top. It has more than enough grind settings (I wish it had guidelines for where standard drip cone filter, drip flat bottom filter, espresso, and french press should be rather than 18 dots with no standard guides). My problem with this grinder is how loud the motor is and how much of a static mess it creates. The motor is SO loud and has a piercing shrill tone to it. I have 2 babies at home and we can't grind coffee in the morning because of how loud it is. It also is a mess; I've had several grinders but this one sprays static coffee grounds ALL OVER the place every single time. My counter and floor is full of coffee grounds every time.
Excelente producto aunque lo acabo de usar por primera vez no se su durabilidad pero parece bueno. Me encantó y lo pude maniobrar super bien lo recomiendo.

reviews.reviewTitle: Out with the old, in with the new
reviews.reviewText: We needed a new coffee grinder as the old one had finally had enough!! I've always liked and trusted cuisinart products so we chose this model!! We've had it for a few weeks now and all is great!! We love using fresh beans so this grinder works perfectly for us!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: OK performance. Could be better for coarse grinding.
reviews.reviewText: Purchased to use with a French press. Works OK,, but when you select a coarse grind (necessary for a French press) you still get a fair amount of very fine (powder like) granules mixed with the coarse particles. Not sure if other Burr models do a better job. I selected this model because it seemed to get the best reviews without spending hundreds on a unit.
Simple to use this grinder, everything is ready to go right out of the box. I clean it right after I’m done grinding while the French press is making my coffee. Hardly takes up any counter space.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works fantastic! Grinds 8 cups of coffee in under 30 ...
reviews.reviewText: Works fantastic ! Grinds 8 cups of coffee in under 30 seconds, clean up is very minimal. A nice option is having this many grated settings. Holds a lot of coffee in the top so your not constantly filling it. I usually fill it once a week and I make 2 pots of coffee a day. Just buy it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't Make Them Like They Used To
reviews.reviewText: Had one for five years and finally stopped working. So I bought the same thing May 2017 and stopped working today July 2017. Sigh. Got out the hand grinder so I could have my coffee today. Back to research.

The main things people complain about are the small amount of fine coffee powder generated and the plastic container causing static electricity.

The second problem is not a problem. The 1% of coffee that clings to inner wall of the container can be easily put back in it's place by a bump or two in said container.

The first problem can be avoided easily. Every single time I grind coffee using this, 99% of the fine coffee powder gets accumulated on one place inside the container. It hangs to the lid and the inner front of said container, probably with the help of the infamous static electricity. If you carefully remove the lid, place a flat thing under the powder (the wide end of the Aeropress stirrer works perfectly) and give it a little bump, all of the powder will fall on the thing so you can get rid of it however you want.

Disclaimer: I have never ground my own coffee before acquiring this.

I loved the convenience of turning it on and grinding the beans without having to hold anything down, but the noise is loud and echo's, and it just stopped working one day!!! That is a problem since the only time I use it is when I need a fresh cup of coffee... ugh!!! And reading other reviews, it doesn't look like I'm alone in this issue... not worth the initial purchase, I'll just throw away and get a better brand/make.
This grinds the coffee fine but it's kind of a pain to get the grounds out without making a mess and it's soooooo loud. Okay for the price but I wouldn't buy it again.

The coffee beans seem to stick in the holder and not fall down to be ground. The grinding mechanism works well when the beans get into the grinder. It seems the oil on the beans make them stick together.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and works great !
reviews.reviewText: I was a little bit leery because I had read some bad reviews but it has worked fabulous. It is easy to use and looks nice sitting on the counter next to our Coffee maker. We love it !

I liked this grinder! The grinds and size of the unit and process all worked for me, so I was disappointed that it stopped completely after only two months. Amazon refunded without problem and for that, I am grateful.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... mill an ideal choice for those of us that like to grind fresh beans
reviews.reviewText: The large capacity and number of grind variations for your coffee makes this burr mill an ideal choice for those of us that like to grind fresh beans. There are a few easy directions to show operation of the grinder. I enjoy making a blend of different brands of beans to vary the finer tastes of coffee. I feel that this burr grinder makes the best and most consistent coffee fines of any grinder I have ever used.

Love the adjustable grind sizes, grounds seem consistent and the hopper holds a good amount of beans, though I can't quite say how airtight it is, so I usually only pour in a little more than what I'm thinking I need, right on the Medium setting "4" on the grind setting gets about 15-18 grams and 25-28 grams of ground.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked great for 1 year then quit but worked again after cleaning
reviews.reviewText:
This was a great grinder but it stopped working after one year of heavy use. I loved the large bean bean but it is a little messy.

Update- I took it apart set it upside down and patted the bottom until all the coffee dust fell out. When I put it back together it worked again !!! 🎉👍🏻 Love it

reviews.reviewTitle: Best burr grinder for the home
reviews.reviewText: This model is the best burr grinder I have owned, and matches the performance of professional-grade grinders I used as a one-time barista. My first was lost to Katrina, and one of my earliest post-Katrina gifts was its replacement. I liked it so much, I ordered another to gift a friend (also a one-time barista).

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the large capacity for perfect coffee every day!
reviews.reviewText: Great little coffee bean grinder! Love the large capacity and the fact that I can grind fresh beans for great coffee every day! Freshness is perfect!

We have purchased this burr grinder twice and it works well. It is consistent and works well. The trick is staying on top of cleaning it!! Other than that it works well and is not too loud. It grinds quick!

Replacing an older model (no longer available).... However, ordered the DBM-8AMZ and got a DBM-8... called Cuisinart and was told it was the same..... Amazon site implied the AMZ was a new model replacing the discontinued "8" ..... unnecessary confusion.

SO happy I bought this. I use it for course ground coffee in my French Press. I've ran 2 lbs of coffee through it thus far, no issues at all! Only things that I would change are:
1) I wish the scoop had a slot on the side of the unit
2) I wish the quantity control had more granularity. Depending on which french press I use I either need 2 tbsp or 4 tbsp and the unit is just not built to give me that amount of control.

It grinds the coffee beans.
The grind is adjustable and works well.
You can adjust the grind better than a R2D2 grinder
It is noisey and dusty.
I think it is dusty due to plastic container and static.
R2D2 is less messy

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not use in espresso machine
reviews.reviewText: Not for use with a real espresso machine. Inconsistent grind and does not grind fine enough. This must be for coffee makers. Finest grind does not even work for pour over. Very disappointed. Going back to my old Black & Decker blade grinder--it's a little inconsistent in the grind, but at least it can approximate espresso grind.

After my first burr stopped working I did some research on other brands. From the reviews and the price of the Cuisinart I thought I would take a chance. I am glad I did. So far no problems and the settings for what type of grind you want is pretty spot on. Would I buy another one? YES.

I purchased this because it was highly rated...don't be fooled by the "best seller" reviews. This grinder stopped functioning after two months and the return window was one month. It never functioned like a burr grinder...coffee was too fine for my french press. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS ONE!

This is my 3rd or 4th coffee grinder. I started with a small $10 model and have worked my way up to this one. It is great to push a button and get the same exact amount of coffee every time. The hopper holds an 8 oz bag of gourmet coffee so you don't have to have an extra "coffee canister" on the cabinet. It is easy to clean and adjust the settings for grind and amount. This is a burr grinder so the coffee is always consistent in grind texture and amount. It is also a great size and doesn't take up a lot of counter space. This one is reasonably priced and is a Cuisinart brand so it has a good reputation for reliability. Makes me wonder why I bothered with the less expensive models to begin with.

reviews.reviewTitle: Would highly recommend for the money
reviews.reviewText: Bought this one to replace the last one, which I'd had for over 10 years. I only had to replace because I failed to clean out the little opening where the coffee is dispensed into the plastic container and over the years it wore on the gears. Would highly recommend for the money. Also let's you change the ground settings. The bean holder holds about 12 oz. of beans.

I’ve owned this grinder for about 2.5 years. Use it most every morning and it has been flawless. I am a coffee snob and buy beans from Central America. Took some experimentation to get it dialed in (grind fineness and amount) but once that was done, the only change I make is to the number of cups I need ground for. Couldn’t be simpler. If this one ever quits...I’ll will by again.

reviews.reviewTitle: I know most people love this grinder
reviews.reviewText: I know most people love this grinder, but I find it really annoying to get the ground coffee out of. The static generated by the grinding process makes the coffee stick to the inside of the chamber. You end up having to whack or tap it to get everything out, and they you have a mess.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for budget friendly cold brew setup
reviews.reviewText: Purchased because of the large hopper and hands free operation, and the grinder works much better than anticipated. Easy to adjust grind settings made coarse coffee without a lot of powder from pulverizing, again making for a better cold brew setup.

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee grinder has been awesome for 11 years and finally died
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder has been awesome for 11 years and finally died! I love this grinder for fine grounds as well as the largest setting for an old percolator we like to use at times. It’s a great buy for the money. I never had any issues with my first one. Hopefully this one will last as long. My sis n law tasted the difference of fresh ground coffee and bought one for herself.

After about 3 weeks of use, I'm happy with it. It grinds the coffee well enough for a my French press. It is simple to operate. I'll update after I've used it longer.

Update - 3 months -

Overall it still works, but there are an increased number of small grounds in it which come out in my cup. Overall, I don't need a new one yet...

Noisy as a rock crusher. Totally inconsistent on the same setting from day to day based on... what... freaking relative humidity.... freshness of the beans.... it is a royal P. O. S. I know it is cheap... but so is vending machine coffee... and that, my friends, is what this thing turns good beans into.

It grins the amount you want keeping beans on the top so I use what I need at that time. It's loud but I don't care because it's such a great product. You can also choose how fine you want it to grind the beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: Brings your coffee game to another level
reviews.reviewText: I had been using a blade grinder for years before I decided to give this a go. Wow! I can’t believe the difference. Push a button and it grinds the amount and coarseness to perfection. My only complaint is not finding this sooner.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... mess to a minimum other than that it works pretty
reviews.reviewText: The holding container has about a half inch Gap from the top when you're grinding the beans dust from the beans flies out all over the place I put a piece of tape over the crack around it to keep the contents inside and the mess to a minimum other than that it works pretty good

The coffee mill has an 18-month warranty.
My wife uses it about once per week, certainly not excessively, so we were surprised when it failed. (Just lost power, able to turn the wheel by hand so don't think it was jammed.)
I was going to take it apart, but did a quick check and discovered that it was one week within the Cuisinart 18 month warranty. Called them, and was politely given return instructions. Sent it to them (at our expense) by Priority Mail eight days ago.
Today we were pleasantly surprised when UPS delivered a new DBM-8 coffee mill.
Hope this one lasts a bit longer!

It was so loud I could not use it in the morning as it woke my husband up. I even wrapped it in a towel but that didn’t help. It also ground a small amount of coffee each time so it took many times to get the amount of coffee I needed. I have gone back to my old grinder.
Even though this was one of the cheapest electric burr grinders, it's still chugging along, despite dealing with some really tough peaberry varieties. It is very durable for the price.

Wr purchased this for our french press and my goodness this thing can grind. It has many different settings for coarseness as well as cups of coffee ground. Definitely reccomend and have reccomended to friends and family.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought an identical one from a retailer and it does work great! I love the freshly ground brewed coffee taste ...
reviews.reviewText: I have to say I bought a used one from Amazon and had to return it because it was damaged. However, I bought an identical one from a retailer and it does work great! I love the freshly ground brewed coffee taste as opposed to pre-ground beans in a container. Good product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty good unit with minor complaints
reviews.reviewText:
Overall this is a good grinder but wit a couple of minor issues. First, because the container where the ground coffee is deposit is plastic, the coffee tends to stick to the plastic. Wish it were metal or glass.
Second, the setting for how much coffee can be ground could be better. The difference between the 6 and 8 cup stating is quite a lot. I wish there were settings in between. Other than those, it does the trick

reviews.reviewTitle: Works OK for a little while, but not durable enough for daily use
reviews.reviewText: For the price/class of grinder, it's fine. It does a decent job at the level of consistency you would expect, with minimal mess or fuss. Mine died shortly after a year of daily use, which was grinding whole beans (mostly from Costco) on a medium setting, nothing too crazy. The motor simply stopped working (still turned out, but much quieter and without enough power to actually grind). I reached out to the company and it was around $20 to repair (shipping and handling) even under warranty.
This is a wonderful grinder for bigger batches of beans. My little one does one pot just fine, but this one will grind enough for multiple pots when we have company.

I purchased this grinder several years ago, and for some reason threw it away during a move. I have always regretted it and decided to purchase a new one. While it may not be as "gucci" as the $100+ models, it grinds well and has variable grind settings. However, as with any grinder, I recommend cleaning it once a week (assuming you use it daily).

reviews.reviewTitle: ... coffee expert I'm just a person who wants a better tasting cup of coffee
reviews.reviewText: I am in no way a coffee expert I'm just a person who wants a better tasting cup of coffee. the blade grinder type do not work well. I bought this inexpensive burr type grinder. to me better then any blade grinder. ground beans perfect for my taste. and it's only 25 bucks more. so any of you who would love a deep rich flavor cup of coffee. buy your favorite coffee in whole bean use this burr grinder and just enjoy

reviews.reviewTitle: If you like good coffee, this is wonderful
reviews.reviewText: I used to use an electric grinder and guess when I had the right grind. I'd get some fine grind and some medium grind. With this, I set the grind and the amount and fill up the holding tank on the coffee maker and both are done at the same time. The coffee tastes better because of how it is ground in this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working in 3monthsand you can't exchange it!!!
reviews.reviewText: This product wasnt cheap and simply stopped working.I bought this in May and can't return it, as it's Past their return date, it's only July Unless they will exchange it, I'll never buy Cuisinart again. They are obviously making a crappy product now?Do not buy this. Cuisinart doesn't stand behind their small appliances.

No better or worse than our Mr. Coffee burr grinder. Wish the hopper was round and a little larger. Should have bought the Mr. Coffee again.

I had to downgrade this product. After using this product for 6 months it has quit working without any notice, noise, or warning. Will call the 800 number for warranty information.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lasted about 30 minutes of total use
reviews.reviewText: I bought this in April. Used it a total of 5 minutes per month ,if that . Died in December. Looks good but in reality it is a piece of crap. I want my money back!
Haven't had it a long time but it seems to be working well. I've gone through about 5 lbs of beans so far with no issues. Easy to set. Easy to use. A bit noisy but tolerable.

reviews.reviewTitle: it grinds them coffee beans real good.
reviews.reviewText: I really like this coffee grinder. It has different settings you can grind however many cups of coffee that you want to make. It's the only coffee grinder that I have ever owned. But I like it. I don't know if there are better ones or not but this one does a good job and I like it.

Had mill for less than a year. The motor stopped and smelled like it was burning. The other issue was when it worked it would static charge the coffee so when you tried to put it in the coffee maker filter it would spew everywhere. Mess to clean up.

reviews.reviewTitle: This has been a great purchase. A noisy but hard working device
reviews.reviewText: This has been a great purchase. A noisy but hard working device, I love the various grind settings it offers. My only complaint is that it is messy and hard to get the coffee out of the container without grind ending up on the counter. Still, a very competent machine.

A VERY EFFICIENT GRINDER THAT IS AFFORDABLE AND SO EASY TO USE. AFTER ADJUSTING THE SETTING FOR THE DESIRED CUPS OF COFFEE IT GRINDS THE BEANS PERFECTLY AND CONSISTENTLY WITH A SIMPLE PUSH OF A BUTTON.
Fantastic grinder.regular grinders chop beans, but a burr grinder actually grinds them for the best flavor. Durable and reliable

reviews.reviewTitle: but I am highly satisfied. I am no barista
reviews.reviewText:
I was a little apprehensive about this purchase because it was one of the cheaper options for a burr grinder, but I am highly satisfied. I am no barista, but I like coffee and this grinder is a great addition to my pour-over process. It grinds very well and has not given me any problems. It is also easy to clean too.

If you are tip-toeing into more expensive coffee tastes, this is a great grinder that doesn't break the bank.
Love the coffee from this. Working on how not to make a small mess every time I make coffee. Static, small particles makes it a challenge to get from grinder to coffee machine

I recently purchased the Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill and received it shortly thereafter. Since its arrival, this appliance has been a source of frequent frustration and annoyance. I genuinely had no idea a coffee mill could be so bad. I've had coffee mills and none of them were perfect, so I assumed that the ways in which a coffee mill could be bad would be limited to poor construction or inconsistent performance. Those were issues I was prepared for. What I was not prepared for was getting coffee everywhere. Somehow this device charges the ground up coffee bits with static electricity. When the lid of the grind chamber is removed, little bits of coffee silt and chaff fly from the container propelled by some unseen force. It is very much like working with packing peanuts. Did you notice that I mentioned chaff earlier? Did you know that coffee beans have chaff? Me neither! Ok, so it isn't really chaff, but there is some sort of papery thing in the cleft of the bean. Every other grinder I've ever had has ground this up with the rest of the bean so it goes unnoticed. Not so with this thing. That papery bit gets separated and charged. And then sent flying onto the floor, counter, table, etc. I've tried using a several different varieties of coffee and several different grind settings. It isn't the coffee. It isn't the settings. It's the terrible, terrible coffee mill.

I should also point out that in addition to the above stated issues, it also does a poor job of grinding coffee. Regardless of setting it will always produce plenty of ultra fine, filter clogging coffee powder as well as large chunks of coffee bean. Even though this is amongst the most affordable electric burr mills around it still isn't worth it. If you don't mind a manual grinder, I would strongly recommend the Hario Coffee Mill Slim Grinder, Mini. It's a little cheaper and produces great results. The only downside is that it's hand cranked. But really that isn't a big deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Barista thoughts, also comparing Hario Skerton
reviews.reviewText:
Used 1 time so far.

I've had the Hario for about a year, paid $35 for it and am instantly regretting not having bought the cuisinart last year instead.

The Hario I have does not have an aftermarket stabilizer ($10). For the grind setting of Medium (Cuisinart), the Hario has much more variability in grind size towards the course end (more watery) and the Cuisinart has those super fine Turkish grind pieces that do indeed stick to the wall and can be easily removed.
Pros, Cons and other thoughts.
Pros:
Accurate grind size. On Medium, it's more accurate than the Hario by far. You will HAVE to pay over $200 for a grinder that works better than this. If you want an espresso grinder and only want to pay $40 you're dilusional... looking at those 1 star reviewers...
Fast, has a timer to stop

Cons:
Has a low torque, high speed motor. For some reason I expected different, but these motors are often cheaper. It's a bit of a whine noise.
Lots of dusty wasted grinds***
You need the counter space for this, it's not exactly small. It's similar in size to a nutribullet or similar
Acrylic like parts. Those are notoriously easy to crack and break (we used them at SBUX where I worked)
You probably cannot wash anything here. I will only wipe with a wet or dry coffee filter.
For those that are OCD, the entire top rotates based on the grind setting lol.
Since it has lots of fine bits in it, do not expect to use a metal permanent filter. Also, if you want great coffee, use a paper filter :)

Other thoughts:
I plan to use the "wasted" grinds as cold-brew coffee (maybe 8 hour infusion?) or a coffee rub for meat. Waste not, want not I guess.
I may buy a very small sized "colander"/strainer meant for filtering to get out the dust.
***For the love of everything that is decent in this world, DO NOT use a pasta strainer as a gauge for grind accuracy
Very easy to use. Adjustable grind is handy.

This product is a complete POS! First time ever reviewing anything on here and this just deserves it. I washed the bean holder and it trapped water inside so I had to drill a drain hole.

The noise is about as loud as my Husqvarna 450 rancher chainsaw.

The grinds are inconsistent no matter what setting and creates powder that makes all of coffee bitter.

Best thing about this device is tossing it in the trash
Incredible, I love this

This is an excellent bang-for-your-buck burr coffee grinder. Although it is probably acceptable to use this for espresso type grind, I wouldn’t recommend it. You would need to spend a lot more to get the fineness/consistency you would want for a high quality shot. That being said, it is a perfect grinder if you’re just using it for French press, drip, etc. Also, it is worth noting - I have not had any problems with static electricity causing the coffee grounds to go everywhere with this machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Happy when I purchased it, but not so much now...
reviews.reviewText: Was looking for a coffee grinder that would do the job of large grinds...happy to have this while it worked. Bought it in June of this year, and today after four months of use it just stopped, sounded like it was working but after noticing that the beans were not going down I emptied it, and refilled it (in case there was something stuck) but now it wouldn't even start! Thank goodness I bought the protection plan but who knows how that will shake out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great for the price, coffee gets stuck on occasion.
reviews.reviewText: Works great, fairly consistent grind with a little bit of fine powder. Took a star away because the coffee beans occasionally get stuck and the unit requires a quick shake. This minor inconvenience takes away from the advertised "automatic" feature.

This is the third cuisinart burr grinder I have bought in the past 10 years. Grinder is used twice a day.
My Father told me when I was a teenager that you have to be smarter than the equipment you are working with.
This is a prime example of this.

This unit states that it can be cleaned (hopper) in the dishwasher. When you do water gets trapped between the plastic parts and you can not get it out. Do not buy because I can see it becoming unsanitary.
Grinder has stopped and Amazon will not allow return after 30 days missed dead line by 6 days. So disappointed and I am a prime member...
I am very impressed with this unit. I have only been using it a month or so, so I cannot speak to its longevity.

This grinder is amazing, I wouldn't change a thing. I've had it for two years and it works like the day I got it. The stainless steel really looks good too. Doesn't feel like the cheap silver painted plastic some brands use.

Purchased this for my Dad to replace his that broke. He grinds his beans to espresso fine and this has worked great for him. Hasn't had any trouble with the grounds not being fine enough for his espresso machine and he likes it alot more than his old one.

Read the reviews, folks.

We have a VERY good espresso machine. We have a Breville, which made excellent espresso until the built-in grinder died.

As many others have experienced, we cannot make even passably decent espresso with this grinder.

I don't know which machines folks who drink espresso are using this grinder in conjunction with. Do not take it for granted that the PRODUCT DESCRIPTION is accurate.

This grinder will possibly not work for espresso grinds.

If it were totally up to me, we would have at least tried to return it. Espresso from it is that awful.

Cuisinart replaced mr. Coffee grinder we had had for a number of years. Cuisinart container to dump ground coffee not as useful as previous. It also does not have a mild grind stop feature like mr. Coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Way better than the hand crank manula burr grinder
reviews.reviewText: Exactley what I needed. Way better than the hand crank manula burr grinder.

We have used burr grinders in the past and like how they grind coffeee. However, this one is quite messy. Even carefully removing the container with ground coffee results in the coffee going everywhere! It sticks to the inside of the container as well. I don’t recall having this problem with previous burr grinders. Would not purchase again.
Our last coffee grinder had a 7 inch power cord which rendered it useless without an extension cord. This one has a decent cord, it's powerful and fast, and he uses it daily.
This is the very best coffee grinder that I have ever owned. It is simple to clean, powerful in its operation, easy to adjust and use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Took an hour to grind a cup of coffee
reviews.reviewText: I have had this grinder for a while and do not use it much. The first few times I used it, it worked great. Got it out today to use and it took an hour to grind 1 cup of coffee (a measuring cup). I cleaned it. No good. I kept removing and putting back in the catch bin. Would work for 3 seconds. Remove and put back in bin 20 times, worked for 3 seconds and on and on. Enough! I quit trying and am going to buy a new one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Incredibly Loud, Broke in less than a Year
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this grinder because I wanted to adjustable grind settings but this thing is just poorly made. There is no easy way to clean it. Even if you take apart the one million screws you can't quite get to the mucked up burr grinder part. It is made of cheap plastic and the motor quit in less than a year, even after I cleaned regularly. This unit was also the loudest coffee grinder I ever owned, it sounds an industrial weed-wacker.

Great size, storages the beans ready to be grind whenever I need and keeps a big amount of grinded beans ready to use, I would like the manufactures to add a little on side attachment to hang the measuring spoon included with the grinder

reviews.reviewTitle: grinding beautifully. I am not sure my palate is sophisticated ...
reviews.reviewText: So far, grinding beautifully. I am not sure my palate is sophisticated enough to tell the difference between burr and blade ground coffee, but this is way more convenient than loading the blade grinder for each pot, tidier, and it does a great job of producing a consistent grind. -- nuff said.

Worked great (albeit LOUD) for about 3 months and then just STOPPED WORKING. The motor barely runs now if no beans in hopper and sounds like a dying animal. I should have paid attention to the reviews.

Don’t buy this unless you wanna replace it in 3 months.

Twenty years with blade grinders, and after one month with my Cuisinart burr grinder, I'm not looking back. You know how it is with the blade grinder: the guesswork on how long to grind, the unevenness of the result, the big pieces floating at the top, contributing nothing to your brew. This grinder improves the whole experience in several ways:

First, the beans are stored in the grinder. Refill every few days. Most times, though, when you're ready, the machine's ready.

Secondly, the grind is easy to select, and the results are even and uniform. This comes through in the taste of the coffee and reduces waste.

Finally, grinding is a three-touch process: turn the dial to select the coarseness you need, slide the indicator for the number of cups, and touch the "start" button. Grinding for 6 cups takes about 10 seconds and is no noisier than my blade grinder was. If you use the same coffee-making process and the same number of cups each time, this reduces to one touch: start. I make a pot in my drip machine in the morning (two clicks to the "fine" side of "medium") and a mug's worth in the french press in the evening (two clicks to the "coarse" side of "medium"). This grinder serves each process easily and quickly.

The small amount of fine powder produced in each batch is a minor problem. It clings to the holder, making it easy to separate from the grinds, but the powder also finds its way onto your counter. I've taken to laying down a paper towel, which catches everything and simplifies clean-up.

This product does its job well at a low price. It's improved my coffee and simplified my life. I'd buy it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this grinder but having a issue with grinder cup
reviews.reviewText: This is a replacement for my old grinder. Love this grinder but having a issue with grinder cup. When I remove lid it has static in cup and ground coffee fly's out and all over counter. Any suggestions on how to correct this. Thanks

I received the grinder and was excited to use it but found once plugged in it didn't work at all. This is very unusual for items on Amazon as I have never had an issue like this occur. I am attempting to exchange the item / return the item so that i can re-purchase but seem to be having issues with the center sending me emails.

reviews.reviewTitle: It requires a lot of trial and error but for the casual coffee drinker it's a good deal.
reviews.reviewText: I've had this grinder for almost 3 years, it does a decent enough job with some downsides. It's very loud, produces a lot of fines (coffee dust) and the dial grind scale makes it hard to judge what grind level you need for your brew. It requires a lot of trial and error but for the casual coffee drinker it's a good deal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works fine. Loud as hell though.
reviews.reviewText:
I've had mine a few months. User-friendly and reliable. Really nice being able to adjust fineness with a dial. Being able to grind beans fresh for each cup is also great because i like using different brewing methods.

Downside: if you use this thing early in the morning, it will wake your roommates up. It's friggin loud.
Have been using this daily for over 1 & 1/2 years and it has worked flawlessly. No complaints. It makes perfect sizes for course cold brew all the way to fine coffee for a regular coffee machine.
Best for the money in a stone grinder. Be sure you get a cleaning brush to keep it healthy. Noisy, but that's what you get in a grinder.

This item has served me well for around 8 years. You can grind a whole bag of coffee beans, and only empty the reservoir once. There are several settings, so you can fine tune your grind from drip to French press and everywhere in between. This recent purchase was a thank you gift for a friend who needed a new coffee grinder. She will use it for a long time to come.

reviews.reviewTitle: grinds beautifully. put your beans on the top and set
reviews.reviewText: grinds quickly, it is loud but I can deal with it because it is only for less than 2 minutes. grinds beautifully. put your beans on the top and set. push start in th morning and make your coffee. simple good purchase

Not quite 6 months on this. I've used it 5 or 6 times because I grind a jar full when I grind. Today I got to half a jar and the motor burned out. It has that burned plastic smell. I've treated this thing well, always cleaned it after use and stored it in original packaging. Big FAIL! I expected more of the brand.

For the price, this is a good grinder. This is my second one having worn out my first over six years. However, I find the new one doesn't give me as find a grind as before. I use it for Turkish coffee and home expresso which requires a very fine powder like grind. For an everyday coffee maker, this is an excellent grinder.

Alright so I waited to make sure it wasn't the coffee I used or something else. This is my second burr grinder by cuisinart and I loved my first one. I had it for years unit the grinding stones finally cracked. So I bought this one thinking it would be of the same quality. I was disappointed it grinds for what seems like an appropriate time but I end up with a tablespoon of coffee grounds. I've tired different coffee brands and roasts nothing helps. I've adjusted the grind from the highest fine to largest course nothing changes. I've cleaned it out taken it apart and even blown it out thinking it was clogged. Nothing changes. So now to brew a normal 6 cup pot I have to grind it three times on 18 cups to get enough coffee to brew. Whatever they changed in it please change back.
Awesome coffee grinder!!! I highly recommend this product for coffee makers. Especially if you love to make your coffee from the French press like I do.

reviews.reviewTitle: Messy, but better than a blade
reviews.reviewText: I am so happy with this product. I love the uniformity of coffee. It’s well worth the price. Yes, it’s messy! But I’ll put up with it for the consistency day over day that can’t be replicated with a blade grinder. And it looks nice on my counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: A hit in the coffee bar.
reviews.reviewText: I love this grinder better than the last one I bought. It meets the test in every category. Perfect grind for every type of coffee confection.

I love this appliance. I fill the hopper at the top twist the thing to the correct grind, choose the amount I need and press start. Empty the cup into the coffee maker and done. No scooping or measuring. It just works.

Works exactly as advertised. very easy to clean. Somme folks say this grinder is very, very loud. I understand that can be subjective. I have been using this product for over two months and can tell you, I can have a conversation with my wife standing next to this grinder while operating and I don't have to raise my voice. It snot whisper quiet but its not that bad either. Love this product!

The worst part of this is that it does not so much grind the beans as turn them into dust. Even at the corset grind, it is way too fine. And when you remove the bin from the grinder, coffee "dust" goes everywhere. When you dump it into your coffee maker, dust goes everywhere and a lot sticks to the bin.

reviews.reviewTitle: He has had a lot of fun playing with it
reviews.reviewText: My husband was dubious about this grinder, but had to replace his beloved 30-year old Braun grinder. But he loves, loves, loves the new one and no longer has to guess about how much coffee to put in it or how long to grind it. He has had a lot of fun playing with it. Now if it just holds up.

This is a really nice grinder. I have been using if for awhile and despite some of the reviews I haven't seen it clog very easily. I only grind for a french press on the coarsest setting so that may have something to do with it but I really like the grinder and it beats doing it by hand
I've been using this for a bit over a week now and love the result of freshly ground coffee every morning. I use a french press on the most coarse bur setting.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing value, but not for high expectations
reviews.reviewText:
I returned this item because although the description promised ultra fine grinding suitable for Greek/ Turkish coffee, the grind was unacceptably coarse. If my drip coffee maker didn't already have a burr grinder built in, I'd probably have kept it.

Well built, good looking and easy to use, it's a good grinder for drip and French press. Otherwise, look elsewhere...I am.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tell me why they stopped working.
reviews.reviewText: Bought 2 grinders at a time. We grind a full hopper at a time, then brew the coffee as needed. The first grinder worked for about 2 weeks. then it just stopped cold! Started using the 2nd grinder. After a couple of weeks, it too stopped working, and blew out my fuses!!!! It's too bad, as we like the product.

Decent grinder for price. Even at the grind for most coarse coffee grinds there is a small portion of very finely ground coffee. For the price I would still recommend this grinder though this may not be the best for those looking for a very fine ground for espressso.

reviews.reviewTitle: Crapped after a year of use.
reviews.reviewText: I got about a year of good service before the switch screwed up. The unit then wouldn't turn off. I had to unplug it to get it to turn iff. It gunshot became more of a hassle than it's worth and I threw it away.
1st one broke after 4 months. 2nd one broke after two months. Terrible design causes it to be non functional after minimal use.
This is an outstanding burr grinder. It is very well constructed. It gives you options for the type of grind you want. Keep in mind, it is quite loud when running.

Worked great for 2 months, then kaput, the motor died. I also didn't like the ground coffee container design-- pouring the ground coffee into the coffee pot was a mess everytime. I have used Cuisinart coffee makers for years and always have been satisfied. I'll chalk this one up to a being a lemon.

If you grind coarse (e.g. for cold brew or french press) it does leave some fine grounds. However, they appear in a few compact lumps at the top of the removable chamber--so they are easy to scoop out and discard if you wish.

This is an awesome product, select the coarseness of the grind and the number of cups to brew and press button, Voila, you have freshly ground coffee from this unit. The coffee is now truly enjoyable.

I bought this to grind wheat berries since I only need a small amount of flour for my household of one, and it works like a dream. It has earned a spot on my counter. I love how easy it is to choose my grind. I love the automatic shut-off. It's a well-designed appliance. The price was very reasonable. I couldn't be more pleased.
Overall, this grinder gets the job done without having to spend a lot of money on something more expensive. However, I wish it was easier to clean it thoroughly. So far we like it
The most important thing to me is the different settings a various coffee grinding. What also is important to me is the chamber holds a lot of grinded

This Cuisinart grinder is great. The grind is exceptionally uniform. It has numerous settings to get the exact coarseness one may desire. The only drawback I can see is that it is really noisy. The noise only lasts for about twenty seconds but it is much louder than my old blade grinder. Simple to empty grinds. Easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: We very much like this grinder
reviews.reviewText: We very much like this grinder. We don't use it for anything except coffee and it does a great job, it's quiet, and has variable settings. One thing we like is that you can push start and you don't have to stand there and hold it down like many other grinders. It stops when it's done! Another thing we like is you can load the coffee beans in for twelve cups, but you can choose to grind a smaller amount, like four or six cups. Anyway, we are happy with this purchase.

Bought this as a gift for family member. Have been using it for a couple months and told me they are saving so much money on coffee as beans are cheaper and they are enjoying FRESH GROUND coffee daily. Different family members like different grinds and it's so easy to dial course or fine and anything in between. One of the best gifts to give (or keep) if you are a coffee lover.
After 10 months, the motor works sometimes however it doesn't grind. I LOVED it and am sad and disappointed :(

reviews.reviewTitle: I like that I can fill the top and then grind ...
reviews.reviewText: I like that I can fill the top and then grind the right amount of beans for the number of cups I'm brewing without having to open the top and guess how much to put in a grinder each time I brew. The burr grinder doesn't waste as many beans as my former grinder. Downside, it is very noisy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very Fast Grinder if that is what you need.
reviews.reviewText: Delivered quickly. Arrived in good shape. However, even on the coarsest grind, you get a lot of extremely fine coffee dust. When company is coming, I use a manual grinder. This one is faster, but not as good at grinding coffee beans for my perculator.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not worth the cost. Second one in less than a year
reviews.reviewText: This is the second time we have purchased this grinder. It lasted for two months. The first one lasted for 5 months. Don't purchase this grinder. Its a waste of money. The price was too good too good to be true for the type of grinder we were seeking. Don't waste your money on this.

This grinder looks nice but it’s crap. It takes a long time, it doesn’t grind the amount it says it does, it has a huge static issue that causes grinds to go everywhere. I’ve already packed it up to donate to Goodwill since I’m unable to return it at this point. Save your money, don’t buy this.
Finally a grinder I cant kill. All the others just stopped working when I tried to grind my bag of beans
This grinder works fantastic and is easy to use. The only problem is it is a little noisy for those early morning brews.

reviews.reviewTitle: I can't tell that it grinds much better than a cheap old blade type
reviews.reviewText:
Maybe this is how these grinders are supposed to work. I've never owned a burr grinder before.
I can't tell that it grinds much better than a cheap old blade type. Maybe it does. I need feedback from somebody who knows more about it.
It's loud and makes a mess. But I use it. Just not sure if it's doing a great job or not.
I think the quality is pretty good.
This was delivered 4/28/19. It is the noisiest grinder I have ever owned, and yesterday, it died...would never buy another again!!!

I purchased this mill to grind beans for my Bunn Filtered Drip coffee maker. This is the first mill I have ever used, so I don't have much to compare too, but overall I'm satisfied with the performance.

As usual, this was delivered to me in 2 days, as I'm a Prime member. It took about 30 seconds to assemble and use. You screw the hopper or holding bin onto the base, and plug in. You can adjust the mill to grind the proper amount based on how many cups your brewer is. The settings accomodate 4-18 Cups. I have an 8 cup pot, however, I have found that using the "8 Cup" setting, provides much more product than is necessary. One click of a button, and your ready to put proper amount of grinds into your coffee maker and go. My only complaint is one you will see on other reviews- the container where the grounds are sent it plastic. This causes static electricity and the "coffee dust" collects on the sides of the containers. To be honest, this is a minor problem to me, and doesn't affect my overall rating. Yeah, it causes a bit of a mess, but in the end, the machine does what you bought it for.

For the price and ease of use, I would certainly suggest this product to others who are looking to improve their coffee drinking experience from a blade grinder.
Was using this to primarily to grind drip coffee. Died after two months of occasional use. And in spite of what they tell us, it will not grind espresso. Not recommended.

The brush/scoop that comes with the machine is cool, but when you use it, there’s a mess everywhere. Coffee grinds end up on the counter while it’s grinding, even after making sure the bucket is in tight. It stoped grinding after a few months. Our $11 grinder is still working after about 7 years so idk. Pretty unhappy with it right now
Best for the price. The easy setting to grind coffee how you want it is perfect

reviews.reviewTitle: fine unit, loud and big, but unit itself is a decent grinder
reviews.reviewText: its a coffee grinder. i hear about the perks of a burr grinder vs a blade grinder, but evidently my coffee pallet is not as refined as others because the coffee tastes the exact same. the unit is large, much larger than a bladed grinder. and man is it loud. the unit itself works fine and is good for what i need it to do. its just the detractors of size and noise.
I have owned a grinder like this for years, and it is still working, but I did not want to ever be without it so I ordered the some day replacement!
I sure hope this holds up as it was very easy to use and made a great cup of coffee! It looks nice too. It was a little loud but We will used to it. I like the size too.

I assume most people don't want coffee grinds all over their kitchen counter and probably feel that they don't have the time to use a coffee grinder.

But the truth is that there is no substitute for coffee made from freshly ground coffee beans. Heat, light, humidity, and oxygen are accelerants to deterioration of flavor and aroma of coffee. By using only freshly roasted beans and only grinding as much as I intend to use right away, I have been able to consistently produce coffee at home that is clearly fresher (and better and milder tasting) than Starbucks or most other local coffee roasteries.

Which brings me to this grinder. So far, this grinder has proven itself to be relatively clean, with a grind collection box that keeps the coffee grinds in one place. The box can be removed easily allowing the grinds to be dumped into your coffee maker. It's a pretty good design and doesn't create a mess at all.

The grinder also produces a consistent grind, which is important to consistent coffee. One poor mark for this machine is that once in a while the beans will clog and not drop into the grinding part of the machine. However, a careful lifting and shaking of the unit solved this problem.

The machine looks good on the counter top and I really appreciate the selector which automatically grinds as much as you select with one touch of a button.

A solid four.
Like the automated, one-button frond but it is a little messy retrieving the grinds from the “drawer”.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke my ears, returned for refund
reviews.reviewText:
Pros:
Grinds approximately the right amount based on setting.
Fairly solid construction
Cons:
Makes far too much dust grind even when set to a medium grind setting
Ear-shatteringly noisy. (I returned it because of this.)

reviews.reviewTitle: ) and was disappointed b/c it overheated so quickly
reviews.reviewText: I purchased a different burr grinder first (I'm withholding the manufacturers name...) and was disappointed b/c it overheated so quickly! You could only grind what you needed for the day. Cleaning wasn't easy, so I sent it back~ I like the fact that I can make enough grinds for a day or two without it overheating, and it's much easier to clean. Also I'm able to regulate the beans for grinding much easier! Love this grinder!!

I don't dislike anything about it.

It grinds coffee. It's consistent. Daily use for 4 cups every day for 4 months. No problems.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you want the best coffee ever then you need this grinder!!
reviews.reviewText: I BOUGHT THIS BECAUSE MY HUSBAND WAS COMPLAINING THAT THE COFFEE DID NOT SMELL OR TASTE LIKE IT USED TO. I BEGAN CHANGING COFFEE'S BUT TO NO AVAIL SO I SAW THE CUSINART DBM-8 AND STARTED RESEARCHING COFFEE GRINDERS WELL TO MAKE A LONG STORY SHORT THIS ONE HAD THE BEST REVIEWS AND IT IS REASONABLY PRICED PLUS IT IS MADE BY CUISINART! WHAT MORE CAN YOU ASK FOR? NOW THE COFFEE AROMA FILLS THE HOUSE AND THE TASTE IS SO WONDERFUL IT IS ALMOST TO GOOD (LOL) THE GRINDER WORKS GREAT , LOOKS GREAT , AND PREFORMS GREAT! I AM BUYING 2 MORE FOR PRESENTS.
if you enjoy fresh ground coffee...this is the grinder to get. I highly recommend it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Regardless of the setting you select you will get fine powered plus a variety of coarseness similar to a ...
reviews.reviewText:
Not worth the money!
If you want to up your coffee experience by using the BURR grinder this is not going to give you the consistency of grind.
Regardless of the setting you select you will get fine powered plus a variety of coarseness similar to a blade grinder.
I see why it was cheap! You get what you pay for, CHEAP Quality end result.

This is a replacement for one we got four years ago. We loved our old one, which we received as a gift. I am using the bean hopper and the grinder bin from the old one in the new one. I clean them in the dishwasher, top rack about every two weeks. Great product and great price. If you keep the hopper clean of coffee grounds, it will run quieter and last longer.
I haven't had the grinder that long but it has and is working out fine for me. It is a lot noisier than I expected.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it for my drip
reviews.reviewText: Not much to add here, it's extremely loud, and very messy due to the static. I take mine outside every week or two and use the air compressor to blow the grits out a bit, and I'm going to do a semi tear down soon to get the grits lodged inside. Having said that, epic grits. I love it for my drip, pour over and areopress.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well - best for the price.
reviews.reviewText: Works well - best for the price. This was a replacement for one that was burned w/ our home in the camp fire Northern California.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its a work horse. Its a little quieter then ...
reviews.reviewText: Its a work horse. Its a little quieter then the grinder and coffee pot in one. It has quite a bit of range on the grinding. The spout the coffee comes out does need to be cleaned more than you would think but it may just be the beans that we use.

purchased this coffeemaker in mid-January and by mid-February the automatic grinding no longer worked. Amazon directs you back to the manufacturer and Cuisinart will send me out a replacement product but charges shipping and handling, even though it is their product that is defective and needs replacing. A poor customer experience--I had expected more from Cuisinart and have had prior good experience.

This grinder is a fantastic upgrade from old unit. You load 8 oz coffee in top, set for the # of cups you want to brew adn push the button. Could not be more convenient. Great Product. Looks great as well.
I used it twice according to instructions, and the motor stopped working. This thing is a $38 piece of garbage, and it is going into a dumpster where it belongs.

reviews.reviewTitle: SECOND ONE OF THESE THAT JUST STOPPED WORKING
reviews.reviewText:
SECOND one of these that just stopped working. So upset to have bought a name brand and be disappointed AGAIN.
I want to send it back but the seller info seems well hidden??
Worked as advertised right out of the box. I love the multiple grind size choices available on it. Only drawback is the noise level during the grind.

I bought this to grind beans for use in a Delonghi EC-140B espresso machine. At the finest setting, it's probably marginal for a high-end machine. but it's fine for the pressurized porta-filter on this one. It makes a racket, but is quieter than an impact machine. Adjustment is simple, both for grind size and desired quantity. The hopper capacity is substantial and the see-thru plastic is convenient. The discharge hopper will leave a mess on the counter (with espresso grind anyways), unless you give it a sharp rap on the sink edge to knock the powder down before opening. As an alternative to spending hundreds on a commercial machine, this fits the bill.
good

How disappointing. This is the second Cuisinart product I've purchased in a week. Both don't work. WHAT'S GOING ON CUISINART? Unbelievable. Didn't grind a single bean, never even turned on. No damage to the packaging. How disappointed in Cuisinart. I'm done with your company, never again.......

We bought this to replace our old grinder of the same make and model. We used the first grinder heavily for @ 4 years and I think an interlock switch went bad causing it to not operate.
