I decided it would be easier to buy a new unit than to disassemble the old unit. A little disappointed that it went bad, but I love the way it grinds coffee and I am very happy with the new unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder is not to be used for espresso
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this grinder looking to upgrade from my current coffee grinder. Unfortunately, this grinder is not made for espresso grounds, though it announced that would grind very fine for espresso it does not cut it for an unpressurized basket. If you have a pressurized basket, I do not know what the results are or will be for you. I would not recommend this machine for espresso.

We love freshly ground coffee and this definitely does the job. The ability adjust the coarseness is the best feature. The draw back is how messy it is. You will get coffee grounds on your counter when using it. The grounds build up around the opening and in the corners, even when freshly cleaned. My husband hates this grinder but I am ok with it because I am a little more patient when scooping out the grounds. I use a spoon and am careful, other wise it is a huge mess. BOTTOM LINE - It works but will make a huge mess.

reviews.reviewTitle: I do like it and use it daily
reviews.reviewText: I bought this mainly because I could have a coarse grind for my french press but I also use it in my Mr. coffee machine. I do like it and use it daily. The ONLY thing I do not like about this machine is the static. It's always messy. I don't think that is the fault of the machine, they're probably all like that.

This is our first Burr Grinder and we are very pleased with the ability to adjust the grind for an ideal Coarse for French Press. I just called Cuisiart and Amazon to arrange for a replacement as the "automatic" feature is not working. Hopefully the replacement will work properly.

This coffee mill works great, 4 weeks out. I like how easy it is to load the hopper and set the number of cups needed. Cleaning the tiny opening where the ground coffee shoots out is simple to do by poking in the provided brush. I do worry that one of these days, the mill will just stop working, jammed with fine coffee. So far, so good, though.
Gift for my hubby for Father's Day. He LOVED it! Grinds more than he needs to cuz he loves it so much. HAHA.
Really easy to clean and use. I like the multiple settings for grind. It's my second one for my vacation home--holds a lot of coffee beans for all the visiting family coffee drinkers.

Can’t beat it for the money. This is our second one and the first lasted around 13 years. It literally wore thru the plastic in the grinder area from beans rubbing during grinding. We make cold brew at the coarsest grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for morning coffee with my sweetie.
reviews.reviewText: Best coffee grinder I've owned. I get up in the morning and make coffee for myself and my wife-equivalent. This make such easy and neat, compared to the spin coffee grinder I had before.

I am not giving this product any stars, but that is disallowed. The settings between fine and coarse are minimal. It is messy. Have to place large towel on counter to catch the ”flying debris“. Although the walls to my apartment are thick concrete, my neighbors know when I’m making my first brew. I have owned many products manufactured through the Cuisinart name- this one is disappointing at best.
Great product,good quality,easy to use and clean. I love grinding my own beans freshly for an awesome cupO'Jo

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought in December, died in April
reviews.reviewText: We used this grinder daily and it did a great job. Tonight, it died. I will try to get it repaired if it is possible and not too cost prohibitive. Love the grinder but not how long it lasted.

This replaced a blade style grinder that I thought was too loud. This is a loud as a vacuum cleaner, if not louder. If you have kids, make sure you grind before they go to bed! Average job with the grind size, not a champ by any means. Seems to be an acceptable value for the price.

I use this daily for a coarse grind brew in a press pot. The timer does a great job of estimating 4 tablespoons of grounds with one click. In case you were trying to wake up: hello: grinder noise is almost deafening! After a while you get a pre-coffee boost like Pavlov's dogs. Now, when I hear the noise, I almost have a synesthesia aroma experience of fresh coffee grounds. Maybe there's an upside to the roar?
I've only had it for two days, but I love it! Well made, works great. It sits proudly next to my Cuisinart (pod) coffee maker which also works perfectly. Nice production QC, Cuisinart!

Like many others, I bought this hoping it would do a great job, that the name Cuisinart would mean quality, and that it would look great in the process. Well, the last one it did, until I threw the unit in the trash. Like many others, I was so-so impressed with its grinding accuracy. But, the biggest disappointment was its failing within the first year of light use. The power switch simply stopped working. Real shame, I had equipped my entire kitchen with Cuisinart products [coffee maker, juicer, toaster, griddler, can opener, blender]. But this one was a terrible buy. Don't get one, you'll likely be sorry.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what it claims to do
reviews.reviewText: I can set amount of cups needed and it automatically turns off. Love that it has settings for fine to coarse grind. It's not any nosier than the blade grinder I had.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart quality at a good price.
reviews.reviewText: Nice burr coffee grinder at a good price and with Cuisinart brand quality and 18 mo. warranty.

I appreciate fresh ground coffee each morning, but my budget doesn't allow for a fancy high end grinder. This one offers the convenience of an electric grinder at a reasonable price. I use it for pour over coffee and while the grind it not always totally consistent, it does a reasonable job. Not sure it would work for espresso, but I haven't tried it for that yet.

Cuisinart hit a home run. You can't find a better Burr coffee mill in this price range. Has 18 grinds, Fine, medium and course, which are easy to change. You will have to experiment a little between the grind, the roast, and kind of beans to find the optimal taste. Holds about a half bag, You set the amount to grind, press Start and this little beauty humms away and in seconds, you got enough coffee to brew. Looks nice on the counter, black and stainless.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought one for myself and LOVE it! It took me a couple of pots ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought one for myself and LOVE it! It took me a couple of pots of coffee to figure out the best settings for my taste but now it's push a button and it magically grinds the perfect amount and grind. I bought a second form my Son in Law who is a coffee lover. Can hardly wait until Christmas to give it to him.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grind for a great price!
reviews.reviewText: Perfect grind from this burr grinder! So much better than a blade grinder and $150 les than the one I wanted!

I use this primarily for my French Press. Even on the most coarse of settings, there's always a heaping of ultra-fine powder. It's sad that I'll likely have to use another form of filter to finish the process because the end product is very sedimentary in nature, which detracts from the experience. When I can, I'll be moving to a higher-quality product which produces much more uniform grounds.

Update: We have now had this for less than two months and it is not working. I grind a 1/2 lb of beans at a time, and do so usually 1-2x weekly. So this thing has been used max 15 times. Today it continued to make noise like it is grinding but is not grinding the beans. I cleaned it out (the out-shoot was full of tightly packed grinds) and it still isn't working. It even started smoking. I think it's a dud. I would highly recommend NOT buying this. I'm disappointed, to say the least. And it's too late to return per Amazon, so I'm stuck with a dud of a grinder and no coffee for today :(

We bought this to replace our original Cuisinart Conical Burr Grinder, which we received as a wedding present over 5 years ago. After much use (several times weekly over 5 years) it stopped working. Looking to save a little money, I thought this one would be an adequate replacement. I wish I had shelled out the extra $50 for the conical one again. This one works ok. I usually make coarse-ground coffee for cold-brew (Toddy) coffee. Compared to the Cuisinart Conical Burr grinder, this one 1. is much slower to grind (takes 2-3 times as long to grind a comparable amount of beans) 2. makes a more annoyingly loud noise and 3. does not grind beans consistently. The coarse grind is does not seem much different than the other sized grinds. And, like another reviewer noted, there is coffee "powder" that also is made. The conical grinder makes consistently sized grinds and none of the powder. Since there is nothing actually wrong with the grinder, I do not feel I can return it, but wish I could.

Pros of the grinder: It is a nice-looking grinder, it does work adequately. The parts detach nicely and are dishwasher safe.

reviews.reviewTitle: Did not work for very long.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas for her new house, which she did not move until March 2019...it stopped working after 4 months. She was very happy with operation of this product, just now how long it lasted.
it gets the job done and allows you to pick how course or fine you want your grind, it works for me

Wasn't sure if we would like this grinder, but we do. I really like the ability to change the amount of beans to grind and the grinder figures it out for me. I have the perfect amount of coffee in my coffee maker for the cups I am brewing. Works great. A little loud when grinding, but that's to be expected.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... believe the design of the grinder cutting head is poor but the overall design of the machine is great ...
reviews.reviewText: It is a top seller one does not need to spend 300 dollars for a coffer grinder it cost 42 dollars I do not believe the design of the grinder cutting head is poor but the overall design of the machine is great clear plastic to watch it fill it is extremely load though no early morning apartment use.
This grinder does a really good job of grinding coffee. It has many settings depending on what kind of grind you want. I grind mine to make my own kerig pods and it works great.
Grinds well. I wish there was a more refined metering device. A little too much or not quite enough for a double shot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder, worth spending a little extra.
reviews.reviewText: We've had this coffee grinder for about a month now. It's been working great. I love the settings that let you grind the correct amount for the number of cups of coffee you are making. This grinder is a lot bigger then any we've had previously so it does take up more space in our small kitchen, but other than size I am very happy with this product.

Besides the static electricity of the grinds in the container, the grinder works excellent and easy to refill, and clean the compartments. No more guessing if my coffee is ground correctly. Works well if you have multiple brewing styles (stovetop espresso, french press, drip maker)

Easy to use. Takes time and is a little messy if you want to grind a whole bag like I do. Grinds stick to plastic container because of static. You need a small brush or something to clean out the shute where the grinds come out. Overall it's just OK.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall OK, but great for the price
reviews.reviewText: The grinder works well, not very noisy and does not take too much space. I think that for the price, this is a great deal. But this price comes with caveats. The French press coarse settings are good in terms of the resulting grain size, but they are not very consistent. Also, there is some dust and removing ground coffee can leave a bit of a mess. But overall, these are minor points, given the price. If the price were $200+, I would definitely return the item, but at $50 it's an excellent value.

Best grinder we have ever owned. Large hopper is nice. Good grind. We have a B&B and some mornings we are making 4 pots of coffee. I would be nice if someone figured out how to sound insulate coffee grinders. This is loud ... as every grinder I have ever used has been.

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid Performer If New And A Real Steal When Reconditioned
reviews.reviewText:
The Cuisinart DBM-8 is a very attractive stainless and black automatic coffee mill at a decent price ($50); however it's an absolute steal if you can buy one of the reconditioned units at $16.99. Factory Reconditioned Cuisinart DBM-8FR Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill

This mill is built around a burr grinding mechanism, which produces uniform sized coffee grounds - far superior to the results from the common blade coffee grinders that dominate the under $30 price range. I have even had good results using this mill to grind up flax seed into meal and rice grains into flour (although the end product is not quite as fine as commercial flour).

The grind selector offers 18 levels ranging from fine to coarse; however, my primary complaint is that the very finest level is not fine enough for making Turkish coffee, and only borderline for espresso. The mill is designed so that the upper burr grind plate can be removed, so in theory you could install a thin gasket behind it to reduce the distance between the two plates and produce an ultra-fine result; however, I was unable to remove the screws holding the upper plate in place so I gave up on the idea.
This Cuisinart is larger than most inexpensive coffee mills - it occupies about a 5"x7" footprint, and is 10" high; but that's mainly because of its large capacity. It features a large clear acrylic bean hopper that holds a ½ pound or more of whole beans and seals fairly tightly, so it doesn't require frequent refilling. There is a slide control calibrated in cups (4 to 18) which allows you to set the length of time that the grinder runs, and the clear acrylic grounds container is big enough to handle whatever volume you chose to grind.

I have had my Cuisinart DBM-8 for almost two years and it has performed faithfully. I mainly use it now for grinding meal and flours since I purchased a semi-automatic espresso machine last year that has its own built in grinder.

does what they say it does.

i use this at work a couple of times a week

grind seems reasonably consistent in terms of size however not quite as consist as the Breville coffee grinder ( which i use at home)

https://smile.amazon.com/Breville-BCG820BSSXL-Grinder-Brushed-Stainless/dp/B00OXGXW8O/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1469470587&sr=8-1&keywords=BCG800XL

reviews.reviewTitle: Exceeds what you would expect for under $40.
reviews.reviewText: Only thing I would like added would be an interlock to detect missing lid on the receiver. I set grind half way between medium and fine and stuffed it into re-usable k cups with filters for some truly wonderful tasting coffee.
we use this everyday, does a great job grinding coffee, only down side is the noise, you get use to it after few days

Consistent with the experience of other reviewers, this product stopped working after six months. Cuisinart honored the warranty and I received a replacement after paying $10 for shipping. The replacement product stopped working after six weeks. With so many customers having the same problem, it is clear that there is a design defect with the product that the manufacturer must address.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. Holds lots of beans!
reviews.reviewText: Works great. Holds lots of beans! Very consistent grind. If you have never tried a burr grinder they are far superior to a blade grinder and this is a very one. Have not tried to clean it yet… Hope that’s not too difficult.

Does a good job, would like if it could grind just a little coarser. Once it jammed and I had to turn it upside down to dislodge a piece of coffee bean apparently caught in the mechanics. Since then I make sure to turn off and on till all beans are fully ground and I have not had another problem. It is now April of 2018 and I am very happy with the product.

reviews.reviewTitle: seems to be a good machine for the $
reviews.reviewText: Our second Cuisinart burr grinder just gave up the ghost this morning after 4+ years of almost daily use. The first one lasted about as long but had issues with the timer slide and was finally replaced when the grounds receptacle broke from being dropped. My only complaint would be that its very noisy.

Great grinder! We hate the push-press grinders, but this grinder has so much versatility. My husband and I live to experiment with blends and ground size to make the perfect cup of coffee. You can't beat this price for this type of grinder, and it's definitely worth spending the extra money to get the quality control with your coffee!

Its ok. Could be faster.
It does make quite the mess every single time. You open the lid and even with a coarse grind, coffee just comes flying out everywhere.

it grinds ok, but is plagued with massive amounts of dust which fly all over the counter with each use. Even changing to a coarse grind, doesn't stop the dust. It appears to be static electricity problem with the type of plastic from which the bin is made. The is my third burr grinder and they all seem to create some of this "static dust." But, this model is clearly the worst offender. On a positive note, it is a little quieter than my last grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic piece of technology that I highly recommend.
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic piece of technology. There’s nothing better than fresh ground coffee in the morning. It works like a charm.
Has many settings and can grind about 1/2 pound or more of coffee beans at a time with ease. I've been using it for about 3 months now with no issues.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is not a one or two cup and done grinder. It is better to grind multiple cups worth at the same time.
reviews.reviewText: This is the second Cuisinart grinder of this type we have had. The first one lasted many years before it finally broke down. We are pleased with the performance so were happy to purchase another one at a good price. Although grinding is messy, the fresh grind is much better and less expensive than the other coffees.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Hope This One Lasts Longer
reviews.reviewText: I am giving this machine a lower score because I had this same model before and it lasted less than a year (motor went bad). It's the only game in town, though, unless you want to pay 3 times as much for a Krupps. If it holds up, I love it...if it doesn't, I'll not. Also, I wish the finest grind setting was a little finer, more like a Turkish grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very disappointing, jammed with first use
reviews.reviewText: This product jammed with the first use. I thought maybe there was something stuck in the grinder so I took it apart to clean it and tried again with the same result. I know it is a cheap grinder but it had great reviews and I hoped it would last at least a couple of years.

Has to be the best grinder I've owned. It's loud and obnoxious when running, but grind the night before if that's an issue. I've been using it daily. The container that stores the ground coffee has a bit of static electricity that can be interesting at first, but just wash it a few times, and you're good. I use a French press, and for me, Medium grind is perfect!

Absolutely a great addition to my kitchen and my outdated grinder. I love it and would defiantly recommend this to others. It looks nice enough to sit on my kitchen counter and it's so easy to operate.
Well built, easy to use, loved everything about it until I turned it on. Much too loud. Very loud. Returning it.

This is the best coffee grinder I have ever used. No more measuring the beans you put into the grinder because you can just tell it how much to grind for you. We have this grinder at work and I loved it so much I threw away my old one and bought this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grind selection if great. We purchased the grinder after our local Costco ...
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder replace a grinder from another manufacturer that failed within two weeks. Been in use for about four months and has worked well. Forgot to clean the ceramic surfaces and the outlet from the grinder and we thought it had failed. Fifteen minutes of investigation and cleaning solved the problem. Will not let it go that long between cleaning. Grind selection if great. We purchased the grinder after our local Costco Wholesale outlet decided their Bunn Grinders were too expensive to maintain. Fresh grounds every morning are great.

reviews.reviewTitle: but that is not easy task. They could have simplified the process for ...
reviews.reviewText: Came defective. The grind chamber does not fit properly into the base. There is a gap so when my coffee begins to grind, the coffee spits out everywhere. I think my unit came with a missing part. I'm online with cuisinart trying to register the product to use the warranty, but that is not easy task. They could have simplified the process for warranty claims.

Have used this grinder for over 5 years and it still works as well as it did when first purchased.
Sure, it creates a bit of a mess but nothing a damp paper towel can't handle!
I usually grind to capacity and store up the extra in a canister so I don't have to grind on the weekends.
It is still consistent in the quality of ground coffee! Very happy with this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love my burr coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: OH WOW! I never knew my coffee could taste so much better! The only thing I regret was taking so long in purchasing this item. I can't wait to make expresso coffee... Our coffee tastes so SMOOTH and creamy. We drink our coffee black and it just has a richness to it. I love that it automatically stops grinding too!

GREAT product! Perfect grind. The one thing they don't tell you in the description and should is that the part you rinse out (the container that catches the ground beans) does not involve getting the blades wet. That is good! It will mean that the blades will last longer!

reviews.reviewTitle: 5 years old and it is still going strong!
reviews.reviewText: Have had this for 5 years now and it is still going strong! We use it daily and probably go through 7-8 lbs of coffee a month so it gets quite the workout. Easy to use and the multiple grind selection is great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice machine. Highly recommend if you want to keep your coffee fresh
reviews.reviewText: Simple to use and effecent. Easy to clean. Timer works great. I usually go with a course grind for my French press and this worked out nicely.

reviews.reviewTitle: Could not have picked a better coffer grinder
reviews.reviewText: Could not have picked a better coffer grinder, this was my first coffee grinder and I was a bit worried about this purchase but after using this now for over a couple of months I can say, I did good in my choice...
After a year of having this coffee grinder, I have found it a total nuisance to use, impossible to clean, and annoying. I give up on it.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works great, my parents have had one for years that's ...
reviews.reviewText: I've done lots of research, bought this. Plenty of my friends have done lots of resource and purchased this. I see it in a lot of houses. It works great, my parents have had one for years that's used daily so you know it holds up. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'd spend more for something better
reviews.reviewText:
Not often I have to leave bad reviews, maybe I got a bad one, maybe it's just garbage all around or I'm picky.

For starters, I use a basket filter, tastes better, but the grinds kept getting caught up in the grinder producing marble sized clumps of super fine grind that i can't use or it gets into my coffee and just gross.

2nd, the static electricity mine had was nuts, I'd open the lid and that fine dust would just get everywhere, would have to put a towel down just to grind coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grindin' our beans like a pro.
reviews.reviewText: This is the first coffee bean grinder we have ever owned. I do a lot of research on a product before I decide to buy. Like many of you, I read and trust most reviews from people who have experienced the products first hand. After reading many reviews about the different brands and types of coffee grinders, we decided to pay a little more up front and go with the Burr Mill grinder. We have had this grinder for a few months now and are very pleased with it. It is very easy to operate. We recommend spending a little more up front and getting this Cuisinart Burr Mill.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dead Before a Year/Replacement Issued/Cost of Shipping
reviews.reviewText: I'm definitely not a review writer, but here's my input for what it's worth amongst all the other reviews: The grinder quit about nine months into its tenure with us. The good part of this story is that I called Cuisinart, gave them the model and the serial number, and they are sending a replacement to arrive within ten days. No questions asked. They also waived the shipping fee but are requiring that I send the broken one back to their warehouse at my expense. We'll see what that costs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very poor quality. When set on the very finest grind ...
reviews.reviewText:
Very poor quality. When set on the very finest grind setting, the resulting ground coffee is at best a medium grind with lots of uneven sized chunks. I called Cuisinart and they sent me a new part (after several days) that was supposed to fix this problem but it did not. Called them again today and was advised that to replace the grinder I will have to pay shipping plus a $5.00 fee and this will take up to 10 business days. To say the least, this is a time consuming headache, and it makes this machine as much or more expensive than if I would have purchased it at a local store.

If you are still thinking about purchasing this product, I would advise you to get it from a local retail store where you can return it without all the expense and hassle.

Only lasted 5 months. I previously purchased this same grinder from Costco, who no longer carry it. In fact I've had two previous grinders that each separately worked for several years. The most recent Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic only lasted several months. If I had purchased this grinder from Costco or Sears, then I am sure that I could return it after only a few months of use. We like to grind fresh our coffee. Any suggestions for a better grinder?
This is my second unit after the last one died. It was very old and when it came time to replace there were no question that it would be the same unit. Thanks Cuisinart!
It worked for its short 18 month life span. Very loud, though. Best advice; find another.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sends coffee everywhere plus coffee sticks to container
reviews.reviewText: Very ungappy with this (returned it). Sends coffee flying everywhere & wastes coffee. Awkward to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cool design but poor performance - inconsistent grinds.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this grinder after my combination 'grind and brew' Capresso machine died after about 11 years of perfect performance. After researching the current grind and brew machines I discovered they just don't make them like they used to and most people are going back to separate grinders/coffee makers. I purchased a Cuisinart coffee maker and this grinder. I have many cuisinart products and love them. The coffee maker works great but I had to send this grinder back. I love the design with the bin of beans on top and separate container for the grinds but (like many of the other reviews said) the grinds are totally inconsistent. I read the poor review and purchased this against my better judgement because I really liked the design but it just doesn't perform. No matter what setting I placed it on (fine to coarse) the grinds were wildly inconsistent.
Product is already broken after only a couple months. Motor was very loud and coffee grounds were not easy to contain. Love the idea And wish it hadn't broke because we need it.

My husband uses this grinder daily, and he loves it. It is quick and efficient--loud, but it is a coffee grinder. Only downside is that it is hard to pour the grounds out and he often has to scoop them out, but it is a huge deal. Holds a half pound bag of beans in the top.

This is a really nice looking machine and I had every confidence it would be a reliable machine as all my previous experiences with Cuisinart have been positive. Not so with this unit. We used it 4 times and on the 4th time it died. I believe the machine clogged itself on the really fine grind setting and it bogged down until it quit.

Amazons return policy is great though. They shipped me a new machine almost immediately. Even before I had had time to package the dead one up for return shipping.

We have gone to a courser grind on the replacement machine and so far, everything seems to be working as advertised. Before I purchased this machine I read the reviews and many made note that the machine did not perform well with the finer grind settings. I guess I just had to see for myself.

Overall a great burr grinder at a nice price. The different grinding settings work well and the machine is easy to clean as compared to my old blade grinder. I also enjoy the ability to store extra beans in the hopper on top. My only complaint is that there is a small amount of variation in the size of the grounds. Specifically, when I grind on medium, almost all the coffee beans are ground to that level except a small amount that is very fine that spits out on top of the rest of the grounds during grinding. However, it's hardly worth noting.
Maybe it could have a dial rather than a slider (to prevent bumping) and maybe a switch instead of a button (to avoid accidental presses).

This grinder stopped grinding coffee after only a few weeks in use. I bought it in September of 2017 but only unwrapped it and plugged it in in April of 2018. On Monday morning, May 14 it stopped!!!!!! P. O. S.!!! And Cuisinart’s customer service is NON service!!

reviews.reviewTitle: This grinder did not like "fine" grind
reviews.reviewText: Replaced once. Amazon sent a replacement. It stopped working after a short while. This grinder did not like "fine" grind. I took both apart and cleaned them thoroughly but again the motor stopped after three uses. I would grind a pound of coffee beans extending the grinding process over a few hours thinking to be cautious of the motor. But that didn't help. I finally just threw both grinders away. I do not recommend this grinder if you're going for fine grind.

This coffee grinder was purchased on the recommendation of my sister who told me I was ruining my freshly roasted beans by grinding them in an old blade grinder. I had never heard of a burr grinder, but she convinced me to try one. I am glad I did. After experimenting a bit I found I only need to use a little over half the beans I was using to make a full pot of amazing coffee. I buy beans roasted in a coffee specialty store locally and, yes, I was ruining the beans in my old grinder. This grinder not only works well, it matches the coffee maker I already had! Perfect.

Great for fresh ground beans! Now I can grind a fresh cup when I need it, as opposed to grinding a whole bag of quality beans at the store. The hopper only holds 1/3-1/2 of a bag, but that's not really a knock on the product. It does seem to get coffee dust everywhere whenever I attempt to retrieve my fresh grounds, however.

It's a bit noisy and messy but gets the job done. FAR superior to any blade grinder I've owned. The first DBM-8 Cuisinart I owned was used on a daily basis and lasted for 3+years. I know some have received lemons thanks to poor quality control abroad.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does require being fastidious to clean each time for best results. I had a different burr grinder before ...
reviews.reviewText: Well made, grinds the beans perfectly. It does require being fastidious to clean each time for best results. I had a different burr grinder before that failed to grind just after one year and had been perfectly maintained, so i purchased an extended warranty this time.

I like this grinder as far as how simple it is to get the strength you want but it is a mess! Fine flakes go everywhere! When you take the lid off the flakes fly out. It is as if there is static in the container. You can't just dump the grounds in your filter while the filter is in the coffee pot, grounds go everywhere! I am thinking I made a bad purchase. I usually rely on a product that amazon recommends or rates as a "best seller". But I will be more cautious from now on.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lots of settings not suitable for espresso fine grind.
reviews.reviewText: I like the variety of settings. Didn't like its fine grind at all not up to the grind I need for espresso. Wasted good coffee. Messy and extracts lots of coffee dust. Hard to clean.
We use this every morning to grind our beans. Super easy! We love this product for the price and it is compact so that it does not take over the counter.

Multiple options for grind selection to taste, along with the number of cups you are brewing then it "automatically" grinds the exact amount of coffee beans to provide a deliciously consistent cup of coffee to your individual taste. You can change beans say from Guatamalan to Columbia grown beans and make fine tuning adjustments to either keep the deep rich flavor or lighten it up to taste and the type of coffee bean you are using. Its more than I expected to receive from my purchase. Very happy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little burr grinder so far
reviews.reviewText: Great little burr grinder so far! Just make sure you have the cover on the 'ground coffee' box on the bottom!! (daughter forgot and it spewed grounds all over! NOT the fault of the product!!)

reviews.reviewTitle: Went out after a few months
reviews.reviewText: Worked well enough for a few months, then went out a slow and painful coffee grinding death. It also spit a ton of super fine grounds out, even though I had it set on the coarse grind for the press. So my coffee was always a little muddier than I liked.

reviews.reviewTitle: This little machine works great. I tell it how much I want to ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought whole bean coffee while traveling and wanted to make it last as long as possible so I purchased this grinder for it. This little machine works great. I tell it how much I want to make and it grinds enough for that many cups. I left the beans in the top so I can grind before brewing. Love this little machine. I did a lot of research before purchasing this one and I have no regrets about my choice. :)
Don’t buy one! This is my second one and it died! Replaced with a little garage sale grinder that works great!

Love this. Easily adjustable grind, super easy to use, and can't beat the price. I love being able to just push one button in the morning and have exactly the amount of fresh ground coffee I want 30 seconds later.

Excelente. Encantado con este producto. muele muy fácilmente y a su gusto, molido fino o mas grueso, su almacenaje es perfecto para dejar el café molido y los granos con seguridad. la limpieza muy fácil. excelente calidad.
Best purchase we’ve made this year. Took a few pots to find what grind we preferred to our flavor preference. Definitely a noticeable difference in our coffee flavor using freshly ground beans.

Allright, first of all i may love coffee, but im no connoisseur. So, id take this review with a little grain of salt.

I bought this coffee maker because i wanted to start making better coffee without having to break the bank and pay a $150+ for a good coffee grinder (ok ok, i know its not a ton of money but for a college student it kinda is). I had seen this same grinder at kohls for a about a hundred bucks, but when i saw it on amazon for less then 50 bucks new i had to take it.

Now for the actual review. some of the pros of the machine are: it gives an incredibly even grind, and while its grinding the kitchen smells like heaven. Honestly makes the best cup of coffee ive ever had at home (when using quality beans and a nice french press). The different settings are also nice, there is a very noticeable difference between the various settings of how course or fine you like your beans ground. It also has some nice weight to it, so it seems very sturdy and well built. it also just looks nicer then most grinders.

The only real problem ive had with this machine is how noisy it is. its not unbearably noisy, but it is annoying. especially if you use it when others are trying to sleep. There are some minor issues, like the fact there is some powder that will cling to the sides of the grounds catcher. Or that the power cord is too short. but nothing that is even close to a deal breaker for me.

Well, my verdict is this. Its not the nicest grinder out there, but you will not touch another coffee grinder half as good as this one without doubling the price. Its the most bang for your buck as far as coffee grinders go in my opinion.

reviews.reviewTitle: Spend the money to go up a level
reviews.reviewText: This is definitely an upgrade from the blade grinder style, but, it's not really a burr grinder of the quality I expected. The grinder has false burrs that make this more of a crusher than an actual grinder leading to a variance in grind size of the coffee. Next time, I'll upgrade to a model with stainless steel burrs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great at grinding coffee but is very noisy and coffee clings to the bin
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder is very effective grinding coffee; however, it is LOUD and a significant amount of the ground coffee clings to the sides of the bin because of the static. As such, the coffee does not merely empty out from the bin into the coffee maker basket; it must be helped along with the use of a brush. This adds time to the coffee-making process.

reviews.reviewTitle: Brock in less then a year
reviews.reviewText: I've had two of these, the first one broken after two years. The newest one no longer works only after 8 months.
Nice grinder that stopped working at 3 months and 6 days from time of order. Right when all options to return/talk to an expert are past Don’t waste your money.

reviews.reviewTitle: and worst part is the flat burrs spin too rapidly
reviews.reviewText:
Grind selection does nothing; very noisy, and worst part is the flat burrs spin too rapidly, creating much static. Ground coffee sticks to the side of the container, and must be scraped out frequently. Wish I had not kept this thing past it's return window....

We now own a conical burr grinder that generates ZERO static 'cling' and is much quieter...buy one of those, if you want good coffee!

I am working this thing hard every day and it is keeping up! Louder than I wish but that's how it works. I could set it up on the closet and close the door quickly so I do not wake others up early in the morning. BUT, with my high I.Q. I figured out I could just grind my pot of coffee in the evening and be quiet.
After 2 weeks of use it grinds perfectly on any setting and the flavor is perfect after it’s brewed.

I love this grinder. It's fast, you have a large selection of grind sizes from very course to extremely fine. A pretty powerful motor gets the job done.

There is also a setting that dispenses the perfect amount based on how many cups you want to brew (from 4-12) For a coffee grinder it's fairly quiet. I wouldn't grind with a baby sleeping, but it's not going to drown out conversations.
Pick this up as a gift, they are very happy with it. I may get one for myself.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ten plus years of service seems good to me.
reviews.reviewText: I'm getting to replace mine with this exact same model. It died on me a couple of days ago. At first I thought the bin was not seating right, but I was able to push the safety pin in and it still did not work. I think the motor just burned out. I hardly ever make espresso, so I don't need one of the $100 models. This one died after at least 10 years of faithful service, so I'm replacing it with same model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will purchase again as a gift!
reviews.reviewText: I love this coffee bean grinder with the options on how fine or coarse to grind the beans. Great value!
It works very well but an be a little noisy. But, I repeat it works very well!!

reviews.reviewTitle: In the name of good coffee!
reviews.reviewText: Helps make a great fresh cup of coffee. So convenient I bought one for my parents. I keep it on the counter and use a little brush to dust it off after use. Yes, a little loud... but hey it's time to get up!

reviews.reviewTitle: It works fine but then I amnot measuring ever speck for the ...
reviews.reviewText: It works fine but then I amnot measuring ever speck for the perfect single cup. It is messy no matter how careful I am. About the only thing between my old tiny Krupp’s and a 200.00 model. One of those engineering/marketing gaps between
I recently rated this 5 star. Literally a few months later and it is dead it will not run any longer. Simply junk. Rating change to less than 1 star. Never again. Do not but this machine.
Love the varied settings - we use for pore- overs and really are happy with this

Pros: Grinds well, all different coarseness. Holds quit a bit of beans.

Cons: Freaking loud, Sometimes the beans don't fall into the grinder...they get stuck in the hopper and the grinder just runs and runs. Makes a horrific sound. The static is an issue...we have to put a towel down every am while loading the moka pots. But I'm not sure any burr grinder doesn't have this issue. I also live in Alaska w/a woodstove....it's pretty dry in the house.

Great price for a burr grinder. Seems well made and durable. Only downside is that sometimes the automatic timer is inconsistent and makes less coffee that you'd expect. It'd be easier if you could premeasure the beans a bit better.

I love this unit. The only reason it doesn't get a 5 star is the noise. It is incredibly loud. That said, it grinds my coffee perfectly and to my specifications with a single push of a button. I have only had the product for about a month so I can't speak to durability but it seems pretty solid. I would absolutely buy this again.

Good unit, does what I need for grinding my coffee. I use things from a french press, reusable k cups and brewed coffee. Been a couple months and no issues with regular use. It is pretty noisy though. Wasn't a concern for me but if you want something quiet this isn't it.

Great burr, easy to use, makes coffee grounds just before brewing for a greater tasting coffee...
I just wish the cord was longer its quite short.
This grinding thing is ok. I needed it for espresso grinder but it doesn’t really go that fine. I guess it would be better if it had more fine grinding but it’s ok
I've used this for about 4 months now. This unit is noisy! It has an inconsistent grind. I had a Bodum Bistro Electric Burr Coffee Grinder and liked much better. It's just fair.

My husband and I love this! It matches our Ninja Coffee System perfectly, and it’s really nice how you can store beans on the top. The cup comes out easily, and there’s minimum ground coffee spilling.
We love it, works great. Not too noisy and we really like the option where you can choose how fine you want the coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: the convenience of simply having the the grinder set for the amount of coffee wanted and pushing a button is so much better than
reviews.reviewText: I have a second (seasonal) home, and had to get a second DBM-8 because the first that I have used for years in my primary home makes such a big difference in the taste of the coffee and convenience compared to the blade grinder I was trying to use in my seasonal home. I have used my first for at least 10 years, so it is durable. Also, the convenience of simply having the the grinder set for the amount of coffee wanted and pushing a button is so much better than measuring beans each time into the blade grinder. Most important is the clearly superior taste and the ability to adjust the grind to one's own taste.
Easy to use grinder. We bought this one about 5 Years ago, and pretty much wore it out. We use it almost every day. Love it.
Grinds to my preference, easy to use, the noise is a brief discomfort, since a pound finished in 2 minutes

I owned a Cuisinart Supreme Grind for 4 years before purchasing this one. I ordered this one on July 4th and it completely quit working today (August 16th). I grind coffee every two weeks, so it was not getting daily use to wear down parts. Return window is already closed or I would send it back. Will not be purchasing another one.

The grinder does not work. I contacted Cuisinart and they are charging me shipping to return it and replace it. I was never able to use it. I'm disappointed with Cuisinart and also disappointed that Amazon does not provide a way to return this item.

reviews.reviewTitle: For the value, it's hard to beat this bur ...
reviews.reviewText: For the value, it's hard to beat this bur grinder. Sure, it might clog occasionally, but the grind is mostly consistent and accurately measured. The plastic container to catch the grounds does suffer from static cling, but a quick tap on the counter helps loosen things up. Just be sure to cover the hole when doing so or coffee will errupt from the opening.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice compact grinder, stopped working after 8 month
reviews.reviewText: I liked it a lot, yes it's noisy and creates the static effect when beans are just grinded (you can tap the plastic container couple of times and let it sit for like 30 sec and it goes away) but just as any burr grinder. I have no complaints there. The problem is that it stopped working after less than 8 months.

Super easy to use and grounds are ready in seconds. Creates a very even grind and offers a dial feature for choosing how coarse or fine you want your grounds. No mess and no fuss you just pull the bottom compartment out and you’re done.
Grinds great with multiple options. It is loud! But, hey, the grinding lasts only 30 seconds or so.

Loud!

But it works. The auto stop works and the pieces are easy to disassemble. There was some static on the gind container at first. It caused a mess when transferring grind to French press. But that issue diminished with use.

I've used this grinder about 5 times. If I have any issues....I'll update.
I had to return the first one, I received a replacement the next day after advising the vendor it was defective. The one I received works great.
The Cuisinart has been used 3 times & has stopped working. we are extremely upset because we thought it was a good product! Now we hav to get another product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Ships fast, and makes for a great gift.
reviews.reviewText: This grinder outperforms itself! It was a gift for my wife, and she absolutely loves it. Fun fact, it's not just for coffee. You can also use it to grind up almonds for cakes. This way the oils in the almonds isn't compromised, as it would be in a normal blender.

reviews.reviewTitle: For some reason there is about a 1/4 inch gap ...
reviews.reviewText:
For some reason there is about a 1/4 inch gap at the top of the container..... I have to put tape on it or coffee flies everywhere.
I don't mind the regular clean up mess, but the coffee is flying out while grinding.
Other than that it grinds very well.......I wish they would send me a new container or what ever it needs to fix it.

I really wanted to give this burr mill a chance, but I'm thinking of ditching it fairly soon for another. I can't speak for the quality of coffee over the last grinder I had since I don't notice any actual difference, but the brew on this one is fairly inconsistent. Some days it's weak, some days it's strong. I never change the settings and brew the same way each time.

That's not even the real issue though. The issue is the DUST!! This thing is ridiculous. The dust cakes up on the top (someone else uploaded an image here that shows it) and clings to the plastic hopper on all sides. Just removing the lid causes a plume of dust scattering all over the counter. Setting the lid down causes ANOTHER! .. say nothing about scooping it out. The counter gets covered, the machine itself gets covered and it's a huge pain to clean it out every day.

Granted, some beans hold more oil than others so the level of dust goes up and down with the different roasts, but it really only goes from bad to worse.

Overall.. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought for wife as Christmas gift
reviews.reviewText: Got this to replace a hand powered grinder. So far the wife loves it and all the features. Will update if any issues arise

My first adjustable grinder...and I love it! I am a 3-4 cup a day coffee drinker. I have been told for years "buy a good grinder". Well, they are right, coffee taste so much better. My grown daughter was skeptical, but after using her coffee maker with fresh ground coffee - she is convinced.

It works very well...delivering the right amount of grinds for the cups of coffee you'd like to brew. I'm deducting one star because there's a very slight gap on the hopper that allows fine grinds to be scattered all over the counter top. We've figured out a "paper towel workaround" but it's cumbersome.

I love this grinder and I have used many grinders in my time. This is the second of this grinder I have purchased. Some complaints about this is that it is noisy. I have to agree that if you get up in the morning and like quiet time or people are sleeping and you have to grind coffee this will be loud. My cats hate it. But, it grinds really well, holds a large amount of grounds at one time and has multiple settings. I have a ceramic coffee canister and I grind a weeks worth of beans at a time so I really appreciate the capacity. Very easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: My brother is a coffee enthusiast; I just like a good cup of coffee
reviews.reviewText: Having had coffee made with beans ground in the Cuisinart Burr Mill at a friends' house, we decided to purchase one. Literally the day after it arrived, my brother called to extol the virtues of coffee made via beans ground this way, and suggested I purchase the expensive euro model he'd just bought. I agreed, and when I told him I'd just purchased the Cuisinart, he told me to return it, immediately, that it just wouldn't do the job. (Translation:I learned he'd paid over three times what I had for the same process because he was reading the magazine reviews for hardcore coffee mavens). I told him that I'd just pay the plane fare to Italy if I intended to spend that kind of money and enjoy the scenery while I sipped. Needless to say, we kept our Cuisinart, and find the coffee comes out full of flavor, just the way I like it. (My brother and I don't discuss this anymore)
My wife and I have been using one of these for years. The first slipped a little so I bought another one to not miss a beat

Read so many different reviews on a variety of grinders, but none of them for the price point could convince me they were up to quality and standard like the Cuisinart. With having many different types of coffee makers available in my home, from aeropress to cold brew, this was the perfect option with its 18 different grinds.

I had this product a few years ago and really appreciated the quality of it. It never jammed, could hold enough beans to get me through the week, and was easy to manage. It's rather loud (I mean, it's a grinder, every grinder is going to be loud to a degree) and large, but it works so well that I can't find fault with either of those aspects.
Much the upgrade from the bullet style device I had before. Love the many grind levels

reviews.reviewTitle: Be sure to put the lid on, otherwise the coffee will be all over you counter when it’s running
reviews.reviewText:
My second one. The first didn’t last.
Works well while it’s working

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for Drip, Aeropress or French Press
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this product after being unsatisfied with the highly rated Bodum Bistro electric grinder. It is perfect for what it is: a value oriented upgrade from a whirly blade grinder. I've made wonderful coffee from my freshly roasted beans using a drip maker, aeropress and a french press. The coarseness is perfect for french press!

Yes, some of the fines stick to the container, but they are easily discarded without them getting mixed into your grounds. Also, as others have noted, the unit is rather loud. This isn't a big deal for me as I grind my beans in the garage on my workbench where I roast my coffee. If you are looking for a high end grinder for your espresso machine, look elsewhere. If you want a step up from your whirly blade grinder and you make drip coffee or coarser, you won't be disappointed!
Finally I did something right and got my wife a gift she likes. To all husbands out there who are looking for a gift or their wife who drinks coffee by them one of these you won't regret it.

reviews.reviewTitle: although easily compensated, the preset grind amounts make about 25% ...
reviews.reviewText:
Its loud! Granted compared to hand grinding everything is loud but this is louder than the blender or any of my other kitchen appliances which makes it hard to get up and make fresh coffee without waking the whole household.

Also, although easily compensated, the preset grind amounts make about 25% of the amount needed for the amount of cups indicated ex if I want a 4 cup amount i set it to the 16 cups grind setting.

Still it is affordable and does the job.

reviews.reviewTitle: Take a pass on this one.
reviews.reviewText: Has lasted 2 years - but has always been a terrible grinder. 20% of the coffee ends up super fine dust caked around the rim inside.
Husband love this bad boy! No need to buy fresh coffee outside. :)

reviews.reviewTitle: had problems where beans jammed causing coffee to come out ...
reviews.reviewText: had problems where beans jammed causing coffee to come out into the room somehow bypassing the holding container. Cleaned whole beans out the unit - still using to see if problem occurs again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Extremely disappointed as I sowvd more on a well known make ...
reviews.reviewText: Purchased July 6, 2017 and this grinder has already stopped working. Extremely disappointed as I sowvd more on a well known make hoping it would last for a few years.
The Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill works as advertised, it is just TOO loud.

reviews.reviewTitle: This makes a nice, even grind
reviews.reviewText: This makes a nice, even grind. But people aren’t kidding about it being loud. It’s actually hard to even be in the kitchen while it’s running.
So far, no problems. Looks good on the counter, the rotating dial is kinda fun and will grind 4 pounds of coffee in one sitting.

We're very happy with the new coffee grinder. It replaced a blade style grinder which simply reached the end of its service life. We were very pleasantly surprised by the improvement in flavor with the new grinder. The ground coffee particle size distribution between the two styles of grinders probably accounts for the flavor improvement. Periodically having to clean ground coffee buildup in the outlet chute of the grinder to the hopper is the only change that wasn't welcomed. But this just takes a couple of minutes about once a week to clean, and we find the improvement in coffe flavor well worth this relatively minor detractor.
Have not grind but 3 pounds of coffee beans and it quit working.Will not return it as I threw out the packaging,Am very disapointed. Will order a different brand and hope I have better luck.

reviews.reviewTitle: No matter how you adjust the grind, some of ...
reviews.reviewText:
No matter how you adjust the grind, some of what you grind comes out the consistency of talcum powder. It has to be scraped from the collection box. I don't know what sort of scoop the designers used, but the numbers on the grind select don't match any standard coffee scoops.
I kept it too long, so now I am stuck with this junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product to wake up your neighbors
reviews.reviewText: This is a fantastic product, it does the job I need it to. Love the fact you can dictate how many cups of coffee you're going to make so you don't over/under grind. I have only tried medium and coarse settings as I don't make espresso. Just be aware, it might wake up your neighbors as it is quite loud.

This grinder is not up to Cuisinart's standards. It's very noisy. So noisy in fact that if I grind coffee beans in the morning, it wakes the family sleeping on the second floor. The grinder quit after only three months. Would not recommend this to anyone.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you drink your coffee like tea, really light
reviews.reviewText: If you drink your coffee like tea, really light, this will be great for you. I drink my coffee dark so it has flavor and this grinder will not grind the beans fine enough for me. The water goes through the ground beans so fast, the coffee tastes like tea. I like my beans ground as fine as flour and this machine will not do that. Dissapointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Constantly clogs up...finally engine died after 3 1/2 months
reviews.reviewText:
Had it for just under 4 months and it stopped working. Engine must have burned out or something. But there were more problems with this before that happened anyways....I feel like every other grind we have to clean it out because it wasn't shooting out enough ground coffee per the amount of cups we had the setting on. Looks nice on the outside but on the inside not very great design. Hope to find a better grinder somewhere else. Also sucks because it is out of the return policy for Amazon so I have to pay for shipping and handling to return this product to the manufacture. Hopefully they'll reimburse me vs replace it for me. I don't write many reviews, but this one I did because I was so frustrated. Ugh.....**update...Cuisinart is replacing it for me as they can't reimburse me...oh well...hopefully the new model lasts longer than 4 months! LOL (still not happy I have to pay for shipping and handling though to return the older model)

***Update*** 8/16/16...our second one just died again....will never buy this model grinder again and most likely we won't be reimbursed either

Junk!! Doesn’t matter if it’s set on fine or course it will be a blend of powder and large grinds. It also generates this weird static so the grinds stick to everything making a mess that’s hard to clean. Takes about 5 min to grind 1/2 lb of beans and it’s so loud your ears will literally be ringing when your done. Total garbage!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: We loved this grinder until it stopped working 2
reviews.reviewText:
We loved this grinder until it stopped working 2.5 months after purchase. We called Cuisinart regarding a warranty claim, and they wanted us to spend money to ship this to them and ship a new one back to us. For us this was unacceptable. We will no longer be purchasing any cuisinart products.

Spend more money and get a better grinder. That is what we are going to have to do.

We bought our Cuisinart Burr grinder in 2006 and have used it a minimum of 3 to 4 times a day... we're HUGE coffee drinkers. We've never had a problem with it, except for it being a bit noisy; we remedied that somewhat by putting a terry towel underneath and it helps muffle the sound. Well, this morning, we finally wore it out and am on here to buy another. For us, having used it several times daily for almost 7 years... it's a no-brainer to buy another. We love this grinder!
Bought unit April of 2018. Stopped working March of 2019. Called product support. They told me to mail the entire unit to Arizona with a $10.00 check to cover postage..........just so you know.

reviews.reviewTitle: Noisy and flimsy but grinds okay.
reviews.reviewText: Makes quite a racket and is not nearly as substantial or thorough as our Capresso. Leaves a small amount of over ground (powdery) coffee beans stuck to the sidewall of the collection bowl. Would have expected higher quality for the money and from this vendor. On the plus side, it does grind correctly aside from the powder. But could not recommend overall.

reviews.reviewTitle: Piece of made in China crap!!!
reviews.reviewText: This product worked great the first time I used it. I buy a big bag of coffee from Costco and grid it up in portions to fill up my ground coffee canister. So the first time I used it, it worked great! The second time it started over heating and stopping... The beans would not feed down into the grinder. So I let it cool and it worked. Now this time, 3 days after my 30 day return limit, the third time I used it, it will not grind. Keeps over heating and stopping. Piece of crap made in China... Don't buy it... I wasted $60ish bucks!! If I could give it no stars I would!

I bought this product when my son inadvertently bought my wife coffee beans and not ground coffee for her birthday. Machine is fast and easy to clean. Very easy to operate and having a good time with my new job grinding the family coffee beans.

I like the half pound capacity, the wide variety of grind levels, and the adjustable pot size setting. Very happy with the quality and perfomance; it's not nearly as loud as my prior Capresso grinder, and is attractive on the kitchen counter top.
We use this daily or every other day. Works great. No issues. It’s loud but I expected that.

Perfect classic coffee mill grinder. Takes care of the boulder and silt issue from my old upright with the blades at the bottom like a blender. Coffee comes out super consistent. It is fairly loud however upon grind.
I use in the morning before I go to work I like my coffee strong. You can set it to your taste buds. France Press, Pour Over

reviews.reviewTitle: High Quality and Works Incredibly Well
reviews.reviewText: Very nice coffee grinder. It has large capacity to hold the cofffee beans and it’s nice being able to grind in a larger size for a French Press.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's not as good for a pour over as if you got your ...
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder does everything you need a coffee grinder to do without much fuss. It's not as good for a pour over as if you got your grounds from a local coffee shop, but it is good enough. It is also very very loud when it grinds.

I chose this particular grinder because of its high ratings and good feedback. I use a French Press at home, so I need a course grind. The grind is inconsistent, as the most course setting dispenses large flakes with a generous dusting of fine powder. The result is a grittier than usual cup of pressed coffee, and the last cup is pure mud.
Otherwise, the grinder looks great on a countertop, it's reasonably quiet, and--since grinding coffee can be a messy experience--it contains the grinds really well.

Now that I've bought and used this, I feel the 4 star rating is too high. Maybe I'm spoiled coming off a Baratza Virtuoso. When you take the ground coffee out, it's messy. Many grinders don't have a lid. Removing this lid along with the fact that the coffee sticks to the plastic chamber electrostaticly makes it messy, and coffee grinds spray around when pouring into the coffee maker. I also don't think the coarse adjustment works very well. I turned it to coarse, and the grinds are still fine and powdery. It's ok for the price, but not a great grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works As Well As the Breville
reviews.reviewText: Love this-it's better than the more expensive Breville model that finally died after 5 years-plus it has a smaller footprint on the counter. The one thing I am truly picky about is my coffee and this would have gone back had it not performed as well as its predecessor.
I waited too long to buy one of these, I love it - so easy to use and does a great job.
This coffee grinder has a faulty design. There's too big a gap between the grinder and the housing, so the beans kept getting stuck & the grinder wouldn't work. Returned it after the first use.
Totally unreliable. Every morning it might work, it might not work, you never know. When it works it's great, but many mornings I have to disassemble it to try to find why it isn't starting.
It gets the job done. Still working over a year later. You don't expect that from appliances anymore. It is very noisy. Static isn't all that bad. I get good coffee from it. Thats all.

reviews.reviewTitle: A good grinder makes a difference
reviews.reviewText: I used an older model of the same Cuisinart burr grinder for about 7 years before I wore it out! I knew I wanted to replace it with the same one, but in the mean time, I had to use my spare grinder, the one with the blades that "chop" the coffee beans - not good. Not only did the coffee taste less flavorful, but I had to guess at the amount of beans to use and how long to grind them. Every pot was different. With my Cuisinart there is no guessing. The burr grinding system extracts maximum flavor from the beans, with the correct grind and I just set the number of cups I am brewing .... perfect coffee every time!

When it works, it is unbeatable. Grinds to exactly the grind you need for whatever your coffee desires. The last machine I had of this brand and model lasted 3 years. Unfortunately the one I bought 3 days ago died after only 2 uses. Thank God for Amazons return and replacement policy.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love fresh coffee and this burr grinder is top of ...
reviews.reviewText: I love fresh coffee and this burr grinder is top of the line in my opinion. Sure you can spend $150+ for a better one but with 16 different settings this gets the job done very well. I used the lower-medium grind setting for the normal coffee pot and the super fine (smallest) setting for my espresso machine. Get a fresh cup every time!

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds beans very well, especially since we use it at a very fine grind
reviews.reviewText:
Not only was this grinder impossible to clean, it was also messy as it was grinding. The connection from the grinder to the
receptacle obviously not tight enough. In addition, the coffee would collect at the opening and block some of the newly ground coffee from getting through. Fortunately, we don't have to use it that often.

This coffee grinder is a must for people who prefer freshly ground coffee every day. The multiple settings allow you to customize the grind size and volume of coffee so you get just the right amount of coffee every time. My husband has taken the time to clean the unit a few times as it will start to clog after a few months of daily use but that really seems reasonable given the job it performs. Definitely worth the money!

I'm a little bit disappointed and this product because I wanted course grinder and it's not that course it said it did about 23 different grinds and I've got it on the biggest grind and it's still not course enough for me but I'm using it and I'm going to keep it

reviews.reviewTitle: Six Years, Used Every Day, and This 'Pro-sumer' Appliance Still Works Like New. This is 'The One' to Get.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this six years ago to replace one made by Braun which was similar in design and function. Though I had the Braun for several years, it often had problems which I thought were common to all consumer level coffee grinders. The Braun had to be cleaned about every third time I used it, otherwise it would seize up and the engine could burn out--as my parents demonstrated with three of them in a row before my second Braun finally died.

Because I had bought a Cuisinart coffee maker, I bought this grinder simply because it matched. I didn't think it would be any better, and I was willing to go through the maintenance routine as I had for years just so I could have fresh ground coffee every time. But it turned out the Cuisinart is many times better, and makes the Braun look like a toy by comparison.

MAINTENANCE: I very rarely need to do any kind of maintenance on it except sometimes when the weather is humid and the ground coffee is more likely to compact inside the machine. All I have to do at those times is take a toothpick and break apart the hard packed coffee blocking the shoot.

DUMMY PROOF: Once, with the Braun this Cuisinart replaced, after cleaning it I forgot to put the bin which catches the ground coffee back on, started it to grind enough beans for a full pot of coffee, and somehow didn't realize as I walked away from it that it was spraying coffee all over the kitchen. What a mess.

The Cuisinart wont do that. If the bin or hopper are not properly in place it wont even start. So it's fairly accident proof.

NOISE: It is a fairly loud machine, but very easy to quiet. I used to try wrapping the whole thing in towels and oven mitts until I realized all I had to do was put one small towel on top, and place my hands on either side of the collar if I wanted it to be quiet. Of course, most of the time I don't think about how loud it is, but sometimes if someone is on the phone or watching television in the next room I like to keep it quiet.

SIZE: It's about three quarters the height and width of my current Cuisinart DCC-2800 Perfec Temp 14-Cup Programmable Coffeemaker, Black and the hopper which holds the beans can hold enough for at least three 14 cup pots of coffee with room to spare. I typically keep my coffee in the fridge, but unless the beans have a chance to warm up to room temperature beforehand they don't grind or taste as good.

BOTTOM LINE: Short of purchasing a professional grade coffee grinder (aka 'burr mill') this is the best. I've been using coffee grinders for about twenty years, have owned a few different ones and this is 'the one' to get.

reviews.reviewTitle: Customer Alert: clean the port on this machine
reviews.reviewText: I want to thank Rachel Levin who on Aug 17 wrote about a solution to problem this DBM-8 has: jammed exit port for grounds. My DBM-8 died, I was sure. But after reading Ms Levin's comment I also gave my unit's exit port a thorough cleaning and the thing is working again. That thing was headed for the dump. But now I'm back to loving this coffee grinder.

The fine setting isn't fine enough for espresso. I wish I had just paid for the expensive grinder that I had before rather than going budget. I think my old $20 variety had a better "fine" grind. It's just that I wanted to grind a larger volume. But if you're just grinding for drip or French press this is great
From fine to coarse, you will find your setting. As for noise, it is loud. But honestly they all are.
Love mochas and cappuccino but new at blending my own coffee and making them. Love that this is fast, holds extra beans and doesnt get everywhere:) great for the price.

I had reservations about ordering the Cuisinart grinder after reading the mixed reviews here. But, Consumer Reports gave it a good review. So, I decided to give it a try. I'm sure it isn't as good as a $500 grinder. But, moving up from a simple blade grinder. We're very happy with it. It is noisy, but not more noisy than our old blade grinder. I do wish it ground a little finer. But, ground coffee works fine for espresso and cappuccinos if packed into the filter basket of our basic Krupps espresso maker.

As some have suggested, grounds do stick to the plastic bin. But, it's not a big problem for us. This grinder has markings to control how many cups of coffee for which you want to grind. We make our coffee pretty strong but find that it grinds too much. So, when we make 10 cups of coffee, we set the grinder to 8 cups.

It's too soon to speak to durability. But, we're enjoying the Cuisinart grinder very much.

reviews.reviewTitle: For the price, an excellent grinder
reviews.reviewText:
For this price, you will have a very hard time finding a burr grinder as nice as this one. Like some other reviewers, I had to laugh at the complaints that this doesn't grind well enough for an espresso machine. I use this to produce a coarse grind for my French Press coffee maker. I also use it to produce a slightly finer grind for my Mr. Coffee drip maker with excellent results for both. A couple of very minor gripes (but, keeping in mind the price).

PROs: 1. Very easy to set up and use. Can't get much simpler than filling the large hopper with your beans, selecting the grind, number of cups and pressing the "Start" button. All markings are easy to read.
2. Very easy to clean. All the cleanable parts come right off and into the sink for washing. The instructions say the parts are dishwasher safe, but I don't use a dishwasher so I can't comment on this.

VERY MINOR CONS: 1. As another reviewer noted, this grinder produces a small amount of coffee "dust" when grinding. This dust will settle on your counter top when you pull out the Grind Chamber (suggestion: cleans up in about 1 second with a sponge or paper towel).
2. Having removed the Grind Chamber to dump your ground coffee into your coffee maker, the Grind Chamber is a little tricky to insert back into the grinder - it has to be jiggled and persuaded a little bit. Perhaps I just haven't figured out the correct method yet.

For your daily morning coffee fix, you can't go wrong with this one. If you are making espresso, climb a few hundred dollars up the grinder selection.

I've only experimented with this for a few days but so far I love it. Makes a little noise, but not at all bad for a coffee bean grinder. The many settings do appear to work well and the design is sound. Bur grinder means more consistency and the grinds don't go all over the place. Pieces are few and easy to clean.

Considering I used "spinning blade" grinders for years without realizing what I was missing AND this is only my second true burr grinder (AND the first was a Black & Decker), I might be dismissed as too inexperienced to accurately review this product. So, please: take this for whatever it is worth to you.
ALL electric burr grinders are noisy. This unit is no exception. If you want a quiet grinder, use a manual (hand-cranked) model.
I agree with some previous reviews: the coarse/fine grind settings are a bit misleading; Medium is a little finer than most "automatic drip" grinds. But I like a little finer grind than that, anyway - I set it to 2 or 3 clicks to the fine side of medium and it is great.
The consistency of the grind is excellent (as long as you keep the machine clean).
The convenience of the large hopper is a real plus for me; I only need to fill the hopper about twice a week.
Static is always going to be an issue with this type of grinder. Plastic seems to love the oils in freshly-ground coffee beans almost as much as I do!
Since there is a huge disparity in price between "levels" of machines, if you want a well-made coffee grinder but don't want to spend $200 for it, this is a worthy choice. If I could have given it 4-and-a-half stars, I would.

reviews.reviewTitle: Update your taste to coffee chain store quality. Expect visitors to return for more.
reviews.reviewText: Drinking coffee now like the high dollar chains offer. Avid coffee drinker and found the way to make chain store taste. Starts with fresh ground beans.
it works, but just not able to dial in to the super fine level for espresso also its very noisy
This is my second like unit and the first on lasted five or six years of daily (some twice a day) flawlessly. Large hopper is a big plus as well.
I’ve grounded 5 bags so far. It’s been absolutely great. No problems whatsoever. Awesome product for your money and durable and dependable. It is rather loud but it does its job very well

I tend to buy Cuisinart products if I have a choice, but this coffee grinder and lack of support from Cuisinart might have changed that preference. Before buying I read the reviews here, and I was prepared for the static problem in the collection bin. That really isn't a big problem, though I wish it could be fixed. The trouble started when my wife made my coffee one morning, and the French press plunger went down much less than normal. I looked in the press and there was more coffee than usual. I laughed and told my wife she must have run the grinder twice. A few days later I ran the grinder and it produced FOUR TIMES the amount of coffee it was set for. Then it ran okay awhile, until a couple of weeks ago, when it just stopped working. I checked the collection bin switch and it seemed okay, but I don't know where the coffee bean bin switch is. So I wrote to Cuisinart to ask for some advice on how I might fix the grinder, and they DID NOT BOTHER TO ACKNOWLEDGE MY EMAIL. I can take it when I get responses saying there is nothing they can do, take it to a repair shop, but I really hate being ignored. I'll be looking at other makes of appliances from now on.

Be sure to pay for the warranty. I purchased 8/16/19 and used two times before motor burned out.
Didn’t even get through a 2 pd bag of beans. Tried cleaning out grinder with air gun to seem it was just jammed up.
Today is 8/24/19. Do not buy this grinder. WARNING!!!!!!
Died after 5 months. Extremely noisy. Get a KitchenAid instead.

This grinder makes whatever amount you want, whatever size grind you want! It works perfectly and makes my mornings happy. It isn’t silent, but it won’t wake anyone upstairs either. Easy to clean, easy to store. I would recommend to anyone.

People keep talking about the static and I found if you just let it sit for a bit after grinding, it isn't that bad. I'm no coffee connoisseur by any stretch of the imagination so it works just fine for our needs.
Previous cuisinart coffee bean grinder lasted for 10 years. Great product...
Outstanding machine! It can actually grind coffee fine enough to use for Turkish coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: After Nearly Year Still Performing Admirably
reviews.reviewText: I bought this grinder around 10 months ago and it stills works satisfactorily. Upkeep is needed to keep it working because there will be coffee dust buildup and transfer of the coffee grounds will be messy. I do take issue with the description of the product stating it can perform an ultra fine grind because it certainly cannot and while that it is clearly obvious to anyone with a bit of knowledge on grinders it might be misleading to the uninitiated. Good for drip coffee and great for french press (due to a noticeable variation in grind) this grinder is a decent upgrade from a blade grinder at a reasonable price. If someone is looking at this grinder for espresso please do not do it, as someone who has tried to do so the result will be hot water quickly streaming through the grinds at the finest grind setting. If you are looking for a cheap grinder for espresso the only option for under $100 or $50 is a manual grinder and while some would argue that the time used grinding espresso manually will result in a sub par shot it will be decidedly better than the results obtained with this grinder. One caveat would be that I only use this grinder 2-3 times a week but during the months I have owned this grinder I have had no mechanical or performance issues and it has worked great for the price I paid.
