Have owned an older and more expensive Cuisinart conical Burr grinder for probably 8 years which was great until it wasn't. Thought I would try a less expensive model but it would not shut off automatically - had to pull the plug. The switch is very flimsy and it was very slow to grind the beans.
Which brings me to the major problem, the NOISE is deafening. Not just the decibels but the pitch. Sounds like a jet airplane taking off. Saw reviews that this was loud but on some youtube videos, it didn't seem to be as screechingly unbearable to the point where I had to block the ears or leave the room when it was grinding beans. See attached screenshot of decibel test.
Because it seemed very slow, maybe the beans were not going through the grinder at the correct rate, which would affect the sound of the motor. Also read many reviews that it breaks after a few months after I decided to return it.
Works great grindes just what you need then stops.
our previous burr mill grinder lasted over 7 years with daily use; wanted the same quality, so we purchased the exact same one again!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Even for a beginner, this product is easy to use and the end product is superb.
reviews.reviewText: Excellent product! Instructions are clear and it's easy to use. Looks attractive on the counter and the coffee is superb. I love the measuring slide so there's no guessing like there was with a scoop. Select, push start, and in seconds your coffee is ready for brewing.
Some grinders don't give you options for different grinds or if they do, you don't notice the difference. This one works really well! I'm extremely happy with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds my coffee nice and fine just like I want it.
reviews.reviewText: Love, love, love my new coffee grinder! It's the best!

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s nice when it actually works
reviews.reviewText: When it’s working, it’s awesome. But it jams CONSTANTLY which is extremely frustrating. For a while I was able to empty out the beans and brush out the compartment that jams. But it’s getting increasingly more frequent and more frustrating. I’ve only had it for a couple months, and I’ve tried multiple kinds of coffee just in case that’s potentially the issue.
Glad to have the convenience of having it on the counter. its easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a very reliable coffee grinder.
reviews.reviewText: The Cuisinart DBM- 8 was purchased Nov.2018 it guit working Nov. 6 2019. It was very noisy.I wouldn t purchase another.It almost lasted a year but not guite. I had a cuisinart before not same model it lasted for at least 4 or5 yrs. That why I purchased this one but this one was a disappointment in comparison.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why would you buy anything else?
reviews.reviewText: We have two of this model. Added the second one so we could have two types of beans ready to grind, avoiding the alternative of changing the beans. Our first one is about 4-years old. They work great

The burr mill functioned well at first. But after a few months began producing variable amounts of coffee grinds even though the setting has always been on the setting "4". This causes us to waste lots of grinds or end of with way too strong of coffee. While the deliciousness of fresh ground coffee beans and the convenience of an automatic coffee grinder is still nice, this product may not be the way to go.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s easy to use and very quiet.
reviews.reviewText: I love it. It’s nice an quiet but not so easy to clean.

If the coffee doesn’t wake you up the noise certainly will. The grinder works well. Easy to use and clean. The only downside I’ve come across so far is how loud it is. It is twice as loud as the grinder it is replacing. That one was 3/4 the size but only made 1/2 the noise.

This seemed like a good idea at the time: good price, reputable brand, and enough good reviews to give one hope. And at first, we were pleased: a pretty nice, pretty fast grinder. But no dice. After just 4 months of light duty (I'd estimate that we ground fewer than 10 pounds of coffee) the motor suddenly ground to a halt. We had a Braun grinder that looked a lot like this one that lasted more than 10 years. I mean, c'mon Cuisinart, don't put your name on a substandard product. Folks, I seriously recommend you skip this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quit working after 6 weeks. Limited warranty, meaning ...
reviews.reviewText: Quit working after 6 weeks. Limited warranty, meaning that I would have to pay to send it back to Cuisinart. It would have cost me $28 to send it back, at that cost I decided it wasn't worth it.
Blends the coffee beans nicely. Just came be a little dusty when you open it up lol. But you cant beat the flavor and taste. We use a Glass French Press. We ditched our Keurig. Super!

I love having a burr grinder and have used a manual one for the last 4 years. Well, I finally lost patience with spending 10 minutes grinding by hand for a pot of coffee. So I gave this a try. I absolutely love it. I could not ask for a better coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: A better burr; a better buy
reviews.reviewText: Before purchasing this coffee grinder, I checked out the reviews and shopped around. It is definitely the best buy out there. Furthermore, it does not create a static electricity problem as one of the reviewers complained. Because the container is so tightly sealed when in place, there is no spray of fine coffee. And I do use it on next to the finest setting for my espresso maker. This grinder replaces another Cuinsiart burr grinder of mine which was noisier, messier, and incapable of grinding fine enough for my current needs.

This is the third Cuisinart coffee grinder we've owned -- and it will be the last. The first held up pretty well. The second suddenly stopped working shortly after the warranty ended. This one quit after 5 days! We have a number of other Cuisinart products which we're pleased with but we recommend avoiding this coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too much coffee dust to actually grind anything other then FINE without sifting out the dust!
reviews.reviewText: It grinds coffee fairly quickly but it generates a LOT of coffee dust and the size isn't consistent enough to actually control the grind of your coffee. Since the whole POINT of a burr grinder is to get an even consistent grind on your coffee so that you can actually taste your coffee I consider this a failure for the most part. I got this on sale for ~$40 and I still think it wasn't really worth it for this much dust. Do your self a favor and spend the extra $20 and get a better burr grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought this model a little over a year ago and it worked fine; the grind was really nice and enhanced the ...
reviews.reviewText:
PROS: Bought this model a little over a year ago and it worked fine; the grind was really nice and enhanced the coffee flavor.
CONS: It is really loud. And then a few days into its 18 month anniversary it simply died. Grinders never die!
Probably won't buy again if the motor is that weak.

We were on our third one, which just died. It did last for a couple of years, longer than the first two. Works well while it works. I got one replaced for free, but it was a huge hassle. Lots of emails back and forth. Easier to just buy a new one. Number 4!

reviews.reviewTitle: DIED AFTER GRINDING ONE POUND OF COFFEE
reviews.reviewText: Ordered this to replace an identical one that died. 10 minutes into grinding, this one quit working. What do you call a coffee grinder that does not grind coffee? An expensive door stop.
Every 2-3 grinds I have to empty the hopper and clean all parts. I guess that's good for the OCD types, but doing it only when the bin is empty seems like a reasonable expectation.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke after a few months use
reviews.reviewText: Worked fine for a few months, but then would not grind for the measured time; then broke further and will not grind unless holding down the bean container (applying pressure). Disappointing considering the name brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Will not order from same seller again
reviews.reviewText: Product received was not new. Prior owner left coffee grounds in product and grinding surfaces was still oily. No cleaning brush provides despite instructions saying to use includes brush.

it is a bit loud but works well.....this is my second one and I liked it well enough i looked for the same product when the old one had the motor die. It does have a less than desirable issue with getting the ground coffee out as it goes everywhere. you can set the grind and that matters to what kind of coffee you like, or your brew method.

reviews.reviewTitle: and the amount with very easy adjustments to the appliance
reviews.reviewText: Very noisy, but makes a consistent grind. A very significant improvement over my old blade grinder. As stated, you are able to control the grind, and the amount with very easy adjustments to the appliance. I have only owned it a couple of weeks, but can see how a real coffee geek could appreciate it. The quality of the device is evident.

reviews.reviewTitle: I purchased it to make ice coffee and it was easy to set the grind and amount
reviews.reviewText: Really loving this! I purchased it to make ice coffee and it was easy to set the grind and amount. Fairly small footprint so it doesn't take up much room. Easy to clean w a damp cloth. I would highly recommend it!!
Got this for my brother in law and he really enjoys it.

Our coffee grinder died yesterday. We can’t recall the exact purchase year but are sure it was more than 10 years ago. It worked wonderfully. I replaced it with the same model or at least the new version of the same model. Thanks Cuisinart for great quality and great burr ground coffee for all these years.

We went from a tiny grinder to this, and I couldn't be happier with this purchase! I am sure there are nicer ones, but for a starter one that i wanted to just try out...I honestly don't feel a need to purchase a more expensive one any time soon!

reviews.reviewTitle: I have had the same negative issues as many who have posted about the fine coffee dust being excessive
reviews.reviewText: This grinder lasted 9 months, before failing. I have had the same negative issues as many who have posted about the fine coffee dust being excessive. But yesterday, it suddenly failed, as the motor began to wind down during a grinding operation, and finally stopped altogether. I cleaned the burr grinders as recommended, but it made no difference. As a result, I can only give it two stars. To me, a failure in 9 months should really only entitle it to one star, but I did get good service out of it up until the failure, so I have given it 2 stars. If the one I bought is indicative of the life span one should expect on a burr grinder, then save your money, and do not buy this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not do all that I expected
reviews.reviewText: A good product for coffee beans but I also wanted the ability to do dried herbs, fruits and flowers in it. Not acceptable for my purposes.

reviews.reviewTitle: who did not like it. He said it did not grind course ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my son, who did not like it. He said it did not grind course enough. I grind coffee for my Keurig with it. I have to use the coarsest setting.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grind your coffee, course or really fine
reviews.reviewText: I received this coffee grinder, but it would not work. I called Amazon and they shipprd one immediately (before I returned the defective one) and it is great, and I use it often This is the best coffee Grindrr I have owned thus far.
Works great but very loud. I returned this one and bought a Krups mill and it works great and is about half as loud.

This shipped from Amazon Dec. 19, 2011 and died April 10 2012...that seems a pretty short operating life for a coffee grinder we used mostly once a day, occasionally twice. Looking at the reviews it seems important to take off the hopper and clean it, and I found some dust in there, but not a huge amount. Called the Cuisinart warranty line at 6 ET and was told the systems are being upgraded and I have to call back tomorrow. Not exactly stellar customer service. Worked fine during its very short life.
It does the job fine. I like that you can push the button and walk away. It advertises how it isn't loud. It is extremely loud. Everything else is nice

Does a fantastic job and is very easy to clean. Fast, clean and easy sums up our experience with this product. Have tried others and they all fell short of our expectations. The plastic parts need a bit of understanding to control when dismantling for serious cleaning but then don't they all, Basically a tough machine well thought out and executed. Does the most consistent grinding on the finer setting having some missed bits on the looser positions.
It is loud, not a fan of that. Of course the coffee gounds can get messy. But it grinds perfectly for my French press.

Love it. Sure it's loud, but it's a grinder so.... The grind levels are perfect for my needs. Biggest grind for French press, and middle for the drip pot. My first one lasted about a year. That's pretty good considering the price.
Have had for about 1 year bow. Use it aprox 3 to 4 times a week. Still working strong grinds grounds perfectly. Blades still work great. Love my coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't waste your $. Buy a better grinder.
reviews.reviewText: First grinder died just before 1 yr. warranty would have expired. Company replaced -- just had to cut off cord and mail to company. Replacement grinder just died, even though I have been very strict about cleaning the grinder every time I buy a new pack of coffee filters.

It worked great for a few months and then intermittently stopped working for seemingly no reason. I clean it on a regular basis but it just won't turn on most of the time. There seems to be no rhyme or reason as to when it works and when it doesn't. If I could tell what was causing it it wouldn't be so bad. Incredibly frustrating when I just want to have my coffee in the morning.
Have to hold back on quality and durability because I haven’t owned it very long, so I can’t honestly say. But to date it’s performed flawlessly.

reviews.reviewTitle: This was recommended to me by a coworker and I'm glad I ...
reviews.reviewText: This was recommended to me by a coworker and I'm glad I listened to her . This is an awesome product. I put whole beans and I no longer use k Cups. Tastes so good and I put all coffee that I ground up in a baggie in the freezer so it stays fresh!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: The only complaint I have is that the finest setting it's not fine at all
reviews.reviewText: It's a decent grinder and even more for the price. The only complaint I have is that the finest setting it's not fine at all, at least for an espresso machine the grind comes out too coarse. Other than that the machine is very convenient and has a great build quality.
I love the grinder and after owning one for years, I’ve recommended it to family and friends. You can’t go wrong with this one.
This product grinds the whole bean coffee really well!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sometimes beans don't drop into the grinding burr
reviews.reviewText: This item worked well the first couple of weeks. I had a previous burr grinder that worked for years. The noise and slight coffee "mess" was to be expected. What was not is that the beans don't drop into the grinder as freely as they did initially. I would look for another brand next time.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Cuisinart coffee grinder certainly beats my old propeller style ...
reviews.reviewText: This Cuisinart coffee grinder certainly beats my old propeller style Braun for efficiency, Unlike the Braun, I don't have to shake this grinder to insure a uniform grind, And, I can make a weeks worth of ground coffee with one hopper full of beans. I hope this Cuisinart lasts as long as my Braun has lasted. In 25 years of use, I had to replace the Braun's blade (propeller) only once and it is still working.

reviews.reviewTitle: Used multiple times per day and still perfect!
reviews.reviewText: The most consistent grinder on the market. Making coffee for me and my coworkers is a beautiful process with this machine. Thank you for making a great product.

This grinder does not do a good job for course grind. For our french press we need the beans to be coarse to prevent the coffee from having sludge at the bottom. Unfortunately sludge is very common in our coffee now because this grinder grinds the beans much too fine even under the most coarse setting. Very disappointed. I understand this is a bargain burr grinder, but it is not cheap. Will be looking for a better grinder.

Love this! Able to control how fine you would like to grind your coffee beans and also measures out the perfect amount of beans to grind depending on how many cups you would like to make. Push the button once and while the beans are grinding you are filling up the coffee maker with water. Just expedites the process to get that perfectly delicious cup of hot coffee to your lips in the morning!

The grinder stopped working in less than 30 days time. Not sure what they did to the quality but certainly something has changed. I previously owned this same grinder for 3 years and used it daily. Bought a new one and really disappointed.
Also, can't return it less than 30 days in. Don't buy!
It is noisy but it is a grinder. Saying that, the product works great. Has 3 options fine, medium, and coarse grind. If you like fresh coffee this grinder will give you just that.
We have used this grinder on a daily basis. High quality build. Grinds coffee well. Excellent product.
Grinds unevenly. Very loud. Hard to get grinds into a filter.

I replaced this with a krups. I have to shake it sometimes as it doesn't always allow all the beans to reach the burr so shake it to allow the beans to loosen. Some can say it's a design issue or simply too oily of beans which is natural. Works fine but I have to say that it has begun to do this too early than previous grinder. Big plus is that it's way cleaner to use than the krups.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not nearly as nice as the other model that I owned from another ...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this grinder after another Burr grinder I owned died. This one is way noisier and does not grind evenly, so some of the coffee is powdered and some of it is properly ground. Not nearly as nice as the other model that I owned from another company.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best part of waking up
reviews.reviewText: This was a great purchase for my husband. He likes his coffee freshly ground each morning. It gets the job done. While it is very loud- still happy with the purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: The fine setting was not fine enough for espresso right away ...
reviews.reviewText: This is the messiest coffee grinder I have ever used. No matter how careful I am I always end up getting coffee grounds all over the counter. The fine setting was not fine enough for espresso right away but after a few uses it seems to grind fine enough. Even the course setting there is always a clump of ultra fine powder that accumulates in the top corner of the grounds container and sticks to the wall. Also, I like to grind a bag or two of coffee at a time so that I can bring them to work and every time I make it to the second bag the grinder gets overheated and shuts off. I usually have to wait 30 minutes before it will start working again. Overall, I am very disappointed with this grinder. I wish I kept the box so that I could return it.

Just ordered replacement for the one that died this morning, after grinding coffee..We grind 6 cups of beans at a time, using 3 different beans for the flavor we like. Not sure where I got the first one, but prime is the best, since I will get it tomorrow.

The immense amount of settings, decent sized hopper, and fast motor make this a wonderful product. My coffee is very fresh and always just fine or coarse enough for me with this product. Very happy with the easy to clean, fast, and simple product this is.

reviews.reviewTitle: This mill suffers two severe flaws: 1) The result ...
reviews.reviewText:
This mill suffers two severe flaws:

1) The result is a non-uniform grain grind. There is a large amount of near-dust sized particles that accumulate in the reservoir. I purchased this mill to get away from the "dust and boulders" that result from traditional grinders, but I get the same results.

2) The hopper chute frequently clogs and the beans do not descend into the mill. I have to tap the entire unit on the counter to get the beans to fall through.

I severely regret this purchase.
Solid. Great grind. Long lasting. Sent my last one with my husband on deployment so we bought a second one!
This is great me and my daughter have these and now my sister has one too.
This grinder is super noisy and loud. I don't recommend this one because of that feature. However, I do like how it looks.

Pros. Great quality machine, great grinding options with nice results, very nice for grinding large amounts at one time. All around nice machine at a decent price.

Cons Very loud, better grind the night before if you don’t want to wake up the house. Kinda messy transferring coffee from the drawer Catcher. The storage container needs to be more air tight to keep stored beans fresh.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have to put it on the finest setting to get a medium fine grind for a ...
reviews.reviewText:
I have to put it on the finest setting to get a medium fine grind for a cone drip. Will not grind for expresso.
Set it for 8 to get coffee for six cups, but we do make strong coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: I wish I had this sooner.
reviews.reviewText: I love this grinder. I set it for extra fine and the amount I want. No thinking, just hit the button and dump it into the coffee maker. Great coffee without to much fuss. I got it on sale too, so that was a big plus for me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fill it, select grind and push the button, easy and perfect every time
reviews.reviewText: A true grinder not a chopper, grind what you need each time no extra left over. A little noisy but aren't they all, a little more messy but it is worth it.
I get more fines than a burr grinder should leave. Also on the low end the difference between 4 cups and 4.5 cups is about double the amount. Not all that for sure.
Does the job- but is extremely loud. Lots of settings

reviews.reviewTitle: The best feature is the many levels of grinding option
reviews.reviewText: I'm so happy I bought this product. Very easy to use and clean.
Worked well after grinding a cup of whole coffee beans then just died. Super disappointed with this one.

Not what I expected if you don’t mind coffee grounds all over this product is for you. Had for one month and it started to freeze up while grinding the beans had to unplug it and dump out the bean out. More of a pain then it’s worth.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a must have item if you enjoy brewing fresh coffee every time
reviews.reviewText:
This is a must have item if you enjoy brewing fresh coffee every time. I started recently using a Keurig and I was trying to find an item like this for me to use with the beans. This works fantastic. I like a strong coffee, so I set mine to 3 buttons left of the center mark. I was using another item
before and was grinding too fine. It was not brewing correctly until now. love it!!!!!

i absolutely love this burr grinder! it is easy to use and works great for my purposes, which is mainly grinding french roast beans for my french press. my big concern is with regard to the price, which is high as i saw the same model yesterday at costco for $29.99!!!! i'm super bummed to have paid wayyyyy too much. i have trusted amazon for low pricing, but in this case i was wrong to have not price shopped. i did look at macys and target, but i didnt even think to check costco. :( bummer. amazon failed me this time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Finally a good grinder for french press, and at a good price.
reviews.reviewText: Went through several grinders that produced grind sizes that were way too small for french press before finding this one which does a good job with the coarse grind setting. No need to pay more (or less) for other grinders which don't produce a proper grind size for french press.

The first one of these Cuisinart mills that I purchased quit working after just a few weeks. I wrote the company and they sent me a new one, after I sent the broken one back. I've had this replacement for about 10 months and now it has quit as well. The mill works great when it is working but for me it didn't last very long before it broke. I have written again to Cuisinart and it has been over a week and I have not gotten a response. I can only assume they are abandoning me with this burr mill that no longer works.

My daughter did her research & asked for one last year. She loved it so much, and I had long ago tired of my messy little cheap coffee grinder, so I treated myself to this Cuisinart. I'll never go back to preground coffee again. From espresso to a regular cup of joe in literally a minute. Fast, simple, grinds exactly the right amount with many settings from fine to coarse. Love it.

I use this occasionally... like once a month. So was surprised to see the screws on the Base come loose. Discovered this when i heard noise using it. It looks like there are 3 screws in the base but 1 is missing and it is very loose.

Looks like i will have to call customer service and find out if there is a solution to this or they recommend something.
The grinder is loud, but what grinder isn’t. It grinds well and easy to use. Happy with purchase and a well made product.

This is just what I needed. I can change the grind easily depending on making brewed coffee, needing a finer grind, or cold brew / french press needing a courser grind. I think it even looks good on the counter.
The price point is great too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beautiful grinder, fits well under counter, but plug your ears, it's loud
reviews.reviewText: So far so good. Super easy, love just pushing the button and I have my coffee. Wonderful, fine grind. I switched from a blade to burr and there REALLY is a difference. Only demoted it one star because it's super loud. Not sure what they can do about that... but it does hurt your ears.

I highly recommend this product. Don't even open the lid to dispense the ground coffee. Just shake it out of the small square hole and you will avoid all of that static electricity mess that happens with burr grinders.

reviews.reviewTitle: The system is not designed to be easily used. Nothing deflects the ground coffee from flying ...
reviews.reviewText: I used the coffee grinder for about two pounds of beans. I trusted the Cuisinart name too much. The system is not designed to be easily used. Nothing deflects the ground coffee from flying to all surfaces of the receiving container and the receiving container is made of static prone plastic. As a result the ground coffee is all over the container and is impossible to remove without making a mess. The first time I used the grinder, I tried to tamp the coffee to the bottom of the container and chipped off a piece of the guide that positions it on the grinder. Which is the reason I haven't returned it.

I guess you can call us coffee snobs, we love waking up with a nice fresh cup of coffee. This grinder is going the job. You can grind a few says worth or just what you want. :) Quality is very good just bought 2 more as gifts!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: It did not work as expected
reviews.reviewText: It didn’t grind coffee enough for expresso coffee
THIS COFFEE GRINDER IS EASY TO USE AND HAS MANY DIFFERENT SETTINGS TO CHOOSE FROM. AN AWESOME HOME COFFEE GRINDER !

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a great job and great price
reviews.reviewText: Does a great job and great price. Other comments were right about this thing being loud. It's louder than other grinders that I've owned but worth it for a correct coarse grind.

Although, the instructions states not to use in grinding of other substances other than coffee or it may dull the blades I bought this to grind mustard seed & other spices, it works excellently & works wonderfully with coffee......just make sure you clean it well.

Works well. The only thing I don't like is that it is very loud, I mean screaming loud, especially in the morning when you're trying to be quiet. But it grinds perfectly. I've used it both for espresso grind and french press grind. Perfect every time.

The Good: I like it very much mostly because of all the different grind settings. I can make the coffee perfect for drip to French Press to espresso.
The Bad: The one thing I don't like is the effect static electricity has on making a mess when I use it. The good news is that the more I wash the bin the more it gets a little scuffed and the less static electricity , making coffee go everywhere.
Good buy which is worth the money.Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill
Completely transformed our coffee making experience. We absolutely love this! It's amazing to pick how many cups of coffee you are able to grind, as well how fine or course the coffee is.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dead after less than six months
reviews.reviewText: Low quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this Cuisinart Automatic Burr grinder
reviews.reviewText: Love this Cuisinart Automatic Burr grinder. Can be a bit messy if you are not careful--due to static electricity making coffee stick to container for ground coffee. Love that I can set number of cups to be ground and the measurement is always perfect.
Love this grinder if you are a coffee fanatic as I am you would appreciate this machine
Great Grinder! great even grind. Looks good on counter. Got a Great price on Amazo!

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't buy Cuisinart Burr Grinder doesn't grind fine
reviews.reviewText:
This is our second burr grinder, the first Capresso Infinity worked great, but died after 2 years of daily use.
Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme does't grind fine enough for our Pump style (La Pavoni) espresso machine. It would be fine for coarser grinds and I like the on off button set up and capture unit...but it is a total loser for anybody requiring very finely ground espresso.
I'm going back to the Capresso Infinity, seems to be the best for the lower price point...tho I think $90 is enough for such an item.
We havre own 2 and booth have not lasted one year

I cannot understand why reviewers never mentioned how LOUD this grinder is. It seems equally loud as the electric leaf blower I use.
Does it grind coffee? Yes.
Should it come with ear plugs? Yes
If you are senstive to LOUD things, avoid this grinder.
Works great. I can control the amount by cup and coarseness of the grind by easily understood settings. It does make some noise but not too loud or unexpected. It is grinding coffee!

reviews.reviewTitle: but when grinding on the coarsest setting there is still a significant amount of fine dust that gets sprayed into the container
reviews.reviewText: I'm not sure if I have a faulty grinder or if this is expected, but when grinding on the coarsest setting there is still a significant amount of fine dust that gets sprayed into the container. This leaves an unwanted grit in the bottom of my coffee and renders my French press not as effective.
Cuisinart has always meant quality, and this grinder doesn’t disappoint

Love the easy pour and store your coffee beans in n the top part!
I fill it up about 2 times a week, we drink quite a bit of coffee around here!
The easy switch at the top gives me the ease of picking how much coffee I grind with out wasting!
It’s a little noisy but what coffee grinder is not!?

reviews.reviewTitle: Good value for an above-average grind
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this coffee grinder because I wanted an even, adjustable grind. Despite some of the negatives (detailed below), I would make this purchase again.

+ Functionality: It contributes to a great pot of coffee.
+ Adjustable: You can control the size and amount of the grind very easily.
+ Aesthetic: It looks good on the counter.

- Finer grinds tend to clump at the edges of the container.
- Static electricity makes it difficult to get all of the grind out.

Overall, I'm quite satisfied with this purchase.

reviews.reviewTitle: The medium grind setting is plenty fine enough for my drip coffee maker
reviews.reviewText: This does an exceptional job of grinding your coffee. You do have to learn what adjustments works well for you. In my case for 10 cups of coffee I select the 8-cup setting. The medium grind setting is plenty fine enough for my drip coffee maker. I've only had it for a month so I can not attest to it's longevity but it seems well built.

After much research, I knew I wanted to get a Burr grinder. I was not disappointed. This is a good sized grinder, with many options for grind size. It is pretty self-contained, so not much of a mess. A few stray grinds when you open the top after grinding, but not a big mess by any means. I have trouble fitting the plastic container where the grinds go going back into it's slot once I take it out, but I am sure that is human error. I get it back in each time after a minute but still haven't figured out why I am having trouble. This is a great quality machine. It is a larger, sturdy machine, so if you are looking for something small and compact, this is not it. I have it sitting out on my counter, and I would consider it a small appliance. I have a newly acquired pour over brewing machine and a french press. I am learning which setting works best for both. Too of the things that make me happy in life are a good wine and great cup of coffee. This gives me one of those pleasures.

reviews.reviewTitle: Proven brand, so far so good.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace the exact same model which I'd owned for over 15 years before it finally gave out, and that was being used daily. Don't think I can complain. WAS a little worried at first as it would run, but finally it started and has been going daily every since. I've had it and been using it for a couple of weeks now. So far so good.

I just realized I purchased this grinder almost 6 yrs ago and its still working as well as the day I received it from amazon. It offers a wide variety of coarseness settings and is reasonably easy to clean. My only negative is that it does take a little bit of counter top space but it is totally worth it for fresh coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: making the coffee taste terrible! I returned the grinder and have just ordered ...
reviews.reviewText: I was given one of these coffee grinders years ago. When it stopped working, I went to my local store and bought a replacement grinder. I have a Bunn coffee maker, in which the water runs through rather quickly. Therefore, I need a very small grind of coffee. In comparison to the Cuisinart, the coffee was ground much too coarsely, making the coffee taste terrible! I returned the grinder and have just ordered another Cuisinart. I can't wait until it arrives!

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not buy, used three times won't work at all any more
reviews.reviewText: I can't believe Amazon would sell this piece of garbage!! I was looking for the box to return and now I will have no choice but to throw it away. I'm very upset. My co-worker made fun of me because she can't believe I spent ALMOST $40 buying this item and it's a piece of crap. BUYER BEWARE!

Grinds great, but the static issue with the grind receptacle is really annoying. I live in Utah so it's very dry and the inside of the plastic container is covered with the fine grinds, and if you try and pour the grinds out they fly everywhere making a mess. Can't help but wish it was glass.

reviews.reviewTitle: When it does it's fine but don't buy it
reviews.reviewText: Wimpy motor that sometimes cannot grind its way through beans. Just a matter of time before it stops working completely. When it does it's fine but don't buy it! Cuisinart is a hassle to deal with too. Don't bother
Noise level higher than expected but the offset it gets the job done

Overall it does its intended work. However, this grinder makes loud noise as other reviewers have mentioned. Also, it produces inconsistent results. Even with course setting, we get different ranges of coffee grounds from fine to course.

reviews.reviewTitle: beans get clogged, motor is now dead
reviews.reviewText: Purchased June 28, 2016. The beans get clogged and don't go down into the grinder. The motor has slowly been failing and is dead as of this week. I'm not sure if it is because of the French roast beans from Starbucks or if we got a bad grinder. The beans do seem rather oily. I was disappointed with this grinder because we are happy with our other Cuisinart products.

I had my previous one for at least 5 years or more. I got this one and it is even quieter than the original. Having beans burr ground versus a chopping blade makes all the difference. No scorching of the beans. Plus it grinds the exact number of cups you are looking to brew. I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to Use & High Quality Grounds
reviews.reviewText: This product is actually really easy to use and produces nicely ground coffee beans.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't work the right way. Don't buy it. Company will not replace.
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I are really disappointed in this grinder. This product does not grind the amount of coffee you set it for. Friends with identical model said it must be a manufacturing defect. A shame because it would be a nice grinder if it worked the right way.

reviews.reviewTitle: Noisier and messier than expected. But gets the job done.
reviews.reviewText: Somewhat messy, some grounds noted to blow out around machine while grinding. Must tap lid prior to opening as coffee sticks to lid.

reviews.reviewTitle: It grinds coffee, wish I had paid more for a better grinder though.
reviews.reviewText: It is loud, the grind consistency isn’t that great, it gets gunked up almost immediately, the cleaning tool doesn’t even reach where it needs to, and the holding container always has a static charge so the grounds stick to it and fly out everywhere when you take the lid off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for the everyday coffee drinker
reviews.reviewText:
Bought it for my dad as a Christmas present. To my knowledge, he uses it every day with his keurig. I've only used it a couple times myself, but it's extremely easy to use; just set the courseness, how much you want, push a button and 10-30 seconds later, you have coffee grounds.

The only problem i could see with it would be keeping the innards clean, and I'm not sure how easy it is to take apart.

Absolutely the best coffee grinder we have used. This machine gets daily use and not only give us a great grind, but infuses the kitchen with a magnificent scent. What could be better than the anticipation of a much needed cuppa Joe when listening to the Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill while the fragrance of fresh coffee beans fills the air? I feel like Pavlov's dog each new day!

nothing comes close to this . best grinder hands down for that price range . add 100 bucks more and still same quality . unless you are super rich this is what you want . I tried every setting . looked at grind under magnifying glass and every setting worked

reviews.reviewTitle: but we are VERY pleased with it
reviews.reviewText: We have only had this for about two months, but we are VERY pleased with it. It's exactly what we wanted, and it made a fun birthday gift for my husband. We have pour over, french press, and percolator coffee pots, and this gets the job done at the right consistency for each of these. And it works like a dream.

reviews.reviewTitle: It was fine while it worked
reviews.reviewText: Plastic is on the flimsy side. I dropped the receiving canister on the floor and it cracked. Scotch tape took care of it but the whole unit only lasted about two years before the motor gave out. It was fine while it worked.

Right out of the carton it would grind only when turned all the way to the fine position. Dead anywhere else. The sliding quantity switch is so flimsy one must assume it would fail very soon also. Great looking machine, but quality of switches is as poor as it gets.

reviews.reviewTitle: The choices in fineness and coarseness of the coffee beans as well as how many cups to grind for is a great feature and seems to
reviews.reviewText: I only just received this grinder today but I already know it was the right purchase! The choices in fineness and coarseness of the coffee beans as well as how many cups to grind for is a great feature and is definitely more advanced than my previous coffee grinder, Mr. Coffee. I've used it once and it ground the beans so well and my coffee actually tasted better, in my opinion! I would recommend this grinder and will be back to leave updates as I use it more and more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very good product and worth the $$ but it broke after 8 months (they are replacing it for me)
reviews.reviewText: This is a very good grinder! It has, i think, 12 options for how fine/course it grinds the coffee and you can tell it how much to grind and it auto shuts off. My only issue is that it just stopped working after 8 months. When I went to replace it, it said it could no longer be returned...Thankfully after going to the Amazon chat service, they decided to still replace it for me and also provide next day shipping for free! Very happy customer
Works Great!! Nothing like smelling fresh ground coffee in the morning, really easy to use , great buy

I love how this grinder has multiple options in fine-to-coarse grinding. It does exactly what I need it to!!! The only downside which is a little nit-picky, is that it's super loud. I typically grind my coffee early in the morning and it'll sound like someone is running a log through a wood chipper hah.
A high quality grinder that I used for years.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a great product for a real coffee lover.
reviews.reviewText: The product claims to grind different sizes, and it does, all the time. I use a French Press, and need a rough type grind for the beans. This does that, but there is no uniformity. Fine and rough come out all the time, and there does not appear much different in the settings. I will keep using it until I can purchase a better unit, but I would not buy it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you don't want coffee grounds all over your kitchen ...
reviews.reviewText: If you don't want coffee grounds all over your kitchen counter every time you use your grinder, don't buy this one (or any other one that contains the grounds in plastic). No matter how hard you try, you will end up with spillage with this system, either off the bottom of the plastic (yes, plastic and prone to static electricity problems) container, or off the top of the container, or off the main body as you try to remove the grounds (clinging hard to the plastic).
This worked fine for abt. 5 months . Noisy, hard to clean . DO NOT WASTE YOUR $$$ . I`m going manual now !

Would not recommend. sounds like it starts grinding then gets clogged up and stops. Indeed it is getting clogged up and must be cleaned every single time. The course grind is no different than any other grind. It all leaves sediment. No way to adjust the grind. It’s extremely loud. I am sending back.
This grinder works so well. I'm very pleased.
Noisy. Bought March, died today! Oct 3...not very long life. Just recently started using daily. 😢
Coffee taste great again. I use the 8 o’clock original... SMELLS AWESOME TOO!!!
This coffee grinder works great!

I have used this grinder 4 times now. There is definiately a learning curve to figure out what grind is best for your taste and your machine. But the machine is performing like a champ so far. I will update this review in a few months to let you know if it continues to perform well or not.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product very reliable and the coffee tastes so much ...
reviews.reviewText: Great product very reliable and the coffee tastes so much better than when you use a blade coffee mill. There's a little trial and error when first using one of these, but you'll soon figure out what works best and have delicious coffee.
This is the second time I’ve bought this product, this time for my parents. It’s a fantastic coffee grinder

This is not a proper coffee Burr. It's very noisy and becomes progressively noisier the more you use it. Also, it doesn't have anything to defuse static electricity, which by design it pruduces so every time you access the ground coffee it makes a mess.
Brilliant, it works quickly and I’m thrilled to bits with it.

From other reviews, it seems I was lucky enough to get one with a good motor, it worked well for a year in a 3 pot a day household. Then the grind rate gradually slowed, regular cleanings helped but by 15 months the burrs were so dull it could not grind a pot's worth on a single run. By 17 months it ceased to grind, practically - less than a scoop per run (medium grind, setting 18). So I switched to a different grinder, a small antique (1930's?) heavily used hand crank conical, and started looking for replacement burrs. Seems half replacement is possible via buying the entire hopper assembly (includes the top burr) for about the cost of an entire refurbished unit (sucks), wasted hours looking for compatible parts from other models, and even other brands but couldn't find a rotor head (the bottom burr ring is riveted onto a plastic rotor, no screws).

A week short of the warranty expiration I contacted customer service via email for replacement. Did ask about parts, burr rings/disks or rotor aren't available but they could replace the unit, only needed to send them a shipping address, seemed great. Then a week later they replied asking for the same information again (despite it being quoted in my previous email below their reply), and with bait that for faster service I could call in instead but that the service rep would not have access to the emails, meaning a new claim and my warranty would be expired, so I stuck with email. This repeated a few times for month, then they declined replacement saying the warranty is expired. That's fraud, its purchase date to claim date, no running out the clock.

That replacement burrs are not available should be warning enough, never ever buy something non-disposable with a high-ware surface that cannot be replaced.

Without the warranty fraud, I would have rated this two stars, it really did work well for a year, good enough for a pot-a-day household to get several years of service. With replacement burr rings/disks available I'd rate it 3 stars as-is, or 4 stars if they lasted at least twice as long. But no, fraud is fraud, they crossed a line.

I strongly urge everyone boycott Cuisinart. (at least for new consumer products)

Better yet, instead of buying some new cheap garbage, find something high quality, used, and with parts available, fix it up, and get years of superior service at a lower price.
This is exactly what we were looking and looks attractive as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: can't beat all the features and the quality construction for the price
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this item on March 17, 2016. Very nice. Grinds well and is simple to use. It is a bit loud but you can't beat all the features and the quality construction for the price.

Update 10/14/2016...Still going strong. I use it almost every day for french press or auto drip.
Well made, looks good, work fine, but it don’t grind fine enough for my espresso machine. Burr aren’t fine enough as well

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds unevenly, especially when making a larger grind - ...
reviews.reviewText: Grinds unevenly, especially when making a larger grind - there is powdery coffee that sticks to the sides of the container. So French press coffee comes out a little bitter and grainy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Died after less than a year and a half!!
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder worked great...while it lasted. I bought it April, 2018 and it died today...September, 2019. Less than 1 1/2 years old?? I expected a Cuisinart product to last longer than that! While I love coffee, I did not use it daily so I totally don’t get it dying so soon.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Cuisinart DBM-8 appears well designed
reviews.reviewText: I hesitate to say too much about a product that I have been using for only 1 month, but I have owned four or five coffee mills in the past and I have a bit of perspective about electric personal coffee mills. First of all, I prefer a burr style mill. The smaller mills with high speed blades grind small amounts only and it's tough to get the fineness of the grind to come out consistently. I have read that the high speed blades heat the beans as they grind them, causing some of the bean's aromatic oils to boil off in the process. The coffee would, therefore, be less flavorful. The burr mills, like the DBM-8, have fixed settings that produce consistent grind fineness at any quantity. If I am hosting a party, I like to grind a lot of coffee ahead of time. The timer and function buttons do not appear prone to sticking or jamming - a problem on some machines I have owned. The hopper holds a convenient amount of beans and they slide into the grinder without stalling thanks to the steep sides. The grinds container holds more than enough. Some grinders I have owned had a nasty habit of vibrating so much during the grind that the grinds hopper would sometimes pop forward, resulting in coffee grounds being spewed from the mechanism to the countertop, etc. The DBM-8 appears to hold the grinds container tightly enough to prevent this. So, it seems to me that this grinder is an evolved machine that doesn't have some of the problems of the less well-designed units. The price was competitive as well. I didn't give the machine five stars because I simply haven't owned it long enough to say that it is problem-free. Maybe it is a 5 star machine after all.... time will tell.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent value in a quality grinder.
reviews.reviewText: As good as the top ratings suggested. Does as excellent job with uniform grinding. My only tiny complaint is that I'd like to grind only 2 scoops at a time but 4 is the smallest. Not a big deal. I'll likely give these as gifts to my coffee-loving friends.
I bought the coffee grinder in April and it lasted only 6 months. The motor burned. Very disappointing...

reviews.reviewTitle: I have used this grinder for 3 month, accepting ...
reviews.reviewText: I have used this grinder for 3 month, accepting the fact that it is inconsistent in the amount and grind size of the beans. I had to manually measure for every pot of coffee. Today it fell apart inside, grinding up some of the screws that hold the burr mechanism together. We live the U.S. and had to have this brought to us, so returning it is not an option

I've had three over time and they just don't hold up over time as long as I think they should. I drink a pot most every day and they typically last only a year of so before either locking up or burning out. Otherwise like the ability to adjust so precisely the the grind I prefer and ease of use and minimal cleanup of the grind-catching chamber.
good grinder , I've had no problem with it .

just fill the hopper select how much to grind and press the one button

choose the coarseness/ fineness of the grinds by rotating the hopper
Takes too long to line up coffee bin to insert properly. Also a bit too much coffee dust spray for me.
Item as described by the seller

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall a decent grinder for the price
reviews.reviewText: This is a great value given its appearance and grind quality. It looks great sitting on the kitchen counter all day and the adjustments allow me go from a pour over (fine grind) to a french press (course grind). I would recommend investing in something different if you will be using it for espresso's however. Also this grinder is a bit noisy in the mornings and some times it get tough to zero in consistent grind weights. Overall I think 90% of people can get away using this grinder but I would like to invest in a quieter more accurate grinder down the road.
Works well, thermal shut down seemed quick but cooled quickly
Good quality and good blade

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for my office use since you need to have ...
reviews.reviewText: Good for my office use since you need to have a fresh coffee without all the expert work and details. This one does the work.
This is the best grinder! I would buy this again and again!

reviews.reviewTitle: Can grind coffee beans from fine to coarse.
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to coarsely grind coffee beans for a cold water coffee toddy. Works well.

Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill

Motor started erratically or failed to start when item was essentially new. Turns out there are two slightly different ways to insert the "catcher" container, and only one satisfies the safety sensor at front bottom of device. Just shove down when you insert the "catcher" container and it should engage the safety sensor properly. Poorly engineered.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not feed from the hopper into the grinder
reviews.reviewText: I have to constantly shake the entire machine to get it to feed the beans into the grinder. The only way to avoid this is to disassemble and clean it after EVERY use. Save your money.
Sadly this grinder worked great the first time I used it. However the second time I went to use it, it would not turn on. Too late to return

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not like to grind the beans if they have been in ...
reviews.reviewText: LOUD! Does not like to grind the beans if they have been in freezer. I will continue to use it, but only when I buy the smaller bags of coffee. Not so sure there is much difference in the grind types - whatever setting I have it on seems to produce the same results.

Bought to replace the first one of these from 2006. Yes its a bit loud but Cuisinart has not changed anything in the design/operation which is why I bought another one. If the first one lasts 10 years it was worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love the product but reliability is suspect
reviews.reviewText:
We've had our Burr Mill grinder for under a year and LOVE it! The grinder itself really brings out the flavors of the beans. The grinder has given us flawless performance with daily use, until this morning. The motor was turning but there was no grinding.

The good news is that when I called Cuisinart directly and gave them the serial number, they were willing to replace the unit for no charge. The replacement did not include shipping so the cost to replace this defective unit was $4. I suspect Cuisinart is aware of defective units which fall into specific serial numbers although not publicly announced. Be wary... you may get a perfect unit or one that needs to be replaced.

This device made a mess every single time I used it. The casing that holds the ground coffee holds static and does not have a pour spout, which makes it a terrible solution for daily coffee preparation. The first one broke in 30 days. The second one broke in 30 days.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like it but don’t love it
reviews.reviewText: I like it a lot but i can’t say i love it. It makes a huge mess, not sure if it’s static electricity or what but coffee grounds end up everywhere. That being said, it’s a nice consistent grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: I've cleaned it as best I can but it's pretty much a sealed unit
reviews.reviewText: Had this less than 6 months and it no longer will automatically grind the coffee for the preselected number of cups. I've cleaned it as best I can but it's pretty much a sealed unit. And it's noisy - sounds like an airplane taking off in your kitchen. Will be going back to the grinder that lasted 10+ years and cost 1/3 the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: It can not make very fine grinding
reviews.reviewText: It stopped working after a few months. It was manufacturing error. Power sensor was not assembled properly.

I've owned the grinder for approximately 2.5 years. I will say that when I first go it, I was happy with how it performed. It provided proper differentiation between coarse and fine grinding of the beans, and was easy to clean and use. However, I noticed about 4 months ago the motor would randomly not work. After thoroughly cleaning the coffee grinder, it would sometimes start to work. Since that time the motor has been inconsistent. Sometimes it works - most of the time it doesn't. Not the best thing to wake up to in the morning. And considering this grinder isn't all that cheap, replacing it with a new one every 2 years seems unreasonable. Ultimately, it was an O.K. grinder at best - and a poorly built one at worst.

Amazing product, always had a blade grinder and decided to upgrade when it finally died after 10yrs. This machine grinds the beans effortlessly and the coffee has a richer flavor. Why did I wait so long???

Very nice coffee grinder!!! Price was very reasonable. We use ours all the time and have never had any issues with it. Definitely recommend the mill blades over a regular blade grinder. You get a very accurate and even grind of the beans.

At first, it seemed to work fine. It wasn't wonderful, but for $45 I didn't expect perfection. There was a good deal of static, but that's to be expected with a plastic bin. Unfortunately, exactly 6 months to the day after buying it, it has died. And while I didn't expect perfection for $45, I did expect it to last longer than half a year. It looks like I'll have to look for something better made (i.e. more expensive) now. I think I'll also look at a local store, because I've passed my 30 day window in which I could have returned it to Amazon. Oh well; live and learn I guess. :(

reviews.reviewTitle: I just found out that my parents had two of the same model go bad. DON'T BUY Cuisinart - because of their bad ...
reviews.reviewText: Used it twice and it quit working. Called Cuisinart and they said they will replace it but they want to charge me $10 to mail a replacement to me and then it will cost me another $10 to mail them back the old one. I just found out that my parents had two of the same model go bad. DON'T BUY Cuisinart - because of their bad service warranty shipping policy $20 for shipping for a $45 product!

reviews.reviewTitle: Dead in less than two months and I'm glad to be rid of it!
reviews.reviewText: Super loud, does not grind coffee evenly, hard to clean and died after less than two months. Need I say more?

I chose this to replace a smaller, messy one that I have been dealing with for years!! The first thing I can say is that I love the fact that it holds so many coffee beans. The second thing I love is that it does not create any mess. It has a removable lid on top if you want to spoon the grinds out as well as it has a small hole in the back if you want to pour the grinds out. It has a adjustable grinder from very fine to course. It also allows you to choose how many cups you want to grind. I would definitely buy this machine again.

Just like any coffee grinder its loud so i make sure to use it in the middle of the day, but it works wonderfully and at a great price! I also like the look of stainless steel, matches my refridgerator!

reviews.reviewTitle: Difference between European and American electricity!
reviews.reviewText: I'm very pleased with the Coffee grinder, but I do, or rather did, have a problem. When I was looking to buy it, I shopped around in the various Amazon stores online and chose the .com. as considering transport etc, the price was the lowest. I was a little silly in that I didn't think about the difference between the European and American electricity and when it arrived I found I needed to buy a transformer which of course cost almost as much as the grinder. Could Amazon when posting to Europe, please advise people like me of the difference? Otherwise, very pleased.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked for exactly 41 days and then died!
reviews.reviewText:
Worked for exactly 41 days and then died. No power... Couldn't return to Amazon because it was past 30 days. I had to pay $4.28 for Cuisinart to ship me a new one. I then had to cut the cord on the old one and mail back to Cuisinart. Very Sad...

Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill

The bottom line: This worked quite well for approximately 2 months. It started to make some funny noises, and this morning it stopped and emitted a mild burning rubber smell. Called Cuisinart customer service and the very helpful person said they would ship me a new one if I pd $10 to have them ship it to me, and then I would have to pay to ship the broken one back. Not sure if having another one of these unreliable machines is worth shelling out another $15 or so....
I almost NEVER write negative reviews...I am a very easy to please person...but this was quite disappointing. For those of you who have had yours for awhile without problem, I am very happy for you. For those of you considering buying this, you might want to look around a little more.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very noisey and leaves coffee dust all over making quite ...
reviews.reviewText: Very noisey and leaves coffee dust all over making quite a mess. Having said that, grinds beans well enough.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beware.. They dont make these like they used to...
reviews.reviewText: Father had one of these for almost 10 years before the motor finally burned up.. so naturally, I bought myself one knowing how reliable his had been for that many years. Havent even had mine a year and a half and it has already burned up.. No, they do not make these like they used to. Very disappointed.
Best thing ever. I have also bought as a gift and everyone loves it especially me

We have owned this Cuisinart grinder for 2 years and just bought one as a gift for my father-in-law. Works really well - but be sure to clean it out every couple of months, since the coffee grinds can clog it up. We thought the motor burned out, but cleaning it out worked like a charm.

I am on day 3 with this grinder and I have discovered a couple of things with it. One, it is noisy and takes longer then my blade grinder to grind beans. Two, the middle setting for the beans creates a very fine powder for coffee that in turns makes very strong coffee that I do not care for. So, I cranked it over to the coarse setting not all the way but half way and my coffee was better this morning but still strong with the exact cup setting. Tommorrow morning I am going to crank it all the way to the coarse setting and see if that takes care of the strength problem. If not, I am going to back off the bean grind by two cups. Good grinder but a lot different then a blade grinder. You will have to fiddle with it to get the right grind for your coffee preference. Good little machine though. Looks good and grinds like a champ.

3 month update. I went back to my blade grinder. I got the grind about right but this thing sucks way to much coffee. I am doing a pound of coffee a week now and previously used a pound for two weeks with the blade grinder. Also, it makes a huge mess. I am going to resell it on Amazon.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Review
