reviews.reviewText: This Grinder is very loud like wake up my neighbors loud, its hard to clean but this its biggest flaw is that no matter what setting its on it powders 1/3rd of the coffee beans. It turns the grounds into s dust which leads to uneven extraction and makes the coffee bitter. Waste of money do not buy.

I'm very disappointed in this product. I was looking for a coffe grinder that would give a more consistent grind than the blade grinders I have tried. My experience with this grinder is that it is no more consistent than a blade grinder. I get everything from powdered coffee to the grind I selected. Not only is the grind consistency very poor, it runs at a very high rpm and is extremely noisy. It is louder than my blade grinders. If you're into a lot of noise and varied grind sizes in your coffee, then this is you're grinder. If you want something that doesn't sound like you're sanding hardwood floors and actually gives a consistent grind then keep looking.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use the most coarse setting and get coarse grounds with a lot of very fine grounds that clog paper filters
reviews.reviewText:
Cons: Claims uniform grounds but is a very inconsistent grind. I use the most coarse setting and get coarse grounds with a lot of very fine grounds that clog paper filters.
Pros: Looks nice enough to leave out and the cup setting is useful.
Summary: If you don't care about the grind type, clogging filters, or gritty coffee, then this is for you. Not recommended for a french press. It's not bad for the price, but it does not do what it claims.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cost to Benefit is Quite Good...
reviews.reviewText: This grinder works well and the granular size is consistent. I grind on the most coarse setting for pour-over coffee making, but I would think the granular size should be somewhat larger. Other than that, it is a great product for the price.

Great value grinder! Works excellent for drip or French press and makes all the difference compared to a blade grinder. The only thing I noticed is that there is always a little deposit of more finely ground beans that catches at the top edge of the container. I always just scoop that out before I put the grind into my French press. But that's just me being picky after years of using a $1,500 grinder. Buy it! You won't regret it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great size, looks nice, but a bit noisy
reviews.reviewText: Excellent! We are daily coffee drinkers. A bit noisy though, but we have used it alot and are completely satisfied. I like the larger capacity. Easy to care for and easy access to all parts. Looks nice on counter.

Do not buy this product. It is bulky, ugly, and doesn't do what it claims. Although there are multiple settings, the grind is either dust or gravel. It is loud enough to wake the whole house, and does not shut-off automatically. Only way to turn it off is to unplug it. Yes, you get what you pay for --but in this case, much, much less.
This is my second one. First one lasted years. This one is very loud though compared to older one.

I had this grinder for 9 months and now the timer function no longer works. To grind I have to hold down the start button. Called customer service and they can't help me without a receipt. When I gave them my model and serial, they claim the unit is 2 yrs old and doesn't fall under their 18 month warranty.

I would have given this 4 stars if it kept working. It was a bit messy but ground the coffee just fine.

Totally dissatisfied customer.

Bought this product based upon Amazon rating as their pick. Big mistake. Coffee dust goes everywhere. Removing container with ground coffee allows for more coffee grinds to scatter. Does not grind enough coffee for 12 cups, although it is on the highest setting. i guess if you want tea for coffee, this might be for you.
You get what you pay for, its a cheap burr grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bough a bag ground fine by Starbucks and it worked great
reviews.reviewText: I bought a La Pavoni Manual Espresso Maker. It's very picky on the quality of the coffee grind. I tried this grinder with no success. Its grinds coffee well for other purposes I'm sure but not of my espresso maker. I bough a bag ground fine by Starbucks and it worked great. Lots of creme developed and the water had to be pressed through the coffee. With the Cusinart ground coffee, set on the finest grind and tamped very hard, there was never any resistance to the water flow through the coffee. So, Im back to square one on buying a grinder.

OK, other reviews have complained that it's noisy and I say "Yes, and ..." I mean, it's a grinder - the process involves making some noise. If you absolutely cannot have any noise before your first cup, maybe there's a Keurig in your future. I've been very satisfied with this unit so far and even happier with the price. The $200 burr grinders may have some advantages but I'd be hard pressed to figure out what they are. The grind produced is very uniform and consistent. I prefer to weigh the coffee to determine the correct amount per brew and I did see variation in the actual weight depending on the beans used. A little trial and error was needed to determine the output weight for each "cup" setting on the mill for different beans. The only minor quibble I have is that replacing the hopper takes a little fiddling to get it into the housing over the bottom guide pin - I could probably fix this with a small file to widen the entrance to the groove at the back of the bottom slot. Not a huge problem and it gives me something to fret about instead of the noise.

Update - March 2018

So, experience is how we learn. I've used this grinder daily since last May. My first impression was very favorable and I opined that I didn't see the need for a $200+ grinder, yada, yada..... Well, I just unboxed my Baratza Virtuoso today and retired the DBM-8. What was the reason, you may ask? I have a couple of gripes that became more apparent. First, the DBM-8 produces a fair amount of dust (i.e. "fines") along with the grind. I brew mostly darker roasts that are oily beans and the fines tend to really clog the chute opening into the hopper - so much so that it needs cleaning every 4-5 uses and the hopper has to be washed every time. The second quibble is that the grinder does not feed small quantities reliably. I prefer not to store beans in the grinder - I weigh the amount I want to brew each time. If I load 40 grams of whole beans and grind, I usually get 38 grams of ground coffee with the other 2 grams either clogging the chute or sitting as unground beans in the feed tube above the burrs.

Neither of these issues renders the DBM-8 unusable but I've changed my rating to 3 stars anyway. Relative to the pricy units it's a bargain and will work well for many users. I think that on an absolute rating scale, that deserves a 3. I'll keep mine around for use as a grain mill.
Works great. This was a replacement to our old one. Best on the market

reviews.reviewTitle: Unacceptable way of handling manufacturer defects...
reviews.reviewText: After 2 months of use, grinding a pound of coffee per week, the motor stopped altogether. Even at half price, 2 months worth of use before it breaks isn't acceptable. And there is no way to talk directly with the retailer once an Amazon order is over its one month return date. I am very unhappy about all of this...

reviews.reviewTitle: sturdy. I use it to make cold coffee
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is very well made, sturdy. I use it to make cold coffee, and have found that a medium grind may best. I use a new paint brush (small) to clean out stray pieces of grind. But I use it totally manually: I measure a heaping half cup of whole beans into the hopper and then grind until it is all gone. I put the ground beans in a mason jar, and then add 2 1/4 cups of water, screw the jar lid on tightly and wait at least 12 hours to drink it. I also add a creamer called Hazel Nut. Up date two days later: If you do not want to wait that long for cold brew, Try this: Just grind and soak your beans with a filter your usual way. But then pour the done brew again through the same filter into a second carafe. It's a bit slower than the standard way of one time through. But you can get strong coffee without a lot of bitterness, IF you chose the best type of grind (usually not fine, but somewhere between medium and coarse.) Addendumb? #2 I finally got a STRONG but MELLOW brew! My final recipe is: 1/2 cup of whole beans, ground almost totally coarse. Heat 2 1/8 cups water to boiling point; wait 30 seconds for it to cool; pour over grounds that are in a filtered cone on top of a carafe; after water is drained through the grounds, pour this coffee over the original grounds again! This may require a 2nd carafe or wide jar. I mix in Hazel Nut Coffee Mix by Safeway, one tbls per cup. Well at least mine is not bitter. I also use a roast called "Sweet Italian" From Santa Cruz Roasting Co. They can mail you beans every month if you pay ahead with a credit card. Ed

reviews.reviewTitle: Really loud, and gets stuck every time.
reviews.reviewText: I regret not spending some more $ and getting a better quality grinder. This works ok, but is really loud, and always gets stuck.
Uses a vacuum pot and the option to set how fine you want the beans is a must.

This is a wonderful compact little machine and we like walking away and letting it grind itself whereas before we had a blade type that we had to hold in the on position. The only negative aspect of the machine is the coffee seems to adhere slightly to the sides of the plastic container and we have to use a little brush to remove it all. Brush is included with the grinder so that isn't a major problem. We really love our grinder.

We wanted to up the ante on our coffee experience once we got a nice espresso machine, so we made the switch from a blade grinder to a burr grinder. This machine works really well. We're very happy with it. It does require regular cleaning, as the grounds get caught up where they come out into the catcher. This part is difficult to clean. But other than that, a great little tool for a nice cup of coffee.
Love it, I enjoy fresh coffee and this does the job.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have had several in the past but none were as easy to use
reviews.reviewText: I am impressed with this grinder. I have had several in the past but none were as easy to use. This will measure out an amount according to the cups you wish to press. It allows for getting quite consistent results. I think the grinder is worth the price.

This is my second one of this model. The first I had a number of years but didn't use it much as it sometimes would not work. I was able to get it to work about a year ago (???) and it did a fine job of grinding. I use the finest grind. And then it pooped out. When I looked at making a purchase via Amazon, it was interesting to see that it did not have a stellar rating. I ordered it anyway. Mistake.

It does not fine grind. The grind is uneven; partially espresso with regular grind chunks. It will not work in a french press and I have to use more beans to get enough flavor out of a drip coffee maker. I'm disappointed and would like to return it, but I don't want to pay the postage.

What happened? Is there a different producer of this machine than before???
Great products
This is the second grinder we've purchased...one for home and one for our cabin. We like it. Would recommend hand washing.
I brew coffee every day so I grind almost daily and it's still holding up. If you need one to travel or want something small then this one is good for just that.
Good product
Use fresh coffee beans every week now. Love this. Well made and works well

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn’t last, maybe just a lemon! New one is doing great!!
reviews.reviewText:
My wife and I have grinded a little over three pounds of coffee and it stopped working! Bought the machine in February didn’t even open it till middle of April and it won’t even turn on now.

Update: they replaced it and working great!!
Best I've ever had and I've bought a bunch!

We cannot grind a half of a cup of coffee beans without this machine plugging up which require us to take the machine outside and clean it out with and Air Spray. This process is repeated 2 times or more to grind 1/2 pound of coffee. A terrible piece of equipment.

I bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift when I was pregnant, so I bought it a little early to avoid any shopping when I was very VERY pregnant. It broke about two weeks after he started using it, which was probably about five or so uses. Since I had bought it two or so months before he actually started using it, I could not return it. Incredibly disappointing, since it looks exactly as pictured and does not take up a HUGE amount of counter space. The price does not reflect the quality!
Good coffee grinder. As noisy as I would expect for a grinder. Love the bean hopper feature
Works great

Thanks to my wife researching on how a really good coffee grinder makes a difference with the quality of the brew, I am a total convert to this amazing coffee grinder! I have noticed right away with the coffee I make from beans on a regular basis (Caribou) tastes so much better. I highly recommend this product...it is awesome.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pleased With Its Performance and the Price
reviews.reviewText: Very nice quality and price. A very efficient grinder. Excellent!

Pros: Great product for the price. Easy to use. Texture of the grinds is as expected for each level. Many grind levels to choose from.
Cons: Inconsistant volume from one time to another even when settings not changed. Wastes coffee.
I LOVE this grinder. Purchased it to replace a (several year old Krups grinder) that the grind size no longer works on.
Worth Every Penny I paid. Absolutely recommend buying this. I looked at a few and finally decided on this one and I am completely satisfied.

It's not as loud as I would have expected, and needs to be cleaned frequently, but works exceptionally well! Very happy with this purchase, and I would recommend to anyone needing a small coffee mill.
I have used this everyday for over a year and it is still going strong. It's a little messy getting the coffee out but not so bad I would buy a different one.
Been using past few months no complaints grinds well enough. Little loud but what do you expect it’s a grinder. Happy with purchase looks good on coffee bar

This is the perfect addition to our kitchen. I love that I can have the freshness of whole bean coffee with just the press of a button. No measuring and manual grininding. Simply set it and press start and it grinds just the amount you need at the consistency that you want!

REALLY well priced for a Cuisinart. It takes a little fidgeting to get it dialed in right, depending on the type of coffee you use and the grind you need, but when you do it's extremely consistent and cool to the touch.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far so good. Able to select the quantity and coarseness off ...
reviews.reviewText: So far so good. Able to select the quantity and coarseness off the coffee so that I always have a fresh cup. My only complaint is that the piece that catches the ground coffee can be difficult to reinstall due to tight fit. Lets hope this lasts a long time.
Works much better than a spice mill, little loud but overall for the money was worth it. Other grinders can be much more expensive
Need to clean it out about every other month or so as coffee grounds can gum it up a bit.

reviews.reviewTitle: 3.5 Stars - Only about a 3 year life span
reviews.reviewText: I've bought 3 of these grinders over the past 6 years or so. The most recent two have lasted less than 3 years and 2.7 years. The first one lasted about 3 years. So, the cost is averaging $16/yr. As much as I'd like these to last longer, I guess they're worth it for that price. They definitely provide a more consistent grain size than the cheaper blade grinders, which is preferable for press pot coffee (coarse).

reviews.reviewTitle: Compacted grounds foul up the works.
reviews.reviewText: Grinder worked well for a while, until the grounds on the interior packed too tight too allow any further grinding. Now its an ongoing issue, no easy way to clear blockage - I spill beans and grounds everywhere. I wish I could get my money back , just going to chuck it..
Works like a charm! So thankful!
I never thought on owning one of these. But now that I do I cannot live without it
Works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: It is really a good product and it was the cheapest at Amazon
reviews.reviewText:
It is a bit loud but not that it would wake anyone
I love how you can have several different ways you can grind the coffee
Very good

I have owned one of these for the last two years and use it every day. I buy my beans fresh each week and I get a decent cup of drip coffee. The motor burned out last week and I started to look around. I wanted to fix some of the cons with this unit.

The number one gripe is how loud it is. It is really .... really .... loud.
The second gripe is the static causes the grounds to cling to the hopper.
Third would be a motor that doesn't burn out so quick.

After researching, it appears I need to spend a lot more than I want for a substantial upgrade. I almost bought another product for $200 and at the last second reflected on this model.

It is loud and the motor seems to burn up quicker than I would like, but for $42 I can get four of these for the price I was going to pay for the upgrade. Since it makes a good cup I finally bought this same unit again.
Course grind setting is way to fine, not made for French press lovers

Mine broke. But it might've been user error. If you use it for very dry spices and coffee like you are supposed to, I bet it works like a charm. The little black thing in the middle got in the way of a lot of stuff I was trying to grind up and I have since learned that a hand grinder just simply works better for some things.
Satisfied

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes the best home ground fresh coffee
reviews.reviewText: Makes the best home ground fresh coffee. Great bang for the buck. It's a burr grinder not a blade which I poo pooed until we tried this grinder.
still testing but nice
Nice little machine!

reviews.reviewTitle: Grind is great but too messy.
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for the office. Grinds just fine, but the well-known issue with some burr grinders of static electricity is just too much. No matter what we do, how much we clean it, or how careful we are, grounds are everywhere. I'm thinking of switching to the bodum that I have at home.

Bought this in May and today is 10/24/2019 and the grinder is dead. Tried everything I can think of and nothing. Worst thing is that we only use it a few times a month (3 max), because we use Keurig most often.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does a good job for its price
reviews.reviewText: I have bought a few of these machines. It does a good job for its price. But it needs constant cleaning to function properly. It is annoying.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, does the job, and price is right.
reviews.reviewText: This is the first grinder I have purchased, so my lack of experience prevents me from comparison with others. But I have found it very easy to use and it grinds the beans the way I prefer. It's a bit messy, but I understand that's true with all grinders. The price is quite reasonable, and all in all, I'm very satisfied. Never had better coffee.

Being avid coffee drinkers, we decided to move from ground-coffee to grinding beans each morning - Whether it's the Cuisinart model we purchased or the nature of a standalone grinder, we are back to ground coffee until we find a better, less messy solution.

Bought this in January. Early June and it’s no longer working. I used it to grind decaf beans which I mix with full caf, so on average of ½ serving per day, ground weekly to get my weekly supply. Also very loud.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loud and can not get a fine grind.
reviews.reviewText: I have been trying to make this thing work for over a year. Sorry I bought it. And it is really loud!
Great Grinder

reviews.reviewTitle: The static created during use is a big issue. ...
reviews.reviewText: The static created during use is a big issue. When transferring ground coffee (or just lifting the lid off the receptacle), the coffee grounds jump out and cling to any and all surfaces. Mess is not worth it.
Love it, works great!

reviews.reviewTitle: it does the job ,but receving plastic container has a gap so ground coffee spills out the sides
reviews.reviewText: amazing gound quality , but ground coffee spills out the sides

reviews.reviewTitle: and it does a wonderful job. When the first one broke
reviews.reviewText: This is the second Cuisinart burr grinder we have purchased over many years of use, and it does a wonderful job. When the first one broke, I wouldn't have bought any other brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Seems more cheaply made them earlier version. Louder
reviews.reviewText: I had an earlier version of this same unit. This one appears to be made much more cheaply. It still has the Cuisinart name on it, but I would have suspected it was a knock-off. It does the job OK, but it is a little louder.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have owned two of these. They last 3 ...
reviews.reviewText: I have owned two of these. They last 3 to 4 years consistently. For the price a shorter life is the trade off. From what I read of many reviews the more expensive grinders last about the same.
Retired one that I had for seven years. Thought about another brand by decided to stay Cuisinart. I made the right choice as it works like a champ.

A great burr grinder for freshly ground coffee beans. I had purchased a different brand that I had to keep pushing the button to make it grind. Irritating. So I purchased this one and it's been a dream... easy to clean, works every time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't create a fine grind for espresso
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to achieve appropriate grinds for espresso and pour over coffee. I am very happy with this coffeemaker. Easy to use. Makes great coffee. Looks very well on counter.

This is a great "grinder" for coffee beans. This type of burr mill is much more effective than the less expensive type that pretty much turns coffee beans into a mass if you aren't careful. The only thing that I don't like about it is that it is noisy. Works great . I have had one in my apartment for years and its still going strong. Wanted one for my home
good construction, cleaning is not easy but instructions are clear on how to go about it, noise level is tolerable.

Not enough time has passed to rate this product on longevity, but it works very well and without the mess of the coffee grinder I had before! Seems sturdy and well-made and the grind is even and easily adjustable to your tastes. Happy with my purchase so far!
Works like a charm! VERY loud, if noise is an issue batch your coffee or grind it the night before. The grind however is perfect.

It's just what my husband wanted! Noise is a little louder than I like it first thing in the morning, but it's honestly what I expected having not ever owned one before. The not sure my husband could live without it, so I may have to buy a backup.

Love it..... My previous coffee grinder would grind some of the beans but just "chunk up" the others. The Cuisinart grinds all the beans the exact same way..... Well designed product.... Highly recommend!
I am very pleased with this grinder. After a few tries I was able to find the exact setting I prefer for the course/fine setting and now it is a snap to use.

Works great. Depending on the coffee beans being ground you have to make sure the discharge area is clear. A wetter bean will clog it up. I’ve found the perfect bean and it grinds up nice. Never gets clogged.
This is an expectedly loud grinder, with decent airtight storage, but it only lasted 2 years, with usage of approximately 4x/ week.
Great product! Highly recommend!!

I bought this to replace my well worn burr mill that was the same model. It lasted many years and ground an extreme amount of coffee beans. Why buy something different when I was very pleased with the performance of this model....right?!!

Really handy adn effective. The only thing is that it makes a lot of noise, however, I cannot compare with other eletric coffee grinders, as I only had manual ones. So, if you are planning to burr some coffee in early morning, be warned.

I expect that with reasonable care this grinder should last a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder; purchase the extended warranty
reviews.reviewText: I do love the grinder and am ordering my third one. However, the first two quit working, one at 18 months, the other at 24 months. So I do recommend getting the extended warranty

It's time to replace our ($45) burr grinder...after a year & a-half. We've been very happy with this Cuisinart grinder since we were not expecting it to last this long. It grinds efficiently, but it's kind of loud. Most grinders are loud though, so expect it. This grinder has a WIDE variety of settings for course/fineness of grounds. We used this for our espresso machine a few times, and had no problems. Grounds were plenty fine to allow for adequate brewing. Most of the time, we used it for our drip coffeemaker. The receptacle is made of plastic though, so static and dust is a bit of a problem, and the more you use the brush to sweep the grounds from the receptacle the worse it gets. However, for the price, this might be the best budget grinder available. We will look for a different grinder this time, that has a stainless steel or glass receptacle, but if the price isn't reasonable...we will purchase this one again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish it allowed for finer tuning of grind time for small amounts
reviews.reviewText: Wish it allowed for finer tuning of grind time for small amounts. For use with an aero press I just count 5-6 seconds and switch off manually. Otherwise great grinder for the money.
Worth every penny

Nothing to do with clogged grinder, I've dealt with that on a previous one we owned, which lasted much longer than this one. Great when it works. Off to Costco to get one there with lifetime guarantee.
Didn't last even a year, sadly and we cleaned it EVERY time we filled the hopper. Onwards to a different brand and model.

I have always preferred a burr mill grinder for coffee, rather than one of those helicopter-like spinning bean slicers that are also called "grinders". The challenge has been finding one that has a wide grind range and enough capacity. This Cuisinart has both. The grind can vary from very fine espresso grind to coarse for campfire coffee. Does an excellent job all around. The only reason I do not give it a 5-star is that it is a bit noisy. But, given that this Cuisinart is giving me a great cup of coffee every morning, I'll endure a bit of noise.

It's a pain in the butt to operate. Fine grinds get everywhere. There's no way to prevent it and it's much too small. I expected more from this manufacturer. I would return it. It I've lost the paperwork & packaging
Great

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth the upgrade from the little spice grinder I was ...
reviews.reviewText: Worth the upgrade from the little spice grinder I was using. Maybe it's personal preference, but the cup markers are a little misleading. I use the 8 cup mark to make six cups of coffee.
Great grinder, the only complain I have is that it is very messy! You get coffee grounds all over the place? The good thing is the grounds are fresh every day you brew them.
The product as in the description .. very good. I was pleased to deal with you

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy a different one, for real.
reviews.reviewText:
Worked okay for about a week, then suddenly stopped working at all. I already threw out the box, too :(
Even when it worked, it made a lot of fine powder in addition to whatever other grind setting it was on.
Works great! A little messy when you do a finer grind but overall great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is not the model that I ordered and paid for!!!!
reviews.reviewText:
It works well, is very noisy. My complaint is that I ordered the DBM-8AMZ and did not get what I ordered. I received the previous older model instead of the one I ordered.

Since I was in need of a grinder, I kept this one instead of sending it back like I should have.

Not happy with your supplier!!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: The rectangular grind collection cup insures that you will spill ...
reviews.reviewText: The rectangular grind collection cup insures that you will spill grinds on your counter top every time you transfer to your French Press. The designers need to actually use the product they design before going to market. If this grinder had a round collection cup, I would rate it 5 stars. Having to clean my counter top off each time I use it is very frustrating.
Not a great quality. It work but the rain on the lower position is not that fine.
works well
The options and ease of use make for a great cup of coffee.

Preset times are not flexible enough because I use this to grind one cup quantities for my Keurig. Grind adjustment works well and the hopper is an effective feed for small quantities of beans. Lots of plastic in the construction but so far, so good (two months of one cup per day volume). Overall - is a pretty decent machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent price for a home unit, keep a dust pan handy though!
reviews.reviewText:
Does what it says. Pretty machine. The problem with the unit is that it has a plastic catch hopper which builds a lot of static electricity (especially here North of the Arctic Circle in Bettles Field, Alaska).

Going forward, I would put out the extra $$ for a larger unit with a glass catch hopper. The static electricity ends up kinda "throwing" grounds out, sticking to the catch hopper, and generally a pain...

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well but a little messy!
reviews.reviewText: I think it grinds the beans very well. Only issue (like other reviews) is that it is a little messy removing the ground coffee, wants to stick to the sides of the container. But works well and is pretty quiet compared to my previous blade grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Only lasted a few months, then motor must’ve burned ...
reviews.reviewText: Only lasted a few months, then motor must’ve burned up ,,,never got a response for returning for warranty ,, went back to cheaper blade grinder
Does a good job grinding the coffee beans, but it is noisy.
During use just stopped grinding
Older models were better miscalculated amounts you need to grin 12 cups to get 6

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome, but on the louder side
reviews.reviewText: This is a 4.5 star product. It grinds the beans well, the hopper is a great feature b/c it holds a lot of beans. Only reduced for the sound. It is extremely loud, I have had several grinders and this is at the top end of the range for noise.
Good product. The different levels of grind is what I really like about it. If you don't use the grounds right away, within a day or two, definitely put them in a sealed container.

I love this grinder. I have used it for nearly a year now. It still works well. The only issue I have is fine grounds sticking to the container and It make some coffee dust I have to wipe up every day.
This is a really great grinder and I can grind so much coffee at once.

We have been buying Cuisinart appliances for more than twenty years and have never had a complaint. This coffee grinder is one of the best and at a much more reasonable price than some of the supposedly more sophisticated machines. It is loud and it can be messy but so what-your kids are loud and messy and you still love them!!
buy it....you'll like it.
I really like it. Super quiet when running. My wife knew I was grinding in the morning with our old one. This one she asks when will I make coffee because she doesn't hear our new one. Great buy

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder for the price, very happy with it.
reviews.reviewText:
Yes, from the reviews I knew ahead of time it was going to be a bit loud. For a great cup of coffee, I'll put up with 10 seconds of grinding noise, which it's probably less noise when compared to espresso machines at my local coffee shop.

The grinder itself does a great job, and we can taste the difference now when we grind our beans just before preparing a pot of coffee.

We love the fact that we can set the amount of beans to grind for the number of cups that we are making, and once we hit the start button, the machine automatically stops once it's reached its goal. It's better than our old blade grinder, no over-grinding or off flavor on our freshly ground coffee. I measured the coffee to check how accurate the grinder is, and it did grind the necessary amount for our morning coffee pot. After the first three uses, I had the right grind setting and I do not measure anymore - it goes straight from the chamber to the coffee pot.

The grinder is built well, the conical holder for the beans is a plus. Unlike other reviewers, we have no complaints about the price or performance so far. Other Burr grinders are more expensive, and to us it is a good buy. It's a coffee grinder after all, and better than our old one, which will now become a spice grinder.

Very disappointed in this product. It worked for 2 weeks then stopped. Tried to reach customer service. Waited on hold for 45 mins with a rep only coming to ask for my information to get a return call in 24 hours.

Works well. After 2 weeks paid its price.
Happy customer!!!
A good quality product at a good price.

Horribly designed bin to capture the grinds. The grinds fly everywhere when trying to empty it out or taking the lid off. That would be my complaint about this. It seems like the static worsens due to the bin being plastic versus glass.
Great grinder...
Returning this. It's terrible. Noisy, uneven and not up to the Cuisinart brand. Buying a Baratza Encore instead since Breville doesn't make one that fits well with our kitchen.

It broke right after warranty. I bought it in May 31 and it broke in August 15.
It is a piece of junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent Grindr, but tends to clog. keep it clear and it's good to go.
reviews.reviewText: Works well for grinding, but tends to clog. It's also noisy, but all in all does what it needs to do for a fair price.

have had this one for less than a year. it is giving up the ghost. the hole where the coffee shoots into the little holding tank constantly gets gummed up and needs to be cleaned. now the coffee won't feed properly into the grinder. it seems a simple device to have so many chalenges. I want to press the button and have it do it's thing. this one requires more maintenance than I would have hoped.
I honestly can’t remember. But I know I can never go without one of these bad boys ever again!

Pretty happy with this coffee grinder. My main reason for purchasing was the adjustable grind feature and it does good. It is a little difficult to return the storage box to position, but for me that might me the odd angle at which the unit is sitting.

reviews.reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY THIS MACHINE IF YOU ARE USING IT FOR ESPRESSO
reviews.reviewText:
DO NOT BUY THIS MACHINE IF YOU ARE USING IT FOR ESPRESSO. the finest grind is not uniform nor is it fine enough to make a good shot of espresso. The ground coffee ranged from dust to very large grains- not the soft uniform texture you need. I could not get a decent espresso shot from 4 or 5 tries. Debating whether to send it back or not.
The machine looks pretty and makes a lot of noise

reviews.reviewTitle: Its a good entry level grinder
reviews.reviewText: Its a good entry level grinder, the one down side is on occasion but not always a whole bean slips through.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very solid product for every day use
reviews.reviewText: This is my second one to buy in 6 years. Used almost every day for my espresso habit. The adjustable grinding is a big plus for me. Only complaint - man is it loud!
Stopped working after about 8 months. Very disappointing. Expected better from a Cuisinart product. I would not recommend this unless you want a product you may have to replace in less than a year.

This thing is a piece of junk. Do NOT waste your money. I have had two of them and I gave one to my brother for Xmas. They work fine for a few weeks then just stop working. Then occasionally it will grind and most of the time not. Very helpful when you want your morning coffee???

reviews.reviewTitle: I purchased this for my daughter as she needed a ...
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this for my daughter as she needed a new coffee grinder & I have used mine for over 5 yrs now with no problems. I did purchase an extended warranty for hers though.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does last more than a year!.
reviews.reviewText: Bought two of these the first one died after a year the second one died after 9 months save your money by something better.

In less than 6 months of not even daily use, it stopped working. The unit this POS replaced was 18 years old and still worked but had broken plastic pieces that I could no longer replace. Very disappointed in this product.
this is our 2nd one. love it. bought another brand, never liked it so got this one again.

High quality but affordable burr coffee mill. Have had several of these , the last one lasted about ten years and I grind dark roast on finest settings. The only complaint is the start button can be faulty and needs to be redesigned as a toggle switch.

reviews.reviewTitle: This does its job well, the only problem is ...
reviews.reviewText: This does its job well, the only problem is that it is messy. The bulky container that it dumps your freshly ground coffee into is impossible to pour and open without getting lots of grounds on the counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great price for a burr coffee mill
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder mills 1/2 pound at a time. You can select variable grinds (coarse - fine). The auto shut-off is a real nice feature that frees-up your time rather than holding down buttons on other grinders untill you think it's done. Once you find the proper size grind that works best with what ever way you brew your coffee, you can do it the same way every time. Consistency, is the one word I would use to describe this affordable product.
A very nice coffee grinder.

I recently ordered this product and was disappointed when I opened the box. I paid for a new machine, but received a dirty used machine. The machine had a great amount of coffee ground build up and took forever to clean. Very disappointed in purchasing this machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: We set it up and she has loved it!
reviews.reviewText: My mom has a hard time figuring out how much coffee to grind for her coffee pot. This takes all the guess work out. We set it up and she has loved it!
The top looks like a miniature Stbx machine. The ONLY criticism is the loudness of the machine when it grinds the coffee beans.
It is much too large for my needs, but mostly the container into which the ground coffee goes is very poorly designed - it is a struggle to open and close it.
Nice
Purchased at the end of May and it dies at the beginning of November. Not even 6 fulls months of use grinding on average a bag of coffee a week. Save your money and buy something else
Really love this one...easy to operate! ^^
Use it everyday and it works great!

Seems like you have to hold pressure on the hopper lid or the batch will short cycle and not make as much coffee as you want. Other than that, it does a very nice job grinding and is consistent in its grind. Easy to use and has a wide range of fine to course settings.

Really like this burr grinder. It is the second one we've owned in about 10 years, we literally wore the other one out! We make coffee everyday twice a day. Liked it so well we hunted down the exact model and bought it again. Why pay more?

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't last long with everyday use
reviews.reviewText: Stopped grinding well within a year in spite of cleaning.
Great

reviews.reviewTitle: Its fast and easy to operate
reviews.reviewText: Very simple to use. Its a little noisy but the ease of operating makes up for that. I'm still getting use to what the numbers mean.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does a fine job grinding
reviews.reviewText: It does a fine job grinding. The only shortcoming I can see is that the time it grinds is based on two cup increments. On some coffee you would like to be able to adjust a little more closely. You can effect some change by grinding finer or coarser since it grinds fewer beans as you adjust it finer.
After one week, it stopped grinding and I discovered I had to clean it so soon. I had it set to medium. I have to clean it after every use. It’s a lot of work and not wort it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Five stars if they came up with a airtight storage for the coffee beans.
reviews.reviewText: Definitely a daily workhorse. My biggest comment is that we're nerds about keeping our coffee fresh so we don't like 'filling the hopper' for convenience, we just put in enough to be ground.
I have enjoyed this grinder. There is an option to choose the number of cups you want to grind but it is not very accurate.

Not happy with this grinder. The beans get stuck and clog up the pathway from the hopper to the burr mill. Thus, the grinder must be disassembled to remove the clog. A daunting task especially first thing in the morning. Will be looking for a basic blade grinder.
Great capacity

reviews.reviewTitle: Loud but functions beautifully. I would give it 5 stars if they ...
reviews.reviewText: Loud but functions beautifully. I would give it 5 stars if they could have designed a cup without a lid. Your counter gets a small coffee dusting every time you take the lid off. Also, about 1% of the grounds are obliterated in to a fine dust that sticks to the top of the cup. Higher-end grinders don't do this.

It works while it works and then one day it stops. This is my second one in four years. It is also my last one...have learned my lesson. Friends tell me, get a Bodum. I am giving it two stars because it did the job for a while.
Love the coffee grinder. Holds a lot of beans and coffee tastes great with beans are freshly ground. Only problem is that it is kind of loud when grinding. But it grinds fast.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stick to people who know coffee
reviews.reviewText: Loud, messy, uneven grinds. Owned a Capresso for several years, decided to buy this because of good reviews and cheaper. Not even close to the Capresso.

Works great. The only drawback is that the grinds adhere to the plastic container. A bit messy dumping them from the container into the filter. Do it over the sink now. Would I purchase again? Yes. For the price, it does an excellent job.
Work nicely

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm not sure where the good reviews are coming from
reviews.reviewText: I'm not sure where the good reviews are coming from, because this grinder is a mess. The screws holding the burrs on will shake themselves out, and often when seating the bin that catches the grinds somehow won't trip the mechanism that allows it to start. It's a poor design that produces an inconsistent grind when it does run. Spend a little more for the Infinity, don't waste your time having to return this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working after a few months and for the price ...
reviews.reviewText: Stopped working after a few months and for the price it should work for a long time. My old krups grinder is still working after 25 years!!!
We like all about it!!!
Great control of grind and easy to clean. Got this too avoid using my Blendtec for coffee. Worth it.

Disappointed. While there are many reviews that show this product didn't work for long, I didn't imagine that the second time we tried to use it - no luck. The motor burned out. Amazon provided a refund. Sadly, I have not had luck with Cuisinart coffee products. The mill worked great the first time, too bad. On the hunt for a more reliable replacement!
This item is just okay. I normally like Cuisinart, but this thing is noisy, messy, and a pain to clean. If you’re looking for a fine grind, this is not the Best Buy. It’s just okay.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good basic coffee grinder at a good price
reviews.reviewText: A little loud, but overall a good grinder with lots of options.
Only problem with this grinder is the finer parts of the grind sticking in the collection bin, maybe should be glass instead of plastic.
I have never owned a burr grinder before so was not sure what to expect. It is a little noisy. I love the auto grind, shuts off when it grinds the amount selected. Very consistant grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Like the grinder just wish it wasn't so loud
reviews.reviewText:
Not a bad grinder as long as you don't mind the sound of a jet engine taking off in your kitchen every morning!
If my husband gets up before everybody else he actually takes it outside to grind coffee so he doesn't wake everyone upstairs.
Great product for the price

Works well and does what it says it does... but... wow... is this thing NOISY. I mean far noisier than friends' grinders of the same type (conical burr). It's actually kind of annoying to use due to it...
Easy to use and clean. Does a wonderful job!

reviews.reviewTitle: Its pretty quite for a grinder considering it would have to ...
reviews.reviewText: Its pretty quite for a grinder considering it would have to make some noise doing its job. Works really well. its very easy to use.
What a mess. I would like a refund. Regret buying it. It makes a huge mess. And stops in between. Please do not waste time.

Excellent purchase for the money. This is a quality, well engineered stone grinder that consistently maintains consistent grinds with tight tolerances. I am very happy with my selection of this product.
bought 5 years ago. goes strong
Very good quality! I'm very happy with this purchase!! Great price!!

A burr grinder is a must for consistently accurately ground coffee that isn't bitter or blah. I make drip coffee most of the time but also wanted to be able to vary the grind for French press or espresso. The easy-to-use dials for amount and grind on this machine are accurate. Machine is only a bit bigger on the counter than a "spice-grinder" type machine but not as overwhelming as a more elaborate burr grinder would be. Probably the only quibble would be the static dust in the cannister that needs to be brushed out frequently. Obviously, the burrs need to be brushed as well.

Excellent quality, easy to use and it grinds coffee just the way you want. You can grind for a full pot or for a few cups in my French press. I've also been able to adjust taste by adjusting how fine or course the grind is. The capture container is easy to use and clean. No more grinds all over the place. Just ordered a second one as a gift.
Extremely loud!!! Also takes a very long time to grind the beans; much longer than my Capresso.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder with only one cheap button.
reviews.reviewText:
Only downside at all is the switch to determine how much coffee you want to grinding feels a bit cheap and doesn't stay in place super well.

Used this grinder every single day for 6 months and no problems at all! Absolutely love it!
I gave this as a gift. It is used daily and well loved.
I would not own any other type of grinder, period!!!!
Started making a high pitch noise and stopped grinding in less then a year of owning and using sporadically.
LITTLE NOISY,BUT WORKS GOOD
works great, only have to clean out the chute once in while if coffee beans are too oily
To grind coffee beans very loud

A great machine for sure. However, it is loud! Wow! Also, the ground beans create a tremendous amount of static cling in the plastic hopper that catches the grounds. Pouring the grounds into your coffee maker, french press or espresso machine is a messy task!!

Otherwise, the product is great; very sturdy. It is compact yet seems more industrial made.
Lasted 3 months.

reviews.reviewTitle: FIRST POST 4 STARS WHEN USED THE FIRST TIME, ...
reviews.reviewText: FIRST POST 4 STARS WHEN USED THE FIRST TIME, THEN IN MY SECON USE THE MOTOR STOP WORKING ....... RIP

Grinds too big! Fine setting grinds like medium, medium setting grinds coffee as big as coarse sea salt. Coarse setting is just a bit bigger than medium. On top of that, fine grounds of coffee are always mixed in whatever setting I set.
Product arrived in a used and dirty condition.

reviews.reviewTitle: If you love your wife and kids consider not using this one ...
reviews.reviewText: For an inexpensive grinder, this model works relatively well. However, the motor makes an obnoxious high-pitched whine that could wake the dead. If you love your wife and kids consider not using this one in the kitchen early on a Sunday morning. Other inexpensive grinders are similarly noisy so keep in mind “you get what you pay for”.

reviews.reviewTitle: There are far better coffee grinders available
reviews.reviewText: We used this grinder for a little over a year and it never performed as advertised. It was constantly getting clogged and not able to grind. It finally died and is unusable, but we are past the return/warranty date now. We should have returned it right away. There are far better coffee grinders available.
Returned item as it kept jamming coffee beans and wouldn't release the grinds.

Not as fast as my old Braun but I can grind more coffee at a time, which is good because we like a strong cup of coffee.It is important to clean out the machine after using as it bogs down with fine coffee dust after a time and quits. Machine started right
up after we performed this easy yet messy task.
Gets the job done but VERY loud and not a consistent grind. It leaves a corner of "espresso" fine grind in a corner.
love it grinds great

This grinder is easy to clean and seems well made. The adjustments work perfectly to grind coffee for espresso or french press. I went to YouTube and watched a video on how to sharpen the grinder burrs. I think this will be on my counter for a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart USED to be a good product brand But not any more I wouldn't buy ...
reviews.reviewText: Cuisinart USED to be a good product brand But not any more I wouldn't buy another product that carries this brand. Bought the DBM-8 Feb. 6/2016 it quit working March 9th returned it Amazon sent a replacement and it quit May 16th 2016 of course it is too late to return now. Don't buy this worthless machine spend your $45.00 on lottery tickets they are a much better buy.

its does the job, some of it comes out finer than the rest of the grind. but OMG is this thing loud. definitely a wake up call in the morning. have to grind coffee the night before. I can hear it grinding down the hall in my apartment building, want to get one that is much quieter.

reviews.reviewTitle: I can’t say enough good about this grinder. We love it
reviews.reviewText: First one I received delivered broken. Second one is great !👍
its good for coffee but its a little but noisy

reviews.reviewTitle: It worked great for 4 months......then it quit
reviews.reviewText: I bought this 4 months ago. Tonight it sounded like it was grinding very slowly and then just stopped working. I'll call Cuisinart in the morning to find out if they will replace it. After reading other reviews, I'm not hopeful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not working well after a week
reviews.reviewText: After reading the earlier reviews, I expected grind inconsistency, but I am using this for drip and most of the reviews said it was good for that. I agree with this and the grind is sufficient for what I need. Unfortunately, after a week, the grinder started making a sound like grinding glass. Along with this, the grind setting does not stay in one place when using it. At this point, I consider the purchase a waste of money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, my only problem is the plastic container that ...
reviews.reviewText: Works great, my only problem is the plastic container that catches the grounds builds up a very high amount of static, making it difficult and messy to get all the coffee grounds out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smoke come from it and now it is useless.
reviews.reviewText: It stop working after 3 weeks. Smoke come from it and now it is useless.
Great for coffe fans
work fine!

You may want to buy ear protectors. This grinder LOUD!
It grinds coffee beans to a very even grind. It's a great Burr grinder but loud!

Not loud. Even grind. Holds beans in hopper.
Perfect in every way.
ALITTLE NOISY, I LOVE THE CHOICE OF DIFFERENT GRIND SIZES AND CUPS GROUNDED, HARDEST THING IS FINDING MY FAVORITE BEAN TO GRIND, VERY GLAD I PURCHASED...
grinds coffee...nuf said ! !
This is my first coffee grinder. It is excellent. It has several grinding choices. I use the coarse grind as I have a French Drip. It is perfect. It is attractive and sits on my kitchen counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little loud, but otherwise it’s great
reviews.reviewText: Hopper stores a lot of beans. Easy to use. Is a little loud but that’s to be expected. Highly recommend.
purchased as a gift, but I have one of my own. multiple selections, not messy like some grinders. Worth the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: NOT good for coarser grinds for French press, cold brew, etc
reviews.reviewText: because this isn't a conical burr grinder, there are a TON of fines when grinding any size, making french press and cold brew overly gritty. Once you're down to the finer sizes it doesn't matter that much, but definitely go for something else if you're daily grind is coarse.
Great product
I have enjoyed brewing fresh ground coffee for my weekend mornings. I have bought a couple of other types and I am looking forward to trying them soon. No complaints with the grinder so far.
excelente

reviews.reviewTitle: She says it tastes much better than pre-ground
reviews.reviewText: I have no complaints about this grinder. I don't drink coffee, but I use it to make coffee for my wife. She says it tastes much better than pre-ground, so I'll have to take her word for it. It's fairly easy to clean and the hopper and catch box are dishwasher safe.

I bought this on 2017 April. It is cheap and not too difficult to use. However, it completely shut down recently. I did some internet search online, and seems like there are some safety glitches. I might need to crack it open and clean up a little bit.
Excellent product.
Works great and the price is right

Do NOT buy this grinder if you are a serious coffee connoisseur. It produces an awful powder that gets stuck to the wall of the grind chamber that, if mixed with your main grinds, produces a terribly unbalanced cup of coffee. You might have thought the price too good to be true, and trust me. It is. And on top of that, it can't grind fine enough for espresso. Again, do NOT buy this.
This was a replacement for the same model that I had for 12 years. If this one lasts 10 years I will again purchase this same unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bigger than the Krups burr grinders so you need a little counter-top space but otherwise it is superior in every way
reviews.reviewText: Truly outstanding grinder for the price. Bigger than the Krups burr grinders so you need a little counter-top space but otherwise it is superior in every way.
Grind isn't consistent
It's VERY loud and a pain to clean out. Burrs are dull and not very pronouced. All of my beans do not get grinded. It leaves a few. I'll spend more and get something different next time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent grinder. The grinding is loud
reviews.reviewText: Excellent grinder. The grinding is loud, so we grind before bed for the next morning. This is our second one. The first one lasted about three years before a plastic part broke causing it to be dysfunctional.
Works great and much easier than the hand grinder we had. Fast, quiet and smooth. So far works great!
Love it!! The machine grinds the amount of grounds that I need for my coffee needs in the morning. I only wish the hopper were larger so I wouldn’t need to fill it as often
Works OKl except it leaves some chunks in the ground coffee...have to use a fork to break them up. It's also quite loud. Otherwise no problems.

Wow this grinder works fantastically. Yes it is noisy but if you grind a bag at a time like me it is worth it, its worth it even if you do a pot or cup at a time. With my old one I had to massage it to keep it grinding. With this one you push the button and let it go. Well worth the money.
This fancy new coffee grinder is great. You can set the desired grind, the desired number of cups and it does it all automatically...just hit the button...it shuts off automatically as well.

It completely stopped working. Have been trying to get support from Amazon regarding refund/replacement. I've since ordered a new grinder, different brand, but am very frustrated at the lack of response from Amazon. Feel like I'm in an infinite loop of non-response.

reviews.reviewTitle: leaves a powdery coating of coffee
reviews.reviewText: I have a Barista which I thought was getting sort of dull - I replaced it with this Cuisinart DBM - I use coarse ground for french press and it leaves a powdery coating of coffee in the container and in the brewed coffee - luckily I saved my Barista - I don't like this appliance at all....
This is a great coffee grinder. It is my second one. I bought this grinder before and it lasted more then 10 years
Excelente
Very loud

It worked great the first ten to twelve times I used it. Then it stopped working completely. Before it stopped working, I tried to contact customer service in regards to registering the product but did not receive an answer.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... had blade grinders in the past and really have enjoyed having the burr grinder
reviews.reviewText: I have had blade grinders in the past and really have enjoyed having the burr grinder. It is very easy to use and is an attractive addition to the countertop. I would recommend this product.

This grinder stopped working in a little over a year's time. When I tried to contact the manufacturer about standing by their product they wanted me to ship the old grinder to them before replacing. I would only suggest purchasing this item if you only intend to use the product for a year.
I purchased this to grind coffee beans and then I place the coffee in a separate container and store it in the refrigerator.

This grinder was very loud. The beans were not stored in an air tight hopper. Overall I was very unhappy with its performance from the beginning. Now 6 months after buying it the motor has died and it no longer works.

Great grinder, but obnoxiously loud. Louder than a blender.

If you make coffee while others are sleeping, you’re probably going to wake them. If you’re in an apartment, you’re neighbors are going to hear it in the morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Died after 7 months. A great consistent grind for a better cup of coffee.
reviews.reviewText:
Update: It quit working after 7 months of very light use (2 grinds per day). UNACCEPTABLE for such an expensive product.

I appreciate the consistent grind which enables a brew that realizes the potential of the coffee beans I buy. It is designed for a different usage pattern than mine. I like to grind a single serving at a time and I keep my coffee beans in a refrigerated, air-tight container until I'm ready to use them. This grinder's design seems to expect you to dump a large quantity of beans in the hopper (and leave them there) and then it will measure out your portion based on your quantity setting. I find that dispensing the ground coffee is a bit more tedious than my old spice grinder, but I guess that is what is required with the more consistent grind. It does make a better cup of coffee for me ... and that's what it's all about.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the third one of these we have had and they all failed!
reviews.reviewText: These are made to fail. They just stop working. The switch would have to be held on until the caps charged enough to turn it on. My husband is an electronics engineer and told me they were made with insufficient capacitors that got worse over time. We won't get onother one of this brand. With how pricey they are they should be made with better components. This item is less than one month out of warranty!

I bought one of these prox 4-5 years ago and it finally quit. Bought another and am overall satisfied. My complaints are that I can't get the exact amt. of ground coffee I want using the timer bar--either too much or too little. I solved that by using a stopwatch (18 seconds) then shutting it off.
My other complaint is that the grounds stick to the plastic container

reviews.reviewTitle: The smell of fresh ground coffee
reviews.reviewText: Works great
I’m so sad that it did not last long. It isn’t the best at a fine grind but it does take away some hassle. Mine lasted 4 months before passing away.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sturdy, still going strong after a year
reviews.reviewText: Great product, durable and easy to clean
Ok

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart DBM-8 Delivers the Perfect Grind Every Time
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder makes it possible to get the perfect grind and the right amount of coffee, while storing the coffee exactly where it belongs. We have been enjoying our decaf more than ever since we bought it.

I purchased this from Amazon on 5/10/15. Used it once a day for the AM brew. It broke today 7/7/16 (no power)! That's 14 months X one use daily for a total of 425 uses.

You decide? That was my last Cuisinart.

reviews.reviewTitle: Even on full coarse setting it produces fine powder that a french press will not catch and ...
reviews.reviewText: Even on full coarse setting it produces fine powder that a french press will not catch and leaves fine heavy sediment in bottom of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: powder grinder even on course setting
reviews.reviewText: product is built well but even on the course grind setting it was producing powder... had to machine down the seat that the grinder sat on to allow more space between the the grinding teeth and produce a coarse grind
So far so good been using this grinder for about a month now and no complaints I usually French press my coffee every morning and this works great
Best device for grinding coffee beans
Works very well but rather loud. I like to use my French press once in a while and this allows fine -to- course grind options, which I love.

Motor started smoking and died after less than 10 uses. I thought Cuisinart was supposed to be quality. I won’t buy any of their merchandise. I normally don’t post, but I felt compelled to let consumers know of their poor quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Prepare to clean after every use
reviews.reviewText:
Grinding options are amazing.
One big flaw is when the beans are fed thru the hopper, ground, and shot out into the grounds storage some grounds get flown around not making it completely into the grounds storage

reviews.reviewTitle: I don't like the fact that it stopped working after working perfectly ...
reviews.reviewText: This was our first burr grinder. I don't like the fact that it stopped working after working perfectly for 16 months. We've had other cuisinart products for years and years. Do I need to buy a new burr grinder every year?

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart not even close to uniform grind unless u want coffee pebbles.
reviews.reviewText: Noisy! Scared the roaches and couldn't grind finely for espresso makers. Shame on you Cuisinart. You have done much better w other stuff.

Using this grinder every day now. We love the ability to leave beans in the hopper and simply grind what we need each day. SOOOOO much better than the clunky, cheap grinders. Went through 2 Delonge grinders in 3 months. For a few dollars more, this was way, way worth it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Really love this grinder was a heat for my housband birthday ...
reviews.reviewText: Really love this grinder was a heat for my housband birthday gift works perfect and the size is great for us

Used it five or six times to grind a whole bag of coffee at a time. It was messy to use, very fickle, and now dead. It now just whines instead of grinds. Very disappointed since I can't even return it no that the "return deadline" has passed.

reviews.reviewTitle: powder to chunks on medium setting but makes acceptable "office" coffee
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this for my office to replace our blade grinder. I wasn't expecting anything great, but was still surprised at the inconsistency of the grind it put out. Now I understand why my more expensive grinder at home weighs so much. You need a lot of heavy metal to keep the burrs in one place. Makes perfectly fine "office" coffee though so no complaints for the price.
Last one lasted over 10 years
This is small and easy to use. My husband loves it. It is loud though

You think you getting an upgraded coffee grinder... but its terrible. Better to stick with something cheap or spend the extra money on something really nice.
- Very inconsistent ground coffee sizes (from powder to chunks) no matter the setting
- Super loud
- very messy and hard to clean
Love this product!!
Works like a charm. I like the various grind settings. Am glad I purchased this one and look forward to using it for years to come.

I've immediately found two things that are very problematic with this burr grinder. Since many other reviewers have noted the same problems, I'll simply list them without getting into too much detail. My Braun blade grinder seems to work fine compared to this contraption.

1. The grinder creates an electrostatic charge so coffee grounds spray all over the counter or stick to the interior of the receptacle when transferring them to the filter.

2. The grinder is incapable of grinding beans fine enough for espresso and too inconsistent for a French press.

This is my second Cuisinart product and found them both lacking in quality. The first, a toaster that became a fire hazard after very little usage because it wouldn't release the bread and it kept on toasting until you manually intervened. I think I'm done with Cuisinart as a brand. They seem to stress style over functionality in their products.
This is our second Cuisinart grinder in 3 yrs. both have quit working. Changing to a different brand.

Worked great for 1 year and then the motor stopped. It has an 18 month warranty. However, Cuisinart requires that I send the unit back to them. I am responsible for shipping charges which will probably be at least half the cost of the unit.
This is my 2nd Cuisinart Burr Mill Grinder. I used my 1st one daily for over 7 years before it finally stopped. Love it so much I had to have another.
Awesome
Read the other reviews, they're right. Loud, inconsistent grind, weird. Too lazy to return it.
I love it!
Love this grinder. Have bought 2 for friends for presents!

Had read good reviews, but have been very disappointed. We were looking for a better grinder particularly for french press, but the "coarse" setting is no coarser than our single setting grinder and it also seems to put out more powder than our other (smaller, cheaper, easier) grinder. If I still had the packaging I'd be returning.

I've only had this grinder a short period and used it a few times. It seems to do a good job but takes some getting used to. The finest grind setting results in a powder consistency which I can't imagine ever using, while the coarsest setting results in an inconsistent texture with chunks amid the grind. It is hard to find a happy "drip" grind. I like the burr grind aspect as opposed to the blade grinder I used before because the coffe is more flavorful. School's still out but you can't beat it for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: tends to clog easily with darker roast
reviews.reviewText: works well, tends to clog easily with darker roast beans

I had to order a replacement because the grinder just stopped working. I had the grinder for 6 months and only grind 4 cups a few times a week and it just stopped working one day. I’ve had the replacement for about 7 months and it just stopped working today! I do not recommend this item.
2nd purchase, the first one lasted a decade. Grind you own beans one batch at a time for awesome, fresh coffee flavor.

The item says it was new but there was leftover coffee grounds inside of it.
Not sure how grounds get in it if it's new!!
We do like how well it works, easy to use, grinds grounds well.
works great I like the automatic grinding feature fill it up last a week

It's quiet. Much better than the Mr. Coffee version. Doesn't wake up the whole house when I'm grinding coffee. Always prefer a burr grinder to the blade version. Apparently more wizened coffee affectionardos do as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: The finest setting is so coarse that it can't be used ...
reviews.reviewText: The finest setting is so coarse that it can't be used for Espresso. I had a Starbucks burr grinder for years, but it finally died so I bought the Cuisinart. Disappointed to say the least.
Great grinder overall. Sometimes the beans won't fall all the way through the hopper and you have to give it a solid rap on the side. Lots of grind options.

Love this coffee grinder. Much easier to keep clean & operate than my previous grinder. Which was an expensive nepresso brand”. It is noisy but “it’s a grinder”! It also holds a lot of coffee. Definitely recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart sent me two because the first didn't work
reviews.reviewText: This product is not made for everyday coffee drinkers. The first one stopped working within a year, and the replacement failed, as well. I cleaned both products, followed directions, even cleaned with rice (as directed)...very frustrating.

I had this product previously with no issues so didn't hesitate to repurchase. However, it stopped working after a few months. It was replaced under warranty but it broke again with the same issue (just stopped grinding).
Have gotten a lot of use out of this.

reviews.reviewTitle: I have been experimenting with the coarseness level and amount of coffee and have yet had it produce as good a cup of coffee as
reviews.reviewText:
I've had it for less than a week and I'm ready to donate it to Goodwill.
I bought this as I have been using a cheap $20 Krups blade grinder for years and thought that a burr grinder would give me more consistent results.
I have been experimenting with the coarseness level and amount of coffee and have yet had it produce as good a cup of coffee as my cheaper and FAR LESS MESSY Krups grinder.
The first thing that I noticed is that the measurement selector is poorly calibrated. I usually brew 5 cups in the morning and would measure out exactly 5 scoops of beans using my Bodum 7gr/.25oz coffee scoop. I have found that I get approximately the same amount of coffee with the Cuisinart set on 8 cups. As far as grind, I started with the finest setting on Medium which produced a weak cup of coffee and now I am down to the forth setting on Fine and it's close, but still not as good a cup as the cheaper and mush simpler and LESS MESSY Krups. Tomorrow I intend to try the third setting on Fine.
Did I mention it's MESSY! This is the reason my new purchase is going to be donated to Goodwill. The plastic collection container produces so much static electricity that the coffee literally flies all over the kitchen counter as soon as you remove it from the grinder. When you remove the top, even more mess and when you attempt to pour it out, it makes a HUGE, ANNOYING MESS!
I made the mistake of trying to pour it directly into the coffee maker which was a disaster! I now put the filter in the sink when I attempt to fill it and at least the flying coffee is primarily contained in the sink. I still need to clean the counter and I haven't even attempted to deal with all the coffee stuck to the grinder.
If you like to spend as much time cleaning up as making a mediocre cup of coffee; this is the grinder for you!

reviews.reviewTitle: Awful grinder!!! Huge mistake buying it.
reviews.reviewText: This is a terrible, messy grinder! I wish I had sent it back! To say I hate it would not be going too far!
Works well but is very noisy. Nice to have extra features to customize your preferred grind. If it lasts half as long as my old grinder (25 years) I will be a satisfied customer.
Very fast and ALL the different levels of courseness is amazing!!!
Love this! Works great and grinds very well. Used several times now with no issues. Would buy again
Great product and service.

reviews.reviewTitle: even when I set it on the finest grind it is still too course to make espresso
reviews.reviewText: I bought this item to grind coffee beans to make espresso. But, even when I set it on the finest grind it is still too course to make espresso. I used my old Cuisinart grinder for years and it slowly became incapable of making a fine grind. I am very disappointed in this grinder.
I grind my beans every morning with this. It's been months and it still good.
It only took a few times of grinding beans to figure out which setting to use

reviews.reviewTitle: The messiness when pouring ground coffee out of chamber.
reviews.reviewText: 1) It is very loud when grinding. 2) Also, very messy when dumping the ground coffee from the collection chamber. 3) Grind is not consistent. Some ground product is very fine and powdery others coarser, all within the same grinding. I would not buy this product again.
Works well- no brainer

The burr grinder is able to make fine grind for espresso/ cappuccino. it’s very easy to clean as well as you don’t need to worry about cleaning any blades.. just the container were ground coffee is collected
Broke first week

This is a quality coffee grinder. There are many different coarseness settings to please just about every coffee drinker, The unit is very easy to disassemble and clean. My only small quibble is that it tends to not get all of the beans ground on the first go through, so a quick second grind run is often required.
Great product; tends to pulverize your beans if your not careful.
Great Burr Grinder. Easy to use, numerous settings to control the grinding. Great value.
Stopped working after 15 months. I don't even use it that much. Maybe just once a day. Then suddenly it just gave out. I haven't gone through the warranty process yet. I'll see how it goes....

reviews.reviewTitle: False: Removeable parts are dishwasher safe
reviews.reviewText: Removeable parts are NOT top rack dishwasher safe!!!! Manufacturers paperwork says it all is, lies!! Sending it back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Creates static, clogs and is now burnt out after 4 months of use.
reviews.reviewText: It seems to be getting clogged inside and I have had to dump all the grounds out to clear it. Now it won't even clear and seems to have burnt itself out. This is only after 4 months of use. When it was working it creates a lot of static then the grounds are all over.

reviews.reviewTitle: LOUD, but it does the job.
reviews.reviewText:
Overall, it does the job. However it is extremely loud and don’t rely on the “cup size” setting to accurately measure the coffee. It is inconsistent as beans sometimes do not fall into grinder.

My solution is to measure the coffee in grams and then pour them into the hopper.

Item quit working during second use. Item was cleaned as instructions advised and afterward ran a fraction of the speed it started. Once I tried using it again the speed dropped off quickly until it stopped
The grinder grinds beans with different settings as advertised, but it is offensively loud and screechy and is the last thing I want to use first thing in the morning or on a relaxing Sunday.
Works well I use it for fine grind for espresso. A lot of static build up when grinding beans but a little drop or two of water in the beans before grinding took care of the static.
Like ut
almost perfect. easy to use grinds beans to my satisfaction. love it.

Grinder started up by itself every few minutes. It kept doing this until the plug was pulled. If the electronics are that faulty, not too sure about its longevity. Trying one more. I hope this one doesn't have a mind of its own.

I had an old style burr grinder that finally died. Reviewed many differant styles and prices before deciding to try the Cuisinart. So far, so good. I use primarily Kona coffee that will occasionally clog the chute. Other than that unit performs as advertised. Grind is consistent, timer is accurate, and there really is very few grind blow out or static cling problems. I would purchase again, good value for the buck.

reviews.reviewTitle: Motor died after less than 2 months
reviews.reviewText: This product was super loud when grinding, and a whiny loud too. Then less than two months into owning it, the motor straight up DIED mid grind. So disappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked great until it died after 9 months of use.
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder worked great, but it died after 9 months of occasional use. It is still under warranty, but it's a pain to replace it, and the costs of shipping don't justify the effort.
Grinds using a timer so the amount of coffee is foolproof for the number of cups desired. There is a manual setting as well.

Excellent coffee grinder. We grind each day so have a separate storage container for the beans as we want the best flavor, so it could be smaller for us, but those are our preferences. We love all things Cuisinart, excellent products all around.
Reliable and consistent grind. Lots of setting to get the right grind for the filter you are using. Bought a second one for my summer home, Cuisinart is the best.

reviews.reviewTitle: It stopped working after trying it for the first time.
reviews.reviewText: Usually like this brand, but not with this product bought the same product on the Mr. Coffee brand and is so much better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does the job. I do seem to have some ...
reviews.reviewText: Does the job. I do seem to have some problems sliding the collection cup up back in once I pull it out. You have to get it just right before you can slide it back in.

Grinds our coffee perfectly every day. The ground coffee catcher suffers from a bit of static, so it can be a little messy, but when it's the first thing in the morning, who's to say it's the fault of the device or the operator ? A good sized hopper, and loads of grind size choices - just press the button and off you go.
Funciona para la casa y para principiantes bien

reviews.reviewTitle: Never worked well from the first day I got it ...
reviews.reviewText:
Never worked well from the first day I got it -- the Start button was really finicky and didn't always work.

Day 37: Machine will not work at all. I tried cleaning everything, taking everything apart, spent time googling for answers, etc. Nothing.
I used the machine maybe 10 times total.

7 days too late for Amazon's return policy.

reviews.reviewTitle: A must have for an expresso maker.
reviews.reviewText: A must have for an expresso maker. Grinds excellent. No complaints.
REALLY LIKE GRINDER. SO FAR. USE COUPLE TIMES A MONTH. WILL SEE HOW IT HOLDS UP OVER TIME.
I have had many grinders, this this one set grind and how many cups, it grinds just that amount, holds 1LB of beans
great, so far so good

reviews.reviewTitle: Good replacement for an old one that had switch issues. Like it a lot.
