reviews.reviewText: Replaces an old one that was having problems with its switches. I like this one very much. It holds more coffee beans and is easy to adjust for amount and grind.
I put off upgrading to a burr grinder for far too long, very important for your coffee.
Excellent, works like a charm. Replaced my 6 yr old one that died. I use it on Fine setting every day for espresso and it works well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Its pretty noisy but works great
reviews.reviewText: Does a really good job and has plenty of settings. Easy to clean, fast delivery.

reviews.reviewTitle: When you like a product, buy it again!
reviews.reviewText: Second purchase of same product. The absolute best grinder for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... and that's all that counts plus it has a great amount setting
reviews.reviewText: Wife loves it and that's all that counts plus it has a great amount setting. Great Buy!
too big compared to my original, preferred Breville.

I like this Grind/Burr Mill so much, I have purchased another for a present. I would never go back to one of the "mini-grinders". Fairly inexpensive for the quality. I use this burr mill for regular grind coffee and also for our cappuccino maker on a daily basis. A larger amount of coffee beans could be ground ahead if desired too.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little loud, but a great grind!
reviews.reviewText: This is exactly what I had hoped for - the ease of use and adjustability of the grind is perfect! It is a little loud, but I love the auto-stop feature, grinding exactly the right amount of coffee without the need to measure. This was an excellent addition to our kitchen!
The grinder is really easy to use and allows me to test out different grinding options!
Really appreciate the settings for the amount of grind to make for the amount of coffee you intend to have.
I've refilled this unit about 6 times (a couple months of use) and it's still going strong. Makes excellent coffee. Very satisfied.
Order this in March used it about 3 times now it doesn’t work. Not satisfied at all. Don’t know if the product was not good or if I received a defected one. So disappointed.
I don't like it.
Love this grinder

reviews.reviewTitle: Does it's job so far, but it's a bit messy
reviews.reviewText: So far it's ok, but it is a little dusty. My counter gets covered in coffee grounds when opening the plastic top if I'm not really careful.. There is some static action going on there.
this coffee bean grinder is great you set how much you want to grind hit the button and it grinds your beans, its easy to fill as well. you also can adjust how coarse you want your grind to be.

reviews.reviewTitle: We are very pleased with this grinder.
reviews.reviewText: We are very pleased with this grinder. We use it at least once daily and it works just as we had hoped. We use it daily and it provides a variety of different grinds consistently.
Didn’t work on arrival. Just dead, will not start. Sent email to cuisinart haven’t heard a response yet. Their phone line customer service was busy. I won’t buy this again.

reviews.reviewTitle: I never expected this coffee grinder to be as good as it is
reviews.reviewText: I never expected this coffee grinder to be as good as it is. Put in your beans, set cups, and press the button. I measured at first. Now i do not have to.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked great for 3 months then grinder stopped working
reviews.reviewText: Worked great for 3 months then grinder stopped working. Called Cuisinart who had no problem with issuing a replacement. Had to pay $4.00 for shipping with a 7-10 day delivery. Just a nuisance for a 90 day old product .
Works perfectly.

Does a great job. Grinds finely. A bit noisy and Cuisinart should probably work on that a little in the next generation.
Would buy again.

reviews.reviewTitle: The grinder was sourced by Sweet Deals and I returned it for a replacement or ...
reviews.reviewText: This grinder failed after 3lbs. of grinding. The grinder was sourced by Sweet Deals and I returned it for a replacement or refund. Sweet Deals ignored me and as a result I was out the money. Amazon tried to help with no result. Avoid any product sourced by Sweet Deals as they do not care about customers.

Love it!!! Easy to use, looks nice on the counter too. I like that you can set how fine & hoe many cups. Exactly what I was looking for. I set it to a Med/fine 8 cups for a 6 cup pot....makes a perfect cup of coffee for us!

Originally bought this grinder from Costco. After about a year, the grinder stopped working. Returned the unit for refund but it was no longer stocked. I bought one in March 2013 from Amazon but it failed in April after the return window expired. The Amazon customer service rep. was very helpful and replaced the unit at no charge. However, the replacement unit failed two days before the 30 day window expired on the replacement unit. The unit is great when it is working. This unit must have a bad motor with only one of four grinders lasting more than 60 days. I keep my box ready for my next failure. When I no longer can get a free replacement, I will buy a more durable unit by another manufacturer.

This grinder did the job. it's a little messy( coffee grounds get all over the place) and it's a little loud but none of that matters because it just stopped working after only having it for 3 months.
Excellent product.

reviews.reviewTitle: total waste of money got a 100% refund from amazon
reviews.reviewText: just got my grinder today, fist time I used, I looked at the beans it ground up and I see all sorts of foreign material mixed in the beans. total waste of money got a 100% refund from amazon......machine is going in the trash. going to get a manual grinder

it's ok, I haven't had any problems with it. It's really loud. The plastic dedicated catch container seems cheesy, easy to break, and always has a static cling effect, coffee grinds stick in there which is not a big deal unless you are OCD like me.
did I mention that its REALLY loud?

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working in less than 2 months.
reviews.reviewText:
Grinder stopped working in under 2 months. I use it to grind 12 oz of coffee at a time, so I’ve used it 4 times. DO NOT RECOMMEND!
I am disappointed because I own many other cuisinart products and love them...
Good product I recommended.
Horrible product. Never really worked like it was supposed to and today it finally just died. We’ve only used this grinder for about a month. Very dissatisfied and will not purchase again
An absolute must with Colombian coffee!
item just as described. fast shipping

We have been using this grinder for about a month now and are delighted with it. Each pot of coffee is consistent (unless we accidentally change a setting) and the coffee is ground just the way we want it. For the price, we couldn't have done any better! We are enjoying the best coffee we have had at home ever!

Yes, the chamber is plastic and static electricity holds some coffee to the wall, but that is easily remedied with a coffee brush. While I haven't tried one yet, there are a lot of products that remove or reduce static and if those extra 5 seconds of cleaning ever get to me, I will try one. However, for the price, I can't find anything that will beat it.

I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... coarse enough grind for my French press AND extra fine for espresso
reviews.reviewText: I purchased and returned a few grinders before finally finding one that actually gave me a coarse enough grind for my French press AND extra fine for espresso. I HIGHLY recommended this fabulous grinder.
Good

reviews.reviewTitle: Even ground results and a good value deal
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this burr grinder for two weeks. I am glad I chose Cuisinart DBM-8. It yields very even results for coarse, medium, and fine settings. I like its finest result and it fits perfectly with my stove top moka pot even though the finest result is still not fine enough for the espresso machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too loud. Also the beans get stuck so it ...
reviews.reviewText: Too loud. Also the beans get stuck so it does not give you the amount correctly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works lovely only if it came in 220volt
reviews.reviewText: One for the office and one for the house. Coworkers constantly asking for one but where I work the power is 220 these come in 110.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product for French press users!
reviews.reviewText: Great product! There course setting is great for a French press.
Works pretty well. The burrs aren't machined so I used a triangle file to sharpen and easily got better grind consistency. Works like a much higher prices unit now!

This is my second burr mill grinder. I used my first one for several years but it clogged when we tried a dark (oily) roasted bean and the motor was ruined. I had never cleaned out the ground coffee out let area before and only discovered the problem after the motor failure. Now I know better plus they sent a small brush with my new machine.
so far so good. I have no complaints except that it doesn't have an off button, you have to slide the quantity slider to off position. Other than that, i continue to be biased towards cuisinart :)

Works okay most of the time. Seems like I take it apart often because the coffee beans become stuck and jam the machine. Grinding seems a bit inconsistent. The noise level of this grinder is outrageous!
What a wonderful improvement over the blade grinder. Never going back.

I love fresh-ground coffee but hated emptying the grounds from the top of the old-style bean grinders. It's great to slip the bottom container out and easily spoon out the grounds. Like a Cuisinart food processor, it can sometimes be a little difficult to line everything back up but I eventually got the hang of it.

reviews.reviewTitle: The worst grinder I've had and am sorry I didn't read ...
reviews.reviewText: It is incredibly loud and often doesn't even grind. I have to shake it, open it up and empty out the beans that are in it, clean it out and start all over. I wanted to return it but the dealer wouldn't accept it back after 30 days. The worst grinder I've had and am sorry I didn't read the reviews more carefully. Yes, it grinds the coffee beans beautifully but it's torture to get them ground.
Love this coffee grinder! I recommend this coffee grinder to anyone looking for one.
This is the second one of the DBM-8 that has failed due to a bad switch. Without any warning. the switch would not activate the grind. Tried everything. Last chance. This is not a good product.
Gives a great adjustable grind. Love the fact that it pre-measures the amount I need ground. The noise level is pretty serious. But if you can tolerate it for about 20 seconds it’s a great product

reviews.reviewTitle: It is a very good utilitarian grinder for the money
reviews.reviewText: This is the second grinder, of this model, which I have owned. It is a very good utilitarian grinder for the money.

This is my second Mill. I burned out the first one because I tried to grind too much coffee at one time and didn't let it cool down sufficiently between grindings. I have learned my lesson and only grind 18 cups at a time. I use a single cup coffee maker. The 18 cup setting on the Mill provides enough grounds for two 14oz. cups for 4 people.

I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall, for the money, a good solution.
reviews.reviewText:
Performs as advertised. Very convenient and easy to use. The pull-out bin is a bit fragile. A corner broke off when I tapped it on the counter.
Overall, for the money, a good solution. The coffee is consistently brewed and easy to make.
Great grinder!! We bought this because we went from using our Keurig all the time to a regular coffee pot. This grinder is perfect for us!
The holding container that the grounds empty into is difficult to realign to instep back into the component after emptying. Noise level is extremely high.
Does a good job but a little difficult to clean and it's LOUD !!
I've only used it twice so far but I love the automatic. It's a sharp looking product and so far has really exceeded expectations. Love the ability to choose grind type.

reviews.reviewTitle: love i't but I wouldn't go to much on the ...
reviews.reviewText: love i't but I wouldn't go to much on the amount it indicates as I'm sure it wouldn't be good coffee
Gets the job done. Loud as hell though.
Excellent grinder - I’ve been using it for a couple months now.
Product works great

reviews.reviewTitle: Completely stopped working after a month or two
reviews.reviewText: Worked great for several weeks, then, it began to freeze up and not turn on somedays, but would then continue to work normally. Recently, it stopped working all together and will not even turn on. Its disappointing that other people have also had this problem and that you have to spend an unreasonable amount of money to get a decent burr grinder.

This worked for about 2.5 months. Now it is dead. I have taken it apart and cleaned it - to no avail.

I'll try to get Cuisinart to replace - but not sure I should bother.

reviews.reviewTitle: Older model sent not the DBM-8AMZ advertised
reviews.reviewText: Disappointed the old model was sent (Cuisinart DBM-8) not the newer Cuisinart DBM-8AMZ shown. I have had 2 of the older models which failed after 2-3 years use. I didn't bother sending it back because I need my morning coffee now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Size is annoying but coffee is better than with the blade grinder ...
reviews.reviewText: Size is annoying but coffee is better than with the blade grinder that lasted well over 15 years. Gets used often.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it. Very little mess and great quality
reviews.reviewText: Love it. Very little mess and great quality. I just wish it had a pulse button, once you choose you setting you have to wait for it to go through the whole grind cycle or switch ii back to off. Still the best grinder I've ever owned and I make a lot of coffee

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a great job of grinding to the right uniform size
reviews.reviewText: Does a great job of grinding to the right uniform size. Typically it has a static cling issue in the ground product container and it's a bit messy but not too annoyingly so
Horrible. Loud and messy. I returned and did what I shoudl have done in the first place - purchased the Capresso brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice upgrade from a blade grinder.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought some coffee in Chiapas, Mexico. I put some beans on my blade grinder, pressed the button for a little while, made some coffee using a french press and voilá... well, not voilá. The coffee tasted so bad. It was burnt. I googled on how to grind coffee beans and find out that the blade grinder is not that good; cheap, but not good.

Then I decided to upgrade my grinder to this model. I put the same beans, I selected the coarse setting and voilá. The smell of this ground coffee was so different from the other one, it was not burnt. The coffee was excellent, I could appreciate all the flavors and body.

I love using the burr mill. I now make great coffee and Im not embarrassed to serve coffee anymore.
Great machine. Whole house loves the scent of the grinding..
Wonderful addition to the kitchen. Ty

There are already 3003 other reviews covering a span in excess of ten years. There is nothing I can say that has not been said many times over. If you want an excellent coffee grinder then buy this one. It is tops. I love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: this one looks to be as good a product
reviews.reviewText: Our old Cusinart Grinder died after five years of heavy use. So far, this one looks to be as good a product. Don't forget to clean out the blade every few weeks, as it gets gummed up by the moisture in the coffee beans.
This didn’t last but a year.

Works well. Had to unplug it at 2 AM as it came to life and started grinding. This has happened twice now, and I've ground maybe 10 lbs of coffee in it so far. Spooky!

EDIT: I fixed the spooky grinding by slightly removing the thing that collects the grounds! Changing from 3 stars to 5.
This is a great entry level burr coffee grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Important to ask about voltage. Got 110v when really needed 240v
reviews.reviewText: Good value. Works great
Very noisy and messy! When remove grounds always leaves a big mess
Works very well. Use it to make my own Nesoresso capsules.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very dissappointed since Cuisinart normally has great products.
reviews.reviewText: We only got to use it twice before it completely broke and wont work. Very dissappointed since Cuisinart normally has great products...
We use this daily and love it!!!
This replaced the same model. and works just as well.
We use this product in our restaurant mostly for grinding black peppercorns. While the grind isn't extremely consistent it still works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: I really wish this was a better grinder
reviews.reviewText:
Actually, the grinder is fine. I love the fact that I can set the number of cups to have the coffee ground for and just walk away. It's awesome.

Unfortunately, that feature quit working before 12 months was up. The grinder itself quit about a year later.

I am now shopping again and I would love to have another one of these, but not until they do something about their quality.
Worked beautifully for 2 months now no longer working

reviews.reviewTitle: Recommend for at home coffee grind
reviews.reviewText: I like this coffee grinder! I was missing out on so many good flavored coffees at specialty shops that only sold whole bean. The flavor of coffee is so much better fresh ground. Recommend!!

The interlock switch under the bean hopper failed after just a few months of light use. (I had the same model for about four years and it performed well until the motor died.) Shipping this back to Cuisinart for warranty repair costs about half of price of a replacement -- it's not worth it.
Way too noisy, excessive options, beans can get stuck too often in funnel from holder to grinder; gave up and got something smaller and simpler
Haven’t had it long enough to give 5 stars but we like it.
Our old one wore out after 7 years of almost daily use. Love this

reviews.reviewTitle: Stopped working on it's third use!
reviews.reviewText: I love to grind fresh coffee every morning. To my great surprise, it wouldn't work, just made an alarming buzz coming from the grind engine that was not turning anymore. I asked for a full return naturally.
Happy

reviews.reviewTitle: Ground to a HALT after 10 months, REPLACEMENT UNIT wouldn't grind FINE NEW OUT OF THE BOX. Let's see what 3rd unit does(n't) do.
reviews.reviewText: Ground to a HALT after just 10 months. Glad I purchased the 3 year Asurion protection for $4.99. Won't be replacing with another Cuisinart
Bought this after borrowing a friends and being impressed with the quality of the grind.

I have had one of these for about 8 years now and there isn't a thing wrong with it BUT wanted a second one to grind flavored coffee without leaving that taste in the regular French beans I grind. Little bit loud but only takes about a minute or two to grind enough for 12 cups. Would happily buy another one if one of mine gave out.
I'm a bean grinder from way back. I bought this for the motor and feed. You can still add beans while its grinding. And it does a great job of that!
Great grinder. We use it for coarse cold brew and fine drip coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s easy to get a perfect grind every time
reviews.reviewText: We had been using a blade type grinder. This is sooo easy to use, just fill the hopper set the grind you want and select the amount to grind. Push the button to start and in 30 seconds its done. Perfect every time.
It's noisy and messy but the grind is good and I'm happy with the resulting cup of coffee

reviews.reviewTitle: It does its job and it does it well.
reviews.reviewText: Works as intended. A little loud if you don't fill the hopper up all the way as the beans will ricochet around the inside. The coffee has almost a static electric charge after it comes out of the grinder so it dusts the walls of the container in a weird way. Other than that, I can't complain, this has let me enjoy great tasting coffee in a new way, for a reasonable price. My morning Melitta has never been better!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's good that the thing comes apart for cleaning
reviews.reviewText: I have gone through two of these in less than 3 years and I am done. For reasons that are not clear, the latest version's automatic grind function collapsed completely and I now have to fiddle with several times the bar that sets the time to put it on some setting where the coffee actually grinds. It's good that the thing comes apart for cleaning. It's very bad that the catchment bin is made of plastic and builds up a coat of oily left over grounds in a heartbeat. I am going to try a Bodum with a glass bin next. It's really too bad that Cuisinart has tarnished its brand by putting products like this on the market.
A little noisy

I read the 'bad' reviews, don't get it. This is awesome for $50. Holds half a pound of beans, sure it's loud, it's a coffee grinder. Some dust or powder will occur, so will stains on your teeth, you deal with that don't you? Drink at least three pots a day here, that's lots of grinding, still going strong. I'll update if it fails.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loud, inconsistant quantity, plastic piece broken
reviews.reviewText: I have had this grinder for about 1 year and it does grind well with consistant size of grounds. However, the quantity is very inconsistant. I found that 8 "cups" seemed to be the correct amount for my 12-cup drip coffee maker for awhile, but now it is inconsistant. Sometimes, I have to grind up to 3 times to get the correct amount of ground coffee. I took the hopper off today to see if it needed cleaning (it did, pretty clogged in the area the coffee pours out of) and noticed that a plastic housing around the burr is cracked, so now I am wondering how long this will last. I like to buy quality items that last. And it is really loud, if someone is in a bedroom with a closed door at the other end of the house, it can wake them up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very loud and very good grinder
reviews.reviewText: Good grinder, EXTREMELY LOUD DONT EVEN THINK ABOUT USING IT EARLY IN THE MORNING IF YOU HAVE NEIGHBORS BEHIND A WALL

reviews.reviewTitle: It meets my needs for grinding beans sufficient for two ...
reviews.reviewText: It meets my needs for grinding beans sufficient for two cups of coffee. Slightly noisy, but the noise lets me know when the grinding is done.

I purchased this coffee grinder thinking that it would be a quality item. It came with an 18 month warranty and when it started giving me trouble, I waited a few weeks looking for my warranty papers/invoice before contacting Cusinart. Well they promptly informed me that my item was out of warranty basing it on the shipped to dealer date. I finally found my warranty paperwork and while it was "near" the end of the warranty, it was still under warranty. I could not find my invoice and finally remembered that I purchased it through Amazon and voila, there was the proof of my purchase date which was within the warranty time. So now they are requesting screen shots of my proof or purchase.

Cusinart quality has slipped and their warranty is not worth the paper it is written on.
BE AWARE: Cusinart continues to delay the process so that they can give me time to go away.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great coffee grinder at a great price
reviews.reviewText:
I can't believe the price I paid for this. We have used it every day for several years now without failure. It is handsome in my kitchen and the cup selector is a nice feature as well. The perfect pot of coffee every time.

I would definitely recommend this product to anyone who is serious about coffee.

It grinds coffee well enough, but it's as loud as a jet engine. This has been an issue wherever I've lived--it wakes up the roomies, neighbors, or just straight-up blows my ears out if the kitchen is small enough.
Wow this is so much better than the burr grinder I had.
Use it daily for both drip and espresso machines. Accurate, repeatable, grinds.
convenient but the static created during grinding sometimes causes fine grinds spill out when you open the canister with the grinds in it.
Works great!

I bought this specifically for espresso and it does a very poor job getting the fine grind. This would be a great machine for just coffee, but I would not recommend it for anyone with an espresso machine.
It’s messy, loud and the coffee storage is far from air tight. Buyers beware
It is perfect. Works great. Arrived on time.
This grinder works great, better than my old one. I find I need less coffee beans to get the great flavor I like. The only down side is that it is quite loud.

This machine worked very well. I have tried different grinds to see if there is really a difference and there is. It is loud but does it's job. I never give anything a 5 star, because nothing is perfect. I will recommend this product.
works great

I bought this grinder precisely to grind espresso beans, and it did not dissapoint. Previous grinders that I have owned were never able to adequately grind espresso beans fine enough, but this grinder showed them all up. I also got it on sale, so I didn't have to spend $90+ on this machine. Additionally, the machine is extremely easy to clean, and it holds a good about of beans (either a half lb or a lb of beans).

reviews.reviewTitle: For people who love freshly-brewed coffee this grinder is just what the doctor ...
reviews.reviewText: For people who love freshly-brewed coffee this grinder is just what the doctor ordered. I use a single- cup process where I start by putting fresh-ground beans into a number 2 filter ,and pouring hot steaming water over it. The fresh grinding of the beans makes a noticeable difference in taste of the brew, and this machine works perfectly.
Bought for Christmas present but seems to work great.
Fantastic grinder and I love all the settings on it.

Well I like it. I ground a full container and put in my air tight container to use about a week. I'm not gonna f
Grind everyday. So far it's so fresh yet after a few months, we shall see
Good adjustment grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Did not even last three months!
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this product in April and the motor already burnt up and stopped working! Very disappointed, I thought cuisinart was a quality product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works much better than a spinny blade grinder.
reviews.reviewText: This is much more consistent than the spinning blade type. Seems to work very well and is not ridiculously expensive.
Easy to use and grinds coffee beans exactly as you want and when you need them
Great for making fresh coffee.

I purchased this about a month ago for the second time. I have been very pleased with the quality and consistancy of the grind. I also find for me, that the number of cups settings are right on. I love the amount of beans that can be kept in the top and find that they stay as fresh as in any other container. I frequently use a half caff blend of premium beans that I mix myself right into the top. This grinder even works great for my expresso beans. My only complaint is that the unit is rather loud while grinding. One caution I should mention.. there is no auto shutoff when the grind container is full. I had a friend that was unfamiliar with grinders attempt to grind a lot of beans in 1 session and didnt empty the cup when full. Although she heard the motor straining, she continued to grind and burnt out the motor.
i have now had 2 of these units. they work reasonably good until they just plain die after 1.5 to 2 years. look for something else.

Grinder worked well for a couple of days. Then the discharge chute plugged up with fine grounds and would no longer work. Had to repeatedly take it apart to clear out the blockage. Only ground a medium grind for drip coffee maker but it generates lots of fine material that plugs up the machine. Very disappointed. Not the quality I expect from a Cuisinart.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a good grinder, but not for serious coffee snobs haha
reviews.reviewText: This is a good grinder, but not for serious coffee snobs haha It just wasn't what we were hoping for. It doesn't grind the bean as smoothly as we thought it would. We will hopefully buy a bigger one that grinds each bean individually.
Love it and would not even think of using a different brand! My first one lasted 6years... before I dropped it, so glad to have found another!

Works great.Makes short work of grinding up half pound

Works great. Grinds a half pound of beans quickly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did it stop while using it.
reviews.reviewText: I got this I was very excited to you it when I was using it the first time it stoped working on me I was very disappointed.
Very messy
Had to set it on the most course setting. The lower settings were almost too fine to where it wasn’t ideal for my French press. Great quality product though.

Burr grinders are so much better than the less expensive, blade style grinders. You have control over how course or fine you want your beans ground. And with the Cuisinart you can select how many cups you want to grind which is a nice feature.

This coffee grinder has now failed me. It did not even last more than a year. Also, it is a very loud grinder. While Cuisinart is known for their quality, this product did not meet certain standards. I recommend going with another grinder
Best home coffee grinder on the market. The only one that gives you the flavor of a professional grinder.
It holds about a half bag of coffee beans. It's a great size for daily use.
This works great at our fire station, it is easy to make just one or two cups easily
Just coffee grinder is one of the best things I ever bought

reviews.reviewTitle: Consistent grind w/ lots of powder.
reviews.reviewText: For the most part the unit creates a very good grind aside from the excess of powder. It is quite loud and takes a fair bit of effort to clean. For the price I can't complain much and is an okay unit.
Grounded 1lb bag of beans and at the end it started to get warm and give off that mechanical smell of running gears without lube. I hope nothing got damaged...

reviews.reviewTitle: A little noisy but so much better than everything else I've tried
reviews.reviewText: Works perfectly. A little noisy but so much better than everything else I've tried.

Pros: Sturdy, large container, coffee ground storage, I do not find it noisy.
Cons: container a little messy
Excelente
Holds about half a pound of beans. So far, very happy
Works great but it’s a little noisy.
Great coffee grinder. I love that you can set it to a specific amount and walk away to get other things prepared for whatever you're doing.
Fast and easy to use.
Product doesn't grind finely enough. Leaves clumps. Disappointed. Will suffer along with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Automatic Grinder doesn't grind enough coffee. I have to ...
reviews.reviewText: Automatic Grinder doesn't grind enough coffee. I have to run it twice to get 12 TBLs even set at 16. Too much static creating a mess.
Not worth the money, only had it a few months and now it only want to grind every bean in the hopper and I only want 4 cups worth! Save your money and by something cheap.

This worked great for the first 2 months. Now the beans continuously get caught in the area below the holding area...just before the grinder. We have to keep shaking or hitting it on the counter to get the beans to drop. We use high quality beans and can see from other reviews here and elsewhere that we are not alone.

reviews.reviewTitle: The amount of grounds produced per cups selected is surprisingly accurate and very easily accessed from the removable canister
reviews.reviewText: Purchased this grinder after returning a totally disappointing Breville grind and brew machine. This compact machine works flawlessly for us. It's grind settings are simple to select and provide accurately sized grounds. The amount of grounds produced per cups selected is surprisingly accurate and very easily accessed from the removable canister. Overall we are extremely pleased with this product and the especially the reasonable cost.
Louder than I expected.

reviews.reviewTitle: love the way they work but after three years the ...
reviews.reviewText: This is the 3td one I've purchased....love the way they work but after three years the "timer" portion stopped working so I purchased a new one.....Having used it every morning for over 3 years, I suppose it was pretty sturdy!

reviews.reviewTitle: Noisy, but the grinds are good for my machines.
reviews.reviewText: Grind coffee for both coarse and fine coffee makers.
works great a little noisy, but it is a grinder

The grinder is very noisy, but works good. What I don't like is, that the transparent parts are made of plastic, not glass. Quality seems to be ok, I used it for almost 2 months. You can choose amounts of coffee powder for 4,6,8,10,12,14,16,18 cups. My experience was that you need double amount, means choose the "4" if you want to make 2 cups.
I would buy this item again.
No me gusto no era lo que esperaba y se recalienta muy rápido

reviews.reviewTitle: Broken twice in less than one year
reviews.reviewText: I have owned this grinder for less than one year and It has needed to be replaced two times. Although the company will replace the grinder the shipping is quite pricey. In the end the shipping for the 2 replacements would exceed or come close to the price of a new grinder.
This is a must have for coffee aficionados and for people who like fresh ground coffee

- unless u want to spend 10 minutes every time u use it cleaning up the mess it makes
and it sounds like a power saw

We use at home. Not the greatest but for the money you can't beat it. It is a little messy but gets the job done. The first one I purchased locked up and failed after about 2 years. However, I liked it enough to repurchase the same product. No problems yet.
Love it. Noisy but can you grind beans quietly? Lol
Replaces my 13 year old Cuisinart that was used daily

reviews.reviewTitle: If you want to grind coffee beans , don’t buy this grinder
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this coffee grinder stoped working after about a month .
Returned to cuisinart complicated process
And recieved another .
Well the second one quit working.
This thing is a great deal. We use it every single morning. My only complaint and it seems to be a common one is that it is EXTREMELY loud. Not a big deal but I was really surprised.
Great price

Love it - grinds exactly the right amount for the cups I choose and the coffee tastes delicious. I don't know about serious coffee lovers who need specific grind sizes etc, but if you just want a good grinder for your coffee - this will do you just fine.
Working perfectly after grinding 50 lbs of beans, a bit noisy but that's the nature of the beast.
I have ordered two of these coffee grinders both of them quit working within 4 months. The start button will decide to work whenever it wants. I would not recommend this for anyone.
Does grind fine enough for the Breville machine.

The Cuisinart coffee grinder was the answer to what we needed. We own and run a consulting firm that puts on workshops in our own faciltiy and has become a bit famous amongst clients for our coffee. We have traditionally purchased coffee at the supermarket and over the years we have spent a lot of money. The Cuisinart is already saving money as we buy beans in bulk. As we were preparing to purchase we did our homework and could find nothing comperable in stores like Macy's or Bed, Bath and Beyond. This was a very good choice, inexpensive, rugged and just what we needed.

I just repurchased a new Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill (CCM-16PC1) after my original identical unit died after 10 years of usage. I was happy to see that I was able to buy the exact same unit including stainless finish. I hope to get another 10 years out this one. I highly recommend the grinder. It is also pretty snazzy looking!
We are very happy with our purchase of this coffee grinder! Works great and looks nice leaving it out on our kitchen counters.

Very flimsy buttons, very slow to grind. I could tell right away that the motor would not last. Used it 3 times and the 3rd time the motor made an awful sound and died. What a waste of $45. Never again.
While the grinder wasn’t very expensive and grinds well. It is loud and looks odd when the squarish bean reservoir is on any setting aside from middle.
Works well

The large bean hopper and cup amount control is not found on most burr mill coffee grinders. This is my second DBM-8. Unfortunately I knocked my previous one off my counter. Although the grinder is very durable in most cases, my repair efforts rendered it unrepairable. In my search for a replacement I previewed many other burr grindeers. I was not able to find any that compare with the Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme. In my opinion burr mill grinders are the only way to go. I also might add that Amazon.com had the best selection and availablity It is great to enjoy the noble bean again.

Bob White, San Antonio, Texas

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome grinder. Gave this as a gift to a ...
reviews.reviewText: Awesome grinder. Gave this as a gift to a friend for Christmas and after his experience I said I’d get one too but already have a grinder. My friend gave me one for Christmas. Sometimes it’s great to give early Christmas presents. 😄

I bought this grinder a little over a year and a half ago, and right as the warranty was expiring it started to fail. It started with a weak grind and eventually burned out completely. I used it about 4 times a week for about 10 seconds each time. That's right, less than a minute per week and it burned out. If this were a $15 cheapy model no big deal, but I bought a model that is not supposed to be junk. Customer service cordially let me know about the 18 month warranty limit and indicated that in any case I would have to ship it, and send $7 dollars as well for them to return it. It was a moot point because I am out of warranty, but I think what is clear is that Cuisinart is making products that are poorly engineered. Very convenient for them!
Had I known about the god awful noise this makes I never would have bought it!
Works very well.
great coffee grinder! can't beat the price! Variable grind settings and automatically grinds the number of cups you want.

Have bought 2 of these in the past 8 months. Grinder works great for about 3 months then the motor burns out. Not eligible for replacement because it lasted more than 90 days. I recommend trying a different brand.

I purchased this coffee grinder for my office's coffee station. Our old grinder was the old spice-gridner looking style and though it lasted about a year, it took a lot of wear and tear. I was out for maternity leave for 3 months and when I returned it was trashed! So it was time for a new grinder, but this time I opted to go for a more industrial style grinder for the heavy wear and tear that we tend to put our grinders through. This machine is awesome! But very very noisy! It sits right by my desk, so it is nearly impossible to have a conversation with someone either in person or on the phone while it is running. My other observation is that the settings for grind and cup size aren't even close to accurate! My first pot of coffee was like tar and others were too weak. So trial and error will be your lot for the first few pots.
I bought this 12/2018. And works great. If you drink coffee everyday with fresh scent of coffee, I recommend it.
Very good

This very easy to use "burr" grinder works "like a charm." The amount of coffee that you grind is determined by you and the coffee has never tasted better. Any coffee drinker should purchase this ASAP as it has many features that a regular grinder does not have.
Excellent grinder. Static can be a problem in winter or any other time when the air is particularly dry.
Great grinder for 3 months. Only used on 3 occasions and motor burned out. Cuisinart products are becoming pieces of junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Motor burned out after 5 months. Unable to return ...
reviews.reviewText: Motor burned out after 5 months. Unable to return on Amazon. Was told to contact Cusinart website. Did that. No return responses after several attempts.
It stopped working after 6 months.
My second, only because the first was dropped Works very well

reviews.reviewTitle: My second grinder, same type but it continues to run shuts off and runs again.
reviews.reviewText: It runs then starts running again.
best one I have found for years after searching for a grinder that will grind my beans like expresso fine. So happy I found this great grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Worth the price & easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: While it was more expensive than many others, it had much better reviews. Have only used it once to grind about 3 lbs of coffee beans but it seems to work well and be easy to adjust.
Very good grinder. I like that you can grind what you need and keeping the beans fresh.

I can't relate to all the fuss and discontent people have had with this burr mill. Granted, I am writing this review soon after my purchase as I have only used it for 2 wks. But in that short time, I must say that I am very pleased with the grind quality, options for various settings, and apparent sturdy and aesthetically pleasing build of the machine. This is a vast step above my prior little krups bean grinder, and I am delighted to now reap the benefits of a consistent, course grind for my daily brew or 2 via french press. I am very happy with my purchase thus far.
Looks great next to my coffee maker. A little on the noisy side but expected since it has to work with tough coffee beans.
works great. best home use grinder i have found after trying several others.
Only 4 month and not working any more
Don't have other machines with which to compare, but it does the job (I think) I need done. Have yet to experiment with a variety of grind coarseness, but OK with Fine.
Grinding coffee

I bought this unit a year ago, and now I stopped working. No, it’s not the thermistor that tripped - I’ve left it unplugged for one day, plugged it in, and does not work.

Usage - daily to make 4 to 8 cups of coffe

If you can afford to spend more, go for a better unit.
Works great. Had one before.

reviews.reviewTitle: Inconsistent grind, creates tons of static-y coffee dust
reviews.reviewText:
I've had the grinder about a week now and these are my first impressions after using it 1-2 daily. Overall seems to be a decent grinder, does very well on finer grinds but more coarse grinds get some fine powder. I've used it for Clever Dripper and Aeropress brewing and really like the results with the Aeropress.

My main complaint is that it creates a ton of staticy dust. I've yet to find a way to keep coffee dust from jumping all over when I use it. Not sure if other grinders create this much, but it seems pretty excessive. It's bad enough that I'm considering an upgrade already as I'm sick of cleaning up the dust every day.

UPDATE: After a few more days of use I couldn't take the dust that this grinder makes and I'm returning it. It creates a lot of static and the dust sticks in the grind bin horribly. I ordered a Baratza Encore and the difference is night and day. The grind is much more consistent and there is no dust! It is a more expensive grinder but the performance is much better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Can't get at some parts to clean coffee grounds
reviews.reviewText: Machine works great, can adjust grinds to the way you want them. Would give five stars, but the bottom grinder holds coffee under it, you can't get to it to clean it out. (Can't put the motor unit in water)

bought this grinder exactly one year ago and it stopped working. I estimated that I averaged 1/2 cup of beans per day, or around 180 cups of beans total before it gave up the ghost. I guess I expected more.

This grinder is very noisy and quite messy. I feel like it gets noisier and Messier the more that I use it.
I would not recommend this product

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t buy if your looking for a quiet grinder!!!
reviews.reviewText: This works well, easy to use but the sound is awful! There is no way I can grind my beans in the am or my whole house would be awake!!
Works great

This Cuisinart grinding mill does an excellent job of grinding coffee. At half the cost of other mills it is quite a good bargain. My wife prefers a very fine grind which it does an outstanding job. I it weren't so noisy it would have gotten a 5. It cleans up easily and stores well and it will handle 1/2 pound of coffee in the hopper.
So glad I purchased this grinder! Works great and not messy at all!

reviews.reviewTitle: We like it very much that is why we gave this ...
reviews.reviewText: We like it very much that is why we gave this one to our daughter and her husband for Christmas. Would highly recommend this product to everyone who like fresh ground coffee. It is very easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is a great grinder. My last Mr

reviews.reviewText: This grinder sounds like an airforce jet landing in my kitchen. I used it twice but threw it out. It's Garbage! The quality is cheap, way too loud, and grinds slow. The capacity is small.

There is so much static electricity after grinding the beans, the grounds fly everywhere when trying to transfer them to the coffee maker. Too much mess to clean up. Now we need to find another grinder, so I would say this one is not worth the frustration or money spent.

I love this grinder! I purchased one for myself after living in two different households using the same one. After more than a decade of being a barista, I have a countertop full of brewing equipment and this grinder caters to it all! Very reliable and very precise!

Disappointing for a Cuisinart product.

a good product, at a reasonable price

I purchased this coffee grinder to give as a gift for a friend last year. I selected this particular grinder because it seemed to have quality reviews and was selling at a great price. My friend, who is a major coffee drinker, loves her grinder.

I recently found myself in need of a new grinder, and automatically thought of this one. I ordered immediately and have not been disappointed. I use it most to fine grind coffee for my espresso machine. I love the fineness of the grind. Selecting the grind is easy, and the course grind I use for the coffee press is excellent. It is quieter than my last grinder, which is a bonus.

Overall, I think this is a great grinder and would have happily spent much more money to get it. I'm just glad I didn't have to spend more!
Pretty quiet.

When I utilized the top container to hold the beans I would get different amounts of grounds even though I never changed the setting. Sometimes the difference was a half a cup or so. Now that I measure the beans before I grind them I have ran into less problems. It seems to defeat the purpose of the storage container up top. No regrets for what I paid for it, even if I have to do a little bit extra myself to get the right amount of coffee...

reviews.reviewTitle: and you are all set to making the perfect pot of coffee

used it for a very short while. two people and an espresso machine. this grinder simply quit running. cleaned it and cleaned it again. it be dead. waaaaaaaa!!

Love it. Its perfect for when we want to use our french press with some freshly ground beans. We dont use everyday (we buy preground coffee for that) and do 4-8 scoops of grounds at a time.
I never leave reviews but I felt I should on this one. The motor stopped working just shy of 3 months. I have used the grinder once per day since the end of September. What a waste of money.

I use it to grind for cold brew, espresso & drip.

Purchased this and have now had it a week, I love that holds 1/2 lb of beans, don't care for how loud it is. Also the fine setting is not that fine of a grind.
Happy overall

Honestly I wanted a super cheap coffee mill. I thought I was going to get a super cheap coffee mill. It works great! Better than I thought it would. All the pieces are equal sizes and the adjustment is great. For what the price is this is great! I would recommend this one for sure.

reviews.reviewTitle: You can’t beat it, so grind it....
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is definitely a product to purchase, easy to use and is made of quality materials for the price...

This is the second one I have owned. I bought this to replace one I bought from Khols 5 years ago.It works as it is supposed to. I had no problems with the first one, but after 5 years, it stopped working. This grinder works fine, I do not understand the negative reviews. Static and ground coffee clings to it?, well it is plastic, after a few uses and washings the static is gone, the noise? well lets be real, you have a small machine that is spinning at high RPM's to brake down a bean, build up of coffee inside the machine? I took my 5 year old one apart and found no coffee grounds inside. I use a drip coffee maker, and it grinds the beans as well as the can of coffee you buy in the store. Those that need finer ground for espresso, buy one made for that purpose. All in all it is a 40.00 grinder that works well. With proper care and cleaning after each use, I feel it will last as long as my first one. I think people expect to much out of most products. With proper care it will last for a long time, but my guess is that most folks do not take the time to really care for the items they buy, from a car to something small as this grinder. Maybe I'm just very meticulous, but I am that way with the things I own. I've gotten 351k miles out of 1 Honda Goldwing, and 250k out of another Goldwing, sold then still running, that was only 2 out of 10 motorcycles, never junked one. Some things are made cheap and that would reflect in MANY negative reviews.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinder for coffee does a good job.
reviews.reviewText: Noisy operation but otherwise does a good grinding job. Coffee is ground to your specification and is just fine.

the catch can needs some improvement... gets pretty messy.

reviews.reviewTitle: For the price, expected better reliabilty
reviews.reviewText:
This product became unreliable after only a year of use. It got to the point where it would only grind if the slide switch on top was 'wiggled', and after a few more months it now will not work at all.

I spent significantly more on this brand expecting quality, I am very disappointed.
No more grinding in the store or slightly rancid coffee. This is great. The grinding is consistent and the ability to pre set the amount of coffee to grind it wonderful.

Some of the negative reviews made me worry, but the performance/price of this unit is good. It is no louder than the rotary coffee grinder it replaced, and the uniform grains improve the coffee noticeably. The brush included with the mill is essential for getting the powdery flakes out of the grounds collector.

The noise it made when I ran some frozen beans through it (forgot to fill the supply bin at the top) hints that the catastrophic failures reported in some low ratings might be due to frozen beans. I do not intend to make that mistake again!
I love it
Works great, love that you can store beans in it
Stop reading and get it ,absolutely love it

reviews.reviewTitle: it's a great product. This is our second one
reviews.reviewText: What can I say, it's a great product. This is our second one. We think the first was around 10 yrs old and still working and we gave it to my wife's dad because his grinder died. Now we use the new one and dad uses the old and they're both working well

reviews.reviewTitle: I don't love it. But it's okay.
reviews.reviewText:
I'm keeping this coffee grinder, even though I'm not 100% sold on it. I had a little hand-held coffee grinder from the 90s that finally died on me. I guess I had my technique down pat, so I always got perfectly ground coffee.
This coffee grinder has lots of settings (coarse - fine), but weirdly you can only make even number of cups. I generally make 5 cups of coffee in the morning. So now I have to make 4 (too little) or 6 (too much). I'm making 6 and then leaving a bit of coffee behind in the ground coffee chamber.
Speaking of the ground coffee chamber, I make a mess every time I take it out of the grinder. Little coffee grinds everywhere.
This is also not a small piece of equipment. You're going to need counter space for it.
Why am I keeping this grinder again? I guess because it's okay. It's not great, it's just okay, but I don't want the hassle of sending it back and trying another one. Maybe it will break soon. :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Much better consistant grind than my old coffee grinder
reviews.reviewText: Much better consistant grind than my old coffee grinder. Think it cut out some bitterness by reducing small fines of coffee. Would have given it 5 stars, but believe more expensive burr mills would be even better. This will do for now.
See photos. Order says item is new but as received the grinder had coffee grinds and a whole bean in it. These photos are right out of the package. Would like explanation / disposition.

This product is great! You can easily adjust the grind you want on your coffee beans which is essential as I use it for my French Press and Latter Machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: The downside is it runs hot and the end of the grind is so fine the heat releases the oils and it sticks together ...
reviews.reviewText: For the price this grinder does get the job, the coffee beans are ground and relatively uniform. The downside is it runs hot and the end of the grind is so fine the heat releases the oils and it sticks together in a clump. I usually just throw that away if can grab it. This grinder is still pretty decent and much better than using a spice grinder with no uniformity.

The quality of the grind is very consistent and not having to hold down a button is great because of the automatic shutoff. Value would be 7/10.

It is a handy and efficient gadget. I replaced a Bodrun unit which wore out after many years. The only criticisms I have are that the bean holder is too small and the grinding process makes a lot of finly powdered coffe which stick to the holder. However, the powder is well contained and is much less messy than was my Bodrun.

Works great

The grinds stick to the plastic container. It can be annoying trying to get the coffee into the filter. Other than that I have no complaints.

I've never entered in one of these opinons on an Amazon product before, but I'm just too excited about my new Cuisinart Mill! I LOVE this thing! I use it for grinding flax seed since you must consume your freshly-ground flaxseed within 15 minutes for the cancer-fighting Omega 3's to be fully beneficial. You can keep a bunch of the flax seeds in the hopper, and set it for the minimum volume setting and push the start button. It stops automatically, and dispenses about 50 grams (a very rounded 1/3 cup) of finely ground flax seed powder (on the finest setting). Dump that into your fruit smoothie and viola! It's not a mess maker, and the powder comes right out and doesn't seem to get all over everything, which is nice.
A must for. Grinding your great coffee bens

I bought this grinder 11 months ago and I can truly say it s a "workhorse." In those 11 months I estimate I have ground approximately 100 lbs. of beans. You see, I also grind coffee for my church. And in that sense it has been very dependable. Now, why did I rate it 3 stars? The machine that I received will produce only medium to medium fine grind, and that is at the coarsest setting...ok for drip but definitely not French Press. I said it has been dependable and also very efficient...fast. That motor is really turning the RPMs Maybe that is why it produces a great deal of cake...very fine particulates along with the natural oil of the bean. I don't believe this is characteristic of a true burr grinder, which this isn't. It's more of a burr/blade hybrid as someone else mentioned. For those reasons I believe this unit deserves a 3 star rating.

Despite the mediocre reviews for this product on Amazon, I purchased it for 3 reasons.

1. The price - this thing was cheaper on Amazon than anywhere else that I looked.
2. Recommendation from a friend - a good friend of mine who s a serious coffee geek has this grinder and loves it.
3. I wanted a higher-quality grinder to replace my old blade grinder.

I own several other Cuisinart small kitchen electrics and so I had confidence in this one. After using this product for about a month, I can say that I'm satisfied with it on all counts.

Having worked in a high-end coffee shop for 4 years, I worked with my fair share of high-end burr grinders. This one is definitely not that. The actual burrs are very small and lightweight but for the average American home making one pot of coffee a day, that's not a problem by my standards. The one thing that I wanted from this grinder that I was not getting from my blade grinder was consistency. This grinder produces a nice consistent grind size which makes for a nice pot of joe.

The only complaint I have so far is that it's kind of noisy (as most coffee grinders can be). If you are the earliest riser in your home and the one who normally makes the coffee while others are still asleep, I would consider grinding your beans the night before.

But other than the noise, I have no complaints with this grinder thus far. For the price I paid, I don't think it can be beat.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is not a Burr Grinder:(
reviews.reviewText:
If you really like coffee; Do Not Buy this Grinder.
This is NOT a Burr grinder. The grinder is very convienient, which makes this review hard to write.
This grinder does a really terrible job - the coffee is not all uniformly ground; worse than a bullet/blade grinder by far.
The cheap grinder surfaces used in these types of grinders are actually composed of large masticating ridges, NOT a fine burr.
This results in some of the coffee being extremely fine, while other chunks of the bean just broken and not ground at all.
This Grinder will waste your time and money, as I have not had a worst tasting cup of coffee in a long time, watery and tasteless.

Pros: Easy to use. Inexpensive for a burr grinder. Adjustable, great grind from expresso to drip. Not to big, small foot print on the counter. Easy to keep clean. It feels substantial.

Cons: This is a replacement for the same model I had for a little less than a year. The last one I had the whole hopper broke and came off. It was returned to sams club and I purchased this one beacause sams no longer carries this model. I liked it so much though, I bought another. It is a little on the cheap cunstruction side. But.

Final: I dont think you can beat the price. It is a nice grinder with great features. I bought one for my mother-n-law. She loves hers also. I see on the web were this model has been returned many times just because of the same reason mine did. The hopper might break down near the neck of the hopper. Personaly I think it could be rocks and stones that could have made their way into the coffee. Thats just a guess or adjusting grind whil grinding. I really did not feel like spending $100. or more for a coffee grinder, but, you get what you pay for. I think if you are looking for a grinder that cheap and grinds great, this is it. I bought one, and really loved it, but it just totally quit one morning, poof, simply did not do anything, after only three months of about once-daily use. I tried what everyone said about cleaning it out and all that, and still nothing. Cuisinart replaced it, but I had to pay for shipping, and pay to ship the old one back, which, even though it wasn't very much, made me feel like a total sucker. I mean, it's their defective product that died after only 3 months, shouldn't they be paying to send it back? Probably won't be purchasing anymore Cuisinart products again.

The role of Amazon in the purchase and delivery of the coffee grinder was, as usual, smooth and efficient. The coffee grinder was branded Cuisinart, a brand I have trusted and respected for many years. This particular grinder does not live up to the reputation of Cusiinart. The instructions claim the grinder can be set for fine or coarse grinding. Not so. The most coarse is roughly equal to "regular grind" coffee, and there is a lot of coffee powder so fine that it adheres to the sides of the receptacle.
This grinder performs roughly as well as the cheapest spinning blade coffee grinder selling for $19.95. Does anyone make a grinder similar to my manual burr grinder, but electric? This one is not it.
I've had this for about 4 months now and I still absolutely love it. I would highly recommend this to others!

So, if you want to spend forty bucks for something that works for three months, go for it. It's junk. I'm tired of every "used to be decent company" cheaping out and having China make their stuff. Never again, Cuisinart. I'm getting a hand grinder or using my Grandpa's old fashioned hand grinder from now on. It was made back when companies and people made good products that last.

It's easy to select the grind consistency and the number of cups you'll be brewing, and then the grinder shuts off automatically when it's done its job. It is a bit noisy, but it is a burr grinder after all. It does a much better job that the less expensive blade grinders, so the cost and noise are definitely worth it.

It seems to be a great match for my espresso maker though so I am satisfied. The design of the grinder is great. The storage compartment is convenient (especially if you've ever used one of the small grinders). If you're one of those with a really nice espresso machine I would spend the extra money for a nicer grinder or you will probably be disappointed. If you have a lower end espresso machine or normal drop coffee machine this grinder will do the trick.

Anyhow, it's worked well to provide coarse ground coffee. Although it does produce a lot of coffee dust which will stick to the sides of the hoppper. I would probably not buy this again. Instead I would buy the kitchen aid burr grinder.

I can't say this is the worst thing I've every bought but it's not on my list as a good purchase either.
I bought this to replace a grinder that is on it's last leg. Espresso is the only thing I use it for and the DBM-8 at the finest setting is not even close to fine enough to be consider an espresso grind, as far as I'm concerned. Also it's very loud and grinds a crazy fast speed so the coffee oil get's lost in the spin cycle. This kind of grinds like a blade grinder but it a burr head. Way too fast for fine grinds.
The grinder I was replacing (Capresso) has settings from coarse to extra fine. I use the fine setting and it turns the bean into a talc like powder. I don't know what the ultra fine would do! The Cuisinart just doesn't compare to the grind I get form the Capresso. I will spend the extra few bucks to get the right grinder...Maybe for regular coffee this is ok but I don't know that for sure since that isn't what I bought it for.
Back to amazon this grinder goes....

reviews.reviewTitle: Best value in a burr grinder
reviews.reviewText:
I strongly recommend the Cuisinart DBM-8 Supreme Grind Automatic Burr Mill. It is cheap ($50) for a burr grinder (burr is the only way to go for a consistent grind, blade grinders are cheaper but waste coffee), very easy to keep clean, and has a good sized storage hopper for beans. Intuitive controls (select # of cups, hit START), and automatic shutoff means no measurements are required. Simply grind and empty the contents into your coffeemaker. The grind selector is integrated into the hopper, so going from coarse to fine is as simple as turning the hopper to the desired size.
Plus, it is a good looking addition to any kitchen.
Really like the performance, look and features of this grinder.
I love this but find it a bit messy and not the easiest to clean.
Most impressive! 18 different settings - a chef's dream at a price affordable for my non-conforming kitchen.

Had a smaller grinder, but LOVE the larger one! great price and great product. We've had it for awhile and grinding to perfection. perfect grind for Turkish style, French press and every type in between. As a former barista for sbux. this is an excellent grinder
Love this coffee grinder

I was skeptical that fresh ground would be that much different. I am very pleased with this burr mill. The coffee does taste fresher and I love that I can use this mill for not only my auto drip coffee maker but also for my espresso machine and my percolator! Perfect!

It has a consistent grind, is easy to clean, and doesn't take up a lot of counter space. It performs much better than the more expensive Black & Decker burr mill this replaced.

reviews.reviewTitle: It is an OKAY buy, good value
reviews.reviewText: Nice looking unit, fits well on out kitchen counter. It is not the size you want to store away and pull out every day for use...best to leave it int place, especially since it stores a goodly amount of ungrounded beans in its plastic hopper. So far I have left it set to four cup mark on amount to be ground and that works good for my two cup (12 oz.) Bialetti porcelain coffee dripper. One problem is the girders prodigious coffee dust production, sort of messy. Keep your damp sponge handy. The motor seems powerful and makes short work of the grind. I tried a hand crank burr mill and I could not take the long, boring, tiring crank turning ordeal. This DBM-8 seems like a good, sturdy appliance for the modest price. It is OKAY.

I have one of these at work and at home, and they both stopped working after a while. The beans will not fall down onto the burrs, I have to shake and pound the unit to get them to fall in. Cuisinart replaced the home unit, and the same thing happened with the replacement. It's a frustrating waste of money.

Went to grind my coffee this morning and the Cuisinart did not grind. It didn't even attempt to grind. I checked for any blockage but none found. I will contact Cuisinart for 18 month warranty. This happened too soon for this product. Purchased in April 2016, product ceased working July 2016.
I love this machine and makes coffee grinding so easy. Little loud when grinding but the process goes fast.
Powerful, relatively quiet grinder. Does the job effectively. Good quality.

The grind is inconsistent. Hard to remove the ground coffee because of static. It first broke after a couple of weeks, but we were able to unclog it. After clogging almost weekly for a couple more months, it has finally given up. Stay away.
I had to set it to the finest level of grinding in order to get for the brewer. Stop decieving people to buy this item. This is a rip off.

reviews.reviewTitle: It looked to be more then what I used in the past and sometimes the Bunn would overflow if ground too fine. I figured I'd give i
reviews.reviewText: Just received the new grinder. I was a little hesitant on the amount of grind for twelve cups on my Bunn coffee maker. It looked to be more then what I used in the past and sometimes the Bunn would overflow if ground too fine. I figured I'd give it a try with the factory amount and the coffee came out perfect. I'll never go back to the small grinders again. This Burr grinder works great with a Bunn coffee maker.

Somewhere inside this machine, there needs to be a seal/gasket to keep the grounds where they belong.

The grounds it makes are fine, the noise is expected and there's a lot less static cling than with our new one, the capresso infinity, possibly because of the stainless housing or the lid on the grounds receptacle.

We grind for french press coffee - quite coarse. I imagine that with finer grind settings there could be more lost coffee to the internal areas of this machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not Worth The Money At Any Price
reviews.reviewText: I originally purchased a this type of grinder under a different name from a wholesale club over 5 1/2 years ago for approximately $29.00. That coffee grinder lasted for 3 1/2 years before it stopped grinding mid grind. The coffee I have used for the last 10 years is Starbucks Breakfast Blend or more recently Starbucks French Roast Beans. The grinding pattern I use is to grind enough coffee for a 12 cup pot. I pour 4 cups into a large coffee cup and the remainder in a carafe which I use for 2 more days microwaving my coffee. So essentially I use the grinder for a pot for a fresh pot of coffee every 3 or 4 days. In December 2012, after my no name brand died after 3 1/2 years of service I purchased the Cuisinart DBM-8 Coffee Mill Grinder from Amazon.com. I was excited that It appears that Cuisenart purchased the no name brand raised the price, and now I was getting a name product. Little did I know that 10 1/2 months later, my "Cousinart" would stop and burn out while grinding Starbucks coffee beans. I called Amazon they, contacted Cousinart and I received a new replacement for the burnt out unit in October 2013. In that time frame, I was doctor restricted diet for over four months, one month in Florida and personal leave for 2 1/2 months where I did not grind or drink any coffee. So from October 2013 until January 1, 2015 (a total of 15 months), I did not grind any coffee at all for 6 1/2 months and the remainder of the time I used the grind coffee and make a pot every 3 or 4 days, the effective use I got of the replacement was 7 months. I called Amazon, they looked into a record and saw that the replacement was handled by Cousinart. I called Cousinart and basically they told me the warranty period from the original purchase and there was nothing they could do. I got the Cousinart Customer Service Manager address and plan on following up with him regarding the shoddiness of the product they sell. In all fairness Amazon refunded my purchase price (less restocking fee) as long as I return the burnt out unit in 30 days. I was going to purchase another Cousinart Grinder/Mill from Amazon until I saw the price was almost $50. I decided against wasting my money again on a poor quality product that lasted only 7 months of effective use and a company that uses loopholes like using the original purchase date as the warranty date and not the date I received a new replacement product as the warranty date. I ended up purchasing a Capresso Coffee Grinder which was pricier but I am sure has to be higher quality than the product Cousinart sells.
I don't like the noise but other than that, it works fine.

This is a fantastic grinder. The only two gripes I have aren't much, but they are gripes nonetheless:

The vessel in which the grinds deposit collects so much static that it's mostly impossible to clean without the tiny coffee grounds flying every which way. There is a constant coating of very fine grinds all over the vessel and wall behind it, even if it's set to the coarsest grind. Without a tiny vacuum, it's hard to clean. The grinder won't run indefinitely. If you fill the hopper all the way up and set it to the largest amount, which is 18 cups, it will still stop halfway through with the vessel only halfway full of grinds. It means doing multiple batches if you're brewing a large amount (like for a cold brewer, etc). That said, it's great and I'm glad I own it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best I've ever used(for my purposes)
reviews.reviewText:
I've owned many different grinders over the years: burr grinders, pulverizing grinders, food processors, hand crank, built in, etc.

This is by far my favorite so far for a couple of reasons.

It allows for me to select the exact size of grind I am looking for without too much trouble.

It is simple to clean(and I strongly suggest you do so at least once a week if you are grinding daily) which is very important to me as I like to switch beans often and some are more oily than others.

The cost! It's so affordable that I wouldn't be upset if I had to buy another to replace it after a few years use.

So far I have had this one around a year or so with no problems at all. Would definitely buy again. And should you!

reviews.reviewTitle: My new Cuisinart Coffee Bean Grinder
reviews.reviewText:
The Cuisinart coffee grinder is easy to use, efficient and rests happily on my kitchen drain board ready to use. It holds plenty of beans and all
grinds from fine to very coarse. Couldn't ask for more.

A bargain at the price. The grind selection is quite effective, helpful if you're making coffee in a French Press or an Aeropress. I use coffee quickly enough that keeping beans in the hopper doesn't particularly impact their freshness, and being able to just hit the button first thing in the morning is a huge convenience. You'll be greeted by the satisfying aroma of freshly ground beans. This is not a premium conical grinder, and it makes a bit too much dust for my taste. Most of this sticks to the ground coffee container at the top, close to where the grind emerges, so you can just leave it there while you're scooping grounds and brush it off when the bin is empty. A terrific value, nicely constructed, far superior to cheap blade grinders.
It worked perfectly for a while until it burned out. We don't know what happened, might have been our fault. but we loved it!

Meh. It works... but it sure is MESSY!!! We use the grinder on its medium setting, and yet we seem to get a lot of fine coffee particles that stick to the sides of the plastic hopper. I use my finger to knock them out in the trash before putting the rest of the grounds in the coffee maker because I'm convinced that the fine grounds make the coffee way too bitter. There's always grounds coming out from the back of the hopper on to the counter top. So... if you're a neat freak like me, steer away from this model. Last thing.. we tend to use oily french roast beans. I think they are contributing to the sticky dust issues and also seem to cause the feed hopper to get clogged. Not a total waste of money, but I'd take my blade grinder back over this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuisinart DBM-8 good for as long as it last....
reviews.reviewText: I bought this coffee bean grinder October 2015. Paid about $50 bucks for it. I didn't use it everyday but used it frequently. No complaints with how it grinds coffee beans. Got it out this morning to grind some beans and it did not work...the grinder was completely tits up! So I had to get out my old Braun KSM2 to do the job. The Braun does not hold as many beans as the Cuisinart. With the Braun you have to guesstimate the texture of the grind; course, medium or fine since there is no selection setting. But it gets the job done. I've had the Braun for over 20 years. I won't purchase another Cuisinart and I certainly don't recommend them. If you can't get at least 5 years out of an appliance then it's not worth having....instead of buying a cheap Cuisinart DBM-8 go ahead and spend a little extra money and get a Braun KSM2 or a similar quality coffee bean grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Probable planned obsolescence in the electronics
reviews.reviewText:
My mom really liked the convenience of this product so, when hers suddenly stopped getting power a year ago, I thought it'd make a great Christmas present. The new grinder broke down just the other week with (seemingly) the same problem. Fast forward to today when I'm telling this to my friend, joking that at this rate I'll be getting my mom the same Christmas present for the rest of our lives; he tells me that he and his wife happened to have the same grinder, and the same thing happened to theirs after about a year...

It's a good product while it lasts, but I expect a bit more than a year of use from my coffee grinders.

reviews.reviewTitle: SHOULD (COULD) BE A 5 STAR PRODUCT EXCEPT
reviews.reviewText: This Cuisinart will turn a pound of coffee beans into meal in just a few minutes. Excellent (5 stars) Yet, more emphasis should have been placed on power cord storage that on 16 levels of grind when 3 would do (coarse, medium, fine). During the grind process, product is hurled into the hopper with enough force to the point of needing to rake out the lumps of the final product with a fork before brewing, pressing (3 stars). And that POWER CORD ARRANGEMENT (.05 stars)! All in All? It would be 5 STARS because it gets the job done very well. But that POWER CORD ARRANGEMENT? There's no way it can be stored and sit flat on a shelf, countertop, top side up.

reviews.reviewTitle: What does that darn "cup switcher really do?"
reviews.reviewText:
I've never had a burr grinder before. I've always used the other kind where you pour in some coffee and push the top down. This has a more consistent grind which is the point i guess. There's a few things i don't love about this machine though despite all the great reviews.

Cons:
1. The "Cup Switcher" makes no sense to me. Nor does it seem to do much. The never really explain it very well and it seems like you're just guessing when you're using it. Also, it holds 1/2 pound but you can only grind like 1/3 of that if you use the max cup setting. So what's the point of having it hold so much if you have to dump out the ground stuff 3x's.
2. It's pretty slow. I could fill up my coffee canister twice as fast using my old grinder vs. this one. Maybe all burr grinders are slow.
3. It's loud. Most are but this seems really loud and whiny (maybe not unlike this review! haha).
4. There's a small corner where much finer ground coffee builds up in the catch cannister. Isn't the point of a burr grinder to have a more consistent grind? If every time i'm getting this micro dust it isn't really that consistent is it?

Pros:
1. I like i can fill it up, push a button and come back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works fairly well for my application . . .
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a replacement for a Krups grinder. I make coffee for use in my Keurig with the reusable K-cup. I do not need a lot of coffee ground at once, and even the 4-cup setting is too much for a full K-cup size. I usually leave it halfway between 4 and off. The automatic feature makes it great as well as a removable basket for dumping wherever you need it. Personally I do tend to think the coffee tastes better. Maybe it does not heat up the grounds like a grinder . . . For those who thought that a burr style grinder make more even grinds, it does not with this model. No matter the coarseness I choose, there is always some powder that shoots out as well as larger chunks. I usually do not see the larger chunks until I am rinsing them down the disposal (good way to help remove the smelly disposal smell). I am happy with this model and it works well for my application, be wary if you are especially picky about even grounds.
