reviews.reviewText: My grinder worked for almost a year, then the motor died. We opened it up and found there was a lot of build up of grinds internally. I recommend periodically opening it up to clear out any internal powder buildup to extends its life.

I don't have anything to add to all the reviews that say "it just stopped working one day." Probably a faulty switch since there was no burning smell from the motor. I tried to take it apart to investigate, but the molded plastic design does not allow this.
I am returning this item because it is so LOUD. This hurt my ears. I'm switching brands because of the sound of the burr. Please be careful.

Only had the Grinder for 3 months, AND only used about 4 days a week for one pot at a time. The Motor is already burnt out. I could handle the dark roast coffee's just fine. But a few weeks of medium roast coffee sent this grinder into a flame-out. Worked great when it lasted... RIP...

We bought this grinder about a month ago, and the flying coffee grounds from the static is making me nutty! This is the first burr grinder I have purchased, and the coffee does taste better using this type of grinder. But between the mess from the static and the very loud noise the grinder makes, I think I chose the wrong one.

Even though I've had this one a short time and it is working fine, I am thinking about purchasing another one with a glass container so there is less static.

Purchase the Cuisinart from Macy's. after a few month the start button stopped working. returned and the second grinder stopped working after a few month. the grinder I bought from Starbucks prior to this lasted for years. looking for my next grinder,
Gotta have my cup of coffee in the morning.

The grinder worked fine, was actually pretty happy with this grinder until one day it just stopped working. Took it apart cleaned it but the motor just burned up. I will say we used it every day but I think it should have lasted more than 6 months.
For $20 more you can get a quieter, more efficient Capresso machine with the actual capability of grinding to an espresso level. Don't bother here.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good Grinder, But Unreliable, At Best . . .
reviews.reviewText: It's a good grinder and we've used them for several years. That said, however, we've had 4 of these and 3 have died in their first couple months of service. I'm looking for a better solution.
We like our Cuisinart grinder. We bought it for our travel trailer. We have a professional grinder at home, and this one performs as well as that one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't waste your time or money
reviews.reviewText:
I had this grinder for less that 2 months before it started going bad. It started not staying on for the automatic grinding. Then it was very touch to even run. I finally unplugged it when I noticed it was warm BEFORE I used it.

This was also VERY noisey. The reviewer who said 106db is not a suprise to me. It is also a VERY high pitched grinding sound. My recommendation is to look for something else.

reviews.reviewTitle: I had it on the finest setting for making espresso
reviews.reviewText: Worked well until the warranty had expired, then the motor died. I understand quite a few others have had the same experience, so I hope Cuisinart addresses that issue. I had it on the finest setting for making espresso, but there was some variation in particle size. There is nothing like the taste of freshly ground beans.
Best coffee grinder I've ever owned! Such a great deal too!
Like everybody else my motor stopped working, What a loser crap

I bought this burr grinder because I wanted freshly grinded coffee in the mornings vs. grinded at the store, which sits in a bag for two weeks. This machine grinded the beans very evenly. I use a moka pot to make espresso. Using a moka pot, you have to use a medium grind so the grinds don't go through the holes and into your espresso. I am very pleased with my purchase. The only downside to this product is the static. Because the hopper and the bottom compartment are both plastic, the grinds stick to the sides. If you aren't careful, you will get grinds all over your counter. This was not a major issue for me, I just scooped my grinds out over the sink. I would buy this product again.

It worked, albeit loudly and messily for several months, then the plastic hopper disintegrated and literally fell apart when I lifted the cover to refill it. If coffee bean oils are chemically degrading the plastic, I'm wondering how much plastic I've consumed since using this product. This is the second Cuisinart product I've owned that has failed within a year of its purchase. I would not buy or recommend them to anyone.

It does grind well and adjusts to a fine or coarse grind evenly, but unfortunately because of the plastic catch(I guess) it creates a static mess and grinds fly everywhere when you take the catch out and remove the lid. Even when you pour the grinds into the filter they fly across the top of the pot. This is going back to the store and I will try to find a better burr grinder with less or hopefully no static!

This grinder is the absolute worst grinder I have owned. The finest grind is not acceptable for espresso. The coarse is good for french press. The plastic grind hopper holds static which makes it extremely difficult to pour the grinds without making a mess. Junk junk junk. I expected better from the Cuisinart name. Would make a great gift for someone you don't like. This should be on the $19.99 clearance shelf, then it would only be overpriced by $15.00.
Someone gave me this coffee grinder as a gift. The button on the top that you click to grind the coffee stopped working after one year of use.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's junk, and the service is no better
reviews.reviewText: The grinder works fine until it dies, which is frequently. I received two new replacement units (it took as long as four months to receive them, and I had to pay a service fee and shipping on the dead ones). So among three brand-new grinders, none lasted beyond five months. The final one just died and there is no more warranty. The experience has put me off anything made by Cuisinart for life.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't turn on at all I'm very disappointed. Now only way to get it fixed or ...
reviews.reviewText: Just got this grinder today. I had ordered it through Amazon. Tried to grind and turned on then couldn't get if to work again. Doesn't turn on at all I'm very disappointed. Now only way to get it fixed or replaced is send back to Cuisinart. Called cuisinart and gave them the model # and they said it was discontinued ! I just got it in the mail today. Made in China very cheaply made. I know the switch is faulty and wonder how many others have the same issue. I wish I could find a good American made one.
Quit working in two weeks!!

This product is not only very sleek with the modern stainless steel look but it is SO easy to use. You just press the button of the amount of coffee you want and walk away- it automatically has it ready whenever you're ready for your fresh ground coffee. This is the main reason why I LOVE Cuisinart! I carry nothing else in my kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder, but does not grind fine enough for espresso.
reviews.reviewText: This grinder does not grind fine enough for espresso. Otherwise, its a fine grinder. You may choose to shim up the grinder plates with washers to get an espresso grind, but I'll be Cuisinart would void your warranty. This is the common complaint and solution elsewhere.

reviews.reviewTitle: Broke in less than one year
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder was a great buy for a burr grinder and was great while it lasted but it has now broken after less than a year of daily use.

I regret having bought this product. It died after less than two month of use. Warranty replacement costs $10 handing fee plus postage to ship the defective unit to Arizona, so nearly 50% of the original price. No more Cuisinart for me.
After only 3 months it has died!!!!!! Buyer Beware!
Love it!

This grinder is the best one we've ever owned. There are many levels of grinding available. It is sturdy, durable and is worked to death. Fortunately it has lasted quite a while. We use it everyday at least twice. When we have company we use it more often. It's like the energizer bunny. I would buy another one exactly like it if I need another.
This grinder did a good job, looked nice, but after 8 months it has died. I always buy Cuisinart products when shopping, but that habit has ended.
Loud but good.

This is a burr grinder. In essence, it should produce even results, granting you the ability to use it for espresso through French press. When attempting to use the coarse setting, it produced a lot of powder, which is unacceptable for French press. Also, my 5-year old and 1-year old are both wide awake now that I'm making coffee - this thing is excessively loud.

I do not recommend this product. I had better results using my blade grinder.

After a couple years of using this grinder on the finest setting (for espresso), the grinders have worn almost completely down and the grounds are courser than desired. Am considering switching to a ceramic hand burr mill for consistent fineness and to reduce noise for early morning coffee.
I have owned this grinder for over 10 years. It has always worked well.
I have had one of these grinders for about 8 years and have had no problems whatsoever. Does great job with regular or espresso grind.
Appliance stopped working after 6 months. Will cost more to repair than replace, but will not replace with Cuisinart.

This grinder worked wonderfully for the first year. Thereafter, a screw came loose that secures the grinding component. This in turn cracked the base of the coffee bean container rendering the grinder useless. Because Cuisinart no longer makes parts for this model, it cannot be fixed. This is not the first bad experience I have had with Cuisinart products. The next time a make a purchase in the small appliance category I will surely avoid Cuisinart.

reviews.reviewTitle: If works just fine for the money!!
reviews.reviewText: We have owned this grinder for about 6 months and it works fine. As a previous reviewer noted, a GREAT burr grinder would cost much more money!! I agree the espresso grind is not quite fine enough, but the consistency of grind for drip brewed to french press is decent and a big improvement over a basic grinder. I like that beans can be stored in the top and it is heavy but does not take up too much space. For the price, (we bought at Costco) we are happy with it.

I've really liked some Cuisinart products but not this one. It is very loud but that's not a big problem. It produces an ultra fine powder around the top of the bin. You have to brush it away and it wastes coffee. Also the canister is plastic and there is a mini explosion of grounds when you open it I think due to static.

Finally, in my opinion the fine grind settings for espresso (the main reason I bought it) are not nearly fine enough. The grind is uneven and chunky compared to my Barista from Starbucks. The espresso tastes okay but just the thinnest crema that dissipates in a few minutes.

I have returned it.

Wow, I'm jealous of all the people whose grinder lasted a few months before dying unexpectedly-- mine didn't even last 6 weeks!

I didn't need or expect a top-of-the-line burr mill, just an affordable step up from a blade grinder. And it WAS a step up, as well as convenient - being able to store the beans in the hopper, set the coarseness and cups, press a button and walk away - until it stopped working after a mere 5.5 weeks of grinding (4-6 cups/day). Now I'm paying more than the price of a blade grinder to send it back. At least I'm still well within the 18-month warranty.

This is so clearly not a fluke, caveat emptor.

reviews.reviewTitle: I tried to wipe coffee grounds off the controls, ...
reviews.reviewText: I tried to wipe coffee grounds off the controls, with my finger, the numbers, and graduations wiped off along with them. The whole grinder lasted less than a year. I would never buy thing again.

reviews.reviewTitle: No better than a blade grinder
reviews.reviewText: I bought it a while ago and expected to use it both for my french press and espresso machine. However, it is horrible for this purpose. It generates lots of powder for french press, resulting LOTS of sediment in my coffee. It cannot grind as fine as necessary for espresso either, resulting a very weak espresso cup. That said, it's good for drip coffee machine, pretty convenient and easy to clean, but don't expect it to be an upgrade for a blade grinder.
Does NOT grind fine enough for espresso. Complete waste of money.

We've had the burr mill for over a week now getting daily use. Its very easy to use, adjustable for amount of coffee being brewed and size of grinds. Unit is very easy to clean and its easy to pour the grounds into a coffee maker filter. If you do get some buildup on the side or front of the where the ground coffee sits, simply tap gently against the counter and the problem will be eliminated. This is a styling unit that gets the job done.

THis grinder is SOOOO loud. It wakes up my whole house and runs forever just to grind enough for one pot of coffee. We have to pre grind beans at night to avoid waking everyone. The canister the grounds go into is very poorly designed and it makes getting out the grounds super messy. There are grounds all over my counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: We had the older model, which frequently clogged with ...
reviews.reviewText: We had the older model, which frequently clogged with darker roast beans. This required us to remove bin and use a bamboo skewer to remove the grounds which were blocking the exit port. The machine died after 3 yrs of use.

Wife bought one of these at a fundraiser auction, still sealed in the box, but more than a year old. It was dead on arrival--I suspect one of the two safety interlock switches was defective. Manufacturer offered no help since product was out of warranty. So the machine went directly into the trash without ever grinding a single bean. I am still searching for an automatic burr mill, but it won't be this model for sure.

reviews.reviewTitle: WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY - CUISINART DISSAPOINTS IN MANY WAYS
reviews.reviewText: Not only did this grinder make an awful noise, not only was it a bit pricey, but it didn't even last a year before the motor blew (and we didn't even use it every day). I took it to a local repair shop to get it fixed, and they told me they couldn't touch it because Cuisinart won't sell anyone else their parts.... but because it was after the warranty, Cuisinart wouldn't touch it either. So now I'm left with an expensive piece of junk. A complete dissapointment.

reviews.reviewTitle: while it worked I did really like it.
reviews.reviewText:
I have had two of these, each one was a gift and each one died after less than a year of use. The motor just decided to quit.

That said, while it worked I did really like it.
Stopped working after only 3 months.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for Coffee - BAD for Espresso
reviews.reviewText: I have been grinding coffee beans for years and have not found a perfect grinder - not looking for one. This grinder is a nice looking piece that will complement any countertop - brushed chrome, stylish hopper, clicky adjustments. It will grind coffee just fine, but does a HORRIBLE job grinding fine for espresso. On the finest setting, I have to run the grounds through 4 times and use a wooden spoon to shove them through. The only reason it is not in the trash is I am waiting for Cuisinart to reply to my inquiries regarding adjustments. It is my hope that my grinder has bad factory settings or maybe I can open it up and adjust it myself. I do not recommend this grinder for anyone intending to grind espresso.

First of all I want to say that I waited until I was beyond the 3 month mark to write this review as a past comment said that the grinder died right at that point. Happy to say that this is not the case! I love this grinder! It allows you to choose the strength of the grind and the cups. I love strong coffee and this makes that possible every pot! It is easy to use and easy to fill. I have had no problems at all. The perfect companion to the Brew Central!
Easy to use and has excellent control.

We purchased this almost exactly one year ago and it no longer works. The grind quality was inconsistent, the motor overheated after about 2 bins full of grinding and it's just not worth the money. Put your money from this, add some more to it and buy something that will really do the job and last.
I bought this less than 6 months ago. It's already not working at all. Don't waste your money.
Terrible for espresso. Finest grind is much too coarse and consistency of grind is from powder to half bean sized.
I found this appliance extremely loud and not very accurate on the coarseness of the coffee. I would not recommend this to my friends or family.

I am on my second Unit of this model. The first one only lasted six months so I thought it was just a fluke and got another one.
What was I thinking?? This one lasted another six months and now will not process the coffee. Took it all apart, cleaned it- works fine if no beans in the bowl!!

Going to spend more money this time and get a better quality grinder

reviews.reviewTitle: Boo - four months later, completely dead
reviews.reviewText: This grinder worked great for a while. We used daily to make a pot of coffee, and although we found the machine to be extremely noisy, it ground even oily french roast beans very well. But within four months, the grinder stopped working completely. Rated a 1 due to unacceptable lifespan and noise level (much louder than our last burr grinder purchased from starbucks that lasted ten years).
Bought it for my parents for Christmas and they love it. It automatically shuts off when the hopper is full.
Best Burr grinder for the money.. But, not so easy to clean and start button does not hold up to daily use!
This grinder worked well for about six months then slowed down and came to a stop. No amount wiggling the switch or the cord or anything would revive it. Don't wast your money on this one

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall I would rate this product as average
reviews.reviewText: Overall, I would rate this product as average. While the grind is acceptable, the amount of the grind is very inconsistent, no matter what the setting.

reviews.reviewTitle: not consistent, messy, for drip coffee only
reviews.reviewText:
For the money, I guess I shouldn't complain...but:

it's inconsistent--you'll always have plenty of powder with your "coarse" settings. You'll always have a teaspoon or two of coarse stuff in your "fine" grinds. And no, it doesn't grind fine enough for Turkish (understandable)....but it's finest setting is not fine enough for some espresso machines, either. If you own some French presses, you'll hate this grinder. If you own an espresso machine, you'll hate this thing. Also, you'll need a tray, because this thing is MESSY!!!

We upgraded from our old Krups blade whirly grinder for this burr mill unit. So far it's been working without issues after 6 months of use and 8+ pounds of beans. This unit does suffer from the static issues, in that the collection bin is made of plastic and causes the ground coffee to stick to the walls and will make a mess when you open the lid to pour out the coffee. We're ready to try a better burr mill grinder now.

GOOD:

- Affordable

- Nice looks

- Adjustable grind settings

- Auto shut off

- Grinds designated amount of beans, so it's hands free

BAD:

- Very LOUD!

- Plastic bin produces static grounds, making a mess

- Inconsistent grind

- Produces clumpy grind

- Clogs

- Hard to clean due to design

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not buy this! Spend your money on a company that RESPECTS YOU and the environment.
reviews.reviewText:
After a couple years of light use, this Cuisinart Supreme Grind DBM-8 Electric Burr Grinder, DIED. It started having problems with the on button. It would only operate if the button was held down. Then it would only operate for a couple seconds after the button was pressed. So then I would have to sit there and press the button repeatedly for 5 minutes just to get enough grinds for one cup of coffee.
Now it has stopped working altogether, except for a little purr when I push the button.
I have tried cleaning it. I have tried resetting it. I have gone online to see if anyone else has this problem.
Lots of people are having this problem.
I know it is a corporate trend these days... but...
Shame for making a disposable product that breaks so easily. This is contributing to the exponential mountains of TRASH and environmental destruction...
I will not buy Cuisinart products again.
Spend hard earned money on a company that respects the consumer and the environment.

I purchased one of these mills at Fry's, and it died after only a couple of uses. The motor just quit. Cuisinart must be having quality problems with their motors, because I had purchased a "Grind Central" model to replace one I had worn out, and the motor also died right away. I will try another brand (fool me twice, shame on me...)

Don't be fool by the big brand name! This unit is extremely loud and never yield good ground quality. I have owned it for over a year and I am not happy with it.

The unit produce too much coffee dust in all different settings. I noticed the burr is already wore out. Hey, I only use this once a week in average! How can this happen?

This machine does not live up to its appearance, nor price.

A burr-grider is supposed to:

A) Produce consistent grids

B) Operate at lower speeds then blade grinders.

C) Be capable of making esspresso grade fine grinds.

After $90 CAD and evaluating it against a $15 blade grinder with 1lb of beans, I can safely say that it does none of these. A complete let down. First off, it's extremely noisy, and I would wake up my entire house using it. Second, it operates at an enourmous speed, always producing ultra-fine powder in any grind level, even coarse: something a burr grinder should elieviate. Lastly, the finest setting is no where near fine enough for espresso. Upon further investigation, the burr used in this is the same as that used by Krups models and a few others, which also don't work that well. My guess is the design of burr dictates crazy high grinding speeds that ruin its performance. You pay for the lovely, seductive Cuissinart look, but that's all.
Low cost good quality

Do not waste your money on this grinder! This grinder worked great, for maybe two months. Then the strain of the grinding on the cheap plastic parts broke the neck of the hopper internally. After several attempts to repair or "hold it together" it has gone into the garbage. Get yourself a burr grinder, just not this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought this grinder 2 years ago... ...
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this grinder 2 years ago...even though it was loud..it worked until today!
it quit while I was grinding...the motor gave out!
I am on line to get a new Burr coffee grinder today...it will Not be this brand!

reviews.reviewTitle: ... Christmas and it has helped make Espresso's at Home Wonderfully!!
reviews.reviewText: I received as a Gift in 2015 Christmas and it has helped make Espresso's at Home Wonderfully!!!!!

I had a decent grinder, but I really wanted to get one I didn't have to put beans in every day. This looked great. But it only lasted about 3 months. I dug out the old one. Not the most expensive lesson I've had, but I really wanted this grinder to be a good one. It wasn't.

After using this daily for three months, the motor burned itself out this morning. Surely we can find a burr grinder made in the U.S. that outlasts this good-for-three-months version from China. What a disappointment.
It was clear this was engineered for price and not performance. The burrs are stamped sheet metal and don't cut but break the beans. For around the same price other grinders perform way better.

Received this item as a gift. After four months of use it stopped working. Cuisinart sent a new one. Eight months later this one stopped working. Cuisinart customer service stated the item was now out of warranty based on the original purchase date and would not replace this item. I am back to using my reliable Krups fast touch coffee grinder.

I have had this grinder for going on 6 years and use it everyday, sometimes twice a day. It's powerfully noisy but gets the job done. I love having the option for fine, medium, and course grinds. I drink a lot of coffee from my coffee press and need medium/course coffee grounds. I also love being able to set the grinder to make fine/medium grounds for my coffee maker when having guest over and need a larger quantity of coffee. Would recommend this grinder to anyone who is in the market for one, or looking for a gift for a friend or family member.
Cuisinart #2 just went south after two months. Burn me twice?? I forget what "W" said, but it was funny. But seriously, don't buy this grinder. Two months... you cannot be serious.

Read these reviews today cause I just purchased two more today at Tuesday Morning for $35.00 each!
I paid $50.00 years ago. I bought two one as a gift and the other as a backup. For Five years I have been thrilled! Read the review where the guy lost two in succesion and it makes me wonder what he is grinding?
My boyfriend lives his burr grinder. He raced about it to everyone, even at coffee shops!

Bought this unit at a local kitchen supply store and I am sorry. Lasted less than six months and I can't find the receipt. Another review mentioned the "powder". I ground about 1 pound of coffee a week (hopper holds 1/2 pound)so it averaged out to about to a dollar per use. I will spend more next time.
This grinder is junk.......quit working after 2 months

I should have read these reviews before I bought this machine. I was perfectly happy with the grinder -- not in love with it, but satisfied -- until it just stopped working after less than 4 months of use. Happily, the retailer where I bought it (bricks 'n mortar) took it back with no hassle and gave me a full refund. The shame of it for Cuisinart is that this experience has pretty much tarnished their brand name for me across their entire line of merchandise.
Product worked well for about 1.5 years and then stopped working suddenly. We like it while it worked. Just doesn't have good longevity.
